''Hi, I'm Cassi'' said the girl in a friendly voice. ''I'm Madison, we must be roommates.'' It was obviously awkward at first, but after awhile of talking they realized that they really liked each other. Cassi was from a small town in Kansas where her family were wheat farmers, far different from her upbringing where her Dad was a successful businessman in the Miami area.

As dinner time approached, they found some other girls from their floor went to the dinning hall on campus, which had just been recently redone. They were shocked at how good the food was, and how much of it there was, seeing as it was buffet style.

Madison usually ate pretty healthy when she was at home, but she decided that she should go for something tasty since it was the first night. She had a slice of pizza and huge burrito.

While her and Cassi were eating they go to know some other girls on the floor, there was Kelly, a lanky blonde who used to play basketball in high school, a short skinny girl with brown hair named Ginger, and Megan, a medium hieght girl of african descent who looked to be in pretty good shape. They all got along great, mainly because everyone was trying to fit in during the first week of college. Madison also noticed that she ended up in a pack of pretty attractive looking friends. She was a really nice and outgoing person, but her one flaw was that she had an overdeveloped sense of vanity, and deeply cared about her appereance.

Still, she could not get the thought of Tom's dark blue eyes, darkening with disappointment at her rejection, the only betrayal to his otherwise masked and understanding expression.

Cassi must have noticed the internal struggle consuming her because she suddenly jumped to her feet. "C'mon, you need comfort food. Let's go get milkshakes, I'm buying!"

Madison fake groaned, "but I'm still full from dinner with Tom..."

"Oh shut up girl. You need this. Let's go."

Cassi yanked her to her feet and the next thing she knew they had driven the few blocks to the Burger shake and were sitting at a booth with the largest cookies'n'cream milkshake she had ever seen, and a large thing of cheese curds sitting in front of her. Her blonde friend laughed at her expression. Wide eyes and a slight bit of dread and...her mouth started to water.

"Cassi...I really don't think I should eat this." her hand rubbed her already full stomach remembering how her washboard abs had been losing their definition recently.

Her blonde friend laughed in her girly bell-like way. "I can think of three reason right now why you should. One," she ticked off on her fingers, "you need to drown all of your confusing emotions in sugar and move on, 2, this place has the best food in town and I already bought it so don't you dare waste a single bite, and 3, what's college if we can enjoy a little late night indulgence and fun. You are so thin anyway I don't think you have anything to worry about."

Madison couldn't help grinning. "You win. This looks delicious anyway."

Laughing, the two slim girls, dorned in sweatpants dug in to their feast. Madison told Cassi about her relationship with Mitchell and how she was certain she no longer loved him but how she still felt like he was there and all the regrets she had. Cassi told her about her troubling high school life with her dad getting sick and never having a boy friend before. Madison found that hard to believe. Guys eyes followed Cassi when she entered a room. A little shorter than she was, Cassi had smooth sun with a few faint freckles on her cheeks, sunkissed from the summertime, and while not as toned as Madison, she was slim and had nice curves, a flat stomach, slightly rounded hips, a nice butt and big boobs. She was flirtatious and outgoing to. But apparently, in high school Cassi was too stressed and now she felt awkward committing to more than a one night stand.

As they finished off their shakes and cheese curds their talking turned to laughter and they even got more cheese curds and despite her protesting stomach got another shake to share. It was all almost enough to forget about Tom.

111111122.content:
"I think your mom is here." Cassi called from the front room.

"Just one second!" Madison called. Then she turned her attention to the waist band of her jeans and tried tugging at them again. In the passed few weeks since her night out with Cassi, Madison had done her best to go to the gym and workout but with the constant parties late night drives to the Burger shack she just could not keep up. She was not fat at all but to her dismay she had noticed the tone she had once been so proud of disappearing. Her arms were ever so slightly softer as were her thighs and hips and her washboard abs had been replaced with a slight pudginess.

After failing to button the jeans, she splayed her self, back down on her mattress, sucking in with all of her might and got the button to close. The jeans were good quality and despite the fact that they were squeezing her like an extra skin she needed to shed they complimented her figure well. She added a slightly loose fitting navy shirt to cover any evidence of her soft stomach. She practiced sucking in, examining herself from every angle. Not bad. Not as satisfied as she wanted to be. But not bad.

"Madison!" Cassi called again. She heard the front door open her roommate greeted her mom.

"Coming!"

Madison took one more look in the mirror, took a deep breath, ignoring the tightness digging into her hips and went to greet her mom.

Adriana Kraft stood like a model in all of her Spanish glory, looking much too glamorous for their tiny apartment.Tall and slim her form fitting clothes and black stiletto boots emphasized her hours at the gym and self discipline. Like Madison, she had a sharp chin and defined cheekbones, full lips, and piercing eyes--a face framed by long dark hair. People frequently commented on their striking resemblance, usually right after a guy Madison's age had accidentally flirted with her mother. The only difference was that Madison had inherited her Caucasian father's blue-green eyes which made her own face even more striking.

Though she was a nice woman, her mom was quite strict in her healthy lifestyle and never left the house (or even her room) without dressing to the nines and had a tendency to make everything around her look plain in comparison. Even Cassi, who Madison considered to be exceptionally pretty looked a little soft and out of place next to her mom. Or maybe Madison wasn't the only one who had put on a few pounds.

At the sight of her daughter, her mom relaxed and swept her into a hug with an extravagant sweep of her arms. "Ha pasado mucho tiempo hija. It's been too long my sweet girl."

"Hey mom," Madison responded sheepishly. She pulled away and quickly introduced Cassi who she could sense was growing more and more uncomfortable by the second and ushered her mother out the door.

They went to a private restaurant at the edge of town, one that was usually way too expensive for Madison's college budget. Her mouth watered at the menu. Steak, buttery potatoes, ribs dripping in barbecue sauce, and the desserts! Oh the desserts looked heavenly. "So how have you been mija? You seem like you've let yourself go a bit."

Madison bit the inside of her cheek. Even though she had been expecting this, her mother's candid scrutiny still stung. Instinctively, she straightened and reminded herself to suck in her stomach even more.

"It's just a few pounds mom. I promise to work it off."

"How much?" Her mom asked.

"How much?"

"Yes, how much have you put on?"

Madison flushed a bright red, her hand cradling her softer stomach. Was it that noticeable? "Um...I'm not sure maybe ten pounds, I think. Does it even matter? I am still active, I will burn it off quickly."

Anyone else who saw Madison and overheard such a conversation would probably be appalled. Madison was still quite slim and all the weight was distributed in an even, attractive way. But her mother, who truly had once been a model had always had an attentive eye to such matters and had always stress that her daughters remain toned and active. Beauty was success in her mother's eyes and ten pounds was basically a mortal sin.

When the waiter came, her mom ordered for both, of them a grilled chicken salad with light dressing. Madison liked salad usually but with the shame and silent rebellion coursing through her, her taste buds rebelled and she still really wanted the lava cake she had seen. Maybe it was all for the best anyway. Her mom was right to be appalled and she knew she had to change her eating habits eventually.

"Maybe we could go work out tomorrow morning before I leave. Are you still going to those cardio kickboxing classes?"

Madison hoped her blush didn't give her away. She had not been since the second week of school. "Um...it's really early but we can definitely go," She and her mom used to share a personal trainer so she tried to tell herself it would be fun to exercise with her tomorrow.

"I just don't want you to get any fatter, mija,"

After their boring lunch they went shopping. Her mom laid off on the fat comments after the restaurant, much to Madison's relief but it was impossible to ignore her stern glances each time an outfit did not fit or she did not look flawless. To save herself some misery, Madison began sneaking a size larger in the dressing room with her and by the end, all was forgotten. On the way out they stopped by the book store for a few extra school supplies and to get some fun reading books when Madison saw him.

Tom was handsome as ever in his modest unaware sort of way. He was crouched in the aisle, one hand tucked into his sweatshirt while the other held a book his nose buried in. His black hair fell in his face, messy but she could imagine the clean smell of his soap and shampoo radiating off of him even though it looked unkempt. As if sensing her gaze, Tom stood up and smiled. Even from across the room she could see his deep blue eyes fringed by dark lashes that were completely unfair for a guy to have. His twinkling gaze made her heart skip.

When she realized he was approaching her, she fixed her face into a casual smile and greeted him. "Hey Tom! What's up?" This was not the first time they had seen each other since she rejected him but usually they were both surrounded by friends.

"Maddie! I mean Madison... hey," his cheeks flushed a slight red at the use of her nickname. It made her laugh.

"Maddie is just fine," she said, then remembering her mom was there watching them with her analytical gaze, she quickly introduced her.

"It's very nice to meet you Mrs. Kraft. You've raised a wonderful person. Madison is pretty great,"

Madison rolled her eyes playfully, "Tom you don't have to lie to her!"

He grinned, "You're right. Forget what I said before, Madison is kind of the worst."

The three of them talked for a moment, joking and getting to know each other, and Madison felt the tension melt away. Maybe everything could go back to the way it was before?

"Anyway, I should probably go find my girlfriend. I told her to meet me here." Tom said. As if on cue a plump, pretty red head with big brown eyes rounded the corner, sauntering up to Tom and grasping his hand.

Madison felt the light feeling in her chest instantly harden but she ignored it. This is what she wanted, wasn't it? If they weren't going to date than why should he be kept from dating anybody else?

"Mrs. Kraft, Madison, this is Renee, my new girlfriend. Renee this is Madison and her mother."

Renee had a bright smile but it turned frosty when she looked at Madison. "Oh, this is Madison. Tom told me about you."

Madison felt her heart skip a beat, finding it even more difficult to ignore the lump in her chest. What did that mean? Her mother too had grown stiff. Usually, she was a smooth talker and rarely was at a loss for words but all she could manage was an awkward, "Hey," and then when there was an unnatural pause in the conversation her mom added, "How did you two meet?"

Madison zoned out. She caught something about a mutual friend and hitting it off and how romantic Tom is. But it was the last thing she wanted to hear and when Renee placed a possessive kiss on Tom's cheek she wanted to gag. It could be anyone else but she suddenly hated Renee and wished Tom had chosen anybody but that sickening, boastful redhead. She was not good enough for him and...

Before she knew it, he mother was pulling her away, having made an excuse for them to leave and as they left she was grateful that her mom disliked the girl as much as she did. "What a simpering little butter ball!" She muttered something angrily in Spanish, making Madison laugh. "I have to say I had a good opinion of him until I saw her. I have never seen such a poor choice."

"She's pretty though," Madison said. She felt obligated to say something in the defense of Tom's happiness but she was quite happy at her mothers criticism.

Her mom snorted, "If you are in to excessive make up and the shape of round on a woman." Madison felt this was a little excessive but then again her mother always exaggerated even the tiniest bit of fat. After a few more comments about the girl talking too much and seeming too clingy and how she did not look right for Tom. she concluded, "Well maybe they are right for each other anyway. Tom isn't the most fit either."

"What do you mean?"

"Well he seems lean because of his height but a young man his age should not have any hint of a gut."

It had never occurred to her that Tom wasn't as fit as the usual guys she was into. She just liked him because he was modest and handsome and funny. He did have a little bit of a belly on him though. Madison thought about this, trying to be disgusted but she found it endeared her to him even more and she found herself grateful for Renee. Because then she couldn't be tempted and at least Tom was happy.

1111111222.content:
Madison walked into her room and threw herself face down on her bed, still red faced and panting.

Cassi looked up from the vogue magazine she was reading on her side of the room. "That bad huh?"

"I could barely finish the workout," she mumbled into a pile of pillows. With a grumble she rolled onto her back and patted her little rounded belly, she frowned as it jiggled slightly but went limp again in sheer exhaustion. After struggling with the kickboxing class with her mom the week before, Madison had vowed to get back in shape and lose the extra ten pounds she had gained but it was proving to be a lot harder than she thought.

"I should really go with you next time. I could use the exercise. This is not alright," Cassi gripped her soft gut in two hands. She had taken to lounging around in sweat pants and a sports bra and there was no denying the affect their lifestyle had had on her. While Madison still managed to eat decently during the day, Cassi indulged in her favorite things with reckless abandon. She slid off of her bed and Madison watched her rub her belly which stuck out a few inches of pure flab. Her boobs had grown and her butt was a big round bubble. From behind, Madison noticed some love handles had formed and resisted the urge to pinch them. She didn't want to be like her mom and she could care less if Cassi was gaining weight as long as her friend was happy. "Like, I cannot even fit in any of my real clothes."

To demonstrate she pulled on a pair of jeans she had apparently failed to fit in earlier. She stopped at her thighs where she had to jump, wiggle, and sashay to get them up. Her butt and arms and belly wobbled as she heft them over her her bottom end. Madison was slightly fascinated at the feat of Cassi trying to pull the wide jean flaps together.

"Need help?" Madison hopped from the bed and gripped the two flaps. "Okay, suck in."

Cassi obeyed while she yanked with all of her might. Once, twice, on the third try she finally felt the latch of the button closing. "Yes I did it!"

"Yay!" Cassi exhaled jubilantly but with a small pop it burst apart and her belly rolled forward slightly resembling jello. She deflated slightly. "Alright. That's it. From this point forward, we diet!"

Madison laughed. "Agreed," If Cassi hopped on the health bandwagon then she might actually stand a chance of losing her extra flab.

"Besides, if you get those abs back then there is no way Tom can stay with that skanky Renee girl the next time he sees you."

Madison laughed. "You know I'm over it right?"

"Yeah, yeah, and you also don't want a boyfriend, I know. But I don't think it's going to be as bad as you think. Just look at me and Adam?"

"You guys are pretty cute,"

Part of the reason Madison seemed so relaxed is that for the first time in her life she had gotten an official boyfriend. Adam had seemed to come inout of no where and swept the buxom blonde off her feet. Literally, they were at a party and after one too many drinks Cassi had been dancing on the ping pong table about to strip from her thin sundress when she tripped and Larson had swooped in to catch her. Madison had expected it to end at a one night stand, especially when he was gone the next morning. But in a show of true chivalry he had shown up an hour later with cookies and grilled cheese sandwiches to cure her hangover. Then the following day had taken her on a real date. Then flowers and so on and so forth. Now they were one of the happiest couples on campus.

"Speaking of which, he should be here any minute, we were going to a buffet for brunch with his roommates. Want to join?"

As if summoned, someone knocked at the door. Cassi's eyes widened. "He's early!" She burst into action scrambling around the room for a bra and a t-shirt that would fit her. Adam had let himself in as usual and Cassi burst from the room in a flurry of blonde hair and a beaming, sheepish smile. She had found a lavender shirt that made her eyes pop and had once been loose on her but now struggled to contain her belly.

"Hello gorgeous!" Adam greeted her with a kiss "Sorry I'm early. Hey Madison."

"You should always give a girl extra time," she scolded. "I was making myself beautiful for you!" He eyed her up and down.

"You always look beautiful. Um...even if you're uh, pants aren't buttoned.

Cassi blushed a brilliant shade of red. "They don't, uh...fit. They don't fit."

Adam laughed warmly, patting his own gut which strained the buttons of his shirt. "I think I need to go a size up as well."

Madison laughed. She had never met such good-natured people. Ones who were so open about their weight. It was so different from her own family. "Did you want to come with us Madison?" Adam asked. "we have a bit of time if you both want to finish getting ready.

She couldn't say no so she hopped in the shower while Cassi searched for a dress that would contain her extra curves.

At the buffet between Cassi, Adam, and three of Adam's roommates. She was by far the smallest one and found it easy to justify a second helping and then a third and then more until there was a huge stack to her name. There were five different types of chocolate cake and she had to sample all of them, since she still had not gotten the lava cake she'd been craving when her mom was visiting. Plus, she had been so good at eating healthy she could indulge a little. By the last piece she could barely breathe her stomach hurt so bad, when she thought nobody was looking she undid the button allowing her bloated stomach some relief and covered it with her shirt.

Between the laughing and talking somehow the topic of Renee came up.

"Wait, Renee?" Adam frowned. "As in Renee Lumberg?"

"That's the one," Madison replied, she had looked up her Facebook page enough times to know her last name. "Do you know her,"

Adam and his roommates exchanged glances. "I hung out with her for a while but then I caught her making out with her roommate." Said Tyson, one of Adam's roommates.

"She's lesbian???"

"Well I'm not sure, she could be bi, but I remember I took her out to all these fancy dinners and dates and then she didn't say even a thing about it. I was kind of under the impression we were together when I found out."

"I'm so sorry Tyson,"

"That is seriously a jerk move." Cassi added. "Was she just using you for..."

"The money?" Adam finished.

Tyson shrugged. "I just feel sorry for whoever this guy is,"

"Yeah, if she is a gold digger. Tom would be just her type."

"What do you mean?" Madison asked.

"Don't you know? Tom Russel is loaded. His parents donated a huge charity to this school and practically saved the sports department a few years ago. Madison went silent. She did not know that.

Cassi put her hand on Madison's shoulder. "Girl, we have got to check out this Renee girl. Whether you want to date Tom or not."

"You're right! She can't hurt Tom!" To emphasize her point, she leaped to her feet with surprising agility for how full she was. In the process her bloated stomach lurched forward, exposing her situation.

"Um you might want to button your shorts first," Cassi giggled.

Adam added. "Looks like we all might be needing some new clothes."

Later that night, after Madison had changed into a much roomier dress. She sat in the car with Adam and Cassi outside Renee's apartment. She felt kind of creepy but had a determined fire to keep Tom from hurting any more than the hurt she had caused. Although, he had moved on quite quickly so maybe he was not as disappointed as she had thought.

She wasn't quite sure what they were looking for. and was getting a bit bored. Despite all the food she had eaten earlier and a salad at dinner time she was craving cake like crazy. It suddenly seemed a lot more appealing than sneaking into a strangers house. Was it really her business to get into Tom's life?

"There she is," Cassi said. Attention caught, Madison moved to watch the curvy girl leave her house to meet none other than Tom. He got out of his car to greet her and the three of them were exposed to a passionate make out before she got in and they drove away. Madison's stomach did somersaults and she regretted all the food she had eaten earlier. She did not want to see this.

"There are no lights on, I don't think anyone else is home."

Though this had become the last thing she wanted to do, Madison found herself following Cassi and Adam into the apartment. Because it was not Miami where she was from and the town was considered safe, no one really locked their doors so it was easy to get in and find Renee's room. It was obnoxiously pink. Hot pink. With clothes strewn all over the floor and make up cluttering her vanity. Maybe her mom was right it did look like this girl wore a lot of make up. There were dirty dishes with hardened food on her desk and the trash was overflowing. It gave the whole room a rotting smell that was covered in an exorbitant amount of cheap perfume.

Cassi coughed. "I think I am going to be sick,"

"What are we even looking for?" Madison asked.

"Does she have a diary somewhere?"

"We are not stealing her diary!"

"We really should have thought this through." Adam said.

"Maybe you should have,"

They all froze and looked up to find Renee in her door way. Arms crossed.
1111111222.title: Madison tries to find out more about Renee

11111112221.content:
Madison's head swarmed with a solution to their situation. She thought of the window but it seemed a little pointless now that Renee had seen them. Plus, Adam and Cassi had had another large meal for dinner and she would fit and maybe Cassi but she was a little more dubious about Adam getting through. It seemed the only option was to talk through the situation. Which she was ready to do until Tom walked up behind Renee. All her words turned to mush in her throat.

"What is going on here?" Tom asked

"That is a good question!" Renee snapped. "What are you guys doing in my room?"

"You were supposed to be gone," Cassi said.

"How does that make it better exactly?"

Shame burned beneath Madison's skin. Her eyes were cast down and she could not meet Tom's eyes but she could feel his scorching holes into skin. For a moment all five of them just stood there, Adam, Cassi, and Renee glaring Tom and baffled and Madison completely mortified.

"Look, this is all just a misunderstanding. We thought this was someone else's apartment and it was going to be a good prank but obviously you are the wrong person. So we will just be going now, we're really sorry about that."

"Adam?" Tom asked suddenly just as Renee was about to snap something.

"Oh hey buddy. I did not think you would recognize me."

"Aha so this is not an accident. I know exactly what is going on!" Renee interjected but no one was listening to her.

Instead the attention had turned to Tom and Adam. "Why would I not recognize you? We used to live together," Tom's tone was more poisonous than Madison had ever heard before. How could anyone speak in such a way to Adam? He was one of the nicest guys she had ever met. apparently, Cassi was thinking the same thing because she was looking murderous.

"What are you talking about you cottoned brained sissy with bad taste in girlfriends?" In any other situation, Madison would have laughed.

Tom's poison turned to a boyish shame but Madison could still see the tension in his broad shoulders. Had he lost weight? She felt a tinge of disappointment but then reminded herself how stupid that was.

"Adam was my..." Tom began to answer but Adam cut him off.

"We used to be buddies way back. That is how I know he's rich."

"Yeah, you would remember that." Tom muttered.

Adam threw his large hands up in the air. "Whatever man, it doesn't matter. Look, we're here because your girlfriend is like me and Madison cares about you so we wanted to do something about it before you got used. C'mon guys lets go."

Without another word, they followed Adam out. He was a large guy so there wasn't much choice for Tom and Renee except to move out of the way. His face had darkened and he was hunched over slightly with some emotion Madison couldn't name. She looked to Cassi for an explanation but she looked just as confused as she did. What was going on between Tom and Adam?

She wanted an explanation but she could not look at Tom and Adam did not look like he wanted to talk. As she passed Renee hissed in her ear, "It doesn't matter what you do. You can't have him."

Madison fought the urge to roll her eyes. While she was beginning to feel hopeless about the Tom situation, threats seemed a little high school. She met Renee's eyes and said. "Get over yourself, I can have any guy I want. I just want Tom to be happy."

The retort filled her with adrenaline and she met Adam and Cassi in their car.

"Do you guys want cake?" She offered.

Adam snorted a laugh then shifted his car in gear. "Yeah that sounds good."

Stay and wait for Adam and Cassi
111111122211.content:
At the burger shack, Adam pounded back more cake than Madison ever thought someone could eat in one sitting, polishing it off with a vanilla milkshake. She had finished her piece and would have liked more except she was too focused by her friend who was obviously distraught. Even Cassi had stopped eating and was watching half awed half concerned at her boyfriends gluttony. Each time the worker delivered another slice his eyes grew wider. After consuming what must have been an entire cake, (and those things were huge) Cassi snatched the plate from him and scowled.

"Okay that's enough! You are avoiding giving us an explanation. Out with it."

Adam looked sick though whether it was from the cake or the thought of talking about his past, Madison could not tell. He stifled a burp and leaned back, taking a sip of the milkshake while he eyed us warily. His stomach was so full it pressed into the table the buttons straining to stay together.

"Look," he hiccuped, setting the milkshake down. "Before I tell you, you just need to know...I am not a good person."

"That is not true!" Cassi protested immediately. Though there wasn't much room left in the booth where Adam sat she scooted in and began to rub his distended belly.

"Definitely not," Madison agreed.

"Well I try but my childhood was complicated...So was Tom's but I didn't make it easier."

As always at the mention of Tom, Madison's chest tightened.

"When I was young, I got taken from my home and put in the foster care system. I essentially was raised by dozens of strangers that were always changing. I had a few chances at adoption but I ruined it each time because I would always act out. Usually, I would steal or run away but sometimes I would get violent. When I was fifteen no one wanted me because of my record and that I would most likely end up at a juvenile detention ward. I was angry, hopeless, scared. But my caseworker came to me and told me there was one more family in the state that would take me in, that they would pay off my jail time and that I better not mess it up. I had accepted that no one wanted me. I mean, no one wants to adopt a teenager. They just take us foster kids in because of extra money or they feel bad for us. But not this family. This family was wealthy and all they wanted was to help someone. They had heard about my behavior and were willing to take a gamble. That was the Russel family. Tom's family.

They were all really kind. Lois and Jared, Tom and I became close friends and I adored their daughter, Missy she was disabled and would have outbursts and they made me feel better like I was not this problem child and that I could be accepted for who I was. They really helped me. Except, I didn't know how to accept their love. It scared me a lot and so I made a plan to run away for good this time and because the Russels were rich I would be able to pull it off. So I sucked up to them, pretended I loved them back and prayed that they would adopt me. I think they were going to, looking back I realize that now. Then I would have gotten an inheritance anyway. But Lois had just had a baby, another girl. Lissa. And after a few months I began to get scared. I panicked. They don't love me I thought. Which I know is a stupid thing for a teenage boy to think but really the system messes you up. I wasn't thinking right. I got access to their private information and tried to get money from the bank. When it didn't work I took Missy. I tried to ransom the child. But of course that didn't work. They knew it was me and Lois and Jared tried to come for me instead of calling the police. But I was manic and not thinking straight and I hotwired a car. I didn't buckle Missy and-and I don't even know what happened. There was a crash and then I woke up in the hospital, completely fine but Missy...Missy wasn't. Missy was gone and it was all my fault."

Adam was fighting back tears. The way men do when their soul is completely ravaged but they want to appear strong. Cassi had stopped rubbing his belly and was hugging him instead. Her tears falling for him. "The Russels didn't want to adopt me after that and I don't blame them. I wasn't ready for a family anyway."

"That's not your fault Adam!" Cassi said with conviction. "You were young and you've changed so much since then..."

Adam smiled tenderly at her, stroking her blonde hair. "But it is though, Cass. No matter what I do or how bad I feel it doesn't change the fact that I killed Tom's little sister and he has every right to hate me."

"Maybe if he knew how sorry you are..." Cassi trailed off weakly.

Adam continued on as if in a trance. "The worst part is, they still gave me the money. And it was a lot. I didn't get to access it until I was eighteen so I didn't know, but Cass, it's a ton of money. I know I should give it back. I want to but...I can't. I need it and besides I cannot see them again."

"Then why did you come to the same University as Tom?" Madison asked.

"I guess-I guess the kid in me still wants a family and they are the closest thing I've ever had to one. Tom was my best friend, basically like a brother. We would have been brothers if I...if I hadn't...anyway. Knowing that I have some connection to the Russels helps me remember what it was like to be...loved." he tried to make the last word, loved, sarcastic as if it was silly and not a big deal but his pain was palpable.

Madison felt sick, invasive. Though she was glad Adam had opened up to them, she felt that she had read a chapter from Tom's life, a horrible, intensely private chapter and she didn't even know him that well. That guilt, coupled with the conflict of understanding both Adam's pain at making such a mistake and Tom's for losing his sister so suddenly were knotting together furiously in her stomach, churning the chocolate cake. She and Tom weren't even dating--didn't even know if he even liked her... How could she assume she knew his thoughts and feelings? She felt she had to say something. Her hand stretched across the table, touching Adam's limp one.

"I know there is nothing we can say that will help but we really care about you Adam. What would we do without you?"

Cassi nodded and mopped the tears from her face. "Yeah, I can't imagine how hard that must have been for you and for Tom's family.

"But...but if you hadn't gone through that...who would you be?" Adam didn't answer but looked thoughtful. "You probably wouldn't be the nice, charming, friend we know."

"Not to mention handsomest." Cassi added.

His lips twitched in the hint of a smile. "Cass, how is that relevant?"

"Because all of that lead you to me and you are sexy as hell, mister. I love you Adam. I need you," He maneuvered his weight in the booth to face Cassi, a feat that obviously pained him due to how full he was.

"I know we haven't known each other long Cassi, but I love you too. I really do,"

Feeling that this was a private moment for the couple, Madison excused herself and went outside through the back door. It was chilly out. Though she had put on a sweater it was thin and she was still in a dress so the wind was free to nip at her skin and into her bones. She didn't care. It cleared her head. There was a pain in her chest that she couldn't identify, a pressure behind her eyes that made her squirm with discomfort but slowly with each breath, coupled with the cool temperature she calmed herself down. Madison wasn't sure how long she stood there but her attention had fixated on the bugs gathered around the light, fluttering around it like it was their life source. She wondered if they knew it would kill them but still went for it anyway. There was a small zap and a large white moth went spiraling to the ground.

"Is everything okay?"

Madison jumped.

"Sorry, I didn't mean to scare you." It was only one of the workers. The handsome, young black man who had taken their order. He looked familiar for some reason.

She rubbed her sore eyes. "No, no that's okay. I'm just thinking."

He came to stand next to her. "I get that. You know your friend in there can really eat. I'm impressed."

"Yeah, he's talented like that,"

"My name is Eli," He offered a hand. She took it and couldn't help but smile, grateful for the distraction.

"Madison." She said. "Do we have a class together or something? You look familiar."

"Humanities, 10am?"

"That's the one,"

"I guess I'm not as easy to notice as it is to notice you. You are breathtaking,"

If she wasn't so emotionally drained, she would have blushed. He was handsome, tall, fit. With milk chocolate skin and the kind of dark eyes you could get lost in, and lips meant for kissing. He probably would be good at it. All those thoughts rushed through her head but they were just basic facts. She felt no interest in him at the moment.

"I should get back to my friends," She said.

Eli opened the door for her. Inside, she could see Cassi sitting on Adam's lap as best as she could, they were smiling now, taking turns feeding each other giant bites from an entire chocolate cake they had ordered.

"It's the end of the night," Eli explained. "I'm the manager so I was able to give it to them for free since we have to get rid of it anyway,"

Madison smiled, "That was really nice of you,"

1111111222111.content:
Madison couldn't bring herself to ruin their moment. Adam had had such a difficult night and being with Adam made Cassi happier than anything else in the world.

"They seem really happy," Eli commented.

"Yeah,"

Without meaning to, she sighed. Part happiness for her friends, part exhaustion, part a feeling of not quite having a place she fit in. Which was her own fault of course.

"You know, if you don't want to bother them I will give you a ride home. Do you live near the school?"

"Yeah I do, but it is not far. I can walk, really."

He raised his eyebrows. "You will freeze,"

They argued for a few minutes before Madison relented, let her friends know, and left with Eli. It occurred to her that she was getting in a car with a virtual stranger and that she was potentially putting herself in a risky position. But she was too tired to be anxious about her safety. Besides, he was nice and made pleasant conversation. She wasn't planning on it but she even invited him in for some food. Though she wanted to go to bed she wanted company even more. To be alone with her thoughts right now sounded like torture. Plus, she was starving.

"Hey, you are way too tired. Let me cook," Eli said as she started exploring her cupboards for stuff to eat.

"No, no it's fine," She protested even as she sat down.

Eli ended up being an exceptional cook with just a few spices he concocted a cheesy chicken Alfredo, with some of her frozen vegetables cooked and smothered in butter and borrowed some of Cassi's bacon for added flavor. As a side (because you can't have Italian food without all out as he said) he turned half a loaf of bread into delectable cheesy garlic bread. Too tired to care about eating healthy, Madison dug in. Each bite was a a warm, creamy explosion of flavor--a party in her mouth.

"How did you learn to cook like this?"

Eli shrugged, "I just like to watch people enjoy food."

he was more than halfway through the meal when she realized he had not had even one bite. "Eli, you made all of this. Please have some!" He shook his head,
"Its fine, I ate at work and it just makes me happy to see that you like it,"

"That is over generous of you. But you're totally right I'm in love with your cooking. You must become my full time chef!" She joked. Secretly, she was quite greedy about the meal and her inner glutton had taken over. With Eli's encouragement she finished every last bite. It was a good thing he wasn't her full time chef or she would be a mammoth. Groaning, she rubbed her bloated stomach. She could not believe she had eaten so much. But Eli seemed impressed which made her feel a little proud. If a fit guy like her enjoyed her stuffing her face than who was she to hold back?

Wow. She really must be tired if she was being this loose about pigging out. Or maybe she had just been spending too much time with Adam and Cassi.

"Hey, you're not done yet. It is not a feast without dessert," He pulled the new half gallon of triple chocolate brownie ice cream from the fridge, the one she had been avoiding all week.

"I really don't know if I can. You can have some though. Actually, you can have all of it."

"Suit yourself," he grabbed two spoons anyway and sat down beside her they had moved to the couch for more comfort. He took a big bite, savoring it slowly. To her shock, Madison felt her mouth start to water.

"Screw it. Give me that spoon,"

Eli distracted her with questions about herself. Her major, her family, her future, her favorite food, her favorite drink, favorite restaurant, favorite dessert, they talked a lot about food, which Madison was not to keen on because she only cared about eating food not talking about it. But they also watched youtube videos until the entire half gallon was finished. Afterward, she was so full that moving was impossible. She tried to stand up a few times but was too weak and heavy feeling to do so. She leaned back with a labored sigh, panting slightly from the effort. "Wow, am I okay? I can't move."

"Its totally normal. I can help," Eli offered to massage her aching belly and before she could protest he stretched his muscular arms around her. It felt strange at first but then she realized why Adam loved it so much when Cassi did the same thing. It really did ease the pain.

When she could move without intense pain again, Eli helped her upstairs to her room. It was only once he had left and she was about to fall asleep that Madison realized he had only taken three bites of the ice cream in total. Half a loaf of bread four peoples worth of pasta an entire bag of cheese, a stick of butter and bacon. What had gotten into her?

11111112221112.content:
Tom wasn't sure what he was doing outside Madison's apartment. All he knew is that he wanted to see her, wanted to apologize for last night. Although, he still wasn't entirely sure what she was doing in Renee's room and with Adam nonetheless, he wanted to see her. That wasn't new. He always wanted to see her--her stunning eyes and graceful beauty, to hear her smooth, velvety voice joking with him in a way that felt so natural and easy to respond to. He missed hanging out with her and regretted that he had ever ruined it by asking her out too soon.

"I just want Tom to be happy," Though he had not heard the majority of the exchange between Madison and Renee, he had caught the end of what Madison had said. He wasn't sure what that meant but at the very least he figured that they could keep being friends.

With a deep breath, Tom marched up to the door almost knocked, then, thinking better of it, he sent her a text: "Hey, you up?" he waited an excruciatingly long minute. Then: Yeah. What's up?

He texted: I'm at your house.
That sounded kind of creepy, haha but can I come in?

Sure thing, be down in a sec.

Inside, he shifted nervously. He tried to sit down at the kitchen table then stood up again, paced around then half sat at the island, fidgeting with his phone but not actually looking at anything. The sound of footsteps alerted him to her presence and he couldn't help but stand as Madison entered the kitchen. Although tired and a bit surprised, she looked ever bit as beautiful as ever. She was in a tiny pair of light gray pajama shorts lined with pink and a matching tank top that hugged her figure alluringly.

"Am I dreaming?" was the first thing she said.

He shook his head. "No I just wanted to see you. and talk to you...about last night."

Her eyes widened, suddenly remembering the events of the night before. Her full lips formed a silent oh and a pretty blush colored her cheeks. Tom could barely breath she was so gorgeous.

"Um it's kind of early, would you like something to eat? or drink? I have eggs and orange juice I think."

"Just orange juice is fine,"

Madison leaned into the fridge. From behind he felt more free to admire her. She had put on weight and with the mini shorts he could see how her thighs were full and soft--her toned thigh gap on the verge of disappearing. The added padding on her butt shortened her pajamas so that when she bent down start of the cheeks were visible. He tried not to focus on that, not wanting to think in-virtuous thoughts about her. Leaning forward into the fridge the tank top rode up over a slight roll of flab that she had not had before, her hips had the slightest curve of love handles that only enhanced her feminine hourglass figure. She turned, a pitcher of orange juice in hand an amused look on her face.

"Okay, I have been craving cake since I woke up and look what I just found." She pulled a huge chocolate cake from the fridge, one of the moist delicious ones from The Burger Place. There was a note on it that read, "Adam and I couldn't finish it. The rest is yours, love Cass."

"Hey, if you want cake for breakfast, no judgment. That's the best."

She smiled mischievously and fetched some forks."Only if you share with me,"

He matched her smile, the awkwardness suddenly gone and she plopped down. He tried not to notice how her tummy pooched out even more when she sat slouched at the counter and how she hadn't noticed to pull it down. The tank top was too small and her slightly larger breasts were quite visible. Tom felt his hand itch to touch her but he picked up a fork instead.

"About last night...he began. I'm really sorry. About Renee and my outburst and everything."

Her blue-green eyes softened. "You don't need to apologize Tom. I was the one sneaking into your girlfriends room."

"Yeah I was going to ask about that..."

She took a bite of cake, a pondering look on her face. When she swallowed she said, "Adam's friend Tyson sort of dated Renee once and he told us some things that happened that were concerning. I was worried so we decided to, um...actually I'm not really sure what we were doing. It was really impulsive and dumb and I'm sorry. But I promise we were not going to exploit any of her personal belongings and I was really just curious and..."

Tom chuckled. Madison always rambled when she got nervous, it had a calming affect on him. But then he grew sober. "You know you could have just come to me directly."

She looked away. "Tom...no I couldn't have. Things have felt so tense since...well you know and I sort of thought you hated me."

"Hated you? How could I hate you?"

She shrugged taking another bite of cake.

Tom sighed. "Look, I'm sorry if I have been...distant. It's just when you rejected me I was more hurt than I realized. I'm over it now," He rushed to finish. Something flickered across her face, was it disappointment? Then it vanished. "I guess I didn't want to make you uncomfortable either."

"Me too," Madison said. "I really do care about you, you know. And your girlfriend...I know I'm not in charge of your life, especially in this area but are you sure she..."

"She is egotistical and messy and kind of talks a lot. I know."

Madison laughed.

"But she has good qualities too, and right now I think I need that. Something I know won't be long lasting."

Her eyes seemed to penetrate his soul. "Is there anything I can do Tom?"

He shrugged, "Can we just be friends?"

Her expression was unreadable was she relieved, disappointed, confused? It all seemed to flash through her expression at once. Before settling on a soft, understanding look. "Of course."

"and about Adam..."

"He told us last night. Everything."

"Everything?" He couldn't hide the hint of panic in his voice. because it jolted through him so intensely it almost hurt physically. He set he fork down. a detail that did not go unnoticed by Madison.

"Well...I mean...he told us how you were his foster family and that he tried to get money from you guys and then your sister. Oh your sister..." He eyes filled with tears but she swallowed them back.

"Missy," a whisper was all he could manage.

"I'm so sorry," she also whispered. He realized her hands were gripping his. So warm, so comforting and they were the only thing grounding him to the present. "And I don't know if you are ready to hear this but Adam is so so sorry. You should have seen him last night... he cares for you so much. I just hope you don't stay mad at him forever. I mean you can do whatever you want..."

Tom looked at her, surprised. "I-I don't think I'm angry at him anymore."

She looked even more surprised than he was. "You're not?"

"I thought I was, but last night I realized something. Well, maybe I am mad but it is not because of what you think. Its just that every time I look at him I remember how I-I..." His voice grew hoarse and he could not finish the sentence. "It is just easier to blame him than to take responsibility for my actions and I don't know if I'm ready to do that yet..."

"I don't understand Tom."

"I'm sorry. I'm just...it's just...I'm so ashamed Maddie! I can't stop blaming myself and so I turn it on him instead and that is not fair to Adam. I just wish...I'm such a..."

"But you didn't do anything! You have nothing to be guilty over."

Tom didn't realize he was standing and she had stood along with him. His whole body was shaking and he felt very weak and sick. There was something that could fix that but he knew he shouldn't, knew he couldn't... Madison interrupted his racing thoughts by wrapping him in a hug. It was both bone crushing and the best thing he had ever felt at the same time. He relaxed into her, drinking in her sweet floral perfume, letting himself feel safe for just a moment while she held together all the pieces of him that were coming apart.

Finally he murmured in her soft cloud of black hair, "I don't think Adam told you everything."

She didn't move. "That's okay. You tell me when you are ready."

"Thank you,"

He used his fingers to tilt her head up to face him. The look on her face was earnest and loving--a look that made him both strong and weak. Before he knew it, their lips were touching. Not just touching, but moving together as a matched pair. It burned and tingled and numbed all at once, filling his soul with energy. At last they pulled away although he wished he could hold her slightly fuller figure all day long. Everything about her drove him crazy. But he couldn't do that. He had to do the right thing. He had to take care of the demons in his own life before he could be with her, if she even wanted to be with him.

"Tom..." She said her voice thick with desire. He planted one last kiss on her swollen lips.

"We should not have done that,"

She shook her head. "probably not."

"I still have to go." He said. "Renee is my girlfriend now and I need to be true to her. Even if she isn't to me."

Madison nodded sadly. "I get it. It's what I want anyway. You should go,"

The words stung but Tom nodded and pulled away, linking just their pinkies. "We can still be friends right?"

She smiled. "Friends,"

111111122211121.content:
Madison finished the expanse of the road beside Eli panting and gasping from the run. She linked her fingers between her head and forced her breathing to slow. Eli was looking at her with admiration, something she did not understand because they had only ran a few blocks and he had barely broken a sweat. It was infuriating.

"Don't look at me like that!" She growled. They had not had breakfast yet and Madison was always grumpy before food.

"Don't worry I'll get you food my princess," They entered the Dunkin Donuts they had run to and got a dozen to share. Well, mostly she ate them while Eli watched, enamored by her appetite. An appetite that kept growing. Usually they would carry them home and eat but recently Madison's hunger had been impatient and insatiable and she demanded that they sit and eat. The moment they did she wasted no time in digging into the warm doughy bread. The first three she barely tasted, she was so hungry. Then she slowed down to appreciate the sweetness and the texture.

In the past six weeks since her kiss with Tom these mornings had become quite frequent. Frequent, meaning everyday. She would run with Tom in the morning to get donuts, pancakes, Mcdonald's, pastries or whatever "his princess", as Eli referred to her, was craving. The best part was it was all free. Because one, Eli loved to watch her eat--or not just eat indulge, binge. 2) he was her gentlemanly and devoted boyfriend now. He had expressed his love of watching woman stuff their faces and let it grow on their frame shortly after they had started dating. While she was not too thrilled about the weight gain part she had been on a constant hunt to satiate a strange emptiness that had begun to grow within her. Ever since witnessing the battle within Tom and experiencing a taste of the agony he was in, Madison had wanted nothing else than to be with him and make him happy. But he needed Renee and she needed Eli so that is how it was and besides the endless desire for food (the increase in grease and empty carbs which she had had little to do with before could also be a contributing factor) it was working out quite well. She had even hung out with Tom a few times and much to her delight they had both managed to keep it strictly friends. It was hard though.

"C'mon princess you have one more. Please finish, for me?"

In the past, this much sugar and bread would have made her feel sick and bloated but now she just felt comfortably stuffed. She managed to eat the last one, noticing that he had only had one donut and a black coffee while she had polished off the rest of the dozen. A voice in the back of her mind reminded her of her goal to lose weight. She was going home for the semester break and she did not want to deal with her relentless mother nagging her about her weight. She didn't want it either but at least she had kept up on working out enough so it was not just pure flab. As they got back to her apartment (they walked back because she could not run on such a full stomach). They parted with a heated kiss. Eli admired her curves with his hands and she felt both pleased and irritated that his desire for her seemed to increase as her waistline did.

Though not fat, a month of indulging without restraint had definitely tipped her to the side of chubby. She had been 130 when she first started school, slim and muscular and modelesque. When her mom had visited she had easily been 140 maybe a pound or two over and her mother had thrown a fit. She had managed to keep her weight at 145 before dating Eli. Now, nearly a month and a half later she was 155lbs, having easily packed on 15 pounds. No amount of exercise could keep up with her eating. Almost, to the end of freshman year and she had not only gained the freshman 15 she had nearly tripled it. This excited Eli and he encouraged her to get the last five pounds to make it even. She wasn't trying to reach any sort of goal. She just sort of ate what she wanted and let Eli keep track for her.

When she came out of the shower, Cassi was admiring herself in the mirror. The night Adam had told them his story, Cassi had been resting at 155, the same weight Madison was currently at. But being a bit shorter than Madison this was quite pudgy indeed for her. If Madison stood Cassi side by side with the girl she had first met as roommates she would have a hard time recognizing them as the same person. At her highest, Cassi had stood at a round 170lbs but she and Adam had recently taken to a whole food, no sugar diet and while they were known to cheat quite frequently, she now was 163 while Adam had significantly trimmed down from being outright obese to a pleasantly plump young man.

"You look good," Madison said, she meant it. She was wearing a nice royal blue shirt that slid past her butt to the nice leggings and flats the girl wore.

"Thanks so do you!" Cassi chirped.

Madison snorted, throwing on some pants and a maroon blouse with a corresponding cardigan and scarf to accommodate the cold weather. "Lets pray that my mom agrees with you,"

Grabbing a canned Dr. Pepper from the fridge, Madison went to her last day of classes before finals. Despite the sugary breakfast and the soda, Madison could barely concentrate. Maybe she had finally packed on those last five pounds Eli was hoping for. Her pants were merciless. They pinched and squeezed her belly, making it hard to breath. The decorative holes in the pants had become exit points for her blubber to squeeze. She shifted and tugged at fabric and moved the entire class, trying not to be a disruption but the whole ordeal was miserable.
Note to self, she thought. Wear leggings to the final. During her second class some snow peas and a chocolate bar distracted her from the discomfort somewhat.

25 pounds. She thought. 25 pounds. If she reached 160 it would be exactly 30 pounds in one semester. Just the thought of her mom made her sick. Two large protein bars helped the anxiety go away and she used the energy from the food and the fear of her mom as motivation to power her through a 30 minute workout.

Right as she finished Eli sent her a text, he would be on break now. "How's it going, my princess?"

"good" she responded. "Starving. Will you have my order ready when I get there? I'm craving shakes and cheese curds."

Madison, Kelly, Ginger, Cassi and Megan decided to rush for a sorority when rush week came up. They went to a variety of events, but they soon realized that they wanted to get into Delta Pi Eta [DPE] which seemed to be the coolest house on campus. The girls were all really friendly, and as Madison noticed, really pretty. Delta Pi always seemed to be teaming up with the most exclusive fraternities for parties and she wasn't opposed to that.

On bid night all the aforementioned girls were thrilled when they got into Delta Pi. Madison was honestly surprised that all of them got in, given the exclusivity, but she suspected that the rest of her group of friends were also popular in high school, so they were not intimidated by Delta Pi's grandeur and elite apperances.

Madison was loving sorority life during the first few weeks. Her sorority had a beautiful house, and it seemed apparent that she had chosen one of the cooler ones on campus. All the girls seemed really nice, and Madison had a great time hanging out with them. Most of the girls felt the same way about Madison and her friends.

A group of seniors were in charge of pledges for the semester, and would guide them into the sorority. This group consisted of three members. Karen was a senior who was a very smart philosophy and business major. She had light brown hair and stood about 5'6, and weighed 140 pounds. When she came to powers she was about 15 pounds lighter, but 4 years of parties had added a little extra padding. Karen was smart and creative, but could also be a bit cynical at times [but if you asked her she would just call herself pragmatic]. She approached college with the same analytical focus that she would apply to whatever post grad field she ultimatly decided to go into. She figured out 'the game' of how to make friends quickly, and create a large network of people on campus that she could confer with to her own advantage. When Powers was going to crack down on Delta Pi for underage drinking after one of the parties that it threw got busted, it was Karen who wisely already was friends with a few people in administration and the students on the greek advisory board, and then blew through the Delta Pi alumni phone book to get donors to start calling the university and letting them know to lay off. Almost through sheer willpower and lots of charisma, she got admin to look the other way.

Sarah was another girl pledge guide. Unlike Karen, who relied on her intellect, Sarah embodied another way to get ahead, her looks. The product of a rich businessman and a trophy wife, Sarah was a knockout, a perfect 10. She stood 5'8, yet weighed only 120 pounds. Sarah had a model like body, yet somehow also had a decent sized rack. Her face looked like she was taken straight out of a photo shoot, and her blonde hair complemented it well. You know how in movies, the lead actress always has an attractiveness that usually doesn't exist in reality, Sarah was one of the lucky few who had that. Sarah could be shallow, but contrary to what one may think, given her hotness, she was pleasant to most people, which made her even hotter to guys she talked to. Like Karen, Sarah had built an impressive network of friends for four years, it helped that she didn't mind sitting next to average looking guys in class and chatting them up as well, she realized that friends were currency, and she wasn't about to go burn some nerd who may go on to be a Senator or prominent figure someday.

Rachel was the final pledge guide. She was cute, but not the knockout Sarah was, and she was decently smart, but wasn't the ever calculating intellectual that Karen was either. Rachel stood 5'4, and had a slender build. She seemed rather down to earth when Madison was talking to her. Rachel had a great work ethic, which came about through means that she never lead on about. Powers was a rather exclusive university. It was private, and it wasn't cheap. Most of the people who went there either were decently well off, or had some combination of aid and scholarships. Rachel was in the later category. Her parents were never rich, but they worked hard and instilled the notion of hard work in her at an early age. This drive got her a full ride to Powers, and she worked hard to keep it. When her Sophomore year rolled around and she got to choose a room in the sorority house to live in, she purposely choose a room on the top floor, back hallway, in a nook that was small. This may have seemed less than ideal to most, but she wanted the ability to study most nights and not get sucked into a random party that had broken out on a Tuesday. Because of her background, Rachel seemed to be the most approachable of the girls.

1111122112.content:
Cassi continued to study hard, she was just happy to get into such a good sorority, she wasn't going to risk starting off on a bad foot with everyone. Cassi went through the first 11 chapters, which went over the background of the sorority and it's bilaws. She learned some stuff that she thought was cool, and she learned about famous members of the sorority, some former first ladies, CEOs of a few fortune 500s and a few members of congress, things that interested her and she figured may come up on the test.

She continued and learned about proper decorum at meetings, and then a ton of things about proper formal attair and other things that she thought was archaic, ''Man, this must have not been updated since the 1920s,'' Cassi half thought as she continued to read through the rules.

Eventually, Cassi came across chapter 11, which was titled, ''New Member Procedure.'' It started off with a disclaimer, ''The following is the new member procedure of which new pledges will be brought into the Delta Pi Eta sorority. This is not the full procedure. Further instruction on new pledge procedure will be given to three pledge guides upon their election in a meeting with quoroum of the sorority chapter.'' This made sense to Cassi, they were not going to tell the new pledges what was coming up ahead of them, it would kind of ruin the whole point. So, whatever was in the book, they wanted the new members to see.

Chapter 11 went over things that they had already done, the bid night ceremony, she learned that they needed a 75 percent vote of the sorority to get a bid, she learned about other major ceremonies, big sister evening, and pledge retreats, among other things. Then she came to something that confused her.

''Chapter 11, Clause 26, A- New members [footnote 5, in 1986 the international sorority voted to informally term 'New Members' as 'Pledges', to seperate them from full members who had been initiated in good standing.] will be given a test to evaluate their knowledge and understanding of the Delta Pi Eta sorority and its functions. This test will cover all portions of the Rules and Bilaws publication of the current year. The new test will be mailed [footnote 6, in 2004 the international sorority voted to change the mailing of the test to secure email.] to each chapter in good standing with the international sorority each year. Test scores must be recorded, ranked, and sent back to the international sorority. Faliure to send back scores will result in probation for pledge guides.''

Cassi looked up, ''Crap, this must be important if they are sending these back to the international sorority, I wonder how long they keep these scores.'' She continued reading.

''Chapter 11, Clause 26, B- After tests have been recorded new members shall be ranked from first to last in order of test proformance. The new member who has the highest score should be invited to a meeting of the chapter and praised for her intellect and work ethic. She will be forever marked in our achieves as a Gamma sister, which will be marked next to her name in all future printed materials of the sorority chapter, or international sorority.''

''Okay, that's pretty cool,'' thought Cassi, ''I really want to go for that.'' The guide continued.

''Chapter 11, Clause 26, C- The new member who has the lowest score in the sorority shall be treated with scorn among her new members. This individual has shown a level of disrespect for our beloved sorority, and should be treated with consequence. This sorority was founded with forgiveness as one if its main ideals, the lowest member will be allowed to stay in the sorority. However, this member's appereance will be affected. [footnote 7, in 1923 it was voted on by the international sorority that 'apperance' refers to the physical apperance of the new member. The lowest new member will be forced to eat a diet of her sorority sisters' choosing for the remainder of her pledging.] After one semester, the lowest member will be forgiven for her disrespect to the sorority, and may enter in as a full member, assuming completion of the other requirements.''

''What the hell,'' thought Cassi as she read clause C, ''what kind of freak sorority is this?'' Cassi was studying alone in her room, which was too bad, because she wanted to motion Madison over and share in her shock over this.

Cassi decided to go the sorority house

Cassi noticed it wasn't nearly as hot as it was a month ago, now that they were getting into mid September. She thought about the weight issue and realized that none of her friends had really put on a lot of weight, which was good because some of the girls were looking a bit porky, which is probably why they didn't get into Delta Pi.

Cassi continued to walk and thought it was interesting that some sororities could be known as ones for fat girls, ''how does that happen, why do they all get grouped in like that? It's kind of weird when you think about it, that we are all so judgemental about one thing like that,'' thought Cassi. However Cassi wasn't in delusion about her ability to change the system. She knew that it may always be like that, at really any age. Cute little girls in grade school make fun of ugly girls, everyone know how insecure they all were in high school, heck studies showed that students, even before they were sexually aware prefered attractive teachers at a higher rate. Now, Cassi wasn't the victim in this scenario, she was attractive, and hung out with popular people in high schol, but it drove her nuts about how teen movies always protrayed these things. Maybe it was how she saw how nice her parents were to everyone, but she didn't pick on people, and talked to anyone she came across, regardless of social class or apperance, it just always seemed like the right thing to do. It was like she was trapped in a system that she hated, but benefited her.

Cassi eventually got to the Sorority house and went up to Karen's room. Karen came to the door in sweatpants and a t-shirt.

''Hey, what's up Cassi.''
''Not much, what are you up to.''
''Just writing my senior philosophy thesis, 'The consequences of hedonism in a nihilist world.''

Cassi vaugly knew what she was talking about, but some of that went over her head.

''Wow''
''Yeah, just finished my 26th page.''
''Yikes.''
''Yeah, but I like doing this kind of work, I guess that makes me a freak,'' Karen noted with a laugh.
''Hey I wanted to ask,'' Cassi said in an uncomfertable tone, ''what is the deal with Chapter 11, 26, Clause C.''

''Ah, yes you found that. What do you think about it?'' This was a trick that Karen always used, she wanted to get someone's angle on a subject going it, so she could figure out what point they wanted her to make, she had perfected this trick through four years of networking.

''I think it's weird, like do they actually make you fat?''

''I agree, it's messed up, some bilaw they amended in the 1920s to put a true consequence to not taking the sorority seriously.'' Karen agreed with Cassi, she thought it was humiliating, and counter productive. She remembered 4 years ago when she stumbled across the rule while studying and she still wondered why a sorority would fatten up a pledge. Wasn't that like a car dealer taking his new model and hitting golf balls into it? Karen continued what she was saying to Cassi, ''Yeah, the person with the worst score will probably gain some weight, some girls get really into it and buy a ton of junk food to make the girl eat.'' Karen said while shaking her head. ''It's stupid, they tried to repeal it at the international sorority a few years ago, but they couldn't get the 80 percent of chapters needed to take it out. Some girls a just mean spirited or think it's tradition.''

''Gosh, that's awful, I should probably go tell the other pledges,'' said Cassi.

''You know, Cassi, that may not be a good idea,'' said Karen, ''I take it you don't want to get the worst score,'' Cassi's head nod served as affirmation, Karen continued, ''So it may be in your best interest to not spread it around, so you have less competition.''

''Karen, they're my friends.''

''I didn't say it wasn't cold, I just wanted to give you some advice on how to avoid it.'' Karen said.

''Okay, I'll think about it. So who ended up getting the worst score in your class.''

''Bridget, she ended up gaining around 35 pounds during the semester.''

''Huh, I never met her.''

''That's because she dropped out of school due to the stress and teasing.''

''Really??''

''No, she lives upstairs, I'll introduce you guys sometime.''

''So did she lose the weight afterwards,'' asked Cassi,

''Well not all of it, she probably lost about 15 pounds. But she's still trying,'' Karen said, and thought about how many times she saw Bridget pushing herself in the gym. That was the crappy thing about weight, it was much harder to take off once you put some on.

''Who ended up getting the highest score and being a Gamma member?'' Cassi asked.

''Me.'' Karen said, sheepishly.

She walked past the basketball arena, and suddenly got pumped for those games, saw the new student center that was still under construction, which would replace the old and outdated one that they were using now, and she saw some statues of famous Powers alumni. She also walked past a card table set up with some upperclassmen. She looked at the sign, "Coooking club; Tired of just watching cable food shows in envy? This is the club for you." Madison was intrigued, like much of the country, she was all about celebrity chefs.

"Hi, so what does your club do?"

"Oh well, we meet once a week, and we learn 5 or 6 new recipes, then the next week, we make them and bring them back and have somewhat of a gourmet potluck, as contradictory as that sounds."

"Oh cool, well, I guess I have a bit more free time now than I expected. Can I take your flyer and email you if I decide to come?"

"Of course!"

Madison walked away with the flyer, it could be kind of fun, she thought, but at the same time it would run counter to her goal of not eating anything extra while at the gym. As she kept walking she saw the building for the student newspaper. Madison was intrigued by this because she had always known she was a good writer. She walked in, where someone walking by and greeted her. It was Jim, the paper's chief student editor.

"Hello, you look new, what can we do for ya?"

"Well...I don't know, I just have always wanted to write a bit, and I thought I would come in and check this out."

The guy didn't know what to say, they were not really taking new volunteer correspondents for a while, but at the same time, you could never use enough free labor, and she was pretty hot.

"Well....we" he was thinking on his feet, and just said the first thing that came to mind while staring that the very well dressed Freshman, "we do have an opening as a fashion columnist, but you'll need to submit a sample copy to me."

"Oh wow, yeah that would be great!"

"And just one other thing, we do two issues a week, so it may take up some of your free time."

Madison knew that he was saying that to her as a dealbreaker, but in reality, this was perfect. She could work on a story at the paper, while Cassi was working out. Maybe the stars were aligning to help her bridge some time until Cassi was done working out!

In the days leading up to her first deadline, Madison narrowed down her topic and got started. She decided to write on the evolution of fashion and the neo-80s design period that was currently overtaking American fashion.

All of this was taking up a lot more of her free time than she had planned, but she was enjoying it, and it was an excuse for her to get out of the gym. Along with her studies and social life, she wasn't at a lack of things to do, but she was rather pleased to have gotten involved. At the very least it made for good networking. Madison spent the Tuesday before her Wednesday deadline editing her story, which she found to be pretty decent. She emailed it back to Jim, who upon receiving it, was shocked that a freshman writer could be so competent in both content and style. Maybe this freshman, who he only gave the assignment to because of her appearance, was actually going to work out fine. He ran the story, expecting ridicule for putting a relativity subjective piece in their paper, but response was good. Jim would usually keep his ears open around campus the day that the new issue of the paper dropped to see what people were saying. Much of the time, the deficiencies of a college newspaper were evident, and people would laugh about a glarring typo, or a stupid op-ed. However this week he didn't hear much of that. When he was around a group of hot girls in line at the dinning hall, he overheard them talking, about how spot on that new fashion column was. Later that day when he went to the gym, he saw a few girls reading the page with the column on it and casually nodding their heads. Maybe that new freshman had a nack for this kind of thing.

The next day, Jim invited Madison over to the paper's offices,

"Madison, I have to say, that was a great column, I've heard a lot of good things about it."

"Really?! That's great!"

"Yeah, I was thinking. We have an opening, as our scene correspondent decided to quit and try other things, do you want to take that over?"

"Yes!! Jim, that would be great! Does it differ much from my current duties?"

"Somewhat. You would be in charge of review restaurants and bar openings, I know you're not 21, but we can probably work things out, or you can just interview people who went to the places. Also, you can still write fashion stuff, since that fits in the scope of the title. The paper will pick up the cost whenever you review a new place, and you'll get a small weekly stipend for the time you put in, but it's not enough to be considered a part time job."

This part didn't really hang up all that much on Madison, because her parents paid for most of her expenses.

"Wow, that sounds great, do I start next column?"

"Yep."

Madison could not be more pleased, but this also meant that in addition to the lack of gym time, she would be eating more fattening meals while reviewing restaurants.

As Madison heard the main door close she breathed a sigh of relief. At least for now her new insight was confined o herself alone.

Slowly she made her way to the bedroom, still not acknowledging the extent of her recent eating, instead rationalizing that her metabolism must have slowed down. She felt she looked like a blimp, but also had a gnawing hunger.

"What is going on with me? What am I going to do," she wondered as the phone rang. It was Jim.

"Hey girl," he greeted her. "Great column today. You are really some writer!"

"Yeah, thanks," she replied flatly.

"Hey, you sound a bit down - would you mind some male attention?" he offered.

"Yeah right, like you or anyone wants to be seen with the Hindenberg," she thought, but before she could reply her tummy rumbled, and Jim heard it.

"Say, what about I pick you up for a bite," he invited. Madison liked Jim, and this was the first time he'd invited her anywhere and she obviously was hungry. . Maybe this wasn’t the time for her to be worrying about a diet.

"Uh, well, maybe - but you need to know I have had a little wardrobe malfunction. My clothes may be a bit tight." She responded.

"Not an issue - you can deal with the laundry later. I'll be there in ten minutes.” Jim replied and hung up.

Madison in a panic raided Cassie’s closet, finding some size eight slacks and a top she hoped would fit. Thankfully they did. She resolved to go out with Jim, eat lightly and go on a diet beginning the next day. But when Jim arrived he had other ideas.”Hey beautiful, you look great – just perfect for where I was planning to take you.”

“Where is that?” Madison replied.

“”A new Mediterranean place I the mall – they have great lamb shanks and ecven do baklava.”

The thought of healthful mid-eastern cuisine appealed to Madison, who thought it couldn’t possibly be that caloric. The two had a great evening, including several baklava pieces, and as they got near home she thanked him for taking a miserable fat girl out.

“Fat?” replied Jim? “Now listen, I guess maybe you’ve gained a little and are now fussing about it. But no way am I dating you as a fat girl or from sympathy. I like you, including your figure, as a person. Don’t sell yourself short.

“Jim, my metabolism has changed” Madison complained.”. I’m bigger than Cassie if you haven’t noticed. This outfit is actually hers from before she lost weight these past few months, I’m afraid I won’t be able to lose what I’ve gained.””

“Hmmm – I see why you are feeling out of sorts.” Jim answered. ”Can I suggest that you get some clothes of your own? If your metabolism really has shifted you could indeed be exactly who you are, Cassie or no Cassie. But with your own wardrobe that won’t matter. You can just stay where your body wants to be. All I ask is that afterwards you let me date you some more, because I think you look great! Really!”

When Madison got home Cassie was waiting, and happy for Jim’s having taken her roommate to dinner as well as his counsel. She promised to help Madison shop for new clothes. Thus assured Madison began to relax, even giving in to the temptation to finish off a pint of ice cream in the refrigerator before retiring. Gone was her resolve to bring her increasing weight into check. Cassie took note of this and smiled.

The next day Jim made a point of catching Madison after her last morning class and accompanying her to the campus cafeteria where he added a piece of apple pie to her burger combo for lunch. Madison love it, thinking “I guess he must like chubby chicks.”

At first it was just a bit of a stomach that caught his eye on the college freshman, that he assumed was some overeating, but then he realized that it was persistently there. He didn't really know how to approach the subject of her weight, he figured, if he said any more than her did a few weeks ago, she would get creeped out, so he just let Madison continue into her new habits without commenting.

One evening after a movie, Jim noticed that Madison had moved towards the window of the dorm to overlook campus. It was a typical move, since the dorms at Powers had a nice view of both downtown and the campus mall, but he thought Madison look gorgeous from behind. He moved in towards her and pushed his body up against her's. He felt her butt which seemed softer than usual, and he couldn't help himself, so he moved his hands up against her front, which she happily obliged. Jim noticed that her belly felt soft, and he enjoyed feeling the bloat of her stomach after a large meal and sitting down for two hours. Madison slowly turned around, and they progressed into bed for the evening.

---
