Was it possible that he was into her being larger? Or was he just being polite. Either way, she did not have time to work out and felt self conscious whenever Cassi came back from her daily workout. The gym rat now had a toned body, and Madison was jealous of the days when she rivaled her, but she didn't have the will to attempt any kind of diet plan, and she questioned whether Jim would even want that.

She wanted to say something to Cassi, and remind her of how crappy she felt when she was larger, but instead she declined, she didn't mind being a bitch and talking trash about something behind their back, like she was doing about Madison, but she really didn't want the awkwardness of confrontation.

Unbeknownst to Kelly, her boyfriend, Mike, had noticed Madison's gain as well, and it was driving him crazy. Second, this was just something that went over her because of Madison, so maybe the feelings would disperse, and he wouldn't want to try to put some weight on his girlfriend if he was just going to have a change of heart. Besides, he reasoned, there is no way Kelly would ever let that happen.

"Maddie!!!"

'HEEYYY"

"Hey Jim, want to retreat to the back deck and have a beer?"

After a while, they got around to dinner plans.

"That reminds me, I haven't booked a reservation anywhere for tonight."

"Man, you know that would hit the spot...plus I would be able to see if Madison was being truthful when she talked up your cooking abilities," joked Madison's Dad.

That evening, Jim started cooking on the steak, but tried to marinate it in as much fatty olive oil as possible. Then, while he created some servings of mashed potatoes, he also dumped a ton of butter into the mix, possibly doubling the caloric numbers. "Maybe if Madison's Mom feels even the smallest gain, she'll lay off."

At dinner, the family raved about Jim's cooking skill,

"Jim, how did you learn to cook like this," asked Alexa, while she ate some fried apples, something she didn't have much in Southern Florida.

"Oh you know, I guess you just pick it up here and there."

Even Madison's Mom looked to be indulging.

Chris Kraft enjoyed Jim’s steaks as much as did his rail thin daughter Alexa, whose metabolism had always proven able to handle anything. Both raved about the food, which even Mrs. Kraft had to quietly admit was enjoyable. If this was a ample of what Madison had been exposed to it was obvious why she’d ballooned so much in a single year. Despite her opinion even she enjoyed the mal, eating perhaps a third more than she normally permitted herself.

“Maddie,” Alexa queried, “is this the kind of cooking you’re getting at school? Its divine.”

“Hardly,” replied Madison. “Jim’s a genius but the dining hall is just a commissary with no creativity. That’s why the girls in our dormitory cook a lot of their own stuff.”

“Madison makes a mean breakfast burrito – and her crepes and quiche are great too,” said Jim. Mrs. Kraft, who seldom cooked anything besides minimal survival rations due to her own stressful job, glowered but held her peace. Chris and Alexa, however, were intrigued

“You’re a chef now?” Me. Kraft asked his daughter.

“I used to cook meals for the family because Mom seldom had the time when I was living at home – you know that,” Madison replied. “Its nothing that new. I’ve just expanded the menu”

“I don’t remember you doing crepes, though,” said Alexa. “Do you mind doing some for us?”

“Alexa,” admonished her mother, “Do you want to go down the same road as Madison? Look at what that kind of eating has done to her in just a year,”

“Mom, I’m nearly a stick and can’t gain an ounce for trying. You may find that great but frankly I wish I had enough padding to have some curves. Its just not possible for me to get over 115 even when I’ve tried. I sort of envy Madison a bit,” Alexa announced. Her mom reacted with bewilderment.

“Well. The question is, Madison is on vacation. Does she want to do crepes and do we have the ingredients,” queried Chris.

“I’m sure Coral Gables has stores where we can get everything required,” replied Madison. “With Jim’s help I think we can give you a breakfast you’ll remember.

Jim immediately began spieling off a menu. “What about galettes? They’re a crepe which began in Brittany. They’re made with buckwheat flower and honey for the crepe plus blackberry jam and scrambled eggs for the filling. They’re gluten free so they’re actually health food- but very tasty. The French even have a special day, February 2, in their honor.. They go great with duxelles on raisin toast.”

“Duxelles?” asked Mr. Kraft.

“It’s a French paste spread, sort of like jam, for toast, made from chopped mushrooms, shallots and butter. Don’t knock it till you’ve tried it. I think you’ll find it, well, different but delicious,” answered Jim.

“You have me drooling already and I’ve just had a big supper,” said Alexa.

“Dad, we’ll be happy to do it. In fact, if you like we’ll be happy to try preparing other things later in the week,” Madison offered, “but before we take off I think Alexa and I need to do the dishes for Mom and Jim.”

With that the two sisters got to work, Mrs. Kraft eyeing Madison’s wide frame and ting it was nearly double that of her sibling. Was she the only one bothered by the transformation?

After they departed Mrs Kraft wasn’t happy with either her older daughter or her husband. “I hope you’re happy – you just let the family hippo take over the kitchen. What is the point of me cooking low calorie meals all the time if you can let a pair like that just come in and take over?”

“Its hardly a takeover, dear. It will only be a few weeks and they’re obviously content with being who they are. Why not relax and enjoy,” replied her husband,

“And honestly, mother, do you think we could possibly gain very much in that short of a time? I hope I could but its not going to happen,” Alexa sighed.

“Well,: huffed Mrs Kraft, “with this whole family against me I guess I’ll just have to keep my mouth shut. But if your clothes don’t fit in four weeks don’t say you weren’t warned.”

Despite her protestations Mrs. Kraft’s behavior contrasted to her words. The next morning, when served three crepes along with everyone else, she polished off every bit. This fact was not lost on Jim.

Jim and Madison didn’t just buy food for a French style breakfast. They procured supplies for a week of breakfasts and supper as well. Madison struggled to keep her own appetite undr control but was happy to see her family more eager to see what was coming next than to be making comments on her bloated belly.

Chris and Alexa noted a side effect of the gourmet dishes. Meals n the Kraft household had traditionally been “gobble and go” according to everyone’s schedule. Now there was a specific serving time with everyone together. As a result there was more conversation, at least between Jim and Chris and Alexa and Madison. Mrs. Kraft felt lke an outsider.

Jim picked up on Mrs. Kraft’s isolation and noticed something unusual. She was actually indulging in some comfort eating to compensate. How, he wondered, could he capitalize on this?

Hey, Alexa, what’s with the ice cream? Its not even lunch time,” queried Madison.

Jim was thinking fast as he talked with Madison and Alexa. “OK, now I’ve noticed your dad, Chris, seems to especially like my fish dishes, so here is what I propose for dinner tomorrow night. I can get some pecans, crush and mix them with flour, then baste them with egg whites onto trout for a crust and add a sauce made up of oranges and rosemary. Combined with green beans and rice it should taste really great. Then when I get ready to serve dessert your mom will probably leave like always and we’ll have Chris to ourselves.”

Madison and Alexa were already salivating at the description, Alexa wondering what the dessert would be.

“Sounds great,” said Madison. “but what do we say to Dad?”

“I’ll break the ice – just try not to cut me down, OK,” offered Jim

“Alright” the girls agreed. Alexa once again observed her younger sister’s billowing belly roll surging out from beneath her rib case into her lap, the back fat on her rib cage also noticeable. The new flesh on her face, puffing her cheeks and forming a double chin completed the picture. She could see what her mother did but due to her own frustrations Alexa had more envy than criticism. Madison for her part seemed to be either unaware or didn’t care about her size.

However, the next night Madison came to dinner in a comfortably contoured tie-waist dress with a pattern which emphasized her bodice and hips while distracting from her stomach. The impact was stunning. Alexa was much more informal, wearing tight pants and a top that did nothing to conceal her minor pudginess. Jim smiled as he realized they were both baiting their mom in different ways.

He served the meal, explaining that the sauce, in addition to orange and rosemary had shallots, two types of wine, parsley, lemon juice and whipping cream. This drew a compliment from Chris and a cold stare from Madison’s mom.

“That was a great meal, Jim,” acknowledged Alxa. “Can I ask if there is dessert?”

“Of course,” replied Jim. “we have a pecial kind of pound cake with a lemon glaze all over the top and soaked into the cake itself. It originated in Germany and is called Zitronenkuchen. And we have cherry vanilla ice cream to go with it for those wanting it.

At that Madison’s mom arose, declaring, “I don’t have any need for such things, thank you. Please excuse me.”

With that she left, obviously not in agreement with the menu.

“Hmmm – I guess that means more for the rest of us,” mused Alexa.

“Alexa, that is selfish. Can’t you be a little more understanding of your mom’s feelings?” said her father.

“I try daddy, but she makes it impossible sometimes.” answered his daughter

”If I may suggest that we have our desserts and get the table cleared, then perhaps there is something we all need to discuss.” offered Jim.

“Very well,” agreed Chris.”I personally am rather curious about this unique pound cake – nitronuken I think you called it?.”

“Zitronenkuchen,” corrected Jim

Jim served the cake, giving Chris one small scoop of ie ream while he and the girls each had two large ones. Chris silently noted the difference and took note of the symbolism. When everyone was finished Jim began to speak.

“Chris, I’ve just met you a few weeks ago and what I’m about to may seem presumptuous. But I see a major collision coming no matter what I say or do. I think you know what I’m talking about.

“Yes,” sighed Chris, “I think maybe I do,”

“I am committed to standing by Madison, and Alexa as well. They’re both adults, as are you and I. That means we accept another’s choices unless its something illegal or immediately life threatening. We shouldn’t try to control one another because in the long run t seldom works. Do you agree with that in principal?”

“Yes, of course. I think I’ve always supported my daughters,“ stated Chris somewhat defensively.

“Yes, you have so far as I know. But your wife has her feelings about weight, which for herself is fine and her business. But she’s puhing Madison and Alexa away by trying to transfer those feelings onto them when they don’t want it. The question is, why does she feel so strongly and what can we do about it, if anything?”

Chris sighed and hung his head. “I‘ve lived with her nearly thirty years and although I can answer the first part of the question I don’t know what to do about the second.”

“Go on,” encouraged Jim.

“Her mother’s husband left them when she was four and her mother taught her that it was because she’d gained too much weight. That probably wasn’t the whole story but it created a fear of being unacceptable if she were to be heavier.

“Shallow jackass. Grandma was better off without him if that’s true,” exclaimed Madison.

“That’s your view,” acknowledged Jim, “and I certainly agree. But its not what your mom can see. She feels a need to protect her chicks.”

“Even though we’re grown up?” Alexa interjected. “She does need to let go. I wouldn’t ever want to be as large as Madison but I envy her ‘cause I can’t gain much no matter what. I’m sick of being a flat chested beanpole!”

“And as an adopted child you don’t have my genes so you probably never will be bigger like me. But I love an respect you anyway,” answered Madison. “But mom shares genes with grandma and me so if I get fat she’s fearful she might as well and lose dad. Am I getting close to something?”

“I think so, said Jim,. “Now, what can we do about it?”

“I think Dad needs to talk to mom an just lay it all out,” declared Alexa.

“I won’t work, replied Madison. “people dance to their own scripts – even if you convince them to make statements against their will to end an argument they’re of the same opinion still. The change has to one of mind and heart. The real issue is her not wanting to let us loose to live our own lives. I know I’m pushing 200 pounds, but that’s my business, not hers.”

Jim and Alexa were both startled. That statement was the first Madison had openly acknowledged to either of them that she actually knew how big she had become.

“Perhaps if I told her we want to talk with her as a group?” suggested Chris.

“That might be a good start – I’m sure she feels isolated and not in control right now,” replied Jim quietly.

1122312122111111122112221222122211221212.content:
Chris Kraft retired to his study to think, but not before Jim and Madison suggested to Alexa that they go out for a movie to give Mr. Kraft space.

About ten minutes after the trio of young adults left Mr. Kraft heard his wife exit their bedroom. He knew what was happening for he’d heard it before over the years, but he knew he needed to let it play out, so he bided his time The refrigerator door opened, a dish rattled. Then the refrigerator door opened and closed again. Still he waited.

After about five minutes he went into the kitchen, catching his stressed out wife devouring a huge bowl of the ice cream she’d rejected an hour earlier. Chris got a bowl, went to the refrigerator and took out the ice cream, scooping out a generous serving for himself.

“Mind if I join you?” he asked as he returned the now nearly empty container to the freezer,

“Might as well, but I don’t think you’re doing it for stress relief like me,”
answered his wife. “Do you realize how much pigging out I’ve been doing? If I don’t watch it I might start becoming a whale myself.”

“Whales are an endangered species. Maybe that wouldn’t be all bad,” quipped Mr Kraft.

“Chris, can’t you take this seriously? We have one daughter as big as a house, another who wants to be and you’re making jokes?” cried Mrs Kraft

“I am taking it seriously, more than you know. But do you realize that not everyone sees things the same way? There might be another viewpoint than yours – or mine? Madison and Alexis are adults now. How do you think they see things?” Chris countered.

“What do you mean?” she answered.

“You see being overweight as a guaranteed key to rejection and probably health issues. But some women find being bigger erotic, enjoyable and a way of attracting certain kinds of men. Since they’re adults can’t we grant them the freedom to find their own way? Who are we to be trying tp control them? I don’t think I have that right and I’m their father. What about you?” he asked

“Nice platitudes – but be honest. If I weighed forty pounds more wouldn’t you be out the door in two minutes? Maybe not because I’d have a paid off house – but otherwise I bet you’d be gone, gone, gone,” she shot back.

“Actually no, my dear. We do and enjoy many things together, I don’t want anyone else and except for when we focus on weight I think we’ve had a good marriage even if you won’t let me take you out to dinner as often as I’d like. Even if you gained a hundred pounds I wouldn’t leave you over it. Can you believe that?” Chris declared.

“You can’t be serious?” she gasped

“How many happily married men with fatter wives do we know? Its very possible – not that I’m saying I want you to try doing it. I’m just saying our marriage isn’t defined by your figure. Can you accept that? And the girls feel they have a right to define themselves. They’ve told me so and wish you could accept and be happy with that.”Mr Kraft stated

“Sure they feel that way with that Jim as the pied piper of calorieville. He even has me eating more than I usually do. He’s the reason Madison’s gotten so fat, I’m sure of it –even if she claim she got bigger before meeting him,” retorted Mrs. Kraft.

“I’m sure he’s helped add to damage already done, but the question is, are such matters our business or the girls? I think you at least need to talk with them instead of storming about raising your blood pressure every time they take a bite. Maddy will be gone in a week but we’ll still have Alexa and, you’re right she’s trying to emulate her sister a bit.

“But why? I just don’t understand it. The idea of liking to be fat contradicts everything I’ve been taught!” Cecelia replied.

“That is a question you need to ask her.” Mr Kraft responded. “When they get home will you do it?”

“Can we be eating ice cream while we do,” Cecelia Kraft asked. “You know it helps me when I’m under stress.”

“I’ll try getting some before they return,” her husband replied.

Thirty minutes later in the theatre Jim received a text message from Chris: “Mrs. Kraft willing to talk. Am at market laying in supply of ice cream for all. Please advise as to arrival time.”

Jim showed the text message to the two Kraft sisters, each of who was contentedly munching on popcorn and sodas. Then he replied “Movie about 1/3 through. Estimate arrival in ninety minutes”

When the three young adults returned to the Kraft home Mr. Kraft already had five ice cream bowls out and was filling them. A somewhat dejected Cecilia Kraft sat at the table. When everyone was seated Mr Kraft began

“This is a family meeting which also involves Jim who is our house guest. I’ve had a talk with Cecilia and she understands Madison’s concerns about being allowed to make her own decisions as an adult. I’ve also told her Alexis has a view and that that she should be willing to listen to what others have to say, even if she doesn’t agree. She has agreed to listen.

“Mom, Madison said. “I didn’t start out to upset you or get fat on purpose. But you know how you are about ice cream – well in college I guess I had the same thing about food in general. It started out with trying to be in and be popular. I had successful column in the school paper and got invited to a lot of parties. I hit it off with a guy and then when I gained a few pounds he dropped me. I think you know why I felt I couldn’t share that with you. But that’s when the comfort eating started.

“Next it was my roommate. We tried out for a sorority and that turned into a mess. She was bigger than me and we tried to exercise, then I let up to make her feel better and, honestly, also because I was feeling a need for food to be happy. Well, we went home to her place for a weekend and I found fat people for who it was normal and we both decided to chuck our diets. I didn’t even know Jim to speak of then.

“By then I’d gained probably 25 pounds and was ashamed to let you know so I didn’t come home for the holidays. Jim helped me out of the depression I’d sunk into and helped me deal with some critics. I stopped gaining so fast but still added a few each month. But by Spring I was happy and found that I liked both my body and my life. Then we visited Jim’s family and found that they were like my roommate – very supportive of my being myself. I just have no desire to be different just to help you fight your issues, and for that I’m sorry. But I want to be me – is that so unreasonable?”

“Alexa?” said her Father

“Mom,” said Mrs Kraft’s adopted daughter “I’ve never had to turn into a pretzel to appease your weight issues like Madison. I know what she did just to please you when she was in high school, but I also understand how she couldn’t keep it up. As for me, I’ve always felt like a flat-chested freak, all brains and nobody. But my metabolism isn’t like hers and probably yours. If you can understand this, I’ve even considered weight gain pills or having padding added by surgery I so want o have some curves. I’m not you, I’m not Madison, I’m me. And like her, I’m sorry you find it so hard to accept that.”

“Jim, do you want to add anything?’ Mr. Kraft inquired.
‘
“I guess just that I’m not the enemy in all this. When Madison and I got involved she was already bigger. For some reason, I liked all of her, including her size. I resented the remarks of others and made it known. I never thought about such things before, but believe me I would never do to your daughter what happened to your mother. But I think Madison probably was programmed genetically to be happy as a BBW from the start. I hope you can accept that.”

Mr Kraft turned to his wife. Tears were streaming down her face.

“I see what I’ve been doing, transferring my mother’s pain onto everyone else. I don’t know if I can change but I want to, ‘ she sobbed. “What do you think Chris?”

“I’ve already told you I wouldn’t ever leave the woman I love over her weight I meant it.. This has been your issue, and only your issue, for nearly thirty years. Are you willing to let me take you to a few good Mexican and Italian dinners now and then?” he inquired. “Give yourself permission to be who you are without fear, whatever that might be?”

“I guess that might be something we could try, but will please you all forgive me?” she replied softly.

“Mom,” said Madison, touching her hand, “We already have.”

“Absolutely,” agreed Alexa, “and although you have nearly finished your ice cream, I’ve barely touched mine. Mind if I dig in?”

Jim and Chris smiled at the irony as they looked at one another, neither man saying a thing. Their bowls too, and Madison’s as well, were virtually untouched. In unison they followed Alexis's lead.

As she and Jim headed back to college Madison knew she’d gained a total of 77 pounds in 15 months – more than she’d admitted to her parents or even Jim. She was at 207, which meant that any day she consumed over 2600 calories without a lot of exercise she was likely to gain a bit more. Cassie at 3000 per day seemed to have stabilized at around 230. Madison hoped that would be her fate as well because she had come to enjoy eating too much to diet.

Her roommate Cassie had reported that Kelli was back two weeks beforte school started and had admitted to gaining another 17 pounds over the summer, bringing her gain to 57 pounds and a total of 177. This she speculated might be more than Kellli’s plump but care free former roommate Ginger, who in the Spring had said she was pushing 170. Madison was happy to hear that Kelli and Michael were still together.

Cassie had described Kelli in an email. “I saw her on her bike at the corner. She was wearing turquoise shorts and a matching top she must have bought thirty pounds ago.. She had a belly roll bulge in her shorts and then a bigger one on her torso. Remember her slender runner’s thighs? They are totally bigger than they used to be. But she seemed happy and oblivious to the amount of change. I don’t know if she’s crossed over to the round side yet or is just still in denial but of course I have no room to talk.”

That is what had caused Jim to text Tim and Michael, inviting them and their girl friends to a cookout when he and Madison got back. He would have included Ginger but word was that she had a job and wanted to take a break from school to accumulate tuition money while paying down what she owed,

Kelli was into her second bag of chips in front of her computer when the message was forwarded from Michael.. Earlier she had had a tv dinner and a bowl of ice cream, so she certainly wasn’t dieting any more than cooking for herself. She knew Jim’s invitation meant he and Madison would likely be cooking and she began wondering what he might prepare and smiled in anticipation.

This was the new foodie Kelli, no longer focused on her weight or that of others, but rather enjoying food as Michael had suggested. He liked it, her family didn’t mind, and she felt free of the pressure to be thin. But indeed she didn’t yet see herself as really fat, dressing in clothes normally worn by those of lesser size. After checking with Michael she accepted Jim’s offer for both of them.

Cassie too accepted the offer. She knew she was the biggest of the trio and not the tallest. Unlike Kelli she knew she was a fat girl. But it was something common in her family and it didn’t bother her. Madison at over 200 considered herself formally fat as well, but tried to dress and act attractive to good effect. Like Jim she wondered how the new roommates the trio would soon be meeting would react to living with a set of certified BBWs.

Upon returning to school Jim dropped Madison off. They both had work to do, He had to check out a portable b-b-que he’d arranged to use at a frat house while Madison prepared a cobbler for the next day. Cassie was supposed to be doing the salad and Kelli was supplying the beverages and paper goods. Jim wasn’t confident of Kelli’s cooking skills but thought she could do basic shopping.

Madison dropped in on Cassie in her new room. The two sophomores wondered how they would handle their new freshmen roommates whom they both knew were likely going to be far smaller than they.

“I really don’t care if they get bigger or not, just so they don’t try to change me,” stated Cassie. “I’ve decided this is the way I’m meant to be and that’s my decision to make.”

“The very point Jim and I had to make to my Mom,” agreed Madison as she accepted a bag of cookies and withdrew a handful.

“I know I told you about Kelli, but I think you’re still going to be surprised.” observed Cassie.

“Probably, but I think I’ll just be friendly and not gloat. People can change and she’s probably still got some learning to do.,” noted Madison.

Cassie nodded in agreement. “Yes, a number of her friends didn’t make the cut on grades and won’t be coming back. She’s going to have to build a new social circle and at her size that probably means beginning with us. It’s a strange turnabout, but true.”

Next day Jim started out early buying supplies. Then he went to the frat house and cooked three BBQ chickens bursting with flavor after being marinated in a garlicky sweet and sour sauce. Meanwhile Madison had cut her cobbler into pieces and put them into a hamper with cold ice cream, , shortly to be joined by Cassie’s potato salad and macaroni salad. Cassie also brought along a hot kettle full of mixed vegetables. Jim and Tim showed up right on schedule and they headed for the park,

"How was the workout?" Madison asked.

"Great, the more I do it, the more I want to keep going." Cassi said as they walked into the food area together. When they got back to the table, Cassi noticed that Madison had grabbed a burger, much in contrast to the salad that she was eating, even though she tried to hold her poker face, she accidentally shot Madison a look of disbelief. She could not help it, this was not the beach bod girl that she knew.

"The diet starts in a few days," Madison responded, "we need to start working out in tandem again. I want to lose this weight by spring."

"Yeah, one burger will not hurt."

"I know this isn't a good start, but I've been having a really bad day, and this just looked so good."

"Justified," Cassi said, trying to sound convincing.

Just then, Madison shifted the conversation to a guy. "Hey, you know Mike over there," she said, nodding a few tables down, "I heard him and Grace just broke up, I think I may start texting him a bit more, and see if anything is there."

"Really?" Cassi said, somewhere between being sincere and not.

"Why do you say that?"

"I just heard he was into Kelly, and thought she was really hot. I don't know do you think it's a coincidence...about Grace?" Cassi said, referring to his ex-girlfriend who had gained around 15 pounds since coming to the school, but then leveled off, unlike Madison. Given Madison's sudden look of frustration, Cassi was also sure that Madison connected Kelly's almost pencil thin physique and realized that she may have let herself slip down a league.

"Ugh, I really need to lose this weight." Madison said, while getting up.

"Oh, come on, maybe we will run into him on Friday. You've never had problems getting guys in the past, let's go out."

"Fine, but we need to work out first." Madison said as she was walking away. Cassi was sure to take note of Madison's growing behind as she went back into the food area, and assumed she had to have gained weight. About a minute later, Madison came back with some ice cream.


Later in the day, Cassi was walking through the dorm common area when Kelly and Megan caught up with her. "So, not to be mean," Kelly said, which almost always meant something mean was coming, "but like, what is going on with Madison?"

"What do you mean?" Cassi asked, knowing perfectly well.

"Well...her weight, she looks a lot more puffy." Megan said.

"Yeah, what do you think she weighs?" Kelly asked, "She really needs to be careful."

Cassi pondered whether to give the two girls the URL she had created, with the knowledge that it would probably be updated soon.

choices: It turns out Madison isn't the only fit-and-trim girl getting into Cooking Club
A week later, Cassie notices Madison is a voracious student
11223121221112.content:
If two things could be said of Madison's personality, it was that she couldn't refuse an opportunity opened to her and that, whatever she did, she threw herself in with gusto--some might say, obsession. Truth be told, if she really thought about it, that had at least as much to do with her killer body as her good genes. Between some crucial developmental changes and the pressure of an older, somehow prettier, athletic sister, Madison had been heading into high school with her weight on an upward trajectory and looking a bit chubby. Alexa seemed to have the category of "hottest Kraft sister" sewn up, after all, so without any sense in competing, Madison let herself blossom into a different rung of high school society and a lower tier of freshman boys who no less loved her softening Latin curves. It wasn't until her favorite teacher, who happened also to be the school cheer coach, took a special interest in the increasingly unhealthy but dedicated young girl and personally invited her to train for cheerleading tryouts, that Madison's life took the shape it had now. Once someone pointed Madison to the workout room, she was an undeterrable force, and well before senior year she'd become the taught and toned 130 lb. cheer captain that now graced the halls of Powers and, more immediately, the office of the student paper.

Still, that doesn't mean that she was good at everything she threw herself into.

Jim stared troubled into the drafts on his desk, looked up and across at Madison for a moment as though about to speak and hesitated thoughtfully again. "It's just--"

"It's no good. ...is it." She looked disappointed.

"No, no--technically, grammatically, structurally, it's fine. I mean, but yeah, I can't run either of these, sorry. Look, you're a fine writer; it's just..."

Madison glimpsed a window and her disappointment shifted to determination. Maybe she could muscle her way to success after all. "Just...?"

"It's distant. No feeling. It's like you know your subjects academically. The fashion piece, it's like you're reporting the weather. And the food review--I know I kind of threw that on you just to test you, and we need someone on the column like yesterday--well, it's like you've never eaten before. I mean, I've been to Marcella's, and you're describing the factual properties of every eggplant parm on the civilized planet. Frankly, I'm not even sure you actually ate there. There's no life, no passion." Jim suddenly backed off, embarrased, and Madison said nothing. "That probably sounds out there and really self-important. I know it's just a food review for a college paper. It's just--"

"Just that writing that connects with people has life in it." Her eyes were fixed on his in understanding, as though reading them like a teleprompter. "And that life comes from passion."

Jim was surprised. And a little aroused. "Yeah."

"I can do it," her eyes flashed. "I totally get what you're saying, and I can do them better. Give me another shot, chief."

"First of all, keep calling me 'chief.' Second, I've got to move on the fashion column, and I've already got someone else ready to move into it. So if you're serious about this, I need another food review in two weeks, and I need it written by basically a completely different person than the one that wrote this chilling analysis of breaded aubergine. Can you do that?"

"But the next issue is in a week. Why two?"

"Because frankly I'm not sure that you can do this, and two weeks probably still isn't enough time. Sorry to be brutal, but they don't call me 'chief' for nothing--well, presumably you don't--and by the way, I'm going to need you to start spreading that 'chief' thing around. Look, I can tell you're a people-person; let's say you can connect with people. But to connect with the readers I need you to connect with food, and..." Jim figured he might as well go for broke: "I just have a feeling you have kind of a...distant relationship with it." There was silence. Madison did not react to the prejudgment as Jim feared she might. He was used to pulling no punches and, for that matter, earning a few punches back for it. "I have no idea what you're going to do in two weeks, but I promise I'll read anything you put on my desk by that deadline."

Madison had been silent because she knew he was right. Sure, Jim was being an ass and could have been way off base. Maybe Madison's body did look especially fit in her high-cut shorts and tight tank. Maybe Madison had showed up at the office on her way to the gym (Cassie couldn't expect her to go cold turkey yet, could she?). And Maybe she had already squeezed in a five-mile run that morning, apportioning the proper amount of calories accordingly. But none of that meant that she had a "distant relationship with food." It just happened to be true anyway. "Chief," she said firmly, perhaps a bit flirtatiously, "I do have passion. And you'll see just how much." With that, she turned on a toe and left.

But as she sat back in the dorm room alone with little else to do, with Cassie at her gym, Madison was having doubts and, quite frankly, starting to feeling a little crazy thinking about food in terms of a "relationship." It wasn't an unhealthy one. She certainly remembered loving food, loving to eat, but she never gave any thought until now that that just wasn't there anymore. It's not like they had a "falling out"--just that in the fitness fervor that seized her a few years ago the role of food kind of shifted and became more utilitarian: fuel that kept her tight body turning heads. She thought in calories rather than flavors. And where she was certainly right, that she did have passion, she wasn't sure what it would mean to feel anything when she ate. Somehow she wouldn't be defeated, by journalism of all things.

At an impasse for the moment, Madison went to lower herself to the floor for some quick, surreptitious sit-ups--addict that she was--when her eye caught a bright flyer sticking out of her bag. "Huh," she mused, and seized the familiar paper. "Cooking Club." Checking her watch against the printed meeting schedule, she saw she had just enough time to make it to the lunch group. "Man," she thought, "they do sure meet a lot. This could really help to fill out my schedule until Cassie's ready to work out with me again." Without a sit-up crunched, Madison bounded off to learn the secret to irresistible gourmet macaroni and cheese. (Hint: mostly, a lot of butter and cheese.)

112231212211122.content:
While Madison was on her longest vacation from the gym in three years, Cassi ramped up her commitment from zero to 60. It was doubtless a struggle. Unlike Madison, Cassi's former physique was the result more of youth and once more-reasonable eating than disciplined fitness regimens, and now she was downright out of shape. Still, she managed to drag her heavier frame back and forth from the gym with an almost imitation regularity compared with Madison's old schedule, determined to reclaim her old '9' body and close the gap between Madison and "Madison's fat roommate," maybe even get herself some abs this time too and rival her '10' roommate. Only a week and a half into the friends' arrangement and down only five pounds, the chunky blonde had few results to show yet--at least not at first glance. Coming back from her evening workout, Cassi was nearly drenched and still breathing hard, but she undoubtedly carried more energy lately, and confidence. After a couple of days of powering into something like Madison's routine, Cassi had changed her habits drastically, kicking her between-meal grazing and junk food, even moving her stash of snacks from her side to the middle of the dorm, where it had remained as of yet untouched.

All while Cassi was being consumed with the beginnings of her own transformation, she hadn't noticed the changes in Madison's own demeanor. Come to think of it, between her shifts and the gym, classes and, well, wherever it is Madison had been off to, she hadn't seen much of the girl. Only after she collapsed in a chair to remove her running shoes did she notice Madison slouched behind a monitor, quietly working away at her desk. Working away at two things, actually: an article, and some leftover Chicken Florentine. The half batch of lobster biscuits don't count; she had already finished those by the time Cassi returned.

"Mmhh!" Madison swallowed, finding herself discovered. "This is so good, Cass. I just learned how to make this. ---Well, mine wasn't as good, but I'm catching on quick. It's fascinating how the flavors are brought together. In fact--mmhhh!" She interrupted herself with another sizable bite.

"I thought you had another week to submit your column again," Cassi questioned. Unconsciously her hands felt her own enticed pot belly as the fragrance of the buttery sauce reached her nose. Strange, she thought, that she thought she also smelled cheddar biscuits and maybe something else . . .

Still masticating an overly large forkful of poultry and pasta Madison had turned furiously to the keyboard. "Mmhm. And I'm not writing it yet. I'm practicing."

"Cooking?"

"Cooking, tasting, writing. --Seriously, Cass, I'm learning a lot. Who knew there was so much to food?-- I'm going back to Marcella's," she paused to pop some chicken in her mouth, "and I'm going to rewrite my first piece. Jim was right. I didn't appreciate the food, so I couldn't write about it. But I will." She flashed a smile, spinache in her teeth.

Cassi had to admit she was pleased. Maybe it was silly, but she was a little worried about kicking Madison out of the gym for a while. She was a great friend and a great girl, but as driven as she was she needed an outlet to be balanced. The whole foodie thing was a weird fit on Madison, and that phase might take getting used to as short-lived as it would probably be, but she seemed happy. She apparently wasn't wearing workout clothes out of habit anymore, which actually may have been a little less weird than this new gushing over food. Of course that didn't mean that she showcased her gorgeous body any less, wearing tiny jean shorts and a tight Powers tee. --Though, come to think of it, Cassi noticed, was that a little bulge pushing out gently against Madison's waistband? Maybe it was how she was sitting. Maybe it was all the food she very evidently ate that evening. Maybe. But it was still nothing Cassi had ever seen on her perfect roommate before, who was now apparently mixing biscuit crumbs into her remaining Florentine and savoring.

"Oh, and Cass."

Cassi work back up to her own couple of rolls with some 30 pounds to go before she could judge Madison for indulging a little bit on her gym-vacation, which was after all for her friend's benefit. "Yeah?"

"You're totally welcome of course to the leftovers I bring back from Cooking Club. A lot of the dishes might not be great for your diet, but seriously, you know where they are. I just noticed some of it being eaten this week."

"Oh, um. I didn't notice you'd been bringing stuff back. I haven't been in the fridge," she replied honestly and got up for some last cool down stretches before her shower.

"Weird," Madison trailed off, scraping the bottom of the dish and settling back in her desk chair. "But you know what article someone needs to write... How it is the cafeteria food has actually been getting pretty good lately! Tell me you've noticed that."

1122312122111221.content:
Cassi thought she was making progress. Sure, her loss had slowed down a bit, only three pounds so far this week, but as she finished another workout at the gym, she reasoned that all the weight wasn't just going to fly off without any effort. If it were easy to lose a ton of weight, everyone would be thin, Cassi thought to herself. Still, she could not deny that the gym workouts were getting a bit less strenuous. When she started with that horrible workout with Madison, every movement felt like the last thing she could do before she was about to collapse, her body seemingly working against months of indulgence on top of a less than active (but satisfactory at the time) lifestyle in high school. She still felt like a beached whale surrounded by sleek gym bodies, but she felt less helpless, and more in control at the gym, like she at least knew what she was doing. Although it was still hard, and she still sweated it out every workout, she was starting to understand why some people said it felt good to work out, and why people like Madison actually liked going to the gym.

Or, at least Madison used to. Over the past week Madison didn't once try to go to the gym with Cassi, something Cassi had noticed, and she wondered if Madison was being a great friend, or if the lack of activity had caused Madison to get a bit more comfortable with the lifestyle of a lazy college undergrad.

When Cassi got home, she saw Madison still typing away at the computer, "How the was the workout Cassi?" Madison asked, momentarily pausing from the frantic typing pace she seemed to be at before.

"Good! I think I'm really getting the hang of it," Cassi said, walking over to get a glass of water from the sink, where she noticed a 24 ounce bottle of soda. What? she thought to herself, since when did Madison start drinking pop?. Tucking the thought away, Cassi inquired more about Madison's day.

"How's the article coming along?"

"I don't know...I hope it's as good as Marcella's was last night. Ohmygod, it was so good. I know I shouldn't but after the chicken roule...but it just looked so good in the menu! Cassi, we have to go back there sometime so you can try it!"

Cassi was a bit surprised to see Madison gush about the food like this, despite it becoming a more frequent occurrence, "Yeah, Mad, when I finish this diet, we should go."

"Don't worry, you'll get there," Madison said, not condescendingly, but still with absurdness that Cassi knew could only come from someone who was thin.

"Anyways," Madison continued, "want to go get lunch? I'm starving."

"What about the leftover pork from two nights ago," Cassi asked

"Oh, well...I got hungry and had a little snack last night." Madison replied, somewhat embarrassed. Cassi didn't consider the amount of pork left to be "little" by any standard, and even in her carefree diet of old, she never would have gone that deep into it. When Madison got up to go to the cafeteria, wearing shorts and a T-shirt, Cassi was sure that outline of a stomach wasn't just bloat, Madison had actually lost her hard abs. Yes, she was still thin by everyone's definition, but Cassi wondered if she should consider inviting Madison back to the gym, before her roommate let her body slip away under her newfound love culinary creations.

11223121221112211.content:
"Wow," Jim remarked as if to himself and momentarily raised his eyes across to the clearly self-satisfied co-ed. He returned to the page and continued silently running his lips over the vowel adn consonant sounds of the more impressive lines. Finally he set it down and sat back. "OK, so when I said the piece had to be written by a completely different person... I've gotta say, this doesn't read anything like a couple weeks ago. You're telling me you wrote this?" There was some sincere incredulity in his question.

"Same person," Madison quipped. She didn't have to ask whether it was good; she had felt it. "I got in touch with my passion," she shrugged and took a couple of long, sultry steps toward the editor's desk before smiling casually. She did think Jim was pretty cute--especially when she could get a little rise out of him like most of the boys--but truth be told her attention was now beginning to drift back to the memory of that sauce at Marcella's. She wondered if she could recreate it--better than last night's attempts at least--and began compiling a mental list of the ingredients she'd need, allowing for some experimental batches to taste, of course.

"I'll say. You really got into this. I mean, you're describing an experience with this eggplant. And the tiramisu part...well, let's just say we actually might have to censor that part. This isn't Penthouse, you know. I'll be honest, I was kind of bull-shitting a little bit before--what do I know about food? I live on rice and beans--but I'm glad I did. You seriously sound like you know what you're talking about here." Just like that, he was drawn back into the page again. "A completely different person..." he mused.

And there was something a little different about her, not just her perspective on food--a remarkably, suddenly intimate perspective on food. Standing before the same desk as two weeks ago she looked a bit...fuller. Mostly around the hips, maybe a little bit on her belly, and that was a word more appropriate in describing her body than it'd been two weeks ago, before she started throwing herself into cooking--and eating. Her jeans, which had always been tight against her sleek and toned tighs, hugged her more than they had previously and pushed up gently where her once rock-hard abs had softened into a bit of puffy flesh that hinted of a muffin top beneath her shirt. She looked as though perhaps she'd just had an especially large meal, and given all the research she surely must have done for the revision, Jim assumed as much unconsciously and didn't take more notice of the subtle changes. In actuality, and as a far departure from her recent habits, she hadn't eaten since breakfast, and her softening tummy was rumbling. Of course, the fact that she'd actually strung together a few waking hours without indulging her awakening taste buds was by no means because she noticed the added eight pounds she was squeezing into her jeans. Madison had been totally engrossed in her latest culinary explorations on the other side of campus when she realized she'd be late for her meeting with Jim--worse, would definitely miss the delicious lunch she'd been anxiously slaving over--and had to run to get there in time. She was still late, but only because she had to take a minute or two in the hall to catch her breath. Even now, her lungs still felt the effect of the first real physical exertion she'd had in some time, but her mind had been working on the best way to preserve the flavor of the risotto when she'd reheat it later--or maybe she'd just have to make another batch in order to know how it really turned out. "Screw it," she thought. "It's going to be damned good risotto once I make it fresh, and Cassi can help with the extras." Of course the new disciplined Cassi hadn't been helping with the extras.

"Well, whoever you are, or whoever it was that wrote that book report before, you're hired. I mean, not 'hired'--we're not paying you, obviously--but jeez, keep turning in high-class food porn like this and maybe we should. ...but not really. You'll get an English credit, probably."

"Great!" Madison bubbled. "What's my first assignment?"

"You're the desk on this column now, so I'll give you some direction and be the one to tell you 'no,' but by the power invested in me you're the expert on this now. You tell us what's hot--err, what's tasty. Plus, something gives me the feeling you've been working on some ideas already."

Madison beamed at this, delighted. Her face was still as slim and defined in features as ever, but something in the natural dimples she flashed just then complimented the new fullness of her hips and suggested a heavier Madison as imaginable, which no one would have found thinkable when catching sight of her cut figure on the elliptical.

"Am I wrong?" Jim asked.

"So many ideas. Just one article a week?"

"Ha!" Jim wagged his pen toward her playfully. "Write as many articles as you want on your time. Give me the best one each week."

Madison nodded and turned to leave, still elated at her inevitable and self-willed achievement. "The indomitable Madi Kraft," she thought. "The starving Madi Kraft."

"Mads," Jim chimed after her.

She turned to him again. "Chief?"

"Seriously, though. Where'd this come from?" He was holding up the new draft.

Madison paused and fixed a knowing gaze on him. "I told you," she smirked. "Passion. Tell you what: Why don't I cook you a real dinner one night. Maybe I can teach you something." And Madison was gone--full hips wiggling after. "You can do better than rice and beans!"

112231212211122111.content:
"Eight pounds in two weeks. Down eight pounds in two weeks." This was Cassi's mantra as she pounded the treadmill today. It kept her mind on the prize and off the still foreign jiggles of her over-indulged body, which already was feeling tighter and, beneath all that extra padding, toner even. The routine, which she'd adapted from Madison in Madison's absence from the gym, was grueling, but her early results were motivation enough, and as her energy levels increased from regular aerobic activity and clean eating she was finally beginning to understand why her roommate actually loved working out so much. Maybe it wasn't a Miami-princess vanity that had kept the taller brunette looking like a swimsuit model while Cassi's own body piled on a couple of freshman 15s. Maybe she could forgive her friend for keeping such a killer figure after all.

"But enough about South Beach," she thought as she dismounted the treadmill, her road back to bikinis, and caught herself in the wall-length mirror of the workout room. "We're getting some good old Middle American cute here." She checked her reflection out with confidence. Under the extra layer of fat she'd begun to make peace with until Madison intervened, the blonde could more clearly discern her old trim, Harvest Queen body. And just a hair below that was a whole other level hottness she was going to carve out of that doughy physique she'd accumulated. "At this rate, a couple of months and I'll have the body of Madison Kraft." After all, Cassi may have been starting way behind, but she was jumping essentially into the tanned fitness queen's own rigorous--and otherwise unoccupied--schedule. "That is, if she doesn't meet me somewhere in the middle..." Cassi wasn't stupid. She knew that Madison was sneaking in workouts here or there for part of the first week, and in all reasonableness she hadn't expected someone like Mads to swear off physical activity altogether, just to make herself a little more scarce around the gym so Cassi could have a little space to get things under control--wobbling being one of those things. Now, however, she felt like she hardly saw Madison move, except maybe to rush off to Cooking Club and drag herself lethargically back from class, and whatever else was evidencing, it was clear that a pattern was settling in that kept her running shoes untouched in the corner and the chip bags continually shifting about on the shelf, shrinking and somehow magically refilling as a different flavor. "That's all right," she thought. "When Madi's fat, I can help her trim down and be the average-looking roommate." She laughed without a tinge of guilt, because she knew it'd never happen. Madison Kraft would never--could never--get pudgy. "Not like tubby over here," she gave her now-smaller pot belly a good-humored slap, indifferent to who saw. "Hell with it. Tubbs isn't long for this world."

As she began to strut away to the lockers she suddenly recognized the figure cooling down on the treadmill not far from her. Apparently the eye of the tiger wasn't any help to her spotting men. "Hey, you're Jim, yeah?" Cassi recognized his face from the Facebook profile Madison showed her, and she was right: he was something to look at all right. She approached. "Sorry, not a creeper. I'm Madison Kraft's roommate."

"Oh! Yes, of course, she's mentioned you."

"No she hasn't."

"No, she hasn't," he laughed.

"Cassi."

"Jim. Um, right. Sorry, it's really just business when she and I talk--that is, you know, word counts and...stuff. Not that I'm... Because we... I'm just saying you wouldn't have come up." Nope. Didn't land that one. He was flustered and caught off guard to have been approached by Cassi Mitchel out of the blue. He'd had a near instant crush on the freshman since he'd worked the paper's booth at Welcome Week. He'd certainly seen her picking up some rolls as the months rolled on, and where she was, well, thicker than he'd usually go for, he couldn't deny that she was still the same beautiful creature, if carrying a bit of pudge, and she'd now come up to him. "Two months and twenty pounds ago..." he thought before rebuking himself. "Hell with it. This is an angel." He stopped the machine and cleared his throat. "Sorry, I was probably being rude there," gesturing to the treadmill computer. "So, um, where is Madison? I used to see her all the time here. Like all the time. I was starting to think the school leased her along with the other equipment."

"She's tagged me in." She put her hand the rail of his treadmill and leaned in just a bit to get friendly, hoping she could help him out stop talking to a girl about another girl. "You could say I'm taking her spot. No lease, though; I'm a free agent." She dismissed the stupid, insecure urge to say that she was there getting back in shape. "Duh. Don't apologize for being fat, and you're obviously not there for the buffet" she counseled herself. "Let results do the talking. He's not going anywhere. And I know I'm not. Not until you can bounce a quarter of my ass." Best to leave him wanting more, she reasoned. "And maybe next time we talk he'll have someone else on his mind."

"Anyway," she continued, playing at boredom suddenly. "I should really stretch and hit the showers. I'll see you tomorrow," she waved without waiting for his reply.

"Wh--...tomorrow's my rest day, actually!" he called after her, still thrown.

"Well, I'll be here tomorrow!" she answered back, not turning around. Why did women keep walking away from him like that? he wondered. This was shaping up to be a very good week.

1122312122111221111.content:
Back in the dorm, Cassi arrived with her confidence now redoubled. Her extra weight had gradually smothered her self-esteem, and the rejection from Chris had finally knocked it out for the count. It was hard going from drawing almost every look as she passed to turning the heads only of those curious co-eds who still couldn't believe how much she'd let herself go. Guys just didn't see her anymore, and she got used to being a non-factor in the room. Almost a quarter of the way to her weight goal, though, and she was already starting to get her game back. "Imagine where I'll be when I look like Madi." She did a little celebratory shimmy as she entered their room, not caring how generously her love handles and thighs jiggled. She missed feeling like this. She missed dancing.

"We need to go to a party!" Cassi announced. "Like, tonight. Dancing. Dresses. *Gasp*: Maybe I can fit back into that last 'fat dress' I bought now. Ohmigod, Madi, I just got back from the gym--your place, where else--and weighed myself, and I'm now ten. pounds. down."

Madison was fixed in her now usual spot, curled up on her desk chair and munching absently as she typed with ferocity. As she was all bunched together, Cassi couldn't help but notice what looked like a little belly bunched together under Madison's baby-doll t-shirt. Her already short jean shorts rode high from her posture and fully showcased her gorgeous tanned legs, looking smooth and a little softer--actually quite a bit softer--than they had always looked in her running shorts.

"Oh Madikins... talking to you..."

"Mmhfh. Sorry, can't tonight." She didn't break eye contact with the screen.

"Cooking Club?" Cassi rolled her eyes.

"No," she shot back, "It's not every day. Well, yes, I'm doing some baking with them later, but that's not tonight. --And you are going to love the fudge brownies I bring back, by the way--it's OK, you can break your diet now and again, marine." Cassi couldn't help but be surprised at Madison, supportive as she'd been, actually recommending that Cassi indulge while she was trying so hard to lose weight. Was Madison Kraft actually mocking her for showing some Kraft-brand discipline? "No, I just think I really need to keep working on this piece." She grabbed another a handful of chips. "Ihm gehtngh ihn th' grhoove."

"I didn't know you were writing a review on Cool Ranch Doritos," she eyed Madison and the half-empty family-sized bag.

Madison flashed a dirty look and shoved a few into her mouth defiantly. "Humnggry." She swallowed. "And a little snack helps me think. So shut up."

Cassi wasn't done with the banter, especially when she spotted some sprinkles on a paper plate by Madison's elbow. "And the Pop Tart too?"

"I didn't have breakfast. ...Not a real breakfast. ...I wanted a Pop Tart, and it's a good thing because they didn't used to be this good. How was the gym?" The deflection was interesting.

"So these are the high culinary standards of Powers' leading authority on the food arts? Don't let any of your readers see our trash. And don't change the subject from your bogus excuse not to get all sexy with me tonight and flirt with boys for drinks. Common, you should pressuring your fat friend to go out and be social. "Ok fine!" Madison relented after a few more minutes of badgering from her roommate. Cassi still was having a hard time comprehending that Madison Kraft, usually the life of a party for guys, or at the very least the girl who thrived in the company of others would rather stay in than spend a night chatting up guys.

As Madison reached a stopping point in her review, she saved the document and looked at the bag of chips she had just demolished. "Well, those servings didn't last long," she thought to herself. When she bought the family sized bag, she had assumed it could be a good snack for a few weeks, and yet it only lasted a few days. This kind of thing was foreign to Madison. While she could get whatever types of snack she wanted at Powers, she was used to the pantry that her Mom stocked, usually full of carrots for some crunch, or yogurt if she was looking for something else to hold her over to dinner. Speaking of dinner, Madison couldn't believe how much better the food was at Powers than it was back in South Florida. Her parents were both people committed to keeping their great bodies, so while never pressuring Madison (although they were pleased when she slimmed up in high school,) their diets also never exposed Madison to the greasy foods she was now discovering in the cafeteria.

Madison looked over to Cassi, who was still in her workout clothes and getting ready to run to the showers. "Hm, she does look a bit less bloated," Madison thought to herself, while feeling good about being the one who had gotten all of this started.

After Cassi left for the showers, Madison went through her closet to look through her many designer dresses and find one for the occasion. She didn't want to go with something super tight. Although she didn't realized it was approaching a 10 pound gain, Madison knew she was at the very least bloated from her culinary binge over the past few weeks.

She settled on a black dress that was tight, but she thought did a good job of covering her slight 'bloat' on her stomach. Had Madison had a greater moment of introspection, she would have realized that her stomach was not just bloated from the previous meal, but that her hard abs were gone, replaced by the start of a belly. The dress went on quite easily for Madison. It was a short dress, but even in black it showed that Madison had a bit of curve that she never had before. Unlike when she was wearing jeans, Madison was not yet to the point in dresses where you could see an outline of her belly, but if one had a side by side, they would easily spot that her legs were softer, and the tone that had come from her previous workout regimen were slipping away.

When Cassi got back from the shower, Madison was doing her hair, and putting on her makeup, and not with a ton of enthusiasm. However, she looked fantastic. "Why, does Madison get to eat like a total pig for two weeks and still look okay?" But on another glance, Cassi corrected herself. Madison's legs did look softer, her arms no longer looked like she was lifting, and her dress allowed the possibility that her belly from before was not just an aberration.

What Cassi realized was Madison's perfect face, well done makeup, and ability to throw herself together distracted from her slight gain. Cassi knew she was pretty, but now she was realizing that Madison actually was what guys meant when they said a perfect 10.

Those thoughts were not enough to distract Cassi from her desire to go out, however, if anything, Cassi enjoyed going out with her roommate-- Madison's flirtatious attiude attracted guys that would talk with her as well.

As for Cassi, putting on a dress was not as fun as it was for Madison. It was about damage control, does it bring out the right parts and minimize the bad? The first step for her was putting on spanx. Cassi considered having to do this in front of her roommate an indignity, but the results were worth it. The product had been huge for her in limiting noticeable rolls on her belly, although post Chris rejection, clearly not as much as she had hoped. Putting on the spanx consisted of pulling tight spandex over her prominent (if slowly receding) belly. As she pulled them up, fat from her upper belly oozed over, until she got them just below her boobs. "I can't wait until I never have to do this again," Cassi thought to herself.

The reward for the uncomfortable exercise was evident when Cassi put on her dress and it actually fit. Sure, you could see where her belly was, her but was still prominent, and yes, her hips still flared out under the belt of the dress, but it fit, and she didn't look horrible. Rather, like a chubby girl who wasn't trying to stuff herself into the previous size, which was more than she could say for herself a few weeks ago. As she was doing her hair next to Madison, Cassi noted how much softer her arms still were than Madison's and realized she still had some work to do.

In her desire to go dancing, they ended up forgoing the use of their fake IDs and hitting up a party at one of the better fraternity houses. With Madison's presence, they had not problem getting in. "The perks of being hot," Cassi thought of her friend, and they got drinks pretty quickly.

There were no shortage of guys who wanted to talk with Madison. Perhaps it was dark, or perhaps there were not as many near model Latina girls who were on the campus of this Midwestern school, but guys still wanted to talk to Madison, despite the slight softening. Or, perhaps, Cassi thought, as she finished her first beer, we're all just drunk. As unethical as it was, Cassi was kind of hoping that she would pass the muster of someone's beer goggles and she also indulged, sure, maybe they would regret it in the morning, but she wanted to see if she could get someone to hook up with her as easily as she did in high school.

As the night wore on, Cassi found a random frat guy who was willing to dance with her, she figured Madison could fend for her own, and she was right. Madison was completely in her element. "Cassi, was right, going out was a good idea," she thought over beer number 7. As she was walking through the upper levels of the fraternity house, looking for someone to talk to, when she ran into Brad, a classmate of her's who she had hooked up with earlier in the semester. They got along, and had no feelings of attachment, but were each down to have a fun time.

One thing led to another, and they ended up in a spare room together, as Brad ran his hands up and down Madison's body, although he was thrilled to be with her, a thought creeped into his head. "Is it just me, or is Madison getting softer?"

"Uhngh," escaped from underneath the heap of covers. And then, disdainfully croaked,"M--morning." Madison threw the duvet off her lovely, scrunched face but, met by penetrating sunlight, immediately threw it back over herself. She could admit she maybe overdid it last night. She tried to get up, but her head blared and sent her into the pillow again. Maybe she would just spend the rest of the morning dead and try being alive again tomorrow. OK, so she must have overdid it last night, because this was not normal for Madison Kraft. After a good campus party, she would usually be springing out of bed after a little lie-in (8:00, if she was especially naughty) for a run at the gym. The gym was off the table of course now, because of Cassi and all, but she was demanding as much dedication of herself in her new routine, and she had meant to get up at least as early to start experimenting in the club kitchen--not for the article, but she had been hearing about a new recipe for pork ragù she really wanted to try, and she was still developing her passion as a cook, you know, so she could write better. Plus she was enjoying this new world that had recently opened to her. Some classmates had also invited her on a hike with them that afternoon. She'd have to skip it, she decided; she couldn't start slacking on kitchen time just because she had more to drink than usual.

Funny though, she didn't think she had. Just as she didn't think she had the last time she went out with Cassi, at her roommate's insistence, when Madison last wore the black dress. In truth, Madison's metabolism wasn't as up for the task as it had been. Operating in a slower gear and already stuffed with junk and gourmet half the time, there was no bouncing back like back when a night of drinking was a just a break between running 3Ks. Worse, that first evening back out with Cassi seemed not to phase the bulky blonde half as much. More mass, able to put more away, she reasoned. But to Madison's misplaced pride, Cassi was shrinking. "See what happens when you impose a modicum of discipline on your life?" she'd thought at one point taking note of the recently twelve-pound lighter body. At least Madison wouldn't be suffering this Saturday morning hell alone. "Cass!" she croakd out from beneath the covers. No answer. She braved the sunlight and looked over to her roommate's bed. Empty.

Madison knew without having to think it, without wanting to think it, but her fat her roommate had pulled a Madison Kraft and skipped off to the gym early after a night of partying. The conclusion wasn't one she wanted to draw, so it was simple: Madison drank more than usual, and Cassi must not have had half as much as Madison thought she saw. Maybe a little early morning activity wouldn't kill her either, she thought. "No gym, no problem. I used to sneak in workouts in here before." But as she strenuously rolled herself out of bed, she checked her phone: 11:43. "Shit. No way. It is not almost noon." As quickly as that the thought of a little morning yoga had passed and, trying to orient herself to the time of day she'd slept into, she found herself hungry--if nauseated. "I didn't have breakfast!" and she regretted the lost opportunity to enjoy the soft pillowy pancakes of the cafeteria--whose game had really been stepping up in the last few weeks. She'd used to find those syrupy stacks kind of gross and unhealthy. "Oh, eggs!" she consoled herself, and was suddenly lost imagining how she could dress up a few fried eggs to be more brunchy. "Brunch, then the ragù. I can't start letting my self-discipline slip."

Climbing out of bed in a slightly better mood now, she realized she hadn't worn any pants to bed. "OK, I need to start taking it easy." What she didn't realize was the wobble of her thighs as she plodded to the closet. She adjusted her tan ktop down over her belly, as it had ridden up--overnight, when she got up, whatever. "Why did I wear my workout tank to bed? This thing is kind of restrictive for sleeping in." But it wasn't a workout top. She sighed when she saw the black dress from last week hanging up, letting her tummy fill out the bottom of her shirt so that she unconsciously tugged it down again. If she didn't have a very good time last night, it was because that dress was not working. She knew her body rocked that dress. Let's face it, it didn't do her any favors, because she didn't need any, but she made it look good. Whatever was behind last night's bloat, though, was not having it. And after having scrutinized herself for a few minutes and feeling downright uncomfortable, she decided she didn't want to be overdressed--of course, Cassi could be if she wanted to. She'd opted instead, maybe panicking a little bit, for a nice pair of jeans and a cute blouse that dressed them up. The jeans of course were nice because they were a pair she never wore but just kept on hand. Some girls might call them "fat jeans." Well she felt uncomfortable most the night, and probably because the whole dress thing was in her head she kept thinking that the blouse felt kind of snug, even if it was showcasing her breasts better than she'd remembered, and she was sure that she was not holding as many conversations with guys as the week before. She was definitely getting more of her own drinks, even if Cassi was actually doing pretty well flying solo. And it was all because of that stupid dress. "I'm kidding, chica, I love you, but you have to be good to me."

Like that, the bit of self-consciousness was written off as the night's aberrations, and she picked out a hot little pair of jeans and a t-shirt, her new, not entirely unfashionable go-to. Yet putting them on wasn't as easy as picking them out. There was some...resistance. "Come on... Mi beleza negro, this better not be your doing." She wiggled a notably heftier backside into the denim, which was already straining to pack in her thickening thighs. "Stupid, cheap industrial washers." She had begun to notice herself tugging at the waist of her pants lately, trying to get comfortable. Just then she spotted a tiny chocolate stain on the plush upper thigh from when she was working on the fudge brownies--in one sense or another. "Oops," she said, not wanting to start over with a clean pair at this point. "They were so good too. Ummphf." At first she naively tried fastening them without sucking in, to no avail, but her single-minded determination kept her from thinking too much about the struggle she'd never really found herself in before but, if she'd had been paying attention, had been mounting to. At last, after a massive sucking in of her tummy, she'd gotten the jeans buttoned, letting them sit a bit lower as her now squashy tan little belly and adorable matching love handles tried to escape over their taught waistband. Usually exceedingly comfortable showing as much skin as the law allowed, Madison was suddenly eager to get covered, and she threw her size S t-shirt on without a beat. This too she tugged and adjusted, not registering the novel feeling of her stomach and sides pressing out into the cotton.

She didn't glance in the mirror any longer than it took her to tossle her luscious, cascading dark hair into something cute that framed her flawless, slender face. She didn't need an ounce of makeup. She felt cute, if sluggish, and her face lit up as she turned to bounce out of the room to the kitchen. That was what she didn't see: those natural dimples, just a little deeper in her soft, feminine cheeks; her famous smile, where her neck pulled sweetly back just a bit, just a little more jowly, making one wonder if her jaw line wasn't quite as defined after all, allowing for the first time the image to be imagined of a chubby-cheeked, double-chinned Madison Kraft, a pudgy Madison Kraft. It was that unwittingly betraying smile, not the dress that she didn't wear, more even than the ill-fitting blouse and jeans that she did wear, that left the guys' attentions a little less captivated by her extant charms and a little freer to look about for hotter, tighter options. She cast that once-fatal beacon of a smile a lot at the party, across the room and to every guy she thought might buy her a drink, but it was now actually bringing attention to what everyone was otherwise barely registering: Madison Kraft had really filled out. Madison Kraft had packed on the pounds and was now sporting some pudge around her middle. A tiny roll of fat sat like a ring above her hips. Her fully Latin thighs wobbled wherever she walked, and her tight, pert ass rounded out with them. Her breasts were a bit larger, but only noticed when expecting them to be. And now, she was almost starting to looked kind of like a chubby girl when she beamed, which was almost anytime Madison was eating, cooking or talking about food. Madison Kraft had put on the freshman 15--with gusto.
