Strolling back from the gym, confident and feeling accomplished, Cassi could hardly believe her eyes. She already felt like she hadn’t been seeing enough of Madison lately, not withstanding some downtime in their ill-lit room at the end of the day and a couple evenings going out together. In addition to class and the library, Cassi’s time had been utterly consumed by her new workout regimen, and Madison’s with her newfound burgeoning hobby, which as it happened had much to do with consuming. Sure, it was getting harder not to notice that Madison had maybe been putting on more than a few pounds, maybe a sort of spring winter-weight; it was all a little hard to compute when seeing the perfect-ten stuff her face with culinary creations (and the frequent occasional junkfood), and it’s not like Cassi didn’t have anything else on her mind, like getting her own weight under control and landing a boyfriend or two. Then there was the party last night, where only as a roommate would know, Madison was definitely wearing larger pants, and the light-printed blouse was not doing her thicker waist any of the favors her gracious black dress had perhaps extended the last time. But this… Maybe Cassi really hadn’t been seeing enough of Madison, because apparently there was a lot more Madison to be seen.

Cassi was now down a solid fifteen pounds and change, and boy did that make the difference on her. Gone was her pot belly by now, leaving a tauter, still thick middle, better described as a tummy, a sizeable pooch. The difference was that it didn’t have the lazy heftiness that once poked over the waistband of her athletic shorts; it rounded out her silhouette and hardly moved when she did, for now buried not far beneath that excess padding were abdominal muscles such that Cassi never had before, abs that would melt the last of that fat from the inside out. Her legs too were noticeably leaner, while by no means lean. Her arms were thick but no longer puffy and meaty. Next to her belly, though, the second biggest difference in the impressive last few weeks was her face, which actually did look much slimmer, her adorable second chin having receded almost entirely, such that she looked from the neck up almost exactly as she did when she arrived in the fall. No, Cassi wasn’t fat anymore. Maybe chubby, and approaching the outer range again of what most would consider hot as she began resembling her old self.

But those fifteen pounds must not have traveled far—not any further than the other side of her room. Madison was bee-lining it from their dorm to the Student Union building, where Cassi knew the kitchen was that the Cooking Club used, and Cassi could guess why by now if Madison was hung-over and just getting up at noon, their paths about to intersect. Madison may have looked bigger last night in what were clearly her “fat jeans,” but that was nothing compared to how she looked stuffed into a pair of her size-four skinny jeans. Her thighs had clearly picked up some heft, which itself was a new development this semester, but their discernable jiggle revealed them actually be softer than Cassi’s. Not only did they meet on top and kissed as she walked, but they were proportionally thicker as well down their whole length, subtly altering the whole shape of her meaty legs. The shirt wasn’t a good choice either, as it both struggled to give her impressive little jello belly room and to provide enough cover. This in fact it was failing to do, and it had ridden up in Madison’s absent-minded plodding to show the scandalous bottom lip of a very tan, very smooth, very obvious muffin top squeezed up by her undersized jeans. The short sleeves revealed that she'd lost all the definition in her once perfectly toned arms. Of course her breasts looked great, as they always did in their generous fullness, but in truth they only stretched the already scarce cotton and helped to illustrate how soft Madison had gotten everywhere beneath them. Of course, what looked like not a tiny chocolate stain on her overstuffed jeans didn’t help the picture either. No, Madison Kraft was chubby, or at least getting there in a hurry.

As their paths were about to intersect, and the daydreaming Madison spotted her sporty-looking roommate, she beamed ear to ear and waved a soft, toneless arm. Was that the hint of a double chin just then? That completed the picture for Cassi. She had to consciously check that her jaw hadn’t fallen slack and metnally barred herself from looking down at herself and over at Madison, down at herself and over at Madison, for comparison—especially when Madison tempted it: “Ohmygod, Cass, you look so great!”

Cassi couldn’t quite remember how to speak yet. How did one make words happen?

“Hey, looks like the gym agrees with you, girl. It’s funny, it’s like we’ve hardly seen each other in the light of day all month. I can’t believe how good you look! You must have lost almost ten pounds.”

“A little over fifteen, actually.” Cassi had been really excited when she reported ten pounds almost a week ago. Clearly Madison wasn’t paying attention, and she suddenly remembered the occasion for her nacho-flavored distraction.

“Well, I’m so proud of you. You’ll get there. Maybe I can show some core exercises to blast away some of that tummy.”

“Yeah,” Cassi equivocated. OK--she thought--she shouldn’t be excited about this, right? Sure, maybe this was just a little bit awesome after all the humiliation Cassi had felt while Madison got to keep showing off her stupid hot body. But, seriously, Madison was her best friend at Powers, and it’s not like she would wish a weight problem on her. Probably she wouldn’t. And, maybe it’s not even gotten as bad for Madison as it looks. She’s gotten way out of shape, of course, and that’s definitely fat she’s wearing these days, but she’s definitely wearing too small of sizes. And she is taller. “In other words,” she reasoned to herself, “she’s not as chubby as I am now. …is she?”

“Yeah,” Cassi continued, realizing that even if she was the only one appreciating the irony Madison just dropped her silence was getting awkward, “that’s maybe, you know, not a bad idea. I mean, I’m feeling much more confident about working out now, and, well, I kind of know what I’m doing, but really it probably wasn’t fair for me to ask you not to go to the gym for a while, and it’s been a while, so how about you join me, like, tomorrow?”

“Aw, I’d love to help you out, Cass, but I totally can’t tomorrow. I’m going to be working all day to meet my deadline. That’s so sweet of you ask. But maybe if we catch up back at the room sometime this weekend I can give you some pointers. I don’t feel like I’ve done enough to help you lose all this weight.”

Cassi was dumbfounded again.

“But I am so hungry and so behind and so hung-over, so I need eggs and apple wood sausage like two hours ago,” Madison hurriedly added as she started back into a brisk pace, tacking on as she parted, “But I know you’ll get there, Cass. Remember, I’m so proud of you!”

Cassi couldn’t help herself and turned to watch perfect-ten Madison Kraft from behind, wearing some chubby girl’s ass and seriously needing to pull down the back of her shirt.

Kyle of course knew nothing about Madison’s efforts to help her roommate Cassia, much less her visit with Cassie’s family and encounters with Rebecca and Erin. If he had it could have assuaged some of the conflicts within himself.

He next day in class he passed Madison enroute to his own seat and smiled. She noticed and smiled back, recognizing him as the guy who the previous day she had felt was checking her out. His countenance didn’t appear critical of her increased size and she wished he would say something. But he didn’t and when she looked around for him after class he had disappeared.

Madison had returned to her former granola bar and fruit breakfast routine the previous day, following it up with a salad for lunch and a lite supper, even though she had to endure Cassie’s entreaties to share her stroganoff. . This discipline, combined with returning to the gym, she was convinced should be good for at least two pounds a week – if she could keep it up. But only into her second day she felt like she was starving!

That afternoon she faithfully went to the gym again, running into Kyle as he was leaving. He smiled and held the door open, saying “I noticed you in class today. My name’s Kyle and even though we’re in the same class together I’m not sure of yours.”

“Its Madison, Madison Kraft,” she replied. “Thanks for asking.”

With that Madison hurried on, a little non-plussed that her radar was apparently accurate. He had been noticing her, and not in a critical way. He seemed nice enough, why hadn’t she taken time to let him talk more. Was she really that self-conscious about her size and fearing ejection?

That evening she mentioned the encounter to Kelli, who smiled. “You got a hello from Kyle Burgess, one of the shyest guys on campus? That’s a first.”

“Oh, you know him?” replied Madison.

“Not personally. But Beth’s boyfriend, Ralph, lives in the same dorm. Claims he sticks to his books and is just quiet, sort of a philosopher and thinker, not really in sync with the campus party scene. He’s apparently a simple guy from the country and would rather attend a square dance than a keg party” confided Kelly.

“Well, he seemed nice enough. I guess I’ll just have to see,” replied Madison. Later on, weary of diet rations for two days, she helped Cassi finish off the stroganoff from the night before and then had a large bowl of chocolate chip ice cream for dessert. She went to bed comfortably full but feeling guilty for her backsliding.

The next morning is was back to the granola bar and fruit regimen, this time a banana. Lunch was a chicken Cesar salad, with dressing she knew wasn’t really low calorie. After classes it was off to the gym for the third day in a row. She noted her stamina on the treadmill at least seemed to be improving – she put in a full fifteen minutes there plus half hour of other exercises.

Coming back to her car she went to press her key ring – and couldn’t find it. Looking in she saw it lying on the right hand seat – totally beyond reach. Her head bent forward towards the roof and she began thumping the car with her fist in frustration. Then she backed off and just stood assessing the situation.

“Problems?” inquired a voice behind her. Turning she saw Kyle, a concerned look on his face.

‘Yes,” she said with exasperation.
“Dumb me – I’ve locked myself out of my own car. Now its going to cost me a hundred dollars for a locksmith and I’m upset. Can you blame me?” she continued

“Blame placing isn’t called for here,” answer Kyle softly, reaching into his pocket and pulling out his cell phone,. “It won’t help anything. However if you will allow it a call to AAA might save you a c-note or so. May I?”

“But won’t they charge you?” she stammered.

“If I make too many calls, yes. But the base membership carries freebies and this will be the first one this year. I think it’s a lot better than beating yourself up over something anyone could have happen.” He answered.

His calm control disarmed Madison and she nodded, “OK – and thank you.”

After first waiting in the call queue for about five minutes and talking for another five Kyle hung up, informing Madison it would be 30-45 minutes. .

“If you don’t mind I can bring my car over while we’re waiting,” he suggested. “Standing like this can get rather tiring.”

Already weary from her workout Madison nodded. In about five minutes Kyle drove up in a white SUV. He noticed her adjusting her gum pasts, her belly pooching over the waistband, before climbing in. They chatted amiably about their majors and various other general subjects until the locksmith arrived and the car swiftly accessed.

“How can I ever thank you enough?” Madison said gratefully.

“”Well,“ replied Kyle, going out on a limb.. “An episode like this tends to be a bit stressful and sometimes calls for a break to settle down. I didn’t have much lunch today and was planning to drop by Dog-N-Shake. They have all sorts of flavors for their shakes and I’d like to know you better when you’re not so frustrated. Care to accompany me?”

Madison thought Kyle must be a mind reader. She indeed was stressed and felt ravenous. Without a moment’s hesitation she agreed to go with, this time being sure to retain her keys.

At Dog-N-Shake Kyle recommended the cheese burger special and had a raspberry malt, Madison elected to go exotic and ordered Cappuccino. Only when their order arrived did she realize the special meant four burgers plus fries, but that point she didn’t really care. Kyle noted that she had no problem with both burgers plus the majority of the fries.

Kyle knew as they talked that there was a major cultural difference he was going to have to bridge, He had never been part of a sophisticated city culture like Coral Gables and wondered how Madison would react to the truth about himself. Fortunately, because of Kelli’s information, Madison provided the opening he needed.

“You know Kyle, you’re a lot more open and conversational than your reputation says,” she remarked.
“Every topic I’ve brought up you’ve gone with today – most guys would be lost.”

“Oh, and what is my reputation?” inquired Kyle.

“That you’re a country music lover who prefers square dancing over parties,” answered Madison.

“Well, that’s true enough.” Kyle admitted. “Try the CDs I my car – totally different from what’s on FM radio. Country, jazz, even some old fashioned ballads and swing songs where the vocals overshadow the music. Have you ever heard of Mitch Miller or Perez Prado?”

“Umm, no. but maybe you could punch hem up for me,” Madison said. “Personally I can’t stand rap and some of the other stuff on FM radio. I never listen to it.”

“Same here,” segued Kyle. “I’m an Englisher brought into the college environment and frankly I don’t fit in that well. But you’re right about square dancing – I can do ball room and rock and roll as well. Where I come rom they still have Saturday night barn dances, but who at Powers is into that?”

“Well, I’ve never been to one but could probably be persuaded,” answered Madison. “This is Kansas, so there might just be one. But isn’t Englisher a term the Amish use?”

“Yes, very astute,” replied Kyle. “I’m from a community where the Amish and Mennonites make up about 40% of the populace. Families like mine share many of their moral values, but not their total ‘simple life’ commitment. Buggies and no hooking into the power grid? I get the point of my Amish friends but its too extreme for me. Does that seem strange to you?”

“Not really,” replied Madison. “We have people from all sorts of cultures in Coral Gables – li you, I respect their commitment, but could never embrace some of them. Right now I’ve got a big enough struggle of my own to deal with – and my roommate’s an enabler!”

“Oh,” observed Kyle. “What do you mean?”

“The culture at Powers facilitates eating and gaining weight. I tried to help my roommate Cassi fight the trend and now I’ve gained weight as well. The meal I just packed away is something I could never have done a year ago – now I enjoy and crave fattening foods. That’s dangerous where I come from,” Madison disclosed.

“Sell,’ said Kyle, “you’re doing the right hg in going to the gym like you are. It won’t of itself change your weight, but it will give you the muscle tissue to carry it and be healthy. Personally I like you just the way you sre – but that’s your call, not mine.”

“So you have been noticing,” Madison sad. “I suspected as much.”

“Noticed an intelligent and attractive classmate? Guilty as charged your honor. I honestly didn’t know it was a crime,” answered Kyle.
“Not really, I suppose,” replied Madison. “But in Coral Gables it would mean you were considered an easy lay and a failure. That’s why its tough for me to adjust to. My roommate Cassie, on the other hand seems to be embracing it, like some others here.”

Kyle nodded. “OK I understand. Well, you know that I lie you ‘as s” – and if you’ll allow me I’ll take you places better than Dog-N-Shake in the future. We’ll need to dress a little better fr those places. But I’ll make you a promise: what you chose to order is totally for you to decide; I’ll not push or criticize either way, .I’m not trying to corner the market on you for dates but I’d like the chance to know you better. Deal?”

“OK,” replied Madison. “And if I can find a barn dance within 50 miles I’ll let you know. I think its time to get back to my car. “

Kyle already having paid the bill they walked back to his SUV, Madison quietly pulled her gym pants waistband lower to accommodate her surging belly. As they drove back to the gym Kyle played several songs from his CD player – Madison had never heard either the lyrics or the artists, but found herself responding favorably to them.

When Madison arrived home Cassi to her surprise was nowhere to be seen, neither were there any signs of supper being prepared, not that Madison wanted anything. Her mind was going over what had happened with her and Kyle. He had played Sir Galahad to her damsel in distress and proved himself to be both decent and a gentleman. But what disturbed her were both an observation and a comment that he had made.

It is good to exercise and have the muscle structure to carry your weight, he had said, implying that all the exercise in the world wasn’t going to make her nearly 170 pound body shrink. She knew he might be right, but wasn’t entirely ready to accept it yet. And what you eat or don’t eat I’ll never try to control, he had promised, knowing full well he was handing her a license to gain still more.

The warnings of Cassi’s fat and thin sisters, Rebekah and Erin, rang in her head.

“Turn back now – there’s no going back later,” Rebekah had effectively cautioned.

“You’re already turning into another Cassi,” Erin had effectively claimed during Madison’s midnight snack raid. “If you don’t stop you’ll be just like Rebekah.”
But Madison hadn’t turned back or stopped. Her size 14 wardrobe, her second change in a year, was getting tight and the scale confirmed it. Was what Kyle was implying the truth – was her body, plus perhaps a portion of her brain, making a choice to be fat? It would seem so – and Kyle obviously wasn’t opposed.

As for Kyle, he was unexpectedly further into uncharted waters more quickly than he’s ever anticipated. Prepared for finding rejection he’d instead found acceptance. Madison even seemed to like his kind of music, and didn’t laugh at his old fashioned values. She actually seemed a bit disdainful of the pettiness and superficiality of Coral Gables.

He was back in his own dorm pondering all this on couch in the lounge. Ralph Wagoner, whose girlfriend Beth Adams had spoken with Kelli, walked in.

”Cogitating the state of the universe as usual?” Ralph greeted Kyle.

“More than the universe, Ralph. I had supper tonight with a wonderful girl who actually has a brain and doesn’t think I’m a freak from another world,” declared Kyle.

“Whoa man – that’s great,” answered Ralph. “I was beginning to wonder if you were secretly gay or something – this is a first for you! How did it happen?”

“She locked her keys in her car and I summoned a locksmith. While we were waiting we got to talking and things went from there. She’s got some issues like everyone, but I think I can handle them,” stated Kyle.

“Like what issues?” queried Ralph.

“She’s gained some weight and is going to be needing a wardrobe change because inside she’s not ready to commit to eating bird food forever is my take. Typical Power’s girl stuff, like we’ve shared before.”

“Yeah,” said Ralph. “Beth is now up thirty pounds but s getting used to it. Her friend Kelli keeps pointing out that Madison and Cassi, especially Cassi, are way had of her. She fusses but I notice that she and her roomies always have snacks at the ready and never turn down a dinner date. Treat your girl like a queen and she’ll adjust. Do I know her?”


“You just mentioned her, Madison, Madison Kraft.”

“Hey, way to go man. I understand she comes from Florida money. She’s worth everything you put out for her,” Ralph responded.

“I didn’t know about that nor is it important,” shot back Kyle, “I liked her before I even knew her name – it’s just an attraction. I do know she’s a little leery of hitting her dad up for another wardrobe change, but it’s nice to know they can afford it.”

“I guess. But just get to know her and in a few weeks you may be able to give her a surprise. I’ve heard tell of a Powers’ BBW support group that sometimes gives grants for wardrobe upgrades for deserving Power’s coeds,” Ralph said mysteriously. “You just treat Miss Madison right and I’ll check it out.”

By this time Cassi had arrived home and Madison was telling her about what had happened with Kyle.

“I don’t know about all this,” she concluded. “I started out to help you lose weight but wound up gaining myself. Now I’m fat, getting fatter, and despite both your sisters’ warnings I’m not really that interested in going back- if that’s even possible. Now with Kyle I’m tempted to say “screw it” and accept his advice.”

“Like he says, it’s your decision,” answered Cassie, “But I’m glad you have him because now I can stop holding out on you. I’ve had a Kyle in my life as well, was actually with him late this afternoon, which is why I don’t care about my sisters opinions. Mark and I are keeping in touch and we’ll see where it goes. For the time being we both need to get our degrees.”

“Wow,” responded Madison. “I wonder what Erin will say to that – I told her that when she gets to college her body could change as well. She didn’t take that very seriously, I know, but it’s the truth. Why Mark and you instead of Rebekah?”

“First of all, she’s older than him by five years, so they never knew each other in school. Marks only a year older than me and we do know each other,” explained Cassie. “Secondly, Rebekah as you know hasn’t fully accepted herself at her current size. No guy, even one who prefers fatter women, wants to put up with fat girl complaints and whining. It’s not an issue because Rebekah doesn’t care about Mark anyway.”

“So she knows?” Madison asked.

“She’s suspected but I’ve not given her a firm answer; as for Erin we’ll see.” replied Cassie. “But now you know why I’m not seriously dieting. I’m happy for you and Kyle.”

“Yes,” murmured Madison, has her hand subconsciously massaged her belly. . “So am I”

Often times, Madison went to lunch intending to go back to a less filling diet, only to find an item in the dinning hall that she simply could not pass up, always one day away from starting a diet that Rebecca and Erin would have pushed.

The treadmill had simply tired her out too much, at least with the other two workout machines, she could move at her own pace, which Kyle noticed was slowing down a bit.

Psychologically, the gym was becoming less fun for her. Back when she was a 130 pound, fit college girl on the path to joining a hot sorority, the gym felt like a place for her to cool off and let extra energy go. Immediately upon getting Madison’s message Kyle smiled. He would have to wait until Monday to make a phone call, but Ralph and his contacts had already briefed him on what to do to schedule her interview. . As a result Wednesday afternoon found him ameliorating Madison’s stress at Dairy Queen with a pair of mushroom Swiss grill burgers and accompanying strawberry cheesecake blizzards.

“Now as I understand it this is all about your choosing a wardrobe with a consultant after you’ve been briefed on the contract. You pick the clothes and can back out anytime you want to just by paying for the clothes. But every year a few Powers co-eds get to do this and I’m told no one ever has,” he said reassuringly.

“Yes I know,” replied Madison. “I’ve visited the Torrid website and have seen their ‘insider’ models and ‘fan crushes of the week’ – some of them are huge yet the clothes I have to admit are great. But I’m on the low end of their range. And none of the ones I saw were from Powers.”

“Yes,” noted Kyle, ”I looked as well – they don’t say where they come from or how long they’re up. There are more on Facebook as well. It’s not exploitation so much as making a statement about the universality of beauty in every size – including the fourteeners like you.”

“For now – enroute to 16 or 18, if I can keep it to that without becoming a whale,” thought Madison, who knew how tight her clothes were feeling. Towards Kyle she simply said “I guess. Well, OK, it’s time to go!

At the store they were cordially ushered into an office where Asst. Store manager Roger Weatherly reviewed the arrangement and gave Madison an agreement to sign. She noted that it allowed her to back out at any time until she took delivery of the clothes without penalty – after that she would be obligated to pay for them if she reneged and withdrew her authorization or didn’t supply the endorsement letter.

She took a deep breath and signed, after which Mr. Weatherly introduced her to fashion consultant Delores Walker. Delores was a friendly black lady, attractively attired and probably weighing over 250. She replaced Mr. Weatherly at the desk and told Kyle he’d be called for in around two hours. Kyle nodded and left.

“One thing we need to do is get you comfortable in your clothes. Take your bra for instance. Ever find yourself having to adjust things after you reach up or bend over?’ inquired Delores

“Well, uh yeah. My twins have grown some this year and that is sort of comes with the territory,” replied Madison.

“Doesn’t have to,” replied Delores. “You’re wearing a bra with what’s called a camisole back – it allows for more fasteners but is more prone to slippage. There are leotard style bras with kicked in back straps that minimize this sort of thsat.” Delores informed her. “I’ll give you a set, then let you pick up a pencil from the floor and put it on a ledge over the door-sill; you tell me how it works.”

“Umm, OK,” replied Madison.

“Another factor is strap width. 2.5 centimeters is standard, but hose with more to carry should be around 4.5 cm with embedded gel pads. If you have that kind of support and develop your back and shoulder muscles you shouldn’t be experiencing pain or discomfort. And you can now have clear transparent straps that create the illusion of going strapless.

“Next, “continued Delores, “we’re going to match clothes to your body shape. In our world you’re not actually pus size enough to be classed as either an apple or pear –with your height, I’d be surprised if you’re even classed as officially overweight. Still, you’re definitely not a pear so I’m going to build an apple style wardrobe for you.”

“Errr – and what does that mean?” asked Madison

“For school wear, two piece outfits with bright skirts and capris but conservative tops. Also, full length custom fitted colorful formal wear, plus recreational wear designed for comfort rather than impress. We want four of the first, 2-3 of the second and third. And of course there are shows and accessories to think about.”

Mentally Madison was adding numbers. All this at Torrid for $1000? She was definitely getting her money’s worth.

“Come on, enough of this,” prompted Delores. “I’ve asked my picker Irene to make some selections which match your size – let’s go to the dressing room and see what you think”.

With that Delores arose and Madison, who was wondering how Delores and Irene could know her size without taking measurements, compliantly followed. For the next 75 minutes she tried on an array of outfits. Each fit fairly well, although two skirts were a bit snug and had to be ratcheted up a notch. Delores faithfully capturing photos of each one. Finally she tossed a pencil in front of Madison and asked her to pick it up. She did and instinctively reached to adjust her bra straps, being surprised that after over an hour she didn’t need to.

“Now, put it on the ledge over the entrance to the dressing room” Delores command. Again no strap adjustments were necessary and Madison realized that her shoulders weren’t fatigued after standing for a prolonged period either.

“OK, bra fitting chalked up. Now which outfits do you want in each category?” inquired Delores.

“Well, there are least two in each class that are definite keepers, but beyond that I’m not really sure,” she replied. “Why don’t you choose?”

“Not allowed – you could have rejected everything if you’d wished. Right now you stand at $540 – after we go to shoes and accessories you can wait up to 30 days to use up any remainder. Should be around $300.” Delores paused. “I’ll tell Irene to have these wrapped up while you get back into your original clothes. You can text Kyle to get back here in 45 minutes.”

After emerging from the dressing room Madison turned to Delores. “While were waiting on Irene and Kyle cam I ask a question – why is Torrid doing this for me? I’m not a celebrity with a following. How are they going to make their money back?”

Delores smiled. “They don’t have to worry about that; apparently no one has told you that all this is paid for by a grant- it’s from an outside group that picks the awardees and gets to pay wholesale. Torrid gets whatever advertising mileage they can; the group uses the Torrid ads in their BBW support efforts to prove that we big girls can be beautiful. And while I’m a wardrobe consultant not a sales person Irene and your boyfriend aren’t forgotten either.

“Kyle gets paid for bringing me here?” Madison said.

“Not in money, but yes. Usually a 2:1 dinner certificate at some place like he cheesecake factory. But he has had to jump thru some hoops along the way –so you should give him credit for doing it,” the consultant confided.

“I guess so,” murmured Madison. “But he and I are going to have to have a talk.”

112231212221112111221111111121111.content:
With Irene’s help Kyle and Madison managed to load her revamped wardrobe into Kyle’s SUV. Madison was thankful to Kyle but also eager to pin him down on what was actually going on. But she had to wait until Irene was out of the picture and they were on the way back to campus.

“OK,” she remarked,” “I guess that next I need to write me an “I Love you Torrid” letter and then prepare to see myself on the Internet. I wonder which outfit Dolores will use? She took pictures of everything.”

“Can’t say, I haven’t even seen any of them on you remember,” replied Kyle. “But whichever one it is I’m sure I’ll like it.”

“Yes, and I’m also going to have to prepare my family. You know this isn’t going to just stay I Kansas,” noted Madison. “But I feel just daring enough to assert my independence by this bit of mischief.”

“One picture, with no name or location, isn’t likely to become big news in Coral Gables either,” replied Kyle. “Sometimes I’m told even those at Powers don’t notice immediately because the shots from Wichita are mired in with those from everywhere. But I’ll be looking, I promise.”

“I’m sure you will – but you apparently know a lot about this. Do you know anther grantee or something?” Madison enquired.

“Yes, it’s no secret. You know her too – your friend Beth. UMILA gave her a grant six months ago - I’ve not noticed her on the website yet, though,” Kyle responded

“UMILA,” responded Madison. “What’s that?”

“A networking organization of college BBW supporting alumni, especially from Powers but I understand from elsewhere too,” answered Kyle. “It stands for Upward Mobility Initiative for Larger Alumni and the local chapter is a businesswoman named Gwen Porter. I guess they’re tight with Torrid. At least that’s what Ralph tells me. He’s the one who helped get this started.”

“And what did you have to do?” asked Madison.

“Basically certify that you were of good character, not into addictive habits or drugs that could reflect unfavorably, and not obsessed over having gained a few pounds. I certainly hope I’m right about my call on that one,” he smiled.

Once again, as she knew was becoming a habit Madison’s defenses meted. Although it went against her attitudes in high school she had to admit Kyle was right – although she’d gained nearly fifty pounds she really had no motivation or desire to lose them. What had started out merely as a support effort for Cassi had changed her life.
“And assuming you’re correct it makes you happy because, like it seems many men on the Powers campus you like larger girls. Why?” asked Madison.

“I’ve asked myself that and have no answer. The preference has been with me since grade school. I’ve seen the energy of the many heavier women in the Amish community so I know being both fat and healthy is completely possible as long as you’re active. They do it by working from dawn to dusk – not from forcing themselves to a gym. For city folk I think it means physical activities like cycling – don’t forget that used bicycle I told you about,” commented Kyle

Madison had forgotten the bicycle, but mention of it returned to her memory as Kyle brought it up.

“So that’s what Delores was referencing,” Madison exclaimed.

“What do you mean?” Kyle responded.

“She said I’d likely be needing a unique pair of shorts that’s with the stuff in the back. She said it had something she called flat-lock stitched seams and multi-stretch padding – in other words, something someone on a bicycle seat for a long time would probably appreciate,” answered Madison, who was wondering just how far Kyle would expect to ride.

“Yes, sounds like she did her job.” Grinned Kyle. “So I guess we need to plan a cycling outing – assuming you like the bicycle, which we haven’t looked at yet”

“We? You’re not going to just go get it and stick it in my dorm?” said Madison. “Sounds like you’re talking joint decision making.”

“Exactly,” answered Kyle. “I like you – but in a way that’s part of what makes me different from a lot of guys. I’m looking for a partner, not someone to be my property. I think it would be good both of us to have recreational exercise and I hope you’ll like the bike – but its not for me to just decide. I want to hear your voice.”

“Ummm – OK, I can understand that. When do I or rather we, get to go look at this bike?” asked Madison.

“While you’re putting the clothes away I can try making a phone call,“ offered Kyle

“Sounds fine by me, partner,” smiled Madison, who noted that she was starting to feel hungry. Luckily for her Cassie was already preparing tacos and invited Kyle to stay after they’d unloaded the clothes. Since Cassi was in the kitchen she didn’t really; pick up on many there were. She, of course, so far as Kyle and Madison knew, wasn’t aware of the source.

1122312122211121112211111111211111.content:
Following dinner, Kyle stepped out of the dorm for a few minutes, when he came back in, he looked pleased.

"Good news! We can go look at the bike this weekend," Kyle announced to Madison.

"Great!" Madison replied. Even though she didn't really know what to expect; she had not really biked in Miami after getting her license, she was still excited for the possibility of more adventures with Kyle and the chance for them to have some dates off campus.

For the rest of the week, Madison stayed away from the gym. Although she figured that her and Kyle could burn off some calories biking over the weekend, that was not the only reason she was laying off. The photos that were going up on Torrid served as a subtle release for her. Even though she rationalized that there were slim chances anyone she knew would see them, the knowledge that those photos were soon to be out there made her ease up. The idea that she didn't have to hide her body and gain was reducing some of the anxiety that she had surrounding her gain. Sure, this often receded into brief moments of panic that someone she knew would see them--most of all her high school friends, but this week, she was doing fine.

As Saturday morning rolled around, Madison and Kyle jumped into his SUV to take the 10 minute drive away from downtown to check out the bike. Like Kyle had mentioned, it was a fairly standard, but well maintained used 10 speed, owned by a couple whose daughter had left for school on the east coast, "Didn't make a whole lot of sense to ship it out there with her," the father explained.

"Well, $40 seems more than fair to me," Kyle said, handing him two crisp $20s. With that they took the bike back to his SUV.

When they got back to campus, Madison quickly ran up to change into more athletic clothes, while Kyle went and got his bike, and then proceeded put both his and Madison's on the tailgate.

When Madison came out, Kyle asked, "Ready for a fun afternoon?", to which Madison smiled and jumped in.

Kyle drove for about 30 minutes out of town, where the stopped near a park. "This is one of my favorite paths," he stated, "it takes us around the countryside and some nice streams. It isn't exactly leisurely, but we can take it at whatever pace we want.

After they got the bikes off the SUV, Madison and him started riding and talking, Madison felt herself getting rather winded. I wonder if I would have been able to smoke Kyle on this path a few months ago she wondered to herself. Besides the fatigue, Madison was having a fun time. She enjoyed the unstructured ride time, and the chance to learn more about Kyle and his upbringing. She found his more traditional family upbringing and lifestyle interesting as compared to her more contemporary one.

Luckily, the clothes that she was using from Torrid were performing as expected. Nothing would have made the ride more unbearable than her previous wardrobe, which would have left her love handles exposed, her butt uncomfortable, and her things constricted. As they rode, she was thankful that these were working out, and hoped that these trips meant the size 14s were all that she needed for a while.

11223121222111211122111111112111111.content:
After about two hours of cycling Kyle and Madison realized thsat they were into the heat of the day. Madison especially was tired and Kyle looped back to the SUV.

”OK – early afternoon, and I didn’t have any breakfast. Are you up for Mediterranean cuisine,” he asked.

Madison, waking late, had only grabbed a muffin and banana, and was feeling famished. Anything sounded good at this point and she readily accepted.

“OK, its quick 10 minutes to Café Maurice – some call it the best Mediterranean food in Kansas,” remarked Kyle. “Been around since 1955 – the same family does French pastries for hotels all over Kansas through their wholesale bakery.”

Madison was startled. “What do you do? Research these places on the Internet.”

“Yes, including the reviews. I just share the better ones,” answered Kyle as he pulled into the parking lot.

Once seated Kyle opted for Hummus Beef Shawarma while Madison ordered a Kafta Kabob Platter. Kyle mentioned to Madison that there would be complimentary tiramisu for dessert.

“Isn’t that Italian,” she sked.

“Yes,” said Kyle. “The family mixes up the menu a bit – for instance, what is a Mexican dish like pasta Diablo doing there? It’s their place, they get to play by their rules.

Madison nodded, then changed the subject “Beth and I had a talk about UMILA, i thought you should know.”

“OK by me. All I know is that they advocate for certain Powers alumni.”

“Yes, apparently the fat ones,” answered Madison.

“And this is bad, or good, because?” asked Kyle.

“I’m not sure yet – but in addition to fashion awards they apparently fund tuition for a number in the student body. I’m wondering now what brought me here, because my parents got some special deal as well,” Madison noted.

“I’d ask them,” suggested Kyle. “It’s not in my research data base to know what they fund and why. What I do know is that I’m glad you’re here and this food is great,” parried Kyle.

“Delores at Torrid says they’ll be giving you a reward for talking me into being their poster girl,” probed Madison.

“Possibly true – likely a gift certificate to a restaurant I’m told, but I haven’t been given it yet” confessed Kyle.

“I’m just hoping I don’t outgrow this new stuff too quickly – I’m not as sanguine as Beth about getting fatter. She seems to think it’s her family legacy and is adapting. Mine may hit the roof.” Worried Madison.

“Maybe you need to share with them what you’ve experienced and ow you feel about it – like a preemptive strike,” answered Kyle.

“That’s what Cassie and Beth suggest as well,” concurred Madison, “But I’m just not confident.”

“Every parent has to let loose and accept changes in their kids – certainly ginning weight as an issue is better than dropping out of college because you get pregnant or busted for drugs or deciding to become a camp follower of some rock star. You’ve got great grades, a supportive boyfriend who’s helping you stay in good shape and a whole career ahead of you. Why not thank them for making that possible, hen throw in a “things that can be surprising” bulletin,” Advised Kyle. “I think they’ll adjust – the alternatives are to try dieting or letting them find out by accident.”

Madison was silent for a moment. She knew she had no will to diet, and the folly of an accidental discovery she understood. Then nodded her heed. “I know you’re right – just not confident. Its scary.”

Kyle and Madison drove back to campus and unloaded the bikes. Then Madison went off to prepare an email.

         Dear Mom and Dad:

I now have a bike – courtesy of a guy here on campus I guess you ab call my by friend. I think you’d find him quite acceptable – he was raised as an Englischer adjacent to an Amish community and has old style values that you’d expect from that culture. I find the refreshing and more filled with purpose and wisdom that what guys in Coral Gables usually have to say.

We had a great ride today, although rather tiring, followed by a great dinner. He also gave me some great advice – I need to preemptively share with you some things myself before you find out by surprise and feel I’ve held out on you. That s not the way one honors their parents. .

First of all, I’m not pregnant, flunking out, in trouble with the law, addicted or broke – which are probably the five worst things thsat could happen. But there has been a big change in my life that I’ve come to accept and need your acceptance of. Powers is a school where a large portion of the student body is frankly overweight, and it is due to a culture here that I’ve been drawn into further and faster than I’d initially wanted or anticipated.

Initially it was an accident – exercising less to help a roommate with her problems. Then it was peer group friendship and just a few pounds. Then it was visiting a family where size didn’t matter and more pounds. Then frustrated but half-hearted attempts to reverse what was happening. Finally I had to ask myself – am I wrong for not being more upset? Thanks to Kyle and others I’m now content and no longer agonizing.

Now that I’m in sync with the culture here it feels right, so I thank you for sending me here. I hope you can accept a fat, non-dieting daughter as easily as Kyle does a fat girlfriend.

There, now I’ve said it. I hope you’re able to accept this change in your no longer “little” girl. I know I will be criticized and judged by society for not caving in to the common fatophobia, and also what I need to do to handle the health risks, but I need to decide for myself what the priorities are in life for myself. Existing on turnip greens and rye crisp isn’t on the list – not now, possibly never.

Thank you for your understanding

Madison

Taking a deep breath, she pasted the letter into an email and clicked on “send.”

112231212221112111221111111121111111.content:
Chris Kraft had run into the office briefly on a Saturday to get his tablet, which he had absentmindedly left at the firm the previous work day. It's probably time to just buy a second one he thought to himself while driving his late model German sport sedan. It was a rather uneventful evening, so he was expecting to just read some articles and go to bed.

When he got back to the house, his wife, Cecelia, was in the kitchen, reading an email that had just been received by her phone. "Hey, Chris, did you see what Madison just sent us?"

"Nope, driving," He responded. "What did she say?

"You should probably just read it for yourself," she said, about to slide the phone over.

Chris held up his tablet with a chuckle and went into his email app. He started reading, and figured it was a pleasant status update from the midwest, however, his raised and eye brow, This tone is getting awfully serious.... When he got to the portion of the email where she described her weight, Chris was a bit surprised. He figured his daughters would stay trim, like his wife, who at 50 was still in great shape.

"Well, that's unexpected," he said upon finishing the email.

"What do you think?" Cecelia asked.

"I guess I feel bad she thinks this is such a huge deal. Lot of kids gain weight in college, so long as it doesn't get to a place where it affects her health, I don't really see any reason to be concerned about it." Chris was one to pick his battles, and this was something that he treated with relative indifference. He loved his daughters, so the last thing he would ever do is crush their confidence by nagging one of them about their weight. Although he shared his wife's fitness oriented lifestyle, he wasn't one to look down on others.

"Yeah, that's where I'm at as well," Ceclia responded. "I just hope that other girls don't give her a had time."

"It's all about her disposition, and she's 18 now, she'll have to learn to roll with the punches regardless of her weight." He responded.

Madison's Mom typed up a nice response back to Madison, she laid out that basically said, "Well, we wanted you to experience a different viewpoint. Guess it worked out more than we anticipated - but you're now emancipated and we wish you well." If all things were equal, Cecelia would have prefered her daughter not to gain weight, but she wasn't giving it much thought, better to let Madison live her life. Still, she was curious how much weight her formerly trim daughter had put on, and where her weight would crest. Maybe we could come up and visit her sometime Cecelia thought to herself.

Madison was pleasantly surprised by her mm’s response – saying it was her life to live and not even inquiring how much weight was involved. Madison recognized that Cecelia’s seeming nonchalance was likely due to her Dad, who had always had a less judgmental attitude than her mom in such areas.

She thought a little more about her own presence at Powers – which she knew was in some manner due to a gift she suspected had come through her aunt, her dad’s sister. Aunt Rachel was a successful married career woman with three kids – but was also comfortably over 200 pounds. As far as Madison knew Rachel had never been to Powers, but could she be involved with UMILA and their grant program?

Madison wrestled with calling her Dad and asking directly, but decided that wouldn’t be wise. She had Kyle, as well as Cassie Beth, Ralph and other new friends. Trying to dig too deeply might just upset things – especially if her Dad knew what might happen at Powers but her mm didn’t. She decided to keep her suspicions to herself.

During the week Madison’s relaxed ting habits continued but she did make an effort to workout. As a result she had greater energy, felt better and wasn’t focused on her weight.

Kyle kept his word about returning to the Piccadilly Grill, the place where she’d nearly fallen off the wagon and ordered and entrée but Kyle had helped her keep her promise to hold back. This evening there were no pre-agreed restrictions and Madison wore one of her new dinner outfits. It was size 4 and not at all tight.
Madison didn’t hesitate to share a sampler platter comprised of hummus, tabouli, stuffed grape leaves, and fried kibbi, pus an entrée of slow-roasted Portuguese Pot Roast with Ancho peppers and Port wine. It came with sides of carrots, potatoes and green beans. Kyle had Piccadilly Meatloaf served with baked
potato and steamed vegetables,

Kyle was happy to hear that Madison had told her parents about him and her changes and that there was no blowup. He also concurred in her decision not to push matters.

“Beth’s mom is in UMILA,” he noted. “She can probably find out if they’re involved if you really want to know. What I’d like to talk about is Hillsdale Lake and the Walleye Egg Harvest”

“The what?” exclaimed Madison. “And where?”

“Hillsdale lake - man made super pond to the east near Paola,“ answered Kyle. “They have an egg harvest each spring – people from the general public catch female fish, take their eggs, turn hem over to officials who introduce male sperm so as to increase the fertilization rate, then release them into the water to become baby fish. It’s a seasonal thing and guess what – it happens next week. And yes, we can use the bikes.

“Wow,” thought Madison, “talk about unique date thinking.”

Aloud she replied, “so, that’s pretty far. How early should we start?

“It’s a three hour drive – so probably 6:00.,” Kyle observed. “There’s a buffet breakfast in Paola at a place called Molly’s Table and afterwards we can go to a place called Beethoven #9 – I’m told it has lasagna and beef stroganoff to rival the Amish.”

“In east Kansas near a man-made lake where they harvest fish eggs?” answered Madison.

“Sounds adventuresome. Why not invite Ralph and Beth? Do they have bikes?”

“Don’t know,” replied Kyle,” but we could ask.”

As turned out Beth was able to borrow a bike and Ralph had his own but only two could fit in Kyles SUV so Ralph and Beth had to use a second car. The good news was that all four had a great time.

11223121222111211122111111112111111112.content:
Madison kept up her routine for the next few weeks with Kyle. They would stay active on the weekends, and try new places, while her decreased stress from letting go allowed her to focus on school on the week nights. Contrary to her initial fears, the excess weight was not making her feel lazy, much to the contrary, without the stress from trying to stay thin, Madison had more time to study and a greater level of comfort in the classroom.

Even if she had released herself from expectation that she be the super popular sorority girl on campus, her peers still were sociable with her, and her professors were increasingly impressed with their clearly talented pupil. A few had noticed her gain, but must hadn't, focusing on her academic work that showed she was breezying through entry-level courses and ready for more advanced work.

However, there was one sorority girl that Madison knew she had to impress...or rather, one ex-sorority girl, her Mom. Something that she assumed she would not have to deal with in person until the holidays, or summer break, but unexpectedly sprung on her.

---

Cecelia had been checking back in at her frequent flier account for for most of the afternoon. It started as just a cursory glance, then she had started pricing out flights to get to Powers. Now, she was waiting for Chris to come home to tell him her great idea. They could visit Madison at college! She knew her husband was sitting on hundreds of thousands of miles from his business travels, going to other offices in the firms, why not use some of those to go see their daughter?

When Chris got home, Cecelia directly brought up her idea,

"Chris, I miss Madison, let's go visit her next week."

"What?" He replied, with a slightly surprised look on his face. This came out of left field. He had tickets to go see the U play next week, but it's not like those were hard to get...so her couldn't really see a reason why not. "I suppose we could...." he continued, "Two short term plan tickets are going to be pricey"

"We can afford it, Chris," Cecelia responded quickly, "plus, we can just use your miles, for both of us it will cost 50,000 miles, tops."

"Eh, I'll just put it on my card, I want to get to the next medallion status this year. What about Alexa?" Chris asked.

"She's 17, we'll leave her some cash for food while we're gone."

Chris couldn't believe this level of willingness in his wife. She was usually the one who was critical of parents who left town for the weekend, which was basically begging their high schoolers to throw parties...which he was almost certain that Alexa would do while they were gone. Better lock the liquor cabinet if this trip actually happens he thought. This all struck him as odd, why did she want to go up there so badly?

"Umm, you do know how cold it is up there this time of year, right?" He asked.

"Oh Chris, it's November, and it's not Canada!" she said.

This struck him as even odder. One year before they had Madison, Chris had taken his wife to New York for New Years eve. They had a great time, but the whole trip, whenever they had gone outside, Cecelia would complain about the cold, and constantly ask how anyone could live in that climate.

Searching, Chris asked, "Are you going to make sure Madison's boyfriend is up to your standards?"

"Noooooo," she said to Chris' grin. "Well...maybe a little bit," she responded, with a little chuckle. Cecelia continued on in response to a eye brow raise from Chris, "Well we don't know anything about this guy, other than that he had a traditional upbringing, and he doesn't mind if she's as big as a house."

Chris did a full eye roll at that one, and jumped in, "It's her life, we didn't raise her to be stupid about these things. I highly doubt she would change herself for a guy, and even she did, what would visiting her do to change it?"

"Nothing, but I just want to meet him."

Resigned to the outcome, Chris obliged, "Fine. I'll book two tickets. But don't think I'll give you my seat when I get bumped up to first class." Chris was going to get his small victories where he could that weekend.

-------

Madison, unaware of her parents' deliberations, was caught off-guard by the phone call she received from her Mom the following evening. After a bit of chit-chat, her Mom pounced with the same decisiveness she had used with her husband,

"Madison, your Dad and I would like to come visit you next weekend."

"Umm...really?"

"Why are you surprised? We thought it would be nice! We could take you out to dinner, and you could introduce us to Kyle!"

Madison had realized that this was the echo from her email. Her Mom may have been nice enough in the response, but she wanted to check out her daughter and her boyfriend, to make sure all was actually well.

"Yeah...I guess, Mom. I was just going to study that weekend," she replied, knowing that Kyle's date plans were shot at that point.

112231212221112111221111111121111111121.content:
Madison took a deep breath. Her grades were great, her relationship with Kyle was fine, and she was happy both with her body and health – the combination of cycling plus 2-3 gym workouts a week and a wardrobe that fit finally made her unconcerned about her weight, which was just over 180. But the message about her parent’s visit made her suspected that her mom was less sanguine.

She had continued to wonder about her presence Powers. It had a fine reputation as a .liberal arts college, but the make-up of the student body seemed to reflect an agenda. Knowing that Beth was on an UMILA grant Madison had asked her to inquire whether she was secretly as well. It turned out this was not the case. She and Kyle even met with UMILA’s local coordinator, Gwendolyn Porter. She was an administrator with the Wichita Social Services department, approximately 260 pounds at 5’10 or so, and impeccable dressed.

“Obviously a Torrid customer,” thought Madison.

“I did check out your Aunt,” she had said, “She is part of some size acceptance groups we work with and has served as a UMILA scout, but you were never one of her candidates. I even went so far as to call her and confirm that.”

Madison had been visibly startled. “You what?”

“I checked it out. UMILA is essentially a networking post-graduate group for the size acceptance community. Beth and people like her we help after they’ve already shown themselves likely to be receptive to our approach in key areas,” Mrs. Porter explained. “But you were not at any time part of that matrix.

“Like being from a larger family and not minding it” concluded Madison. “That is how Beth thinks of it.”

“Exactly. We don’t try to identify and lure people to Powers in some clandestine manner. Part of the endowment here comes from those favorable to our community but it’s a convergence of values, not a plot. Like any alumni group we facilitate participation by those who seem pre-inclined to want what Powers has to offer. Whatever your Aunt arranged with your parents, or more precisely your Father if I understood correctly, was entirely separate from UMILA,” Mrs Porter assured Madison. “But that said, we are pleased to have you here and can be available after graduation.”

“I think Madison’s mom thinks in terms of sororities rather than post-graduate networking,” observed Kyle. “Nothing wrong with that, but a different paradigm. Personally I’m not into fraternity life myself – too much wildness and not very real.”

“It can get rather petty at times, but not all letter groups are that bad. But you’re right – UMILA is neither fraternity or sorority – and I suspect your mom might regard us with some disdain, so it’s probably just as well that you’re not one of our grantees right now,’ noted Mrs. Porter.

With that they had had left, Madison commenting to Kyle, “So my dad worked one of his deals with his sister, probably without telling Mom much because she usually doesn’t take an interest in his wheelings and dealings. And I wind up on a campus geared to graduating fatties. How do I explain that,” Madison fussed.

“You don’t, “replied Kyle. “I mean, you can’t because you don’t have the facts and probably shouldn’t even try. . All you can do is be yourself. Your Aunt may or may not have done what you suspect deliberately and your Dad may or may not be complicit, for whatever reason. But what your mom has to deal with is your choices – including me. Have you considered that I’m as much of concern to her as your weight?”

A light bulb went on for Madison.

“The best defense is sometimes a strong offense, as my dad sometimes says. So if you come with me to the airport to greet them you and not my waistline becomes the focus. Since they’ll only be here for the weekend you can keep things in check.

“Precisely,” ginned Kyle.” Your Dad seems like a fascinating person I’d enjoy getting t talk to. Who knows, maybe your mom will talk with me as well. I just hope I make a good impression.”

“Also, if we take them to the dining hall and they see how many size 12 and up students are here they may get the point without either of us saying a thing,“ noted Madison.

--- --- ---

Sensing possibly stormy seas ahead Chris took the precautions of any navigator, including touching base with his sister Rachel, asking her to look in on Alexis in his and Cecelia’s absence.

“Certainly,” Rachel replied. “And you may find that Cecelia isn’t the only one with questions. Madison is doing some digging into how her presence at Powers came about. She thought it might have been a grant from UMILA, so she asked them about it.”

“How did you find that out – and what is UMILA?” Chris had asked.

“It’s an affiliate of a group I do size acceptance work or – some of their grants fund scholarships at Powers, but there is no way Madison would have qualified. I found out because they called and informed me. I told them to assure her of that and ask one of us if she really needed to know.” Answered Rachel.

“Oh yes,” answered Chris, “Cecelia would have had a fit if one of your groups had sent her – but are you saying Powers is a school that caters to fa people, I thought you said its graduates had one of the best employment outlooks in the country?” said Chris.

“They do. I gave you the statistics. Maybe not hounding people about their waistlines is part of the curriculum, but don’t quote me on that. I just now made it up.” Rachel said coyly.

“Yes, but I know your advocacy and if this UMILA recommends them I’m sure its part of an gender. Just how much weight has Madison gained?” He asked.

“I’ve no idea, but if she has friends who are UMILA scholars they’re probably size14 or 16 – not huge but bigger than Madison,” Rachel opined.

“Or bigger than Madisen used to be,” thought her Father. “But not all that big – she could carry that kind of weight easily – and give this Kyle fellow less grief than I sometimes have to endure from Cecelia’s fatophobia. It would be a real joke on her if Rachel added five pounds to Alexis while we’re gone.”

Three days later Mr. and Mrs. Kraft were on their way. The pilot advised them hat due to weather conditions they could expect heavy snow in Wichita and temperatures below forty degrees, but the storm had passed. At Powers Madison noted the weather. She was thankful she had an excuse to wear a heavy overcoat. This would not immediately reveal that she’d gained nearly fifty pounds.

In Wichita Kyle decided to use his SUV because it had 4 wheel drive; Madison had decided the icy conditions would make her mom’s traditional high heels a slip risk and therefore she would put her mom in a wheel chair as a distraction while the men handled the bags. Kyle thought this amusing and immediately agreed. With the storm knocking out electricity many restaurants were closed so he decided to use the Powers dining hall for food.

Back at the Kraft home Alexis had discovered a treat – a bakery fresh strawberry and almond chocolate pie with a note from her dad “sorry we have to be gone – enjoy this before we return.”

Alexa indulges
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
While Madison was fretting seeing her parents, her sister, Alexa, was back down in Miami, now with the weekend all to herself and an empty house. She pondered throwing a party, but her Dad assured her that her Aunt Rachel would be checking up on her while she was gone, and if anyone was over at the house, she would be grounded for quite a while.

Her parents had left her money and a credit card for any emergencies that popped up, but even her ability to use that was limited, as she had no car. They had taken the SUV to the airport, leaving only Chris' car, a sport sedan with a manual transmission that Alexa could not drive, even if she had wanted to.

Getting back from school that day, Alexa texted some friends to see if anything was going on that evening, and was coming up short. Most of her friends were out of town for an away football game that evening, something that she just wasn't interested in, after breaking up with the team's #1 receiver a few weeks prior. So, Alexa just sat on the couch and turned on the TV, while helping herself to some pie that her Dad had left for her.

After a few hours of this, and overcome with boredom, she decided she was done with this, and was going to go out somewhere. Hopelessly far away from any public transit, she decided she was going to learn to drive her Dad's manual transmission. Determinedly going into the garage, Alexa went into the drivers seat, and adjusted it so she could reach all three pedals, the third of which, looked completely foreign to her. After opening the garage door, and with the early afternoon dusk of November illuminating the $55,000 car she was sitting, Alexa turned the key....and....was greeted with nothing. The teen sat there dumbfounded. Why won't this turn over she thought to herself. Not knowing to push in the clutch, she just assumed a manual transmission meant pushing the stick into gear, and had no idea how to even turn the car on at this point. After few minutes of trying random combinations, Alexa gave up, closed the garage door, and went back into the house.

"Ugh, what am I going to do tonight?!" she said outloud, to the empty 3,500 square foot house. With that she walked to the dinning room table, and saw the circular in the Herald, with pizza coupons enclosed. "I'm treating myself." she thought, dialing up the number, and ordering a large pizza and bread-sticks, using the cash her Dad had left.

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
As Madison waited nervously in the baggage claim area she was fighting stage fright despite having rehearsed carefully with Kyle how they would handle her mom. Outside the terminal the weather was bitingly cold, a circumstance that had helped turn a serious snowstorm into a blizzard. But there was a four hour window for planes to land and she was at the airport because one of them carried her parents.

The plane had landed sixty minutes before, two hours behind time, but was waiting for a departing flight to load and take off before it could be given a terminal berth. Madison had talked via cell with her dad and they’d agreed to meet in the baggage claim area, then summon Kyle with his 4 wheel drive SUV as soon as they had retrieved the two checked bags.

The key, Madison knew, was to keep focused on logistics, letting her show off her strength and conditioning, thus depriving her mom of any immediate opportunity to focus on Madison’s already acknowledged weight gain.

Madison was dressed warmly for the weather – this was the eighth or ninth snowfall for the season and she’d learned quickly what to do. She wondered if her Mom even owned a heavy coat suited for below freezing temperatures. She knew that this could work to her favor – giving her mom something else to worry and complain about, but she did feel sorry for her. Mrs. Kraft had lived all her life in the sun-belt and hadn’t been trained in cold weather precautions.

Inside the plane Mr. Kraft was sanguine. He’d been in scores of cities on hundreds of flights. As long as it was just waiting in line for a berth he knew there was no danger – he’d been held up in Chicago’s notorious O’Hare for 2-3 hours at least a dozen times. These things happened and he knew passenger safety had to trump convenience. He felt it was inevitable. Mrs. Kraft on the other hand was straining to keep her cool.

”Why do we have to have a docking berth,” she asked, “why not just use portable stairs to get off and walk into the terminal? It isn’t that far.”

“No,” observed her husband, “and that works fine in a small airport with a half dozen flights a day with a dozen or so passengers each. But larger airports have to process multiple mobs of 250 people all at the same time. Trying to do that without berths would tie up movement of all the baggage carts, fuel tucks, and so forth. You can’t move several big planes around with 2000 civilians who move at different speeds and have no idea really where they’re going. “

Just then the plane lurched gently as the captain released the brakes and the 727 began easing its way towards a freshly vacated berth. Mr. Kraft’s cell phone sounded and Madison reported that the bags should be available in 15 minutes, so there was plenty of time to disembark and make it to the baggage claims area. Originally Kyle and Madison had planned to use icy conditions and Mrs. Kraft’s proclivity for high heels to justify putting Mrs. Kraft in a wheel chair, but Chris Kraft had rejected Madison’s offer in that regard.

With the late arrival Madison wondered if she and Kyle could still implement their original plan – taking her parents to the campus for lunch since the power was out for many restaurants and it wasn’t yet check-in time at the hotel where her father had made reservations. She needn’t have worried – upon feeling the cold Wichita weather all her mom wanted was a place that was warm. Her father had already been talking about being hungry. While chatting via cell they’d already decided that Kyle’s SUV and the Powers dining hall sounded like a great combination.

Madison met her parents in the baggage claim area. Her mom was already feeling the cold enough that she merely looked at her bundled up daughter and felt envious. Madison for her part had deftly pulled the two bags, each weighing over 50 pounds, onto a cart, then whipped out her phone and called Kyle. Her dad marveled at her energy and efficiency while his wife’s teeth began to chatter.

“Hmm,” observed Chris Kraft to himself, “obviously not all her weight gain is flab; but, of course Madison never was weak to begin with. I think Cynthia may be getting all worked up over something Madison needs to decide for herself. “

Kyle had the SUV’s heater on, much to Mrs. Kraft’s relief – although Madison didn’t really feel the need and would have turned it off if it were just her and Kyle. As they drove towards Powers Kyle talked casually with Mr. Kraft about the just completed trip. Cynthia Kraft, for the moment, was neutralized.

By the time they reached the campus Madison, wearing a heavy coat over three layers of clothing, was sweltering. She suggested leaving the cost in the car, but Kyle countered by suggesting her mom could use it. Mr. Kraft agreed and before she could say otherwise Cynthia Kraft was wearing a cost obviously several sizes too large but feeling warmer. Mindful of Madison’s concern about high heels in the slush Chris stayed close to his bundled up wife and walked with deliberate slowness. As a result nothing adverse occurred, but the effect was to diminish attention on Madison.

With the coat gone Cynthia, though sidelined, was able to better assess Madison’s gain, which she correctly guessed to be at least fifty pounds. But Madison obviously was full of energy, happy and seemed be as strong as an ox. Cynthia knew she had to hold her peace, but it wasn’t easy – and her uneasiness was made stronger with the realization that Powers was a campus of equally larger women. All around the dining hall she saw students eating meals that were anything but low calorie. What type of school, she wondered, had her husband’s sister gotten Madison involved with?

Kyle graciously invited Madison’s parents to have whatever they liked – he was picking up the tab. He and Madison then both filled their trays with generous but not excessive portions and Mr. Kraft did likewise. Cynthia took a deep breath and followed her husband’s example.

Again, according to script, Kyle engaged Mr. Kraft in conversation, the two hitting it off quite well. Madison on the other hand interrupted by introducing her parents to various passing classmates, sometimes with their significant others in tow. Mr. Kraft noted their maturity and social skills, his wife that every one of the co-eds were at least thick around the waist and many very much so. This was obviously a different kind of school.

After lunch Kyle started to take Mr. and Mrs. Kraft a tour of the campus, but then noted the weather beginning to change.

“I think we need to get you to your hotel,” noted Kyle and the foursome returned to the SUV. The Kraft’s were staying at what Kyle regarded as the rather pricy Ambassador Hotel. As they arrived snow was already falling.

“I would invite you to stay,” said Mr. Kraft, “but I think it might be wise for you to get back to the safety of Powers. However, if the weather allows would the two of you like to join us for dinner tomorrow night? I understand the restaurants there is very exceptional – Its called the Sienna Tuscany Steak House and I’m sure they must have auxiliary power.”

Kyle looked at Madison, who said, “Sure, why not. I have a new dinner dress I’ve been wanting to wear.”

With a nod and a wave the two college students headed back to Powers while Me and Mes Kraft headed for their room.

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Back at the hotel, Chris looked out the window as snow continued to fall in a way that made it seem later than mid afternoon. Or maybe I'm just tired from the flight and the meal he thought to himself. He had checked the weather earlier in the day, and it wasn't supposed to accumulate, but he was starting to think that outside things were taking an unpredicted turn for the worse. Getting back to Miami is going to be a mess he thought to himself.

Inside, however, things were good, for now. Ceclia was just getting up from a quick nap. His initial fear that Cecelia would get grumpy at the sight of Madison's gain had gone unfounded. Whether it was her preoccupation with the cold weather, or just letting this thing go, she hadn't brought up the subject and seemed to be more focused on learning more about the college and city in general.

"Ugh, that was so much food for lunch," Ceclia said, breaking up his moment of thought while putting a hand over her barely bloated stomach. "No wonder Madison gained so much weight!"

Chris decided not to bite at that jab against Madison, instead focusing on the food, "Yeah, I haven't had a lunch with such generous portions in a while, and unfortunately jogging outside looks out of the question."

Cecelia wasn't going to let it go, however, "Chris she looked so puffy, it was kind of surprising seeing her like that!"

"Well...yeah," her husband responded, "but she's clearly not just lounging around all day, look at how she handled those suitcases, I'd like to see you try to throw them around like that."

"I just hope that dinner isn't huge. I don't want to be the second member of this family who has to go up a size."

Chris rolled his eyes, "Eh, vacation calories," he said, while chuckling at their less than exotic destination and weather.

------------

Meanwhile, Madison was looking at her dresses. Her deal with Torrid was coming up huge in situations like these, and not just because it was providing her with clothes. She was actually getting clothes that were playing to her strengths, and keeping her looking respectable. Back when she was thin, she had never thought of it as an issue, but before she had gained some skill from the Torrid advice, she was a bit lost when it came to the new clothing reality she found herself in.

Luckily, the previous time that she had went to Torrid, she found a size 14 dinner dress that would be perfect for dinner with her parents that evening. When she had tried in on in the store, she liked the way that the cut of the dress had minimized her hefty rear and helped hide her stomach.

-----------

Back in the hotel room a while later, Chris got back from the gym, which seemed to be the only part of the hotel that had been neglected. Following a quick shower, he was greeted to a scene where his wife was slipping her dress on. "Chris, does this seem a bit tighter to you?"

He honestly could not tell, "I think you may be playing head games with yourself," he responded, while also wondering if the somewhat tight dress showed a bit of a convex line on her stomach.

In sharp contrast to the snow storm in Kansas, back in Miami Alexa was experiencing typically serene weather as she ate a pizza with the door to the pool open. Before she had known it, she finished half of the slices, but still felt a bit hungry. What is going on with me today? she wondered. Alexa wasn't alarmed with her sudden tick in consumption, figuring she was just in a funk and assuming that her speedy metabolism would burn off the pizza-- in a place where it was always bikini season, she counted that.
