1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
While Chris was off in the hotel gym Cynthia had been basking in the luxury of the Ambassador – she had never been in a hotel suite with walk-in closets! The corner windows gave a spectacular view of the surrounding city, especially the Intrust Arena. She had to agree that he refurbished old Wichita style skyscraper– fourteen stories tall and built in 1926 to house a major bank - was exceptional. After renovation the building now was a truly distinctive luxury hotel with elegant custom furnishings that showed attention had been paid to detail.

She had considered pursuing her astonishment over the extent of Maddison’s weight gain with her husband. He had always simply respected her position regarding food. She’d told him early on that that in early high school she’d endured a lot because of her weight, finally losing it and resolving never to become fat again.

Chris Kraft was neither a chubby chaser nor a fatophobe. He was a builder of enterprises and manager of projects. If his wife wanted to ban desserts and avoid restaurant meals he could accept that. But he’d made it clear that this was her decision, not something he was concerned about.

Cynthia in her heart knew Chris could care less about what she saw in Madison – all he wanted was for her to be productive and happy. It was of no concern to him that Madison’s once angular jawbone was now swathed in a coat of flesh which Cynthia knew was developing into a double chin. Nor would he be disturbed that her expanding belly was noticeably riding on her thighs when seated.

To Cynthia’s husband this was all just part of his daughter trying to define and find herself On the plane he’d bemusedly remarked that Madison and her new beau were trying to orchestrate attention elsewhere as he demurred from the offer of a wheelchair for his wife. He similarly chuckled at the transparency with which a fellow student was controlling visitors to their dining hall table at Powers via text message on signal from Madison while Kyle carried the conversation.

Cynthia was not so amused. She saw Madison becoming what she once had been – a fat girl destined to live life as a lonely fat woman, with all the prejudice and hassle that went with it. She didn’t want that future for her daughter, but it seemed beyond her control. Madison had declared as much. Cynthia wanted to call Powers “Pachyderm University” from what she had observed, nut she knew Chris would only say “it’s her life an out of our hands.”

Cynthia knew Chris was right, but the effect was strange. If her own daughter could indulge, she had begun to think while Chris exercising, why shouldn’t she? So when Chris suggested that they use the suites separate sitting room as a dinette for a meal using room service she readily went along. He ordered a plate of chicken sofrito (chicken legs costed in chili powder and cooed with a blend of rice chopped onion, garlic and bell pepper). For himself he ordered lasagna blended with ground sirloin and a rich Italian chicken sausage.

Rather than discussing Madison Cynthia noticed the clouds parting. She soon found herself relaxing and falling under the spell of the flavors and aroma from the delicious meal, the stars and the snow in a rare evening of romantic peace with Chris.

Meanwhile Kyle and Madison were laying plans for the next day. Maddison had reached her dad via cell phone while he was in the gym. She had extended an invitation to continue their tour of the campus and take in old town as well if the weather allowed. Chris tentatively accepted the proposal, but felt that another blizzard wave might greet them instead.

As it turned our Chris’s premonitions were not unfounded. Around 4:00 am he awoke to the sound of howling wind and cold sheets of sleet and snow. Fortunately Cynthia was sound asleep and Chris, unperturbable as usual, felt everyone was safe. He let his wife sleep until mid-morning, then ordered omelets from room service.

At about 10:00 he checked the news – Midwestern airports were locked down and probably not opening till Tuesday. He called Alexa and told her that they’d be gone longer than expected. A few moments later Madison phoned and suggested everyone stay warm. Chris immediately thought of Cynthia’s Sunbelt wardrobe and agreed. Around 1:00 he ordered a pair of Turkey Focaccia bread Club sandwiches with a Special Cranberry Mayonnaise and a lovin chocolate cake for dessert.

Cynthia knew she was eating calorie bombs, but with the stormy weather and a pampering husband she just didn’t care. It frankly was fun throwing off the restraints of thirty years for a short time. About half an hour after lunch she decided to take a nap. It seemed only minutes I Chris notified her that things were safer, Madison and Kyle were on their way.

Shortly thereafter there was a knock on the door. Cynthia opened it to see a Madison and Kyle she hadn’t anticipated. Madison had a spectacular red dinner dress which seemed to scream “look at me because I’m stunning.”

Kyle was wearing a suit underneath his overcoat. Both looked more mature than their actual ages, which of course was the desired effect, and Cynthia was speechless.
Chris recovered more quickly, greeting both of them and expressing appreciation for their safety. Kyle informed him that he had a tie in his pocket but didn’t know if the restaurant’s dress code required it. Chris informed him that he didn’t need to and Kyle smiled. He’d wear a tie if he had to, but it wasn’t his habit.

Madison caught the view and the commodiousness of the suite, as well as the hand selected furnishings.

“Yes,“ remarked her father, “If I have to be stranded and cooped up its best to do it in style.”

Kyle grinned. This was the type of place he’d love to take Madison to if he could afford it –he was happy Chris felt the same way about Cynthia for he felt that meant Chris had a good heart. Before he could start a conversation, however, Chris gestured towards the on door and suggested they be on their way.

Upon being seated both Chris and Kyle noted a special notice informing patrons that all beef dishes came from the Creek Stone Farms natural beef program - in Arkansas City, Kansas and would be served” grilled to Temperature with Olive Oil, Sea Salt and Cracked Pepper and Accompanied by Silena’s Signature Chianti Caramel Sauce.”

“Obviously they’re proud of their sources,” noted Kyle. “Agri-business is finally catching up to the Amish.”

“What is that supposed to mean?” asked Cynthia, obviously not getting his point.

“Creekstone has a line of beef which is corn fed and totally vegetarian - no hormones, no growth promoting drugs and no mixing of their meat with stuff from other countries. Its been a big deal in the beef industry just the last few years, but its been that way in Amish areas forever. Thing is, since they don’t have websites and do things in small lots few are aware of it. This farm is part of agribusiness trying to do the same thing on a bigger scale. .

“Which means you’re going to try it to compare, I suppose,” interjected Madison.

“What do you think, Mr. Kraft? I take it you’ve been here before.” asked Kyle.

Chris laughed. “Call me Chris, and yes I plan on having some so you and Madison are entirely welcome to. You won’t be sorry But for an appetizer can I suggest a serving of Arancini.”

“And what is that, pray tell?” said Cynthia, for whom restaurant dining was a self-imposd novelty and the $36 per plate price tag on the steak astonishing. .

“Stuffed Sicilian rice balls,” replied her husband. “It takes fancy place like this to do them right.”

“Definitely not what you’ll find on the drive thru menu at McDonald’s,” quipped Chris.

“If we weren’t already committed to beef I might have suggested a platter of Antipasto Misto. It usually has a variety of meats served Tuscany style,” Chris said almost laconically.

“I think I need to study up on Italian food styles,” remarked Madison, “it seems every province has unique dishes.”

“Traveling as much as I do you see them all and you can’t help become a bit of an Epicurian,” remarked Chris.


“Epi-what?” stuttered Cynthia.:

“Epicurus was a Greek philosopher who believed in the pursuit of happiness and pleasure as the great goal of life, so nowadays someone who likes searching for exotic foods and flavors today gets called an Epicurian,” blurted Kyle.”As a hobby its fun, but if you go overboard it can get very expensive.”

“So you’re a student of Greek philosophy?“ inquired Chris.

“Not really,“ answered Kyle. “My own philosophical views are more conservative Judeo-Cristian – pray for god’s guidance, then go where you’re guided. Asceticism is the opposite ditch but in-between there is a balance based on loving and serving others. /I guess some might call it realistic altruism of youth, but our family’s practiced it for ages,

“What he is saying, Dad,” explained Madison. “is that he wants people to help one another rather than fearing and controlling each other. But not everyone is ready for that so you do what you can.”

With that the food arrived and met all expectations. Chris Kraft was left to his thoughts, which he suspected were far from those of his wife. But Cynthia seemed preoccupied with devouring her meal and was the first to accept the suggestion of dessert.

Cynthia continues her culinary rediscovery
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
It was now Sunday and the Krafts were being visited in their Ambassador Hotel suite by their now borderline Rubenesque daughter and her boyfriend. The weather was predicted to continue rough for the next few days and the Krafts knew they were tethered to Wichita. They had informed Alexa, then called Madison who in turn called Kyle. .

“Well, since you’re stranded here on our account I guess that sort of makes you our guests, right?” suggested Kyle.

“Hmmm – well in a sense. Did you have something in mind?” Chris Krsdt inquired.

Well, the Ambassador hotel is literally next door to Wichita’s old town district – and since you like unique eateries I could introduce you and your wife to things you’ll not likely have in Florida.”

“Interesting to me, to be sure,” stammered Chris, “but when it comes to eating out in restaurants Cynthia ….”

“Oh Chris” interrupted Cynthia, I know what you’re thinking but maybe I need to relent a bit. It would mean not being cooped up in this hotel for four days.”

“Yes – and you don’t have to worry about walking in the cold. The Ambassador has a complimentary Cadillac Escalade to ferry guests anywhere around Old Town and even beyond that they want,” interjected Madison.

“OK,OK, I’m persuaded – but you youngsters only get to play hosts in picking the places - I insist on picking up the tabs. Agreed?"

Well, I was going to ask for Dutch treat but that’s far better, Mr. Kraft, err, Chris,” replied Kyle. “So for lunch could I suggest that we start with a place that’s been around since 1910? They have a choice of pot pies, bison and mushroom burgers, or a corned beef Reuben sandwich.

“You left out their pizzas,” interjected Madison.

”That too,” admitted Kyle,” and chicken with waffles if you want to go crazy. Its called the Public and they do have quite a variety.”

“You save me drooling already,” exclaimed Chris, who with a glance noticed a strange craving o his wife’s face. Was this discussion of food exciting Cynthia he wondered.

Cynthia indeed was excited, but why she couldn’t entirely understand. She was out with her husband, daughter and boyfriend with no pressure or responsibilities. To her it was becoming obvious where Madison’s added pounds were coming from – with such food readily available. It was making her hungry as well.

But there was something else. Sure, Madison’s flaring hips and what Cynthia observed was a gradually accumulating layer of back fat were noticeable, as were her plumping upper arms, but for some reason Cynthia didn’t care. She was in fact intrigued when after a full lunch Kyle proposed an afternoon adventure.

“What do dinosaurs, Egyptian mummies, Indians and WW2 have in common?” he asked.

“Things that kids would love?” asked Madison innocently, knowing full well what was coming.

“They are all featured in the museum of national treasures right down the street,” commented Kyle. “Why don’t we make an afternoon of it?”

Cynthia was buttering her third corn muffin and was feeing full, but the idea appealed to her.

“What do you think Chris,” she asked

“We’re he guests, so let’s go where our hosts suggest?” he replied –and so they did, developing a fresh appetite over the next four hours.

“So, our hosts, what do you suggest for supper?” asked Chris.

“hmm,” hummed Kyle. “Your suite has a microwave. What about some woodoven pizza. Ever hear of it”

“No,” replied Chris. “What’s unique about it?”

“The way the dough is flash cooked,” answered Kyle. “You can only do it in a special oven. If we got a couple of boxes I figure we could play cards and graze – give you and Madison some quality time. And honestly, let us get to know one another as well. We can walk over to Vicimo’s and order two pies – cheesecake for dessert if you wish.”

“Ummm pass on the dessert but go ahead and surprise us,” replied Chris, failing to note his wife’s slight pout. .

The foursome walked the few short blocks to the restaurant where Kyle ordered an Angeli (Roasted chicken, sweet balsamic marinara sauce, mozzarella, gorgonzola, portobello mushrooms, artichoke hearts, plus fresh rosemary) and a Melanze with ground beef (Marinara sauce, mozzarella, beef. grilled eggplant, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, oven roasted tomatoes, and fresh basil). Meanwhile Chris called the hotel and requested a pickup in the Escalade.
While waiting for their pickup Kyle noticed an adjacent convenience strew and excused himself. He soon returned with 3 two litre bottles of soda.

“I think we can depend on the hotel for ice,” he remarked.

Back in the Kraft’s suite everyone enjoyed their food long with several hands of rummy. Cynthia, to her husband’s surprise, finished her four slice share first, while Madison finished last. After Kyle and Madison had departed he wondered whether he should say anything, but she spoke first.

“I know what you’re thinking. I’m indulging and enjoying myself like I haven’t since middle school – and don’t ask me why. Maybe because Madison’s able to be happy with her body I’m remembering what it could have been like for me,” she declared.

“Fine by me sweetheart,” her husband replied. “I’m just sorry its taken so long – but its never too late to choose a different path as long as you’re alive.”

“You’re right, she said. “The kids left us a liter of soda. What do you say we order some sundaes from room service?”
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: Stranded in Witchita

choices: Back up north
That evening her Aunt comes over
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
"So you better go to class this week. I'll be emailing your teachers to check"

"I understand, Mom," Alexa told her mother, who had called to inform her that she would not be back late Monday, but rather later in the week, possibly as far off as Thursday or Friday.

"What should I do for food?" she asked her Mom, not really asking, but more doing it to complain.

"Use your Dad's credit card. I'm also calling your Aunt, she'll be checking up on you Monday evening."

"Mom!" Alexa complained,

"No, Alexa, someone needs to drop by to make sure everything is alright."

"Ugh...fine." Alexa said, somewhat underscoring that she had no sway in the matter.

After a bit more chit chat, she hung up the phone and pondered what to eat for dinner that night. The materials to make a salad were still available, however, she also had half of the pizza she had ordered on Saturday, her second one of the weekend. Better just distroy the evidence... she thought as she pulled the box from the fridge. In addition to food, over the weekend she had started binging on shows online, blowing through multiple seasons of comedy on their TV, and she again plowed through a few hours of sitcoms, pushing off a run for when her parents would be back home.

On Monday morning, Alexa showered and got ready for class. She wondered if she seemed a bit softer than usual, or if she was just bloated from her indulgence over the weekend. Regardless, she was running late, and heard a familiar honk, telling her to just grab a few pop-tarts in leu of a bowl of cerial to join her friend, and ride to class, Chrissy.

When she got to the car, Chrissy looked somewhat dreadful, "Do you have to be late every Monday?" she asked Alexa.

"Sorry!! My Mom isn't here to wake me up," she said defensibly.

"Whatever." Chrissy replied, "you missed an awesome weekend, Chris had a huge party, the cops got called, but it was later in the night, and we were able to run out of their before the po-po got to us. What did you do?"

Alexa felt somewhat embarrassed. She didn't want to tell her friend that instead of partying and living it up in the 'in' crowd, she sat at home and veged out. "I visited my aunt," she lied.

"Doesn't she live in town?" Chrissy asked, her 8 year old hand-me down luxury car now turning out of their neighborhood towards the direction of the high school.

"Yeah...but...my parents were out of town, so they wanted me to stay with her."

"Oh, yeah, that makes sense, I guess," Chrissy said, unconvinced.

After a somewhat boring morning of class, Alexa got to the lunch line, and saw a large group of people waiting for salads. Ugh...I don't want to wait in line for that... she thought to herself, while she saw almost no one under the "Homestyle" line. Alexa decided to try something new. She had never ventured in to that line before, mainly because she never thought she would like anything that greasy in the middle of the day. However, as she got closer, the smell of the food...fried chicken and mashed potatoes with gravy looked too good to pass up. She decided to continue her indulgence, Just until Mom gets back she told herself, and get the chicken and mashed potatoes.

As she sat down at her table with her friends, Chrissy raised an eyebrow, to which Alexa shot an indifferent shrug back, "Just this once," she said to her surprised friend.
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: Alexa indulges while Mom's away

choices: Meanwhile in Wichita before Mom and Dad go home
Tuesday and Wednesday in Coral Gables
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Alexa plowed through her calorie rich lunch, thoroughly enjoying every bite. She blithely zoned out and ignored the critical eye of Chrissy and her figure-obsessive friends. Alexa wasn’t model thin but was comfortable with her size 6 clothes. She enjoyed eating on occasion but in deference to her mom’s concerns only occasionally let her self go – usually as a result of stress.

Right now the press of classwork, absence of her parents and ho-hum social life were generating stress and she didn’t feel like hearing her peer’s chirping, so she simply blocked them out. After she was finished she actually felt like having a dessert, but refrained out of concern for criticism from Chrissy and Co.

At an adjacent table Bobby Wentworth noticed the contrast. He was puzzled by the new appetite of his slender classmate, who appeared ravenous compared to her friends. He knew Alexis casually but had thought of her as being just another weight obsessive coed, which wasn’t his preference.

Bobby wasn’t a feeder or even aware of acronyms like FA but he himself was slightly husky with a good appetite. He knew he usually preferred larger girls than Alexa who could eat like he himself enjoyed doing. Unfortunately most of them tended to be shy and into themselves. Alexa’s intelligence and general sociability were nearer to what he felt comfortable with in those areas. As he observed her packing her lunch away he found himself thinking “if she always enjoyed food like that she could easily be a bit larger. That would be nice.”

This thought stuck with him into the afternoon, where the two shared a class together. By then he’d decided to make a point of talking to Alexa at the end of the period.

“Hey, what’s been with you,” he asked. “I haven’t seen you hanging out much lately.”

“Yes,” sighed Alexis, “my parents are out of town and I’ve been working on studies. I’ll get back into things soon I hope.”

“Well, that’s a drag,” replied Bobby. “A girl in that situation deserves something to perk up her spirits. What about we meet up and let me buy you a sundae after school.”

Alexis normally never indulged in sundaes, but after denying herself dessert at lunch she was in a different frame of mind than normal. The idea instantly appealed to hr. She knew Bobby was more grade and college focused than most and from a respected family. She’d thought him reserved but nice and while the sudden invitation surprised her she accepted. It would be her first date in two months.

Bobby met Alexa and escorted her to his 2012 Chevy Aveo hatchback.

“I know, not as fancy as a Corvette but it gets great gas mileage” he joked half seriously. “Thirty miles a gallon!”

To Alexa it was just fine, she saw nothing to criticize and scooted in. “OK, where are we going?”

“Swensons – where else for ice cream,” grinned Bobby.

By the time they arrived at around 3:30 Alexa was a little nervous and genuinely feeling hungry. As she and Bobby perused the menu he remarked that having a burger to balance out the sundaes might be a good idea.

“So in other words you’d really like one yourself but don’t want to do it without me?” she challenged.

“Well, yeah, sorta – as you can probably tell I have a good appetite,” Bobby answered.

“Well it’s not my normal style, but this week I’m stress eating and not apologizing,” Alexa declared. “Since I don’t normally do this sort of thing which do you recommend?”

He suggested a Greek Paleo sandwich (chicken with a lettuce wrap, black olives and tomatoes served with sweet potato fries) for Alexa and a Miami Burger (angus beef topped with fresh avocado, jalapenos, Monterey jack cheese, lettuce and tomato) for himself.

The sundae selection was generous and took some time to review, but ultimately the duo decided to each have a Coit tower (vanilla and chocolate ice cream layered with cold chocolate fudge, strawberry topping, banana slices and diced almonds topped off with whipped cream, chocolate Jimmies, a wafer and a cherry. Alexa’s mind spun as she considered having such a concoction.

As the waited for their order Bobby channeled the conversation to the school reports Alexis was working on. She found that he was familiar with some of the materials she was dealing with and readily offered constructive sources and ideas she could use. He appreciated her questions, pointing out that the challenge for grades under common core come from showing that students are thinking creatively, not just parroting back what’s in the text book

“I like to include off the beaten track material that makes the teacher have to verify my sources. Every paper I’ve done it with comes back with an A and sometimes a side note,” he confided. “With the internet its easier than it was for my dad - but he did the same thing using the traditional library.”

Their conversation became so engrossing that before either of them realized it over an hour had passed; their burgers and sundaes had both been slowly but totally consumed.

“You know,“ mentioned Bobby, “Coral gables is called the burger capital of Florida on the Internet if you haven’t heard. They even have a contest to see who’s is best. They call it the Burger Beast Burger Braawl. This year’s winner was Jrs Gourmet, which is a place we might check it out some time.”

Alexa paused. Her belly was full, even stuffed, but she was charmed by his offer – and still having mixed feelings of elation and dread over what she’d permitted herself to do. .

“Sure, but let’s make it next week, OK?” she replied. Bobby nodded his assent, smiling to himself. Alexa had shared with him Rachel’s cornucopia and he felt she wasn’t really against it. She’d also had a 1600 calories mid-afternoon meal on top of a 1000+ calorie lunch.

As they got up to leave Bobby offered to let his date think on the school things they’d shared overnight and suggested that they could talk more the next day over lunch. It was a deliberate ploy which Alexa was thankful for. She appreciated Bobby’s help and friendship – and it would be a good way to not having to deal with Chrissy’s shallow thinking without giving offense.

Alexa next headed directly home, not overly surprised to see her Aunt Rachel’s car in the driveway. Her Mom had told her to expect a visit. Alexa came in thru the kitchen door and was surprised to see her aunt fully engrossed in cooking.

“Sorry, Alexa. I was hoping to be further along before you arrived,” Rachel said with a smile. “Your uncle won’t be here for supper until after seven, but if you’re hungry there’s pastries in that box over there – donuts, bear claws, turnovers.”

“Uh, thanks but no thanks,” replied the still full Alexa. “I had a bite after school with a friend. A late supper is just fine ‘cause I can get some studying in. What is all this cooking?”

“We’re having lasagna with vegetables tonight, there’s a casserole for tomorrow and Wednesday cooling on the sink counter. I also made a quiche, which I’m sure you’ll enjoy for breakfast. The pastries are for breakfast or whenever and there’s ice cream in the freezer,” her Aunt reported.

“All that for just three days? You must think I eat like a lumberjack!” exclaimed Alexa.

“We’re sharing the lasagna with you and probably the ice cream,” Aunt Rachel reminded her. “If you have leftovers on the casserole Chris and Cynthia may finish them;
I’m just doing what your mom instructed – making sure there is enough.”

“Well, er, thanks. I guess I’ll see you later,” replied Alexa as she headed for hrr room.

Dinner that night was excellent. Alexa’s appetite had returned enough that she even had seconds plus a small serving of ice cream. The next morning she enjoyed a third of the quiche with a bear claw and a turnover, thinking “this decadence is going to have to stop, but when mom gets back it won’t be here. So why not enjoy it now?”

At school she informed Chrissy in first period that she would be eating with Bobby and reviewing some homework, to which Chrissy retorted, “Oh, him, the porky nerd? Have fun.”

This slam rankled Alexa, who shot back “Bobby is no nerd, which you might have known if you’d ever bothered getting to know him. And as far as I’m concerned he carries his weight just fine.”

With that Alexa walked off, barely hearing Cassie exclaim “to each their own.”

That lunchtime Alexa deliberately loaded her plate with cub try fried steak, beans, macaroni and cheese plus a small salad with ranch dressing, making sure Cassie saw her as she joined Bobby. Later on she readily accepted his offer to get her a piece of apple pie for dessert.
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: That evening Alexa's Aunt comes over

choices: Her parents get back to South Florida
The rest of Madison's semester
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
As it wore to midweek, Madison's Dad was pleased that his flight app had finally let them know that their flight back to Miami would be ready. What orginally was planned as a quick weekend turned into a 6 day trip. He secretly wondered if his wife would have preferred they stay even longer, as after Sunday evening, her indulgence on room service had been notable. Going back to Miami for her would mean a return to diets and a beach life, at least, he assumed. As her looked at his wife finish off a non-diet coke, he wondered if she was bloated, or if a bit of pudge was forming on her stomach. She would have killed herself over that earlier in the week, he thought to himself.

He texted Madison about their evening departure, which allowed them to grab an earlier dinner with their daughter before going to the airport to head home. They went to a burger place that Madison had recommended, and Cynthia did not hold back, on the rationalization that they were still treating themselves on the trip. "Well, I'm happy that you both made up, even if it ended up being longer than you had planned," Madison told her parents between bites in her burger.

"That's okay," her Mom replied, "I think this weekend was good for us. It gave us a lot of peace of mind." her Mom said.

Madison was a bit curious about the phrasing, "about my size?"

Her Mom replied, "About everything, really. Chris, the city, even helped us rethink things about ourselves a bit."

Madison could figure out what her Mom meant, she had never seen her Mom order something as fattening as a burger before. She assumed her Mom had adapted a "when in Rome" type attitude towards it, but she was happy to see that the time spent near Powers' campus had melloed her previously high-strung Mom out slightly.

After some goodbyes, the Krafts went back to the airport, and hopped on their fight. Although he had a good time, no one was happier than Chris on the flight to get out of the city, and back to a warmer climate. Although he loved his daughter, he was ready to be home, and go back to work. However, as the plane was in the air, neither him nor his wife expected any of the changes that greeted their younger daughter back home.
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: Meanwhile in Wichita before Mom and Dad go home

choices: The Krafts reunite with Alexa
Something else
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Madison was thoughtful after being dropped off by Kyle. They’d just seen her parents off at the airport after sharing their final burger meal together. Sshe hadn’t forgotten the private talk she and Kyle had shared the day before with Chris Kraft. He’d treated his wife to a room service break after sleeping in, then sent her off for a day of tourism and shopping while he caught up on work.

He mentioned to Cynthia Kraft in passing that she could take her time because he might share some “quality time” with Madison and Kyle before her slated return “if Madison was free.”

The ploy was disingenuous for a purpose. As soon as Cynthia was off in the hotel’s Escalade he texted Madison asking that she call him. At the end of class she did and he invited her (and Kyle if he could as well) to come by as soon after class as possible “for a private talk.”

Madison contacted Kyle at lunch and they agreed to go directly, not even changing from their school clothes. They arrived before 4:00, Kyle bringing a gift of genuine Amish non-microwave popcorn. Mr. Kraft, who indeed had been attending to business in the interim, greeted them cordially. He could not help but notice Madison’s face and figure in her school slicks and to – they reminded of his sister Rachel in the later years of high school, 70 pounds lighter.

Like the earlier experience with Rachel he could tell Madison’s jowls were rapidly filling out, her cheeks becoming more flesh with a slight dimple. The underpart of her jaw was rounder with the promise of a future double chin. Her stomach was larger than it had appeared in her dinner dress earlier in the week, about to extend out past her bust line, but proportional to her expanded hips and thigh’s. Her upper arms were noticeably round as well, complimenting her larger breasts.

“”Yes,” thought Chris to himself, Madison and Rachel share the same genes. It’s a good thing she’s comfortable with her size because she’s likely to get bigger.”

Mr. Kraft offered the two college students glasses with ice and a 2 liter bottle of soda for refreshments, then gotten right to the point.

“Madi,” he had told her, “I think you know this trip was your mom’s idea more than mine – although its been a pleasure to meet you, Kyle. Your mom was really concerned after your email and I think you need to know why.”

“I’d suspected as much.” Madison answered. “She’s been super weight conscious all her life – but after being here at Powers I’ve learned there is another road.”

“Which I fully grasp,” relied her Dad. “I’m a bit husky myself and you know how the genes run in my side of the family. But I love your mom and have been understanding of her feelings for the sake of our greater relationship. Frankly it’s not a big issue for me. But I think you deserve to know the full story of why she has been this way – and how your decision has apparently gotten her to begin relaxing a bit. No promises, but I’m hopeful.”

“What do you mean,” Madison had replied.

“Simply stated, she was bullied over her weight at one time and hasn’t wanted you or Alexa to go thru what she remembers as having happened to her. She was teased and made fun of in grade and middle school before she lost a fair amount of weight – then saw others shamed and held back from being accepted by the in-crowd in high school,” Mr. Kraft related. “By the time she reached college she had bought in to the idea that, for women at east, figure counts before anything. If I want to eat well on the road and carry forty extra pounds its my business, but she wouldn’t participate because no matter what I said she just felt I was being a gentlemen. It’s taken being stranded from a blizzard to get her to enjoy what most people do regularly – just go out to restaurants.,”

“But now she’s enjoying it?” Kyle questioned.

“Seems so – although she hasn’t promised it will continue. But that’s for us to work through, What you need to know that she realizes that you are past the age which caused her so much pain with no defense. She knows, and I know, that you’re happy and can handle your own life, and that’s what counts. Just don’t try to reconcile your view with where she is – that’s something she needs to work out herself, and it may or may not happen. OK?” her father had requested.

“Done,” Madison had responded with a smile. “But now a question for you: was my coming to Powers a set-up? This college seems to be actually geared towards helping support the size acceptance movement like Gallaudet does for the deaf, Rutgers for women or Tuskegee for blacks.”

Her dad grimaced. “I know that now, having checked things out more than I did initially. I’m sure your Aunt probably knew. But, no, I didn’t deliberately plan it to work that way. She gave me, and I confirmed the average salary of their graduates and their track record with corporate head hunters. When Rachel said she could arrange funding I and your mom went along.

“Yes, I called her and she admitted she arranged thanks,“ acknowledged Madison. But what do you mean by your having learned more by further checking?”

“Powers started out as an agricultural school back in the land grant era with the Morrill Act of 1862. That’s for you Kyle, because its your field. But Powers built on that to the point that they’re also strong in business, economics and liberal arts. That’s because during the depression they almost went under; instead a family with some money paid the bills. After WW2 this same family gave them a fairly large endowment –that’s where the newer buildings came from.“ Mr. Kraft informed them. “Members of this same family today are active in the size acceptance movement.”

“Which is probably where UMILA comes in,” commented Madison.

“UMILA?” her father asked.

“The alumni group that faclitates graduates careers and finances grants for probably a quarter of the student body,” answered his daughter. “I asked Aunt Rachel about that because she’s been one of their field birddogs, but she said I wasn’t a candidate.

“No, I never heard about that, “ Chris acknowledged. “But that explains a lot of what your Mom and I observed in the dining hall. The relative size of the student body as compared to other campuses is definitely larger than average.”

“It doesn’t sound as though you disapprove, though,” noted Kyle.

“Honestly, no. I’m not a committed chubby chaser like a small percentage of the country, but if it’s a choice I would lean more that way than towards these ultra-lean skeletons who call themselves models,” remarked Chris.

“So if Mom grew to the size of Aunt Rachel or your mom you wouldn’t mind?” Madison asked.

“As long as she was healthy and happy, not at all,” her dad acknowledged. “That’s just not an item on my bucket list. But no, it wouldn’t be an issue,”

“I think that’s true of most men. Mr. Kraft, errr I’m sorry, Chris,” said Kyle. “Madison will tell you I’ve encouraged her to match her muscle mass to her weight to stay healthy. That’s how the larger Amish girls handle it, and they are frequently both heavier and healthy and happy. I’ve been the outside Englischer, but I think they set a great example.”

At that point Mr. Kraft got a text from Cynthia saying she was on her way back to the hotel. The trio quickly picked out another fine restaurant for the evening. Mrs. Kraft had purchased several new items of clothing, including a dinner dress that was noticeably looser than the one from earlier in the week. Madison and Kyle noticed that she thoroughly enjoyed her meal –including a rich dessert.
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: Madison muses as her parents head home

choices: Madison gets a visitor
Madison and Alexa talk
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Alexa was preparing her last breakfast before her parent’s return – corn beef and hash with eggs and the last bear claw. The last of the donuts and most of the ice cream had disappeared the evening before along with the rest of Aunt Rachel’s casserole.

“It’s been nice,” she thought with a feeling of regret. “But no way can I keep going like this with Mom back. Probably a good thing because I could actually blow up like Madison.”

Then she realized something. She was feeling sad, first about criticizing her sister and, deep inside, about not having the courage to follow her sister’s example.

She pondered the conflict. “So why doesn’t gaining a few pounds bother me? Is it because I know that I’m going to get huge? Is it because of Bobby?”

Alexa didn’t have time to sort it out. There was barely enough time to clean up and dispose of the evidence. But she knew that for nearly a week she’d been consuming nearly twice her usual caloric intake. Before leaving she decided to get on a scale ad see the damage. To her surprise the digital number was exactly the same as it had been two months before – 132.

“Hmm” thought Alexa “I must have a faster metabolism than I thought. All that food and no change? Well, good to know.”

Little did she realize the difference between metabolism and initial weight gain. The former burns calories, the latter is a process that begins with the formation of fresh new balloon like special cells; the weight comes from subsequently bring filled. For someone with few or no available cells it takes time for there to be actual weight gain. New fat cells were in fact being created in her body but hadn’t yet been filled and expanded. One week of indulgence wasn’t going to show immediately.

Alexa went off to school where at lunch Wednesday she had fried chicken and mashed potatoes with Bobby, letting him very obviously buy her cake for dessert just to spite her queen bee clique friends, who had been glaring disapproval of her appetite and association with Bobby all week. They dug in on her report to be turned in the next day and confirmed their plans for Saturday night.

In class she got a text from Madison. “enroute to airport – mom dad have a question about restaurants. Italian or Mexican preferred?”

The message startled Alexa. She couldn’t remember ever going to a restaurant with both parents – her mom refused to step into them. Confused, she texted back “Italian”

“Fine. Mid evening arrival – be at airport after 8:00.” was the cryptic reply.

Class began and Alexa focused on the work at hand. At the end of the school day she was feeling stressed. She felt like asking Bobby for a sundae but instead went home to an empty larder.

“Fine,” she thought. “If we’re going out I’ll at least be able to justify my appetite. And there is a pot pie from Aunt Rachel still left.”

The pot pie was supplemented by the last of the ice cream and a cheese sandwich by 6:00, Alexa correctly rationalizing she’d not be eating until ten. Promptly at 8:30 her parents arrived and her dad announced that they were going to Bugatti’s.

“Great,” replied Alexa, “but what’s the occasion?”

“Well, the storm forced your mom and I to share fine dining with Madison. It just seemed right to extend the same honor to you,” Chris Kraft replied.

It sounded good, but Alexa was dubious about this being he full story, and looked at her mom.

“I know what you’re probably thinking” Cynthia said. “But I knew that there wasn’t much to cook at home and I’ve loosened up after seeing everything in Wichita. Let’s see what adventure your dad has in store.”

Thus assured Alexa went out, aware that her belly felt empty.

After entering the fine Italian restaurant and being seated Alexa opened the menu and was dumbfounded. She had no experience with the myriad of Italian words confronting her. “Italian” food to her meant pizza, spaghetti and maybe spumoni ice cream.

“Dad,” she exclaimed, “you’re going to have to help me interpret this – I have no idea what I’m doing.”

“Sorry,” he replied, fully aware that although he regularly ate out on the rood his wife’s weight concerns had preluded his giving his daughters a proper culinary education. Silently he promised to begin correcting this going forward.

“I understand,” he replied. “Let’s start with chilled potato soup. It’s called Vichyssoise:.”

“I thought Vichy was French,” commented Alexa.

“Very perceptive,” noted Mr. Kraft. “Technically you’re right –and although it’s on the menu here Wikipedia will confirm it was put together by a French chef in a New York hotel around WW1. But it is popular among Italians. Are you willing to try it?”

“Sure, why not?” responded Alexa.

“Now, here is another item to whet your palate – Ravioli Bombay,” her Dad noted.

“I know Bombay is in India – what does that have to do with ravioli?” queried Alexa.

“It’s ravioli stuffed with curried chicken – curry is of course typical of food in India. This chicken has been drenched in a spicy curry sauce that has, the menu notes, diced apples, raisins, roasted almonds, and whipped cream,” her father replied.

“That’s different alight. OK, I’ll try it,” replied Alexa.

“I think I’ll stick with what I can understand - Penne al Salmone. That’s cylinder shaped pasta with smoked salmon cream sauce, right?” interjected Cynthia,

“Yes, and I’m going to go with a tasty dish with a real jaw-breaking name - Scaloppini di Pollo alla Piemontese: that translates as thinly sliced chicken breasts that have been soaked in a light Gorgonzola cream sauce. Its served with fettuccine noodles drenched in a sauce with mushrooms and bell peppers.”

Cynthia shook her head. Alexa obviously was enjoying herself – every bit on her plate was being consumed plus several rolls. She knew her husband dined out a lot but didn’t realize he was such a food hobbyist. The trio enjoyed their meal and let Alexa know of their time in Wichita, with Alexa noting her mom’s frequent comments about food. What, she wondered, was happening?

Finally dinner was finished and Chris asked if everyone was ready for dessert. Cynthia reminded him that they hadn’t eaten since breakfast, so she had a Torta di Mele (home made apple tart).On her dad’s suggestion Alexa went with Crostata di Ricotta (Ricotta cheese cake with raspberry sauce). Chris himself had a two-chocolate mousse with vanilla and raspberry sauce

When they got home it was after midnight. A perplexed but comfortably stuffed Alexa thanked her parents for a great evening and retired to her room. There she texted Madison “what have you done to our mom? Call me!” She didn’t expect an immediate answer, but was herself full after four meals that day.
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.title: The Krafts reunite with Alexa

choices: Madison talks with Kyle about Emily
Madison talks with Alexa abut their mom and Bobby
1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Emily Wells bit her lower lip a bit nervously, then approached Madison. “If you have some time I wonder if I could talk with you?”

Madison smiled. She didn’t know Emily well but had noticed her in classes they shred together. Like many Powers students she had gained the Freshman 15 x 2 by this stage – Madison noted that she could use a Torrid wardrobe upgrade.

“Sure – what about this evening, say around seven?” Madison suggested.

Emily swallowed nervously, “Thanks, I’ll try to be there on time.”

Madison went about her routine for the rest of the day, alerting Cassie that after supper she was expecting a visit from Emily. Cassie promised to retire to her own room unless called upon. Madison also told Kyle she’d be tied up. As for Alexa she’d asked her to call after their parents were in bed.

Emily showed up precisely on time. Madison had a two liter bottle of soda and a large bowl of chips on the coffee table in front of the living room divan. The two Powers students settled in comfortably.

“Madison,” Emily began, “this may sound cray but I want to let you know that you’re an example and inspiration to me; I want to be like you.”

“What do you mean?” queried a surprised Madison.

“Like me you’re bigger than when we came to Powers but you’ve handled it so much more positively than I am. You have clothes that are terrific – which tells me I can do the same thing if I can just adjust my head to what’s happening to me.”

“Can you explain a little more?” Madison inquired.

“When I came to Powers I only had a few extra pounds after being up and down all my life. It was a counselor at school who knew I’d been harassed about my being a bit larger that advised me. She said that there was a special way of funding my coming here and that I wouldn’t get the grief over my belly that I might other places. So I got to come here on a special grant. What she didn’t tell me was that, hassle free from others or not, I’d gain thirty more pounds!” Emily poured out. “How do you adapt so positively to a gain like that? Please, let me know.”

Madison grappled with how to respond. “I can tell you what happened with me. But everyone’s story is unique. Can you share yours?”

“Frankly I wasn’t paying attention at first. Like I guess everyone I was focused on being in college and getting good grades. And like everyone here I really enjoyed the buffets in the student center. And I became friends with Gary Hendricks, who like a lot of guys here seems alright with fat girls. But there was something else as well.

“I did like my roommate suggested and began drinking hot chocolate when I studied. She said hot chocolate is actually found to increase blood flow to the brain and improve memory. I checked on the Internet and found that is true – studies even indicate that long-term use may be a possible preventative measure against diseases like dementia.

“Anyway, when I needed to study really hard, I had a couple cups of hot chocolate, which is only like what, 300 calories? It allowed me to focus and concentrate much better as well as retain information. But just chocolate got boring, so I also started grazing on food like pretzels, chips and the like. So it was like 700 calories extra three times a week, but at the time I wasn’t counting.”

Madison nodded. “So you’re naturally been picking up a few pounds?”

“Yes,” Emily continued. “Although at first I really didn’t notice it. But then I began to notice that my top wouldn’t tuck into my shirts – instead my belly was bulging over the waistband and you could see a roll when I sat down. But it didn’t seem like all that much so I just bought some larger clothes. But that only helped for a while. What used to be a belly pooch is now a muffin top with love handles and my thighs are starting to resemble oak tree trunks. Yet Gary says I’m beautiful and just need to dress for my size – like you.”

“Well, I get my clothes at Torrid – ever been there? It’s pricy at times but Gary is right. They can make even those with figures over 300 look stunning,” Madison answered.

“You’re no 300 pounds,” Emily answered.

“No, but close to 200. But those are just scale numbers anyway,” Madison replied dismissively. “It seems to me you came here on one of the UMILA grants but now are fighting with your mental self-image instead of taunts from classmates.”

“Yes, that and my eating habits. I know I’m going to only get bigger unless I cut out the snacking, lay off the Power’s breakfast buffet and the lunchtime dessert cart – but they make it so temping here,” Emily fussed.

“Yes, tell me about it,” agreed Madison. “I didn’t get my figure from the salad bar, believe me! Eventually you’ll reach a set point where consumption and basal metabolism match. Exercise helps as well, but where that point is for you I can’t tell. I know I’m comfortable now in my body and can do what I want to. That’s the important thing.”

“At least my belly and butt balance out and my boobs have grown two sizes,” Emily went on, not really getting Madison’s point. “Gary says I’m pretty and should just embrace it and flaunt it. Guys back home never talk like that. Gain five pounds and they’re all over your case.”

“The guys back home that like larger girls are generally in the closet – the few with balls enough to be open come here and enjoy the show, or so I’m learning,” answered Madison.

“Swell, I guess, because my belly has really grown. It just pours over my waistband when I sit down and I’m starting to get another roll near the bottom of my ribcage. I think I’m about to get a double chin. Doesn’t that make me officially fat rather than just thick or chubby?” Emily continued to ramble.

“It’s not for me to hang labels and call people names. Some in my dorm claim that fat can stand for ‘fantastic, adorable and terrific,’” answered Madison, “but this is your mind playing games with you. You need to resolve it with your mirror and your guy, not someone like me. I can help you with clothing but you have to make the mental adjustment.’

“It’s strange when your belly starts to rest on your thighs, wouldn’t you agree?” asked Emily.

“I noticed that when it happened to me, yes,” agreed Madison. “But where is it supposed to go? It’s not a big deal to me. What I’ve begun to notice lately is an accumulation on my back up near the shoulder blades. I needed to get another bra and my belly hangs down and jiggles a bit despite all my exercise. My roommate is well over 200 and her’s veritably shakes when she walks without any support. Kyle and I are trying to make sure I get enough exercise with the gym and cycling that I have the muscle tissue a larger person needs to handle their weight.”
“What do you mean?” asked Emily.

“Gaining just fat tissue results in carrying around dead weight. That becomes an invitation to store toxins in our tissues. Exercise removes the toxins and makes sure there are enough muscles and blood circulation near the fat cells for a person to retain both strength, energy and health.” answered Madison. “Can you press your body weight?”

“Umm, I’ve no idea,” replied Emily. “I never go to the gym.”

“Might be advisable – you’ll not lose anything but you’ll feel better after you get used to it. The first few weeks won’t be easy if you’re not in shape though. You might ask Gary about taking up cycling as well.” counseled Madison. “Now I can give you the name of a wardrobe consultant at Torrid if you want. She’s anything but a twig so she is one of us.”

“Umm – ok,” said Emily as she finished off the last of the chips which both she and Madison had been sharing. “’l’ll think about the gym.”

After Emily left Madison sighed. She thought she needed to talk with Kyle – but knew she’d promised Alexa as well.

Madison figured that family came first, although she made a note to talk to Kyle. She pulled up Alexa's cell number and gave it a ring.

"Hey, Madison" her sister answered, somewhat muted.

"I see you're trying not to wake Mom and Dad?" Madison asked her sister. She knew that Alexa was probably calling from her room. Although far away from their parents' room in the sprawling house, she new that Alexa wanted to have this conversation in private, away from her Mom.

"Yeah," Alexa replied, "I don't want to wake them."

"Makes sense."

"Anyway, what's up with Mom? She is absolutely ravenous right now, and all she said was she 'loosened up." Alexa responded.

"Wow, knowing Mom, I kind of assumed she would just go back to her normal self after the week," said with slight surprised. "I don't really fully know what happened. When they got up she seemed flustered from the storm, Dad was fine, but she seemed off for a few days. I had prepared for the worst, since I'm, umm, obviously bigger now, but Mom never said anything. After she met Kyle, she seemed to be a bit more at ease. I think her and Dad were even indulging on room service when Kyle and I were not going to dinner with them."

"Really??" Alexa asked, surprised, given that their Mom had never been a snacker.

"Yeah, I don't know. Did you go out to eat again?"

"We got Italian, and after a huge meal, Mom was the one who suggested we get dessert."

"Wow. Yeah, maybe the Mom of old is gone...or at least in a food comma." After saying that, Madison heard a slight chuckle out of Alexa.

Alexa changed gears on the conversation, "I guess I'm happy Mom is making this change, but, I don't know. Part of me was hoping that Mom would be the one to instill my willpower again."

"What do you mean?" Madison asked, knowing exactly what her sister meant.

"I don't know...I've just been enjoying myself this weekend, and I assumed Mom would me back on a salad run when she got home."

Madison, feeling it was her job to provide a bit of guidance to her sister, responded, "I don't know if depriving yourself can be considered will power, Alexa. Plus, you're younger than me, I don't think you'll put on a ton of weight, and even if you did, it's not the end of the world."

Alexa seemed somewhat content with that answer, so Madison left that point alone and moved on, "Anything else new with you, while we're talking?"

"Well...there is one thing," Alexa replied, "I think I'm kind of interested in a guy."

"Oh, is this why you're stressed out about food, Alexa? Because anyone who treats you like this now---"

Alexa quickly cut her sister off "---No! it's actually the opposite! I think he may actually like it. His name is Bobby. He's not really like the usual guys I date, he seems fine with more food, he's actually a bit on the larger side himself."

"Ah," Madison said, surprised her formerly vain sister would go for someone like that, "what do you friends think?"

"They're not taking it too well. Chrissy keeps shooting daggers at me."

"Well, listen, I know it's tough now, but maybe this is a blessing in disguise," Madison said, thinking of her own experiences. "Anyone who only wants to be your friend when you're exactly like they want you to, isn't a very good friend." Madison also had slightly sneaky motives in so freely handing out that advice. She had never been a fan of Chrissy, who always had come off a bit entitled and bratty. Alexa's life was fine without that presence in it, her sister thought.

They talked for a bit longer about other more chit-chatty stuff, but as it reached later in the night, the call ended, and Madison went back to her desk to study. Sitting down, she noticed her new rolls, which seemed larger after the weekend. Hmm...I hope that was good advice

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
After talking with Alexa into Thursday morning around 1:00 am Madison nearly skipped breakfast in order to make it to her fist class. All she had was a quick energy bar and a large cup of coffee. In Coral Gables things were in a similar state, Mrs. Kraft apologized to her daughter, “we seem to be out of everything – perhaps I should just give you a few dollars for breakfast?"

“Ummm, sure mom,” replied Alexa. She realized she’d used the last of the eggs he day before and there was no cereal or bread. She knew she could grab a double cheeseburger at Wendy’s by 7:30 and still make it school since Wendy’s doesn’t have a separate breakfast menu. But it was unheard of for her mom to suggest such a thing.

Her mom seemed aware of Alexa's puzzlement, but her next statement surprised her.

“I know it’s unusual – but it’s only this time. By tomorrow we’re going to have a different breakfast regimen here, so go ahead and splurge on fast food tis once. OK?”

“Not a problem, Mom. A burger in the morning isn’t my usual thing, but I get it,” replied Alexa, thinking of the omelets, quiche, bear claws and corn beef hash menus of the prior week. . “What kind of changes are you thinking of?”

“After Wichita I’m thinking we might have a little variety instead of just raisin bran and fruit. Maybe some French toast or a breakfast burrito. What do you think of that?” Cynthia asked.

“Mom,” exclaimed Alexa, “you’re beginning to sound like Aunt Rachel! Do you know that?”


“Well, not quite. She's into quantity as well as variety, but I think maybe I’ve been overly concerned in some areas. What is your feeling?” her mom pressed.
“Honestly? I think I’d love it – but if I begin adding a few pounds please don’t lecture me, OK” Alexa responded.

Her mom sighed, “Sweetheart, we may be adding few together. I won’t’ criticize you if yu don’t get on my case, agreed? It’s not going to be a great deal, but after this trip I’m going to try changing.”

Alexa left the house with a $10 bill for breakfast, which she knew she’d only use in part. She wondered if she should have told her mom about Bobby and their upcoming
date at Jrs Gourmet Burgers, but decided it was best not to. She and Bobby did, however enjoy another good sized lunch, during which he commented that after their planned date at Jrs he had something else in mind for another night if she was game.

“What’s that?” she asked.

“Let me cook a meal for you at my place. My family will be there, so it’s safe, but I think you’d enjoy it. I usually do a dinner or so a month and would love for you to be a part.,” Bobby said.

“So cooking as well as dining is another of your hobbies. Are you planning to become a chef,” she remarked.

“No, our family businesses ae my future, but cooking is something I got into from being a bit of a latchkey kid and it grew into an interest,” Bobby sad. “A lot of this belly came from having bath after school snacks pus a meal later.”

“Well, it’s not that big a belly and I think I’d enjoy seeing you whip something together,” answered Alexa. “I’d do more cooking but my mom tended to discourage it. Never have quire understood why.

”Probably afraid I’d develop a preference for high calorie desserts, she thought to herself.
Meanwhile, back at Powers, Madison was talking with Kyle about her conversations with Emily and Alexa.

“I know I told dad I wasn’t part of UMILA,” she said.“ But the way I’ve talked with Emily and now Alexa plus what I’m doing with Torrid I think I’ve crossed over to their world view. My body’s not getting any smaller and I frankly don’t care.”

Kyle smiled. “You’re beautiful, intelligent and now I can add free-thinking to the list. Congratulations. It sounds like you’ve taught your mom some things as well.”

“Yes,” acknowledged Madison. “And dad seems happy about that. So do you think we should ask Gary and Emily to join us on a double date with something active - maybe bowling?”

“Now that’s a suggestion from the past if ever I heard ne,” Kyle replied. “But why not? Since I don’t know Gary why don’t you set it up?”

“Done,” replied Madison. “I’ll see about Saturday night if we can.”

Later that day she texted Kyle – 6:30 @ Westacres Bowl – their sports bar serves pizza”

That evening, in Coral Gables, Alexa arrived home to find a meatloaf cooling on the kitchen counter, baked potatoes in the oven and vegetables boiling on the stove.
“Sorry, no desert tonight. Full meal cooking is harder than I thought it would be,” her mom remarked. “Do you think perhaps we could work on this new menu business together?”

“You mean as in me cooking,” Alexa responded.

“I’m thinking it might be a good idea, yes,” her mom replied.

“Hummm.” Alexa responded thinking quickly. “Would it be alright if I enlisted the help of a friend from school? He fancies himself an amateur chef and already has invited me to his place for dinner some time with his family.”

“What!” her mom replied in surprise, “You’re going with a boy? When did this start?”

“We’re not going steady, just a friend that I’ve studies and shred lunch with a few times,” she relied. “We have our first formal dare-date Saturday night. I haven’t had chance to tell you and dad, but I’ll be home before 10:00.”

“What type of person is he,” he mom probed. “This is all very sudden.”

“He’s a great student, clean living and comes rom a good family – trust me. You might not think of him as a stud, but he’s very kind and intelligent,” she answered. “If I invite him to help with the food here you can get to know him, then let me know if he’s as good a cook as he claims. So, is it a go?”

“Well, I don’t know,” her mom hesitated. “I’ll need to as your father - what did you say his name was?”

Alsea rolled her eyes, “Bobby, Bobby Wentworth. You ask Dad to check him out. His family supposedly has money but they don’t flaunt it. Now, can I go to my room?”

“Yes I suppose so,“ her mom said softly.

“Thanks,” replied Alexa in a bit of a huff as she left.

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
After their large meal of meatloaf, Cynthia and Chris lingered in the kitchen while they cleaned up. Half joking, Cynthia asked Chris, "why did we even get this gourmet kitchen if we never intended to use it all these years?"

"Who knows," Chris laughed, "home equity?"

"I'm thinking about getting into cooking more," Cynthia responded, "Alexa seemed to be open to doing it together, and it seems like a good way for us to get closer."

Chris felt this was a good thing. His wife had always been somewhat distant; loving, but at the same time, somewhat detached, as if her daughters knew that their mother would judge them if things fell out of line-- if they failed to live up to expectations. Over the years, he had tried to curb this, but, until Madison had gone to powers, it seemed to have been futile.

"That seems like a great idea," Chris responded.

"Are you going to mind if I leave my diet of kale?" Cynthia half jokingly said.

"Aww, afraid you'll get a little fat? Honestly, Cynthia, you know I've never cared about that. I just want all of us to be happy. Look at Madison, she seems happier now than she ever was in high school. She's excelling in class, and she's met someone great."

Cynthia, had to admit, even with Madison's growing body, she had seemed to gracefully go from someone who was clearly conventionally attractive to a cute girl that was on the plump side. Perhaps it was good genes, or perhaps it was the confidence that her daughter had. Regardless, hadn't she shown that gaining a bit wasn't the worst thing in the world, especially if it reduced some excess vanity?

The following day at the store, Cynthia loaded up her cart with culinary items she had always wanted to make, but stayed away from for dietary reasons. Ribs, huge steak, and a variety of ingredients for new deserts. Cynthia figured that she could effortlessly pursue this budding hobby, while still making it to the gym once in a while. Plus, it's Miami, not Kansas, how many pounds could she really put on?

Meanwhile, at school, Alex forwent her typical salad and went for a burger. All her life she had been following Madison's lead and sticking to mainly greens. Now that her Mom had opened this door to a whole new line of food, she felt empowered to eat whatever she wished. In the back of her mind, Madison had already drew all the attention away from her. Even at her most shallow, she doubted that a few pounds would go noticed by anyone when her sister had so drastically changed her appearance. She didn't let any of her friends at school know of this paradigm shift, well, besides Bobby, of course, but Alexa figured that anyone who would react negatively wasn't worth her time anyway. As she worked on fries next to her friends at the lunch table, Alexa felt truly content -- and increasingly full.

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
After the talk with her husband, Mrs. Kraft and Alexa began their journey into discovering the kitchen. They went on a cooking and baking rampage, making everything from Italian food to the most decadent and rich desserts. They had a lot of misses towards the beginning, considering neither of them knew what they were doing at first. But they were improving with each dish and now finding some that are becoming their staples.

Today was Saturday, which meant it was a kitchen marathon day. Saturdays were now entirely for cooking, with the Kraft women making breakfast, lunch, and dinner from scratch, something that they can't do when everyone's busy during the week. So at 7:30 AM, two alarms went off and the Kraft women began their day.

Alexa sloppily reached out a hand to turn off her alarm and then sat up in her bed. She stretched her arms above her head and looked down when she felt something funny. Her shirt had come up some when she stretched, but when she brought her arms back down her shirt stayed up, like it was caught on something. And when she looked down, it definitely was stuck. She tried to tug it down but it wouldn't completely go down, which struck Alexa as funny. She knew that she had been eating a lot more lately while cooking with her mom and on her dates with Bobby, but she hadn't realized that it had been enough to impact her body this quickly. She stood up and went over to her mirror to survey the damage, and she was a bit shocked to see exactly how much damage there was. The reason her shirt wasn't going down was because she now had a belly. Not a layer of pudge like she'd had coming before, the onslaught of food had given her a proper belly now, beginning to hang over the waistband of her pajama pants, which were starting to get tight around her thighs. Her thighs were getting bigger too, the gap that had been pretty sizable before was almost gone. The rest of her body was fairly untouched, maybe slightly thicker arms and a less angular face, but if you only saw her chest up you'd never know that she had put on any weight.

Alexa wasn't sure how she felt about this new version of her as she stood and played with her new poundage a little. While she liked the new curves she had gotten with her small gain when her parents went out of town, the fact that the weight wasn't settling in the most visually pleasing way was making Alexa a bit uncomfortable. She decided it was time to hop on the scale and see how much damage she had done to her body, and the number that came up was not one she was expecting. When she last had checked she was almost at 125 pounds, but the number that flashed up at her today was definitely not that.

148. She had managed to put on over 23 pounds in less than a month. That number left her a bit shell-shocked, but it wasn't also the most unexpected one either. "I mean, it's not like I've been the gold standard of health the past couple months, this was bound to happen at some point," she told her reflection in the bathroom mirror. She sighed and went back to her room to get dressed for the day, choosing a pair of jeans and a t-shirt. She started with the jeans, attempting to pull them up over her now thick legs and middle. She was able to (barely) get them on her legs but then couldn't get them buttoned. She even had to suck in her stomach to get the two flaps to meet, but the button simply wouldn't fit. She sat down on her bed with the jeans still stuck on and tight around her waist, her belly filling every inch of the jeans. Even having seen the scale and her gain, she figured she would still have been able to fit into her clothes! But alas, the jeans were simply not meant to be, so she opted for a pair of sweatpants instead. She pulled the t-shirt over her head only to discover that much like her pajama shirt, it didn't completely cover her stomach either, and it was one of her largest shirts. So she simply gave up and left it on to go help her mom with breakfast.

"Morning, sweetie! I thought we'd give French toast another go today," her mom said cheerfully to her daughter. Mrs. Kraft had already begun cooking before Alexa had come down, today with some help from her dad, and it was apparent that their cooking endeavors hadn't just left their mark on Alexa. The apron pulled tied tightly around Mrs. Kraft's waist left an indent in her back from the back fat and muffin top the eldest Kraft woman had been developing over the past few weeks. However, unlike Alexa, most of her weight settled in an hourglass instead of an apple shape, meaning her clothes were straining her chest and hips more than ever before, giving her more of the middle aged mother look she had managed to avoid for so long, even rounding her face out some. And her dad wasn't exempt from the effects either. While he may not have sampled as much during the process of making the food, he certainly ate his fair share when it was presented to him, and considering how calorie laden it was it's no wonder he had developed the body of a middle aged man who had definitely overindulged. His face looked strikingly different from the slender one he once had, his cheeks always looking like there's something in them and a double chin that was now always attached to his face that seemed to be growing more steadily every day. His whole upper body quite frankly looked like someone had inflated it, with his stomach being perfectly rounded out and firm at all times, like an oversized beer gut framed with small moobs that showed through the t shirt he was currently wearing (that as another note, barely covered his belly button). He was standing at the stove to monitor the pan, but he kept having to readjust the knob on the stove since his gut kept pushing it to a different setting.

"Glad you're here, Alexa! Can you monitor the stove for me? I think I keep messing with the dial, but I don't mean to." Alexa chuckled.

"Sure I will, but do you think it maybe had to do with the basketball-sized stomach you have now?"

"Alexa, don't talk to your father that way!" Mrs. Kraft chided. "Plus, it's not like you have any room to talk young lady, your shirt isn't covering your stomach either."

"Yeah, mom, I know. Speaking of that, instead of cooking lunch today can we go to the mall? I think I need some new clothes, with exhibit A being the reason why," she asked as she gestured down to her exposed midsection.

"Sure, honey, we can go. In fact, I think we all probably should because as great as all of the cooking is, the 25 pounds it's added to my already 10 pound gain from earlier in the year has not been forgiving to my clothes," her dad said sheepishly. Mrs. Kraft rolled her eyes as she continued to chop the fruit for the homemade mixed berry sauce she was making to go with the French toast.

"By all means go buy new clothes, but if you two would just do like me and exercise once in a while you may not be in the situation you are," she retorted. But she was really in denial of her gain, having also checked the scale this morning and seen that 20 additional pounds had settled on her body despite her best efforts to keep her gain minimal, although she could still tout it as being less than her children and husband.

A few minutes later, the family sat down to enjoy their breakfast when suddenly there was a loud POP! Alexa checked to make sure it wasn't her only to hear a cry from her mom.

"That can't be! These are my favorite jeans!" Mrs. Kraft cried. Everyone saw what the problem was: she had popped the button on her favorite jeans clean off, with her stomach now surging forward to fill the gap. The table suddenly got very quiet, no one sure what to say.

"So what time should we leave for the mall?" Mr. Kraft asked, with everyone finally agreeing that they all needed a wardrobe upgrade.

1122312122211121112211111111211111111211.content:
Madison was waiting a baggage claim for her suitcase, beginning to get impatient for a couple reasons. A) her bag still wasn't there despite waiting for nearly 20 minutes and B) her family was nowhere to be found, and they promised her they would pick her up! So here she was, standing and waiting.

Finally after half an hour of waiting one of the two things she was waiting on came, and it was safe to say it was larger than she remembered.

"Madison!" she heard her dad call out from behind. She turned around expecting to see the same svelte family she had seen a couple months before in Kansas but the three people standing in front of her were far from that. Gone were the fit, skinny Krafts of the past. As they came closer to the baggage claim, Madison could see even more clearly how the Powers mindset had impacted them once they returned to Miami.

In the front was her mom. The woman who once had been borderline fatphobic now carried around a lot more heft. Her chest was nearly double the size it used to be, probably close to a DD. Her hips jutted out further than ever before, with thick love handles and a muffin top spilling over the waistband of her jeans. Her stomach, while not her most prominent feature, was solidly in chubby territory, pushing out from her body but not as far as her breasts. She has to have put on at least 50 pounds, Madison thought, still shocked by the sight.

Then was her dad. While he had never been particularly thin, he always had at least appeared in shape. Now it looked as if he had a small beach ball where his stomach should be, it was so round and perky that it practically floated out from his body is stuck out so far. Gone was his neck, now surrounded by an incredibly thick double chin and round red cheeks. His legs were thicker, needing something to help balance the large ball of a belly he carried. And he's probably put on just as much as mom, Madison thought. But the real kicker was Alexa.

Her younger sister resembled Madison now more than ever. Much like Madison, her weight was concentrated in her stomach and legs. Her weight had settled in more of a flabby way around her waist than the rest of her family, meaning there was no way to disguise her added poundage. There wasn't really shape it it, it just kinda hung off her, making her look bigger than she actually is. Her legs had taken the brunt of her weight, leaving her with a slight waddle when she walked since her thighs had become tree trunks. Her face was slightly rounder, with the beginnings of a double chin appearing, and her chest had grown a little bit but was still small in comparison to the rest of her body. My god, she's blown up, thought Madison, standing and pretending to be prepared to embrace her now larger family as they came up to her for hugs.

"Hi, everyone," said Madison as she began awkwardly hugging her family. "I'm still waiting for my luggage and then we can go."

"Honey, we'll wait here for it. Alexa, you and your sister go get the car and bring it here so once the suitcase is here we can just pull away and go finish getting dinner ready at home," said Mrs. Kraft.

"Sounds good!" said Alexa and she and Madison walked away.

"So what happened to all of you?" Madison asked Alexa. Alexa shrugged.

"I don't know, after mom and dad visited you they decided to have us learn to cook a bunch of stuff and... well... here were are," she huffed. They reached the elevator for the parking lot and stepped inside.

"But all of you have put on a ton of weight!" Madison exclaimed.

"65 pounds to be exact, I'm now at 190 pounds," she told Madison. "Mom's been in denial a bit but I think she's around 175. Dad, I mean, he's easily put on 60 pounds too, I think he's about 230 now. And what about you, when was the last time you saw your feet?" Madison looked down and realized that her feet had long been obstructed by her stomach, a fact that she still found weird, but now even seeing anything beyond her bulbous belly was becoming a feat.

"I passed that point around the time mom and dad came to visit, I think I'm now around 235. But I haven't checked in a while, I was afraid of what I'd have to tell mom... not like that's a problem anymore."

"Yeah, we don't care about weight anymore around here," Alexis told Madison as they stepped off the elevator and began the walk to their car.
