12411.content:
Still “wearing” the remnants of the very expensive dress, Madison wailed madly as she shuffled down the main stairway, into the dining room, and over to the zinc-countered bar, tears further streaking her already ruined eyes.

Reaching her fat arm across and under the bar to grab a shiny new bottle of Stoli, her exposed belly pushed up and over the countertop, the cold metal making her shiver, plush body quivering.

Madison filled a cut-glass tumbler almost to the rim, with the almost oily, clear liquid. The smell of it alone, was enough to send warm tingles down her spine. She had never quite recovered from her day at the bar, so it went down in a couple gulps like so much water.

Thirty minutes later, the vodka bottle lay in a dry pile of glass upon the dining room floor. Madison, surely blacked out, had retreated to the kitchen pantry, sitting upon the floor with a bag of chocolate chips between her wobbly thighs. Her hands and mouth were covered in melted brown residue. She had even wiped some errantly across her swollen gut.

Another twenty minutes of gluttony, and Madison’s insides began to protest. Enough food, she thought. Time to grab a beer for the road and go to her fucking twenty-eighth birthday party, for christsakes.

Corona in hand, Madison swerved her way dangerously down the wide residential streets of their upscale neighborhood. This was her last chance to find some sense and turn around, or even get out and walk back, before she hit a major arterial and would get called in for DUI for certain.

She was too far gone, though. Subconsciously unable to confront her birthday party in this or any other state, for that matter, Madison’s hedonism drove her towards the McDonalds she had visited earlier in the afternoon.

Steven glanced at his watch for what seemed to him like the thousandth time that evening. Where was she? At this point he was as much worried, as he was annoyed and frustrated. She had done some outrageous things before, but this made absolutely no sense. She had been talking about this party for weeks, as though thinking about nothing else, and now she doesn’t show up? He felt guilty and at fault for leaving her at home. He had even driven back to the house an hour ago, to pick her up, having been gone for less than an hour and a half, but Madison was nowhere to be found and her car was missing from the garage. His many calls and text messages had gone unanswered.

The bright pearlescent face of the Rolex Mariner, read 10:45 PM, and Steven was beginning to fear for the worst when an attractive blonde waitress approached his table in the rented out lounge space, to inform him that a phone call was waiting for him with the maître de.
Gulping down a final sip of cabernet, Steven followed the pretty young woman through the darkened space, past many confused looking friends, to the swanky club’s lobby. He admired the fine lines of the waitress’s rear-end as it moved, slinking from side to side with each step.

Pulled from his daydream, by the attention of a man with a mustache and a cordless phone on a tray, Steven almost hated to pick up the receiver, absolutely certain that it would be bad news. He was absolutely right.

At approximately 10:23PM on the night of Friday, September 3, Officer Robert Guevara of the Miami-Dade Police Department observed a white, late-model Mercedes sedan (license plate #981XXH) driving at a high rate of speed through the intersection of 4th St and Deltona.

Noticing also that the vehicle appeared to be swerving, as though the driver was having difficulty maintaining a lane, Officer Guevara flicked on his lights and proceeded to give pursuit.

When the vehicle continued after three blocks with the Guevara signaling a stop, he engaged his siren and decreased the follow distance between his patrol car and the suspect vehicle. With headlights shining through to the interior of the Mercedes, Guevara was able to identify the driver as female, possibly Hispanic, with a heavy build.

Madison was positively freaking out! The cops were after her. The game was up. Why was she running? What the fuck was she doing? She had absolutely no idea at this point. Things were absolutely out of control. Planting her foot down hard on the accelerator, the powerful car shot forward down the strip-mall lined street. She took one last swig of her beer, before tossing the bottle out of the driver’s side window.

Guevara had already called in for backup, in pursuit of what he now strongly suspected to be a DUI, judging from the beer bottle, thrown from the suspect’s window, that whizzed past his car, shattering on the pavement. The chase had escalated to about 70 mph on a busy Friday night in Miami, and Guevara decided it was time to bring it to a swift end, before bystanders were put in any more danger.

Her drunken brain drawing a blank on how to proceed in this fantastic scenario, Madison locked her eyes on the golden arches visible just then about six blocks ahead down the strip. It was her birthday, and she needed a fucking Big Mac.

Coming fuzzily over the cruiser’s radio-set was an O.K. from the air unit for Officer Guevara to move in and terminate the high-speed pursuit. Other units had already blocked off all intersecting streets, and placed a spike strip about two quarters of a mile ahead, should he fail to stop the suspect vehicle by other means. A spiking at this speed could easily prove to have a deadly effect.

So Close now, images of French-fries and chicken nuggets floated through Madison’s detached mind. The police car was almost in her back seat now, the luxurious leather cabin aglow with red and blue lights. She leaned in over the steering wheel, engorged stomach pressing firmly into its lower curve. Madison was practically naked, the tattered dress mostly deteriorated at this point, only her lacey panties and overstressed bra maintained a speck of decency. She spilled out of the German-engineered driver’s seat, hips bumping into the console and cup holder alike, shining brown eyes agleam in her fat face.

This was it, the first time that Officer Robert Guevara would actually execute a “PIT” maneuver in the field. He remembered spinning out on the blacktop of the training course at the academy, as a few beads of cold sweat formed on his brow. Ok. He was going in on the count of three: 1, 2, …

“We’re here!” Madison chimed to no one in particular, as she yanked the wheel in a sudden, violent movement to the left, badly overshooting the Mcdonald’s parking lot entry in a skidding turn. Had it not been the terrific suspension designed by those boys in Baden, the car certainly would have flipped. Regardless the front-left tire exploded on impact with the raised curb, which also made a joke of the bumper.

“Woah,” Guevara said loudly to himself, turning around in his seat to watch the white Mercedes fly off the curb, clearing a row of shrubs, only to touch down briefly in a parking lot, before barreling into the plate glass window of a lighting store.

Not far enough down the road, the four officers manning the spike strip began to grow increasingly concerned by the failure of the speeding patrol car to show any signs of slowing down before them. Seconds later, applying brakes far too late, distracted by the spectacular crash behind him, Guevara shot over the spikes at about 60mph, spun out, rolled twice, and came to rest overturned in the middle of the next intersection.

1242.content:
One quarter of a Boston cream-pie sat in a box on the kitchen counter. Someone had eaten all the frosting off the top, though. Madison decided last night, that it was her 30th birthday so fuck it, she was eating cake.

She sat across the line of the small studio apartment, where the kitchen turned into a cramped living room. Filling out a slightly shabby green recliner, her mountainous stomach rose and fell with each breath, deep she was in an alcoholic slumber.

Her laptop on the coffee table still played through a season of MTV reality show, a cigarette still burned in the crowded ashtray, next to a purple, plastic bong. The walls of the apartment exuded a smoky musk. The digital clock on the stereo in the media cabinet read 4:00 AM, then 6:00.

At 7:30 AM, Madison’s cell-phone alarm went off where she left it on the apartment’s small, dingy balcony. Well insulated in both sleep, and a thick woolen blanket she had donned, half awake in the early morning hours, Madison slept soundly through her wake-up call.

Drifting through a vague dream, Madison was laying on a white sand beach, the whole of it, for only herself and some hot guy she had fucked her freshman year. He was a total dreamboat. Tan skin covered his limber, toned features, with a full head of sun bleached hair and pearly smile to match. She, herself, was in the prime of her physique, a skimpy black two-piece hugging her slender curves. Her hair raven hair was wet with seawater, and flecks of sand peppered her perfect skin, resembling the surface of a café-au-lait. As they moved toward each other, under the tropic-sun, about to join in passionate embrace, when a loud knocking sound distracted Madison, jolting her into an unwilling wakefulness.

Frankie was frustrated. This was the fifth time in three weeks, that Madison had gone MIA, and Josh, their manager, had sent her a few blocks to Madison’s apartment to try and fetch her. One more round of knocking and that was it, if Madison wanted to get fired, that wasn’t Frankie’s problem.

What on earth was up with that girl? When they first started work together at the restaurant, Frankie had found Madison to be fairly chill. They had even gone out for drinks after shift a few times, or smoked a joint in the parking lot.

Madison had certainly had her issues back then, always drinking Frankie under the table, and it was almost like she thought the rest of them didn’t notice her snacking off of customer’s plates and eating all the go-backs. Frankie found it funny, originally, and she empathized with Madison and her evident weight problem, but Christ, She had gotten even fatter!

Reaching out a closed hand to leave a final rapping upon the door, Frankie’s fist made only two knocks, before the door opened inwards, and there was Madison, bleary-eyed and fitting the doorway tightly. She mumbled something like “just a second,” and lumbered off again into the darkened dwelling. Frankie supposed she could step in for a moment, take a load off, and smoke a cigarette or something. Late as it was, a couple more minutes would hardly matter.

Frankie could only describe Madison’s apartment as “dank,” and not in the new meaning of the word, which is “good.” She meant like a dungeon. The windows were all drawn, and very little outside light found its way in through the blinds. She also noticed an empty handle of cheap vodka on the kitchen counter, standing beside smudged tumbler and forest of empty cans of Miller Lite. No wonder Madison had such trouble waking up.

It took far longer than “just a second” for Madison to collect herself and head off to work with Frankie. By the time they arrived at the restaurant, after the short walk, Madison was winded, sweaty, and a bit rumpled, her dark hair a tousle from the wind. She did not know it, but she would now tip the scales at over 300 pounds, meaning she had more than doubled her weight in the decade since her first days in university.

Clumsily fumbling around with the apron strings behind her back, Madison’s massive belly dominated her appearance, as usual. It kept on peeking out from beneath her too-small work polo. “Damn it,” she cursed under her breath as her sausage-fingers struggled to tie the strings above her bulging posterior. There just wasn’t enough slack in the line. How was this possible, the apron had fit yesterday?

Not until she glanced in Madison’s direction and saw that her apron’s nametag read “Frankie,” did she realize that Madison was attempting to put on her smaller apron, and that she herself was wearing Madison’s, which now seemed comically oversized on her smaller frame. Would Frankie need to babysit Madison all day? Perhaps a bit cruelly, she let her co-worker squirm with the incompatible garment for a few extra moments, before alerting her of the problem.

Broken into a visible sweat, Madison accepted the apron wordlessly, from Frankie. It was 2:30 PM and time for her to begin the shift, more than three hours late. It was then that Josh, the manager walked into the back room, looking quite irate.

12421.content:
Josh came in, looking at this slob of a girl in front of her. He thought about how when she started, he actually thought she was not the worst looking girl in the world, and when he had saw photos of her from her college days she was a total babe. What the hell happened to her? Josh wondered to himself, trading off astonished disbelief at this, and anger that she could be late again. He wanted to ask her how things could have gone off the rails this bad. Clearly, she had a drinking problem, but did that really explain the complete lack of motivation besides that? He knew she had a college degree and a failed marriage, did she thing it was below her to be working at the restaurant?

Instead of asking her these things, he directly took action.

"Madison," he said, "sorry you came in today, but you're fired."

"What?" she said, somewhat shocked by that.

"I'm sorry, this isn't working out."

Madison got up and approached him, trying to playfully hug him like she had when he started. Possibly trying to flirt her way out of a problem as she had so many times in her high school and college years. However, she was no longer in the same universe of appearance as that version of herself, so it failed, and Josh stood firm.

"Madison, I'm not kidding," he said, "don't make me have to call security. If you leave now, I'll let you leave out the back so you don't have to walk past anyone."

Madison was defeated. As meager as the pay was, she needed this job. She wanted to cry on the spot, but she kept her composure, and walked out the back door. After she left, Frankie walked to Josh's desk.

"Josh, was that really necessary?"

"Seriously, Frankie? You of all people should know how big of a drag Madison was on this restaurant."

"Oh come on." Frankie wanted to vouch for her friend, who was clearly having some kind of problem with her life. Madison just was not the same person she was when she started working at the restaurant, and Frankie feared what would happen without the (albeit small) level of responsibility and structure that came from this job.

Josh was not going to let Frankie get out a rebuttal, however; "I should have fired her weeks ago, and you know it. She was dragging you down worst of all. I know you two get along, which makes you a rarity on the staff, but believe me, you're better off without someone like that derailing your career."

My career? What, as a waitress? she thought to herself. Frankie figured this was a fight she was not going to win, so she gave it a rest.

Meanwhile, Madison had gotten back to her apartment, and cracked open a beer. What was she going to do? She had not spoken to her parents since the divorce, and, well, she knew what had happened with Cassi. Madison seemed out of options--there was not much breathing room left in her checking account, so she needed something quick, and she figured she could always find some kind of entry level job somewhere.

She knew that she shouldn't be doing it because she couldn't work out on crutches, but she couldn't really help it, which felt foreign to her.

As the final week of Madison's visit came she and Alex decided to let their Mom’s weight seek its own level as long as she wasn’t ragging on them. They discontinued spiking her food with anything. Alex continued to be happy with her gain. Madison was thankful that she at least seemed to have stabilized, but still missed the attention she used to get from guys. She realized that she hadn’t had a date in over two months and that was depressing, especially in light of the dismissive comments of Greg.

Four days before Madison was due to fly back to Powers she received a text from Jim, one of the editors on the school paper, the Powers Proclaimer: “Am in South Florida, heading back to Kansas. Could I drop by to take you out to dinner and maybe book on the same flight back?”

She was startled. Jim was one of the kinder people she knew, but an upperclassman. They had never dated and she knew he was aware of the embarrassing beer-pong fiasco. Why would he want to date her, the campus clown and resident blimp? Her confidence level in the pits, aware of her seeming addiction to food, perverse enjoyment of her ballooning weight and her mother’s adverse opinions she found it hard to believe that Jim would even offer. She started to blow him off, but instead took another tack.

“If you come here you’ll need to first meet our family before taking me out. Its your call,” she replied.

The answer came back within minutes “”Not a problem. Can be there and meet them Friday evening, take you out Saturday and we fly back Sunday if that’s suitable. Please supply your flight numbers so I can try to match them.”

Again she hesitated.

“Could this be some sort of prank?” she wondered. “Play with the hapless fat girl’s feelings and then brag to your dorm buddies about how you embarrassed her? “

She knew some guys did that kind of thing, but Jim’s reputation was one of being totally straight arrow. He encouraged the reporters, suggested sources, rewrote material without asking for credit. When he had to reject a story, never one of hers that she recalled, he seemed to almost apologize, like he regretted having to do it. She concluded that she actually wanted to know what he had going on inside his head.

She checked the confirmation slip in her purse wallet. And responded “Delta 1258 @ 11:45 from Jacksonville to Atlanta, connecting to flight 5043 (Delta Connect) at 1:40 – both in terminal S”

“OK – will try. If it works we can call together and see about seating. Expect me Friday around 2:00” Jim answered.

Madison considered her now nearly 220 pound frame with opulent derrière and thought “I hope we don’t get squeezed – it seemed snug flying in

Jim on the other hand was ecstatic. He had ideas about where Madison could go on the paper but needed her commitment. Besides, he had always been attracted to her and her weight gain for him wasn’t a turnoff at all. Privately, as one who had had both ft and slender friends in high school, he’d been fascinated by the transformation. But he knew some of the guys thought she and Cassie were into one another, something he found hard to believe.

Mr and Mrs Kraft were surprised by Madison’s announcement of a visitor but Chris immediately suggested that Jim shouldn’t just drop by on Friday – he should be invited to dinner. Madison and Alex agreed, volunteering to prepare it since their mom would be working. Jennifer Kraft, still struggling with her own weight issues, didn’t want a large dinner like she knew the girls were thinking of. But she felt like she was outgunned and maneuvered and ran up the white flag,

choices: Jim and the Kraft family enjoy dinner on Friday

131112111121211122211121111111212121.content:
On Friday Alex prepared a meat loaf with mixed vegetables while Madison put together a Waldorf salad plus a coconut cream pie for dessert. A little after 1:30 in the afternoon Jim called and announced he’d just checked in to a nearby motel. They supplied directions and told him to come on over at 6:00.

The 4000 square foot house in the gated community drive surprised Jim but didn’t intimidate him. His own family was old money and he’d seen big houses and yards. His family just didn’t flaunt it like some. It was his grandparents who had a second home in Florida where his parents and siblings had spent Christmas. The Kraft residence he estimated to be relatively new and wondered if the Christ and Jen Kraft were the original owners.

The short driveway had concrete slabs near the garage for up to four extra cares. Only two were occupied so Jim took one of the empty ones. He went up the walk intending to knock on the door when it was opened by a lithe brunette who greeted him “Hello – my name is Alexis. Madison’s setting things up in the dining area and I presume you’re Jim?”

“Yes, and since you’re too young to be her mother I presume you’re her sister?” he replied.

“Oh, well, yes. I guess she’s not told you about me?” Alex replied.

“Not her fault. We take classes together but I’ve not taken time to get to know her very well personally, I’m afraid,” Jim conceded as he entered the spacious but conservatively appointed living room. On the far side with a picture window he saw the dining room. It had a large table with a white table cloth and five place settings. Three match ing chairs on the side told him it probably had an expander panel for up to eight. Madison, now 50% larger than her sister, emerged from the kitchen a little hesitantly.

“Hello there,” Jim erupted with a greeting and smile. “Are you ready to greet a weary traveler from St Petersburg?”

“St Pete? I thought you lived in the Midwest?” replied Madison.

“I was raised there and that’s where my home is. But I’ve been down here or a reunion with my grandparents for the last week,” he explained. “I’ve met your sister but where are your parents?”

“Working. They’ll be here. Alex and I have done most everything so shall I take you on a tour?” she asked.

“By all means,” he replied. They had finished the interior and were viewing the veranda when Chris Kraft drove up. They went to the living room and greeted her father. Mr Kraft noticed Jim’s courtesy and conservative although casual dress, deciding that he was a serious student and not a loser. He wanted to know more about this young man but before they could converse much Jen Kraft arrived and things appeared not to be good.

“Hello there, you must be Jim – happy to meet you,” she greeted him curtly before turning to her husband. “I don’t mean to be impolite, but this day has been horrid. Will you pardon me while I find some Tylenol?”

Jim had proffered his hand but she hadn’t even noticed. He lowered it and looked at Madison as Mr Kraft followed his wife.

“Is this a bad time? Should I leave?” Jim asked.

“No!” declared Alex. “We made this supper for you to enjoy and you are here to see Madison. This isn’t normal for mom and she would feel bad if you split on her account.”

Madison nodded her head in agreement. “Unless Dad indicates otherwise I think you should stay.”

The three young people sat down in the living room and spent about ten minutes until Chris Kraft reappeared.

“Jen is sorry about all this and asks that we forgive her and get supper going. I’ve given her pulls for her headache. She’ll join us in 10-25 minutes.” He announced.

Alex and Madison arose and went to the kitchen. Mr. Kraft seated himself next to Jim.

“Its good to meet one of Madison’s classmates and friends,” he said.

”Actually we’re both on the staff of the campus paper. She’s a real writer and reporter, not just a composer.” Jim replied. “Most freshman don’t do features because they can’t research. The same for unique commentary, but Madison is a natural. That’s not just my opinion but the evaluation of our faculty advisor. She could be offered an editorship next year, which is rare for a sophomore. “

“So is your interest strategic or personal?” Mr. Kraft inquired.

“Probably a bit of both. Madison has been so busy, and me too, that we’ve just crossed paths a lot but have never had a chance to connect. We’ll see what happens but I promise not to do anything to hurt or offend. In fact if you have any suggestions or pointers I’m open to advice.” Jim responded.

“Well, between us, I think she’s heard enough about her weight from her mother. I’d advise letting her sort that out rather than trying to lecture her.” Mr Kraft said.

“Not a problem,” replied Jim. “She and her roommate Cassie are probably among the largest girls on campus and I’m sure they know it. I’ve known larger girls with the nature of angels and slender ones with mean streaks you can’t believe. I’m charmed by the former and repelled by the latter. Madison’s size doesn’t bother me and I’m with you about not interfering with her life in that area. Some people of size are simply meant to be that way and its judgmental for others to be condemning what for them is natural.”

Chris Kraft sighed “I wish my wife were so open minded. She thinks Madison is influencing Alex – who appears to have put on a few this holiday season as well.”

“Pardon me, sir, but Alex is, well, shall I say, on the low end of slender even now. If she’s gained some she may have wanted it.”Jim asserted.

“You perceive correctly and she’s told Jen as much. So you understand my position in all of this,” Mr Kraft lamented.”I agree with you but my wife is having her issues with the girls. She thinks the meal tonight is going to be hog heaven and she’s totally lost control.”

“And that’s the cause of her headache?” concluded Jim.

“She would say no, but I suspect there’s a stress connection,” Mr Kraft replied laconically.

“You can’t control other people, especially teens. They need space to make their own decisions, even unwise ones. That’s what becoming emancipated and an adult is all about,” asserted Jim.

“You are a smart cookie for one so young,” observed Mr. Kraft. He found himself liking Jim, a lot.

“OK guys, dinner is served,” Alexis announced from the dining room. “I’ll go knock on Mom’s door.”

"Alex, I umm, I think it's really sweet, but..."

At that moment, Alex's heart sunk, he knew that was it. He felt so stupid for even trying. Would Madison want to be friends with him any more? Would she even talk to him? Madison continued, "...I just think we are better as friends. Since I've gotten here, you've been one of the nicest people here to me, but I don't want to risk losing that." For Madison, it was part truth part whitewashing. He was a friend that she held in deep regard. However, had she been sexually interested in Alex, she would have happily taken that risk. Madison continued, "I'm sorry, you probably hate me right now." she said, trying to deflect blame on herself to make it less awkward.

"No," Alex sad, crushed, "Forget I ever brought it up, that was stupid of me." He said walking away.

--------------------------------------------------------

Madison: Yeah, I feel bad, but I just am not going to go out with him.

Alex: Sorry about this afternoon, I agree about being friends.

Madison generally didn't like to highlight the imperfections of others, but she was frustrated by the day she was having, and was still vain enough to care deeply about these things. She wrote in a chat window, Yes! He's just so fat. I don't mind Alex, but I find his fat depressing. He struggles to fit in the desks at class, and what would people say if we went out? Why would I go out with him when guys with 6-packs are checking me out! I just find it disgusting. and she clicked enter. Until she realized something horrible. She had written the message to the wrong window. That message was not sent to Cassi, reading it while bored in her lecture hall. It went to Alex.

"no. no. no. no. NO. NO. NO." Madison screamed "DID I REALLY JUST DO THAT? OH GOD NO."

Instantaneously, in his dorm room, Alex got a message response tab from Madison, and saw the entire message. At first he didn't understand. Then he realized that the message was intended for someone else. Alex started to cry a bit. He knew he looked stupid, crying, but he was alone in his dorm room and couldn't help it. Not only did this girl not want to date him, but she was more than fine with making fun of him to other people.

Back in her dorm room, Madison was panicking. She wanted to throw her $1,500 laptop out the window in a fit of rage, she quickly typed up another message, Madison: Oh my god, Alex, I am so sorry. That message was supposed to go to Cassi. she hit send. "What am I thinking?! I just confirmed to Alex I was talking about him." Madison thought, so she typed up another message. I was just trying to be sarcastic with Cassi---you know, over the top, I don't think that about you. I've changed my mind, we should grab dinner on Friday. Just us. Madison was now crying in front of her computer as well. She could not believe she had done this to someone. She anxiously waited for a response from Alex that evening, but one never came.

Alex's opinion of Madison Kraft changed that evening. He had gone from holding her in admiration, to thinking she was fake and shallow. Someone who was nice to everyone for social perception, but just like the popular girls from high school, and he wanted to make her pay.

“Yeah. Its called a photographic memory and its a family trait. It probably is why I’ve lived such a sedentary and food focused life – not even the nerds want to be around me” Jeff confided.

“Stupid nerds. They should be giving you respect while picking your brain to help themselves,” declared Madison. “But I digress. Do you want to try my Plan B or not?”

“Well, you haven’t told me as yet what it is, “ observed Jeff.

“You’re not the only one who gets no respect, Jeff. You like most others probably think of me as a fitness freak and typically narcissistic high school hottie. The fact is that I have a brain and world view that most have no idea of. I see people’s talents and potential, as well usually their inner fears, rather than just their public personas but I can’t talk about it because it usually scares others. Does that make any sense to you?” she related.

“Uh, actually it does,“ agreed Jeff. “Personas are usually developed to impress or protect – they’re never the real person.”

“Exactly,” exclaimed Madison. “Now get this. I see the real Jeff, more clearly than maybe even you do. And its not his body, its his dreams and hopes – and also his loneliness. If you won’t discuss those things with me at a restaurant, there’s another way. That’s my plan B.”

“Which exactly is?” probed Jeff.

“Let me cook a dinner here for you – something simple for the moment, but I assure you I can do better,” offered Madison.

Jeff knew his belly was ready for action, hardly novel for him, but he could scarcely believe the invitation. Was Madison really this accepting and eager to get to know him? He decided to take a chance. “OK, you win. But excuse me if I’m having difficulty believing this.”

“You go play on the Internet for an hour,” Madison cajoled. “I’ll try to come up with something you’ll enjoy.”

Madison knew exactly what she was going to do – a quick tuna casserole with peas and mushroom soup filler accompanied by an argula corn salad and for dessert some butterscotch pudding. Within 15 minutes the casserole was in the oven followed by the pudding in the refrigerator, leaving her nearly 40 minutes to work on the salad. She even found time to make a carafe of fruit flavored ice tea.

When Jeff was invited to the table he was surprised to see it set formally with a table cloth and folded napkins. The hot casserole was in a Pyrex glass with a pad underneath and the salad in a bowl. Large glasses of tea were accompanied by a carafe for refills.

“Serve yourself, starting with the salad. “ Madison invited. “The casserole should cool another ten minutes.”

“This looks great! Jeff acknowledged. “And it only took an hour?”

“If you like it I’ll devote more time another evening,” Madison smiled.

Jeff got Madison talking about her family and she tried to get him to open up about his, but silently understood his reluctance. It was enough for now that he knew she wasn’t a gold digger on the prowl but had access to resources of her own. When they finished she served dessert, by this time cold and sweet.

“Pretty nice spread for a fat guy,” he commented. “I’ve never had anyone do something like this befre.”

“Unless you have a really slow metabolism, eating like this will over time bring your weight down to 240 – although if I keep pace as I did this evening I might pick up some during the same space of time” confided Madison, expressing a private concern of her own.

“Umm, who was it that was saying outer appearances weren’t anyone’s concern but ours?” recalled Jeff. “I will stipulate that if you happen to add part of what I lose that’s fine and f you don’t that’s fine too. I’m already appreciating the inner Madison if you get my drift.”

Madison smiled as he left. She knew she had him hooked. As for her gaining weight, well, she wondered if that would be so bad.

That night she finally replied to her Dad’s question, telling him she was coaching a scion of the family. She acknowledged that he was really huge but also a very nice guy that she strangely found herself attracted to because of his nature.

“I’ve no idea where this is going to go, Dad,“ she confided, “but for now its all good and I feel right about it. I sincerely hope no one in the family, if you should meet him, will make him feel less than welcome as long as he’s treating me well.”

With that Madison decided to retire – but not before sharing the last of the butterscotch pudding with Cassie.
14133112112.title: Madison offers up a deal

choices: Over the next few weeks, Madison finds herself gaining 10 pounds
Madison and Cassi try out the snack food
141331121122.content:
A few days went by before their next workout session, and Madison and Jeff had cordially chatted, but never met up. For this reason, Madison anxiously awaited their next workout. She put her workout gear on, and choose shorter shorts than normal, hoping that would turn Jeff on a bit. On the way over to the session, Madison wondered if Jeff would eventually be comfortable with being with her. She knew that this would take time, however, as she walked, she thought about what that would mean for her. Throughout high school, Madison had only been with guys who were in great shape. She certainly was not an advocate for the high school social hierarchy, she thought it to be cruel, she still did benefit from it with her great looks and likable demeanor. It may have just come down to her never socializing one on one with someone like Jeff, but for some reason, she found him endearing...or at least that's what she was telling herself after learning about his vast family fortune.

Jeff on the other hand, was also in deep thought. He was still risk adverse to anyone laughing at him about his weight, and he thought the greatest way to stop this was to drop some weight. "Maybe...if this can just work out, Madison and I can go out together," he thought to himself as he was in the locker room, getting ready for the same workout. He really enjoyed dinner two nights ago, in fact, he constantly thought about it, but, he just had some personal issues of confidence he was not ready to conquer.

As Jeff walked into the room, Madison was eating a candy bar. He thought it was an odd thing to bring into a workout room, and he was correct. Madison had indulged on the way to class. She had stopped at the school convenience store for a bottle of water, and then saw a chocolate bar. What the heck, if I gain 5 pounds this year, no one will notice. Perhaps this was still a bit of subtle superiority over Jeff. In her thin state, Madison assumed that Jeff would not freak out if she had gained 5 pounds like some other boyfriends, and she also was still believing in the speech she gave Jeff about personal acceptance, so Madison gave into her urges for the first time in a while and bought a candy bar.

"Chocolate in the workout room?" Jeff asked.

"Guilty!" Madison replied, "I don't know, it just seemed like a good idea...and you know what...I forgot how good these were." She said with a guilty smile.

As they went though the exercises, Jeff noticed a shift in the way that Madison was instructing him. Before, Madison was just kind of going in tandem with him. Not really paying attention to his form, or really the results for him, but more so using them as her own personal workout time. Now, she was enthusiastic about helping him do them exactly right, coaching him, giving him little pointers in the most encouraging manner, taking a real interest in his progress. At the same time, this was at the expense of her body movement, and Jeff noticed that she had not broken a sweat, or moved much, by the end of the workout.

After the workout, Madison had only positive things to say to Jeff, but not in a patronizing way,

"Jeff, I thought that was really good. I know it's hard, but you can see the foundation for your growth to continue, are you feeling more flexible than before you started?"

"You know, I really am," He replied.

"See, I think this will continue"

After they each walked back to their separate dorm rooms and showered (although Madison's was questionably necessary) she got a text from Jeff, Hey want to come to my room hang out? Madison had been planning to go study on the green, but she could always do that later. For sure, be over in 10! she responded.

When Madison got to the room, they talked for a while, and she noticed that it appeared that Jeff did not have a roommate, upon inquiring about it, Jeff said that they just paid extra to have a single, since it seemed small for two people. Madison also saw that he had a box full of packaged snack cakes in the corner. Jeff saw her starring and felt guilty, even though he did not have much to do with those being there.

"Yeah, I know, I should not have those here. My Mom sends them too me every so often, but I wish she would stop, because I think they are delicious and have the willpower not the buy them, but once they are here, I cannot really lay off them."

"Well how about this, just give them to me?"

"You like those?"

"I've never tried them, but maybe my roommate and I will like them!" she said, thinking this could help Jeff with his goal.

They had another great evening. Madison thought that little by little, Jeff could get to a physical and personal place that he wanted to be, even if it took a while.
141331121122.title: Jeff wrestles with his inner feelings and pulls...

choices: Jeff and Madison go on a dinner date - and his parents find out
Madison and Cassie obiviously party with friends
1413311211222.content:
Madison had received extensive culinary training at her private school. She knew very well what snack cakes were, especially the sweet vanilla filling, individual sized brand name types sold as Twinkies, Devil Dogs, Ho Hos and Ding Dongs. She thought of them as empty calorie junk food and knew how to make better pastries herself if she had to. But, outside a few times in class, she never had. But Jeff’s cakes weren’t store bought. Even though individually wrapped they weren’t commercial brands, They were high end individual delicacies including butterscotch and chocolate creme, She knew they would taste divine!

“These were probably done by a caterer for the snack table at a family party,” Madison surmised. “But why would Jeff’s mom send them here – unless she wants to be sure he stays fat? Why would she do that? I think I’m beginning to get a picture.”.

In the back of her mind the added thought nagged that in addition to keeping Jeff fat they could also make his girl friend fat as well. Madison ignored it, for she fully intended to share them with Cassie overtime, and neither of them had weight issues. A couple a night they could handle without effect. But first she had tonight’s supper to think about, so she stopped enroute to the burger café adjacent to the cafeteria, There she had a mushroom and avocado burger with fries and a soda, rather much more than she was accustomed to but she felt hungry for some reason.

When she got home she was surprised to find Cassi, Kelli, Ginger and Megan finishing off a couple of pizzas and about to have ice cream for dessert. Her snack cakes wound up rounding out the feast with Madison finally having a large bowl of ice cream as well.

After the others left Cassi asked about Jeff, who she said reminded her of some of the farm boys back home in size, but obviously smarter. She didn’t sound critical, which Madison appreciated.

“Yes, he’s really quite intelligent, very kind but shy. He’s majoring in International Business. If I can get him down to 250 he’ll go far I’m sure, “she confided. “You know how weight-obsessed the world is and I’m sure he feels it.”

Cassie blinked. She thought her Coral Gables roommate would be a typical vain city brat, ready to criticize anyone not up to her view of perfection. But instead she was being positive and understanding.

“Yeah, you’re right,” Cassie replied. “I’ve dated some big guys and they can in their way be better gentlemen and friends than the self-absorbed studs. Having to endure crap for being different maybe makes you more patient and kind.”

“He says he hasn’t heard all that much but is still self-conscious about what he feels they’re probably thinking. I had to assure him that he’s not a freak. The good news is that he’s working hard. If he keeps it up in about a year he will have a new image to be proud of, assuming I can keep those “survival kits” from his Mom out of his hands.

”Survival kits?” Cassie replied.

“Boxes like the snack cakes we had tonight. Split up among five people is one thing – but for one? He hates it, never buys them but his mom ships them!” Madison exclaimed. “He gave them to me to get them beyond his reach.”

“Well, I commend him for trying! And you for helping, but for now I think we both need to get to bed,” Cassi declared, rubbing her fully distended belly.

”I agree,” replied Madison as she headed for her room with a food baby of her own clearly showing.

- - - - - - - - - -

Back in his fortress of solitude the rich young scion brooded on his feelings about his tutor. She’d done her job professionally, accepted his hanging out invitation, urged him to go out publicly, even made a healthy meal for him and consented to get rid of his mom’s surgery temptations. If he didn’t know it was impossible he even thought he might have a chance with her, but he came from a world where everything seemed to revolve around money. What was wrong with him that he felt so insecure about having a normal relationship?

“Money can’t avoid all risk of getting hurt,” he answered himself. “There’s some things money can’t buy. But others risk getting hurt, money or not. Why can’t I? Maybe its time to forget the Gucchi shoes and the family jet and take a chance.”

With that he popped a TV dinner into the microwave and decided to test Madison’s resolve – even let her pick the restaurant. He doubted it would be a fast food place or the college buffet.

“One thing for sure,” he thought. “I’m not sharing this with Mom until it actually goes someplace. She’s tried to keep me from a dating life because of her fear of gold-diggers all my life; I think she’d prefer an arranged marriage with a debutante daughter from her friend’s social circle. Those airheads couldn’t compare to Madison in anything! I hope I can stand up and declare that to both of them some day!”

- - - - - -

Meanwhile in Coral Gables Mrs. Kraft was venting to her husband, who had shared his exchange with Madison.

“I don’t like this one bit,” she declared. “Madison is too talented and beautiful a girl to get involved in trying to make over an obese rich kid. I’m sure its not about his money, she’s not like that. Its her Florence Nightingale problem solver side. But he can use his money to suck her in and we could wind up with an obese son-in-law and she might even get fat as well. This has to stop – now!”

“She’s over 18 and asserting her independence.” her husband reminded her. “We have to let her make her own decisions in life – and I’m not sure Florence Nightingale is the right analogy. She’s more like a campaign manager or coach determined to win. Remember, she getting paid for his because she’s wants independence from my checkbook – and that’s commendable. If he doesn’t shape up she’ll tire after awhile. The alternative at the moment is to pull purse strings ourselves and try to control her life – which knowing Madison would likely produce a real explosion.”

“Yes, I suppose your right. “ Mrs. Kraft grumbled, rolling her eyeballs. “But if fat boy ever comes here I’m not serving dessert!”

Her husband smile and nodded. The storm was calmed. For now. But inwardly he felt sure Madison, not he or his wife, would call the shots if and when the time came.

14133112112221.content:
Jeff got ready for dinner that evening, not knowing where Madison would take him, this time, they had arranged for Madison to swing by his room. After a bit, he heard a knock on the door. Jeff opened it to see Madison, who was wearing trendy jeans and a nice, but casual top. Still not completely accepting that someone of Madison's caliber was interested in him, Jeff was taken aback by how sexy she looked even in everyday attire. He had seen her in her gym clothes, and when she was being ultra casual in the room together, but when she was going out, even just for a quick dinner date, it took her appearance to a new level. He quickly composed himself and started walking to the elevators with her.

"So where are we going?" He asked.

"Have you ever had sushi before?" Madison asked, hoping he would say no, to create a new experience together.

"No, I don't think I would like it that much." Jeff remarked.

"What's not to like?" Madison said, somewhat playfully.

"Raw fish I guess, it freaks me out a bit."

"It's not like you're eating a whole raw cod or anything, give it a shot."

And with that, they went to the restaurant in the downtown near campus. Madison took Jeff through the menu, and explained the things that she liked. Jeff ordered two rolls, per Madison's suggestion, and she did as well. When the food came, Jeff starred at the two rolls, six pieces each, somewhat disappointed, which Madison picked up on.

"You look disappointed, what's the matter?"

"It just looks a bit...small, especially for what we paid." He remarked.

What, now he's going to act like a cheapskate Madison jokingly thought to herself. "It fills you up more than you think, I know it doesn't look like much, but it caught on for a reason," she assured Jeff.

Jeff piked up one with his chopsticks, something he was proficient in from his times at the Chinese buffet, and put it in his mouth. It was different alright, but not bad, in fact as the second and third pieces went by, he decided the taste was acquired but something that he liked.

At the end of the dinner, Madison was pleased that Jeff had tried something new and liked it, "See," she noted, "this is actually pretty decent for you, at least compared to dorm food, and it tastes really good!" To which Jeff agreed.

It was a great night for each of them. When Madison got back into her room, she decided to open up her textbooks, and knock out the reading for later in the week. After a bit, she got hungry again, and walked over to the fridge, where she saw some carrots that she had bought a week ago, and some soda and chips that Cassi had brought home and mentioned it was for each of them. Normally, Madison would have preferred the carrots, but she remembered how great the sweetness of that soda she had a few days ago taste, and the chips would provide a nice saltiness as well. While studying, Madison absentmindedly had 3 or 4 servings out of the family sized bags, ignoring the portion control that she was usually quite held to.
14133112112221.title: Jeff and Madison go on a dinner date

choices: Madison confronts herself about her size and Mrs. Wilson about Jeff
Something else before Mrs Wilson arrives
141331121122211.content:
Jeff was home after his Sushi night with Madison, still puzzled over her seeming willingness to be seen in public with someone twice her size. But he knew that they had had a good time and the meal had been both tasty and adequate if not huge.

“I wonder,” he thought “if there is such a thing as consumptionphobia – fear of being seen eating? That’s what bothers me before dining in public – other’s thinking that I’m a hog feeding at the trough again, but no one tonight seemed to notice.”

Going to Wikipedia he didn’t find such a word – the closest definition was that of Scopophobia – fear of being stared at or looked at.

“Well, that’s close, “he thought. “But whatever it is I’m going to have to lick it. Madison expects me to pick the next place and I’m a basket case even contemplating it. But the good thing is I’m ready for bed without being distracted by addictive snack cakes. I can hardly believe she and her dorm mates demolished that box in one night!”

Jeff slept soundly that night, rising in the morning determined to keep his calories in check. He knew Madison had warned him to avoid going over 3000 per day. He cut a cantaloupe into four pieces and put three in storage bags, then scrambled two eggs and put two slices of whole grain bread in the toaster. As he washed this repast down with a large glass of orange juice he visualized Madison at the Powers breakfast buffet having a similar breakfast.

Meanwhile Madison and Cassie were indeed at the buffet, but having a slightly different menu. Instead of two scrambled eggs they were each having an omelet that included cheese, tomato, and avocados. They also each had a fruit cup and an English muffin. But in addition there were also sausages and hash browns plus tall cups of calorie rich mocha latte. The calories count of Madison’s breakfast exceeded Jeff’s by at least 800.

A similar pattern followed during the rest of the day. At lunch Jeff went to his private room and had a tuna sandwich with cottage cheese and milk. Madison joined Cassie, Ginger and Megan for spaghetti and meatballs with green beans and a roll plus pie for dessert. In the late afternoon Madison did her usual workout, and then reward herself with a couple of energy bars. That evening she enjoyed sharing meatloaf and peas with mashed potatoes prepared by Cassie, who also had a store bought lemon cakes for dessert. Jeff by contrast had microwave beef stroganoff and tea.

It had now been four weeks into their relationship and Jeff wondered how much progress he had made. He got on the scale and found that he had lost six pounds, a fact that he proudly reported to Madison at the outset of their next workout.

“Great!” she replied. “Keep that up and within a yeas you’ll be under 250!”

When their session was over Jeff informed her that he’d chosen a restaurant for them for Saturday night – the Olive Garden.

Madison’s eyes lit up. She loved Italian food and she was happy to see Jeff taking the initiative. She accepted instantly, and then remembered a conversation she’d had with Cassie.

“By the way,” she asked, “would you be free for a homemade upper Monday? My roommate thinks I need to make dinner for you, her and a friend.”

Jeff started to freeze up and say no, but instead overcame his fear and agreed, wondering what Madison might do. That Monday he found out: an English menu featuring Cornish game hens with garlic and rosemary preceded by a Waldorf salad and accompanied by green beans and creamy whipped potatoes with cheese. The dessert was a surprise – Boston crème pie, a dish not normally associated with the English but rather the colonialists.

What impressed Jeff, however, was the vigor of the conversation and seeming indifference to his size by all present. This pattern repeated itself for the next two months, at which time Madison reported to Mrs Green that Jeff was progressing nicely – having lost twenty pounds and becoming increasing sociable. She was rewarded with a $500 bonus, a fact she quickly communicated to her Father.

Mrs Green was communicating as well, advising Jeff’s father of the success of giving his son a personal trainer, whom she noted “is possibly becoming attached at a personal level as well. They’ve dated a few times and I think she may have added some of what Jeff has lost.”

In fact Madison had gained 12 pounds in as many weeks, but hadn’t formally checked. She. could tell that her stomach was softer and her skirts tighter. She knew that she and Cassie had both gained weight but it didn’t seem significant. She just bought larger size clothes and trusted her Dad to deal with her mom when she found out. As for Jeff, he too could tell that she had thickened a little but didn’t care.

The date at the Olive Garden had gone well. Madison, knowing Jeff’s background and international goals, had been checking out websites for news about geopolitics, multi-national corporations and economic trends. She used this knowledge get Jeff to talk about these topics, which she found interesting. Jeff shared this news with his Father, also mentioning his weight loss and crediting his personal trainer. Mr Wilson was pleased to see his son share this with him – for much of his life Jeff had been somewhat of a mama’s boy.

Jeff’s mother, however, was not so sanguine, Upon discovering Mrs Green’s report she demanded that her husband find out about this Madison Kraft and break up her relationship with Jeff. Mr Wilson did have Madison checked out but after assurances from Jeff that she had no idea of their family wealth and that the relationship was entirely platonic at this point he declined to jump in. He was, in fsct, proud to see his son pulling away from his mother and finding himself by developing what appeared to be a healthy relationship. He also discovered that Madison’s family was worth close to $20 million, so she wasn’t likely looking for his son’s money. In fact. Mrs Green assured him that the relationship began at her instigation – Madison initially had resisted even getting involved.. Both she and Jeff pledged that they had not told Madison anything about the family’s business or the Wilson’s relationship to Powers.

Mrs. Wilson wasn’t that easily placated. She had kept her son out of normal social circles for eighteen years by indulging his gastronomic tendencies and she was loathe to surrender control. Maybe Madison wasn’t a fortune hunting floozy but she wasn’t good enough for her son because Mrs, Wilson hadn’t chosen her. She was determined to either buy or scare Madison off.

Jeff and Madison of course were oblivious to this developing drama. Jeff continued losing about a pound and a half per week and Madison kept gaining around a pound in the same time frame up to the holiday season. Cassie and the other dorm mates were gaining some as well.
141331121122211.title: Over the next montJeff has lost a few pounds

Something else before the Wilsons arrive
1413311211222111.content:
After making her report to Mrs Green Madison called her Father and shred her feelings about Jeff and his progress. The upbeat report was tempered by a concern of her own – it was hard to elude the dietary habits of the dorm and frankly she really hadn’t tried or wanted to. It wasn’t all that much, yet, but she knew if her mom was upset about her having a fat boyfriend she would likely be apoplectic about her becoming a plumper herself.

Mr. Kraft sighed. He knew his wife’s attitude towards weight and kept himself trim to placate it. He personally didn’t care and wished she could let up a bit. Thanks to her private school experience Madison knew more about conditioning and nutrition than most married women and he was willing to let her run her own life.

“Honey, we both know your mother’s feelings on this and I wish it weren’t so.,” he replied.” But your education and happiness are the important things, not being tied to us because, truthfully, we won’t always be around. I think you and I are just going to have to make it plain that family is more important than conforming on every little point. I’ll do what I can to mollify things here – and if she hassles you just be kind. I don’t want you taking off and waitressing incognito in Missoula, Montana.”

Madison laughed. Such an overreaction was the kind of things she knew some kids did, but she wasn’t that stupid and she knew it.

“Just be sure your report card is great and I think I can give some perspective here” he answered on a more practical level.

Madison chuckled. “That shouldn’t be a problem. Most of my tests and reports have been A’s and nothing below a B. And you know I’m not taking simple courses.”

“Glad to hear it,” her Dad replied. “Next time you guzzle a frappachino remember that I’m rooting for you – and Jeff.!”

Madison caught that last reference and smiled. Her Dad really was in her corner. The next time she and Jeff went out she shared with him the situation with her mom.

“Sounds like we both have a similar problem” he remarked. “My dad wishes us the best too, but my Mom is giving he and I a hard time. We have a tidy amount of assets in our family and I think she doesn’t believe a fat guy like me can attract a woman who doesn’t have dollar signs in her eyes.”

It was the first time Jeff had referred to his family’s assets and Madison knew she had to speak wisely without divulging all that she knew.

“Well. My family’s not exactly poor you know.” Madison retorted with a touch of exasperation in her voice. “You may drive a BMW because your family can afford to buy it for you, just like they are paying for you to have a place of your own, so sure I know you are well off. But I figured that out after I was already assigned to work with you by Mrs Green. Does your mom know that? Your family is probably richer than mine but we pay our own way and that’s no part of our relationship as far as I’m concerned.”

“Whoa there,” Jeff backed p. “I know all that. But like you and our moms she’s not me. No one is going to be good enough for her until she decides it is I’m afraid – just like with you. Luckily my Dad is more like yours. He’s glad I’ve found a friend to share things with.”

“My Dad’s half-afraid that if my Mom pushes too hard I might just rebel and drop out of college and disappear, but that’s not going to happen,” Madison declared. “I’m here to get an education and I’ll choose my associations for myself. And honestly I think we’ve helped one another.”

Jeff paused, wondering how he could be helping Madison, but he well knew what she had done.

“Well, thanks,” he stammered. “but how am I helping you” You’re the trainer who’s helped inspire me to peel off the pounds.”

“Yes, which I’m getting paid to do so chalk one up for Maddie, even if at the same time I’ve been letting my dorm mates add a few to me I’m afraid..” Madison answered. “But do you think I’d be reading Forbes, Inc, the Wall Steet Journal and the Economist if it weren’t for having to keep pace with an information junkie with a photographic memory? Or did you think I just pick up the things we talk about from MTV? You are part of the force behind my good grades because you set your own bar so high. We are helping one another and I appreciate it.”

A light bulb went on in Jeff’s head. Madison was right – trivia he’d shared that bored most others she was usually able to build on, either countering with more information or asking an intelligent question. They always seemed to be talking and sharing, mostly on semi-serious topics that were over most women’s heads.

“And you didn’t do this before you met me?” he inquired.

“I’ve always read a lot, but not with the focus I have now, I can’t say where our relationship goes after my assignment from Mrs Green runs out. That will be up to you. But its challenged me and I appreciate challenges,” Madison answered. “You are kind, intelligent and whatever happens you’re a person I’ll always be glad to have known”

Inside Jeff felt like telling Madison the truth – that he wanted their relationship to grow, not end after the contract period. But although she’d practically invited him to admit this he still lacked the confidence to believe that a hottie like her could care for someone as big as he was.

“You are a beautiful person, Madison,” he murmured softly. “You could gain a hundred pounds and it wouldn’t change who you re – and all I can say for now is ‘thank you.’ If I’ve been half the help to you that you’ve been to me all I can say is I appreciate it.”

Madison nodded softly. Jeff managed to shift the conversation as their entrees arrived and the evening ended pleasantly, but with both parties realizing that they needed the freedom within their families to chart their own futures.

The next day Jeff called his Father and told him point blank that he thought his mom and Madison needed a meet-up.

“I know it will be rough, but you’ve checked her out and know I’m not nuts. She may or not be the one I marry some day but Mom needs to reconcile herself to the fact that I’m growing up and can make my own decisions, “ he asserted.

Mr Wilson was surprised at his son’s forcefulness but knew he was right. His wife was fighting Grecian chimeras based on fear, Madison deserved to compete on a more level playing field. He agreed to come to Powers during the holiday break and let Madison meet his wife.

The next day Jeff told Madison what he’d done. “My dad will protect me and your job, so don’t worry. I’ve told him I’m ready to go to the mat on this – not to Timbuktu like your mom fears, but she either accepts my hoice of friends or rejects me.”

Madisdon inhaled. She appreciated Jeff’s zeal, which she knew meant he probably shared some of her feelings and hopes. But she also knew the fury of a woman thwarted and didn’t want as an enemy. She didn’t even know the lady after all!

“OK, I guess I should say thanks, “ Madison said thoughtfully. “ But if there’s going to be a meeting it should be on terms and a venue we control, not her. I’m sure that she’s used to manipulating and I want to be realistic. You know my culinary abilities, why don’t I cook her a meal that even a professional chef would admit takes skill?”

“Uh, like what?’ Jeff asked.

“What about a decadent and delicious beef wellington?” Madison mused. “I’ve done it three times before and it takes hours, but with a mustard crusted filet mignon, wild mushroom duxelles, homemade duck pate, puff pastry, chive mashed potato, and veggies with a salad I’m sure she hasn’t had anything more elegant!”

Jeff’s jaw dropped. “You can do that?”

“It will be two weeks until they arrive. Should I do a practice run this Sunday just to convince you?” she offered. “I think you mentioned she is a BBW who enjoys good food, so it should go well, especially when she sees Cassie and I aren’t exactly models right now.”

“I keep telling you to stop making remarks like that – you look fine,” grumped Jeff, “but you’re right about her appreciation of fancy dishes. If you’re confidant I say go for it! Oh, by the way, she has a thing about crème brulee for dessert. ”
1413311211222111.title: Madison confronts herself about her size and Mr...

choices: Madison and Mrs Wilson face off
14133112112221111.content:
Madison skipped the Beef Wellington dry run but had to coax Cassie into serving as her assistant for the evening. She also had to come to terms with herself. It was mid-December and both roommates knew they’d gained past the Freshman 15 at this point.

Madison felt her body was the firmer of the two. She knew she had the conditioned abs of one who had taken karate classes beneath the soft layer of flesh that now covered her torso. She noticed Cassie’s chin filling in and suspected she was doing the same. Another twenty pounds and both would both display full fledged facial tributes to their indulgent life style. That was an issue she might eventually have to address with her mother, but Mrs. Wilson was the immediate challenge and another matter.

What Madison herself felt about her new physique was the question. She stood before the full length mirror in the workout room’s changing area. She honestly didn’t see that much difference – perhaps two pounds on each of her thighs, another four on her upper body, leaving maybe ten for her belly which she felt looked noticeably rounder but not bad.

She knew the cause. As a trainer she was limiting 6’4” Jeff to 3000 calories a day. She knew her own maintenance limit should be around 1800 based on her weight age and activity level. But she had been consuming around 2500, meaning that she was gaining around pound per weak. Extended to a balance point meant she was headed for a truly chunky 230+.

This had been a case of conscious permission. She initially allowed herself to indulge while helping Jeff, not wanting her to be waving a restricted menu in her face. It was also a point of freedom from her mom’s monitoring, which she had tolerated for years but not appreciated.

Cassie and the girls in the dorm certainly were trending up hemselves, which made Madison more comfortable with her current habits. Megan had found a source for French vanilla flavored coffee in half gallon containers which Cassie kept stocked. Thursday was pizza night. And then there were the weekly dozen snack cakes Madison herself kept bringing from Jeff’s place.

“I’d be as round as Vikki Arnold at that point,” she remarked to herself about her projection, thinking of one of the heaviest girls she’d known at her private high school Vikki carried her weight well and exercised, but she’d never been into conditioning and karate like Madison. Yet no one seemed to think of Vikki as ugly or a pariah because she dressed well and had a positive disposition.

What Vikki and Madison shared was a love of food, preparing as well as eating it. Vikki was a self proclaimed gourmand but Madison held back from indulging for fear of her mom. But now she considered her body as Jeff, who had said she could weigh a hundred pounds more if she wanted, might see it. Wouldn’t someone big like him, even down to 250 as they were striving for, be balanced by a partner with some heft?

“That would be eighty more pounds – probably 25 in my thighs and butt, 25 on my torso and arms plus thirty in my belly. Mom would have a cow!” Madison thought. “But if I could do it with Vikki’s attitude and keep my muscle structure it wouldn’t be the end of the world to weigh that much. I think I can defer crossing that Rubicon for a few more months.”

With that she donned her clothes and headed back for the dorm determined to do her best with Mrs. Wilson. She understood her to be a somewhat militant BBW who apparently liked keeping her son big. Madison suspected this was so that he wouldn’t be sucked in by some self-absorbed sylph. She suspected Mrs Wilson wanted an arranged marriage that would reflect the parties social standing.

She knew the kind of empty headed cotillion types Jeff’s mom probably had in mind. They were shallow and quiescent, not what Madison felt Jeff either needed or wanted. She knew that the challenge was to prove herself as an individual and break down the fear-induced bubble Mrs Wilson had created for herself around Jeff.

Madison over the short two weeks used her resources to prepare. She bought both Cassie and herself new clothes for the evening. They accentuated their larger figures in a complimentary fashion as Madison presumed Mrs. Wilson did. They had their hair done as well, then decorated the dining room in the theme of an elegant private room in a swank café. She was setting a stage without telling Jeff too much and spending the entire ay in the kitchen..

Jeff picked his parents up at the airport around noon and took them to lunch enroute to their hotel. He was dressed nicely for his oversized frame and his father gave him credit for sprucing up. His mom, however, couldn’t help but probe and dig, asking why Madison hadn’t accompanied him.

“I wanted to see you myself first,” he half-lied. The truth was that the preparations for the fancy Beef Wellington dinner precluded Madison from coming and he knew this was her show. But he also wanted to spend some quality time with his parents. After checking in and resting at the local Marriott they headed for the campus where Mr. Wilson had attended classes thirty years before.

The dorm where Madison and Cassie had their suite wasn’t familiar to the senior Wilson, being only twelve years old, but the older buildings brought back fond memories. When they knocked on the girl’s door a large-framed Cassie greeted them and for a moment Mrs. Wilson though this was Madison. But then Cassie introduced herself and escorted the trio into a candlelit room with subdued lighting from candles that reminded him of a cabaret.

“Madison will be out in a moment,“ she said. “We don’t have any liquor of course but there is a choice of tea, soda or water – and we do have appetizers.’

Mrs Wilson took her seat, already thrown off her game by the unexpected atmosphere and display of hospitality. She was used to being in control in social matters and it was obvious someone else was calling the shots here.

Then Madison made her entrance, with Jeff immediately rising to greet her. They exchanged smiles and he presented her to his parents. Madison reached out and grabbed Mrs Wilson’s forearm with one hand and shook her palm with the other. Next she turned and gave Mr Wilson a more traditional handshake. Jeff’s mother observed Madison’s thickening waist line and thought “fitness instructor? This girl could well be as big as me in time!”

Seated around the table Madison first tried alternating questions to each parent, but while Mr Wilson answered at length his wife was terse and, while not totally cold, obviously not that friendly.

This continued as Cassie served the meal in four courses. Madison adroitly got Mr Wilson to talking about his business. She surprised him with questions about the American dollar losing its status as the world’s reserve currency and its possible successors; she also drew him out on the practice of multi-nationals to use countries like Ireland as tax havens. Jeff chimed in and the three built a quick bond.

Much of this was completely over Mrs Wilson’s head. Her forte was social benefit work in various charities, not business, which Madison knew. But even when she brought up the philanthropy of the Heinz and Gates families Mrs Wilson wouldn’t open up. Her mind was swirling trying to regain control against someone who had obviously done her homework.

Jeff was quietly amazed at Madison’s skill in leading the conversation and for awhile played along with the interchange. Finally, however, he brought the subject back to the meal.

“Mom, I hope you enjoyed the Beef Wellington tonight. I think it must of surprised you to find food like is in a dormitory setting,” he remarked.

“Yes, I must say it was outstanding. Madison, I must compliment you on your resourcefulness in finding such a good caterer to prepare this dinner,” Mrs Wilson said, meaning to be complimentary

At this remark Cassie nearly gagged trying to stifle her laughter. Madison as well struggled to keep from grinning.

“Err, mom,” Jeff corrected. “This wasn’t done by a caterer. Madison probably took eight hours to prepare it herself. She learned culinary arts at a private high school.”

Now it was Mr Wilson’s turn to suppress a grin at his wife’s gaffe,

“Oh, well, I’m sorry,” stammered Mrs Wilson, “I never dreamed …”

“Is this where I’m supposed to suggest the men retire to the kitchen and help with the dishes?” Cassie interrupted.

“I think that might be a good idea,” agreed Jeff, motioning to his Father. “I think mom and Madison need to talk alone.”

Once in the kitchen Jeff offered his Father a seat saying, “actually Cassie and I can handle the cleanup – there’s really not room for three of us around the dishwasher.”
,
“Well, all right,” said Mr. Wilson to his son, following orders. “But I’m not too proud to pitch in and do a share. That girl is something else!”

The Wilsons return home and Madison continues her relationship with Jeff
141331121122211111.content:
Mr. Wilson’s ear was close to the door to the living room where his wife was alone with his son’s girl friend – for that is what he felt Madison truly was, whether either of them were formally admitting it. There in the makeshift café Madison reached out to Mrs Wilson, who had a full view of the Freshman co-ed’s developing muffin top and the food baby from the evening meal.

“Does this girl even realize what is happening to her?” the hefty social matron wondered.

“Mrs Wilson,” Madison began, “I think you know that you’re here tonight because Jeff and I share a common problem. We’re busy getting an education and trying to find ourselves as adults. That’s what teens entering college all do. But we’re finding that our mothers, from two quite different perspectives, are fearful that our relationship is going to upset their elders dream's for their cherished little darlings. The message of this evening and display – the formal setting, the special menu, the level of conversation is simple: we’re not crazy and we’re not kids anymore. Why can’t we be allowed our freedom and still have our families trust?”

“I don’t think I entirely follow you,” responded Mrs Wilson defensively..

“I know, now, that Jeff comes from money and you rightfully fear gold diggers. But this is Powers University, where your husband and his father attended. Their family I’ve discovered helped build some of the buildings here. But that information didn’t come from Jeff, He and I got started as students without me having a clue – and frankly, although not as much as you probably, my family had to pay cash for me just like you did for Jeff. We’re both too rich for scholarships and loans. Why do you think my parents wanted me in a private college instead of Florida State? They have the same peer concerns as you and your husband.”

“Well, I guess that makes some sense,” Mrs Wilson conceded.

“The truth,” Madison said drawing a deep breath, “is that I wanted some freedom from their purse strings. That meant earning spending money of my own without it showing up on the family credit card. That’s why I grabbed at the first work opportunity that showed up - and its not the first time I've had a job, by the way. I expected to be coaching a group like I’ve done before, but instead got assigned to your son never having met him. And I had to have my arm twisted to do it – just ask Mrs Green. I know she sends reports to your husband."

“Well, I’m sorry about that,” Mrs Wilson replied, “but you have to understand our concern …”

“Of course I understand, don’t worry. She works for you and your husband just like I indirectly do. I know my salary and bonus aren’t coming from the normal college budget. It was a special arrangement for a benefactor, just like Jeff’s special dorm room. That, incidentally, was the first real tip-off to me as to where you’re coming from. The thing is, we were already more than trainer and pupil by then. We’d become friends – something I’ve had a lot of, but Jeff not so much. But my mother, like you, worries when she shouldn’t be.”

“What do you mean?” bristled Mrs Wilson, “My Jeff would never harm …”

“Of course not,” exclaimed Madison, “but he’s a big guy and my mom doesn’t get that larger people are still human. I think she’s afraid I’ll follow his eating habits, turn into a cow and be miserable – which is ridiculous. Fat people can be just as happy and productive as anyone, as we both know, right?”

Mrs Wilson had donated family funds to size acceptance groups, something Madison knew from her Dad. She was hoping to elicit confirmation on this as a basis for discussion, but there was no response. Madison continued to deconstruct the biases in Mrs Wilson’s mind.

“Jeff will tell you, and it is true, that I’ve never discussed your family’s money with him or asked him for a dime. Nor has he inquired about mine or taken a penny. It wouldn’t be polite and it is not what our relationship is based on. But I think you fear it could be. That tells me that you don’t know me at all and came here with a very preconceived image. I hope that what you’ve seen tonight changes that image – showing you a little of what Jeff and his Dad already know - I'm my own person with a brain, a number of skills and hopefully a good heart for the right man someday. But I'm not looking and you need to stop suspecting what's not there.

“Meaning?” queried Mrs Wilson, who wasn’t used to being lectured to.

“That neither Jeff or I are stereotypical anythings and deserve to be judged for who we are, not against some imaginary standard. It may be scary for you, and my mom as well, but like it or not we’re going to decide in due time where our future lies.” Madison continued. “ And right now we’re both a long way from that decision because we both have degrees to earn first. I think our report cards this semester will illustrate where our current priorities are. “

Mrs Wilson had no response; instead she shifted to the issue that was wedged in her mind – Madison’s girth, the thing Mrs Kraft had as a issue.

“You are aware, my dear, that your weight right now is where I was some thirty plus years ago. Your mother’s fears aren’t entirely unfounded,” countered Mrs. Wilson.

“I’ve been enjoying dorm life and my own decisions have added a few, tht's true,” replied Madison. “Frankly it doesn’t bother me –or Jeff. I don’t think it will ever get to the point that it will, but if it does it will be my problem to deal with then. For right now I’m helping Jeff lose to 250, not worrying about how much I exceed 150.

“So then you do know you’ve passed that point?” Mrs Wilson answered with some surprise.

“154 last week before I bought this outfit for tonight,” Madison confessed. “You can imagine what my mom would be saying if she knew. Fortunately my Dad calls the shots and doesn’t share her view.”

“I wish you well in regards to dealing with her, my dear,” answered Mrs, Wilson, “but I can see there is nothing I can do to influence you regarding Jeff – and for now his father is backing him just like your’s is you. You have shown me that you at least aren’t what I feared you might be. Beyond that I guess there is nothing else to say.”

“Oh yes there is,” responded Madison with a grin, “we sent the men to the kitchen before dessert. I think its time for that now - do you like Crème Brule?”

Mrs Wilson smiled. “Always my dear, always. How did you know?’
