1413311211222111111.content:
After the Wilsons had departed Cassie and /Madison looked at one another, tired but content in their efforts.

“Do you think you succeeded,” Cassie asked, her hand unconsciously stroking her distended belly. .

“In establishing my own unique identity in place of a preconceived persona? I think so.” Replied Madison as she began disrobing. “In persuading her to let Jeff fly on his own without her protective wings, probably not completely. People usually don’t do a 180 degree turn overnight,”

“Did you know her husband probably heard the entire conversation,” asked Cassie. “He was positioned near the door while Jeff and I were working and it was slightly ajar. I think he heard every word.”

“OK by me. I just didn’t want him in the room where she could use him for back-up,” answered Madison as she took in her roommate’s corpulent physique, which she recognized likely mirrored her own.

“I wonder what he and Jeff will say when they compare notes?” mused Madison.

“More important is when he and his wife compare I would think,” answered Cassie as she took in Madison’s expanding stomach..She couldn’t help but wonder why Madison seemed either unaware or entirely disinterested in the weight both they and the rest of the dorm ad been accumulating.

“Whatever, shrugged Madison. “Thanks for your efforts – I owe you a few favors.”

Meanwhile, at the Marriott, Mrs Wilson was retiring and Jeff was with his Dad alone.

“Tell me,” Mr Wilson asked, “is that girl as brainy as she seems? “

“Just about,” Jeff chuckled. “She doesn’t have our photographic memory but has a great retention rate on whatever she focuses on. We’re in a duel for top grade in two of our classes. But she’s more of a social mixer than me – which is why I wonder why she’s been so supportive of a shy recluse like me.”

“Because she’s the type of person who’s loathe to give up on a challenge, She expects success and that takes perseverance. You do know that she has a record of such things, right?” asked Mr. Wilson.

”Uh, not really. What are you talking about?” Answered Jeff.

“She’s at Powers partially because of her record in last year’s Academic Decathlon - - ten subjects shared with a team working together, Mr Wilson informed Jeff. “ Hers was one of the top five in the country. That’s why I wasn’t that surprised at her showing off tonight – she does her research and can think o her feet. She played your Mother like the old vaudevillians did their crowds. Amazing!”

“It doesn’t surprise me – she plays me like an instrument at times too, but never with malice. She just gently persuades,” answered Jeff.

“She’s also coached three groups in high school –one with disabilities. I suspect you didn’t know that either,” his dad continued.

“No, but I can tell your investigation has been thorough. What do you know about the Krafts overall?” Jeff inquired.

“Honest, respectable, financially independent, probably in the low seven figures. She is a chip off her Father’s block it looks like.” Mr Wilson commented. “You have a firecracker on your hands.”

“And don’t think I’m not aware of it. Why she has devoted so much to me given my issues is strange, but I think I’ve been emerging out of a cave.” Jeff observed. “I just wonder whether she’ll still care for me as a person once we’ve reached our goals.”.

“You want that, don’t you?” probed his Dad.

“Yeah, I think I might. But she’s got family issues just like I do, so who knows?” Jeff groused.

“I think you’ll work it out, son. After what I heard tonight she’s in your corner for the long haul. I’ll be the first to say you could choose worse – she’s a gem!” Mr Wilson stated.

The next day as the Wilson’s boarded the family’s jet to fly home Mrs Wilson was abnormally subdued. Her husband knew to let her be with her thoughts. About a hour later she came to his lounge chair aboard the plane and sat down

“I have been rather overprotective, haven’t I?” she stated rhetorically.

“Eaglets must fly out of the nest sometime my dear. I’ve abided by your wishes and left Jeff’s upbringing to you but I think the time has come to let him fend for himself. I think you sense that as well,” he replied.

“Not willingly, but you’re right. She stood up for them just like I once did for you and us,” Mrs Wilson recalled.

“Yes, I noticed that,” he replied with a gentle smile. “Actually I was able to hear most of what you both said. She tried to focus on the two of them rather than critiquing you. I think she wants you as an ally, not an adversary.” Mr Wilson observed.

“Yes, I believe that’s accurate. Her interest is in him, not us or our money. That much was obvious,” she admitted. “and she even knows that interest is going to likely make her get larger as a result – which I know you won’t mind. I wonder if Jeff shares your level of FA appreciation?”

“With someone who can cook like that? I don’t think its an issue. So we’re going to keep hands off?” he inquired.

“I’ll try to. Maybe you’ll need to help by being more involved with me, “ she said, reaching over and pulling him towards her. He responded with a fond hug.

14133112112221111111.content:
The following week, Jeff texted Madison about going to breakfast, it was something they did semi-frequently, and after the week of good workouts, Jeff thought that he would show Madison his commitment to losing weight by getting oatmeal that she had introduced him to.

Madison met Jeff in the dinning hall wearing sweatpants and a sweater. Her hair was up, and he assumed that she just got out of bed. This wasn't abnormal for college students grabbing a Saturday morning breakfast, so Jeff did not put much thought into it. When Madison sat down, he noticed that their plates looked much different. On his, a bowl of oatmeal with some strawberries that he cut up, on her's bacon and pancakes. It struck him as odd that she deviated this much from it. When he asked about it, he was somewhat surprised by Madison's almost defensive answer,

"Yeah, I figure that I can just eat really light for the rest of the day," she said, as she went for the second out of 6 greasy pieces of bacon. For Madison, this was something that she actually intended to do. The rest of breakfast was uneventful, but with the workout in the afternoon, they both knew they would see each other again that day.

Although Madison had gotten some new clothes, she neglected to purchase new workout clothes. She figured they were stretchy, and had a lot of give, so she would have had to gain a significant amount of weight for them to get too tight. However, given what she gained while eating all those meals with Jeff's family and the indulging since then, she was at 165 pounds, a gain of 35 pounds, and it showed in her workout gear. She had shorts in her high school colors that she loved, but it was clearly time to graduate from the small that gave her a bad set of love handles and a muffin top, not to mention how much larger her thighs looked in the short athletic shorts. Additionally, she now had to constantly pull her t-shirt down when workout out with Jeff. Her belly, now lacked any of the former firmness that it once had. Luckily, her shirt was sleeveless, but at the same time, that also showed that her arms looked just a bit bigger as well.

When Jeff came to workout, now down to 310 pounds, he noticed that his instructor looked like she was falling out of her clothes. Of course, he would not be able to tell if she was actually out of shape, because she had long since stopped working out, instead almost preforming as a spotter for him while he went through exercises. However, it was working, and Jeff was losing weight, although he wondered at this pace, if Madison would be in a class like this next year.

After their joint workout session, Madison retired to the women's locker room, Jeff really seems to be making progress she thought as she sat down to take off her shoes, which caused her belly to show out the bottom of her too tight shirt. Just then she got a tap on the shoulder, she turned around to see a random girl there, who was wearing only a sports bra and yoga pants, showing off her six pack and ripped body.

"It's great to see you're trying to get into better shape!" The girl said to Madison.

"What?"

"You're here working out, it's the first step. I just wanted to come by and give you a card for my classes!" Before Madison could cut her off, the girl continued. "Whether you've gained your freshman 15, or just looking to finally start working out, I can help you craft a plan that fits your goals!"

Madison was shocked. This girl saw her and assumed that she was one of those girls who needed that kind of help.

"Um, I actually teach one of these myself." Madison said to the girl.

"Really??" She asked, genuinely shocked.

"Umm. Yes." The situation had become terminally awkward for each of them. This random girl then finished with a "well...good luck with your class, I'm going to go hit the track," and quickly tried to leave the situation.

Madison sat there dumbfounded. It was not like she was huge! Heck, other people had gained 35 pounds before. However, this was a moment for Madison that left self doubt with her. She could no longer be considered skinny by any stretch or generous application of the word, she was actually looking a bit chubby and currently was getting no favors from her clothes, which now felt even more tight in her current state of peer-caused comfortableness. Madison quickly left the locker room, failing to even shower, so she could leave the gym.

The whole experience made Madison suddenly realize what was happening to her body, and second guess herself. She thought about all the awesome clothes she had that had in high school that she had no shot of fitting in right now. Then she realized that going to the beach in Miami was going to be a whole other issue. What is Lindsey going to think? Madison thought, wondering about her hot, 5'7 110 pound, blonde, rail of a best friend from high school. She could be a bit more vain then Madison, and Madison assumed that her judgement would be harsh as well. She also realized that any thoughts of her Mom laying off her about her figure would also be wishful thinking.

From that moment, Madison decided that she needed to place an emphasis on keeping her weight in check that she never had to before. However, her new lifestyle had also taught her some bad habits.

141331121122211111111.content:
Over the next few weeks, Madison tried to curb her snacking, and exercise more with Jeff during the workout sessions.

One thing she also had to do was buy new active-wear, since she wanted to avoid another situation like the misunderstanding in the locker room, so on a Saturday morning, she went to the mall near campus to get some new clothes to wear. Madison initially went to a running store, since she figured that they would have a wider range of sizes, something she never had to consider. When Madison got to the store, she was a bit sad to see that as she moved away from the smaller sizes, the clothes seemed to have a bit less selection, or seemed to be for a slightly more middle aged crowd. Regardless, she picked up some size 12 athletic shorts, medium shirts, and larger sports bras, something that was becoming as equally necessary as her new shorts. Ok, these are only temporary Madison thought to herself, still hoping to get back down to 135 pounds.

As Madison checked out and turned around, she noticed that she was the largest girl in the store. Of course, it was a running store, so everyone there happened to workout frequently, but it still made Madison insecure about her growing figure. These feels of slight stress were alleviated when she walked past a cinnamon role stand. She had never frequented one before, but in her moment of weakness, she decided to try it. After waiting in line, with people larger than herself-- she noted, Madison ordered a classic roll. She was amazed with how simultaneously sweet and rich it was, and almost had to watch herself so as not to be too noticeably freaking out over how good her treat was. As Madison was walking back to campus, she thought again, That was delicious, maybe there would be upsides to just thinking, 'screw it' and giving up on my figure something she did not seriously consider, but nonetheless, a thought that would have been unthinkable before.

Jeff, on the other hand, had been working out hard, and watching what he ate, and lost another 5 pounds, bringing him down to 305. He was beginning to see differences, and was excited to pass the psychological barrier of getting below 300 pounds, a place he had not been for a while. Whereas Madison was finding herself indulging frequently, Jeff was doing the opposite. He was continuing to give the sweets that his mom gave him to Madison and Cassi, who happily (if not regretfully, later) ate them. Unlike Madison, he felt his clothes getting looser, and was looking forward to having to buy new, smaller clothes, ones that he also hoped were necessary, but for the reason that we wanted to lose more weight.

1413311211222111111112.content:
After the encounter with a would-be training coach in the gym, the same job she was doing for Jeff, Madison was understandably conflicted. She began a process of going back and forth on accepting her gain. Her immediate response had been to text Jeff, whom she was feeling closer to all the time. Jeff for his own part was getting past his own weight issues and beginning to think of he and Madison as friends with possible long-term options of more.

Jeff looked at the text and sensed Madison’s need to talk, but knew its shouldn’t be on campus. He invited her to join him at at an Indian cuisine restaurant known both for its exotic flavors and a moderately priced all you can eat buffet. There aromas from the medley of tandoori chicken, lamb shahi korma, flavored lentils, basmati rice prepared pileau style and delicately spiced curries quickly counteracted the emotional impact of the gym encounter.

Still, Madison needed reassurance.

“I know you don’t care, Jeff, and that’s a good thing for my ego,” she said, wrestling for the right words, “but when I’m mistaken for a fitness candidate it means others can tell I’m becoming a fat girl. There, now I’ve said it – fat girl, even as I enjoy this luscious curry with yogurt, garlic, ginger and who knows what spices. The girls in my dorm are all getting chubbier by the week with stuff and I’m liking it more than I should. Now its being noticed!”

Jeff smiled. “And you say this to someone who outweighs you by well over a hundred pounds? Pardon me for suppressing a grine.”

Madison had to blink herself, the contrast was indeed so stark. Jeff truly was a heavyweight, so why was she the she so upset?

“The truth Maddie, if I can call you that, is that you’re right. I’ve always seen you as beautiful. Whatever amount you’ve added has only enhanced that view. If you feel comfortable with yourself what should the opinion of some stranger even matter?”

“It shouldn’t,” Madison admitted. “Logically I know that. Cassie only cares about how her weight gain is inflating her breasts. She’s from a frmtown where big people rule. The rest of the dorm doesn’t seem to care. But I know that eventually I have to go back to Coral Gables. There new fat girl me must face Mama, Lindsey and others who knew me before.”

“Your mom we’ve discussed [- she’ll come around with your Dad’s involvement. But who is this Lindsey?” Jeff inquired,

“One of the skinniest people you’ll ever meet. Nice to others but so appearance conscious! She’s emailed me about going to the beach this summer. It scares me to think of her reaction to me in a bathing suit,” Madison responded.

“I think you should prepare her- if she’s a true friend she shouldn’t care if you don’t. And if she’s not a true friend, then shouldn’t you know it?” Jeff suggested.

Madison took a bite of the luscious shahi korma lamb, drenched in cream sauce with nuts. Her tastebuds exploded in a fit of ecstasy and she sighed, “you’re probably right.I ‘m definitely not wanting to dine on watercress.”

“Maddie, I’m the one who’s hired a trainer to lose weight, let’s not forget that, You may have gained some but you’re not really that big. Be yourself and enjoy life,” Jeff cajoled.

“Yeah,” replied Madison. “Let’s have some mango kulfi for dessert and I’ll check out Lindsey instead of beating up anymore on myself.”

Why did her Mom have to be such a problem?

Now, weighing over 180 pounds with a more comfortable wardrobe, she was about to go into a State competition as the captain of a team. She thought her parents should be thrilled, Her dad was supportive but all her mom seemed interested in was having her be skinny. That, she noted, was a concept that seemed strangely foreign to her dorm mates.

There were four of them, all getting increasingly porky, just like Madison. Despite this, or seemingly because of it possibly, they all had boyfriends, not just Madison. Cassie still was the biggest and Ginger the admitted cake addict. Kelly and Megan had probably picked up thirty pounds apiece on a campus where being heavier didn’t seem to matter. At first Madison had written this phenomena off to Midwestern culture – corn fed farm girls would tend to be bigger, but then she began wondering. Few of her classmates were actually from farms, including herself, but there was a definite break at Powers with the conventional image of figures. Why was it so easy to become a larger girl here and still attract boyfriends – she knew in the back of her mind that things didn’t work that way in Coral Gables.

The next morning in the Powers dining hall she took her eyes off the usual array of enticing entrees, placing special note on what others were having. She opted for a breakfast burrito with a side of fruit, Ginger for two cinnamon buns with eggs and corned beef hash, Megan went with French toast and melons, Kelly with corned beef hash and eggs plus toast, while Cassie had an omelet with apples, a banana and a blueberry muffin. Students from other dorm suites followed a similar pattern.

The variety, as always, was tempting. All across the tables they were scarfing down meals that Madison knew had to be over 1000 calories – and it showed. Most of her classmates seemed a bit chunky. Few freshman were as large as she and Cassie, and of course Jeff, but thick midriffs and muffin tops were common, more so than Madison had bothered to take note of before.

Later that day she commented on this to Megan, who was contentedly devouring a mid-afternoon energy bar between class periods.

“They ought to call this Chubs College, the way we’ve all picked up a few,” she remarked thumping her own belly softly.

“Yes,” Megan answered. “I guess you saw the little op ed in the Powers Proclaimer? I thought it was a little snotty – and I totally disagree with the slap at you and Jeff in it."

“What!” Madison exclaimed. “No, I haven’t read it. What slap are you talking about?”

“Some of the vocal non-chub minority seem to think you and Jeff are too big to be heading up the Academic Decathlon team. Tough titty to them – you guys earned it, you deserve it. They are the type dopes who think the world is defined by their idea of the best body type. Thanks to your boyfriend’s family that’s fortunately a minority view here at Powers!”

“What are you talking about?” replied Madison, by now totally confused.

Megan stepped back, perplexed and replied .”You really don’t know, apparently. OK, what about us picking this up after last period over some gliders at Wingstop?”

“Uh – OK. 4:00?” stammered Madison.

“See you there,” Megan said as she sauntered off.

Madison had to get to class as well, but made point of looking at the Proclaimer as soon as possible where she found the letter Megan was alluding to.

It was authored by Erica Mays, a lithe cheerleader who was part of a clique of more slender coeds than most on campus. “At a time when the nation’s first lady is trying to stop this country’s obesity epidemic, especially noticeable on the Powers campus this year, our faculty seems to have blinders on. We would never permit a fat cheerleader team for soccer, so why pick two obese students to head up the Academic Decathlon team. Powers needs to reconsider this choice – taking into account image along with scholarship in making decisions.”

Madison was hurt – but didn’t know whether to feel more angry or guilty. This girl obviously shared the view of her mom and those Madison had overheard in the gym, but what did Jeff’s family have to do with anything as Megan had asserted? She couldn’t wait to get to Wingstop!

At the end of the class day she called ahead to be sure Megan was actually there. She was, and said she was in line placing an order for them. When Madison arrived at the table (Megan had elected not to use a tight booth) Megan already had a set of four gliders (sauced chicken white meat sandwiched between two freshly baked yeast rolls – sold at two for $5.49) and a large serving of cheese fries with two Dr. Peppers of the table. Despite her focus on Megan’s earlier remarks Madison found herself salivating at the sight of the tasty afternoon snack.

After seating herself and having a satisfying bite Madison came to the point.

“I’ve seen Erica’s rant. She’s stupid for calling me obese, but what does that have to do with Jeff?” she demandedl.

“Think about it. How were you recruited to come here?” countered Megan.

“An alumnus from Powers came to our college recruiting fair. She liked what I did in Coral Gables. She offered me a scholarship that covered half my costs,” answered Madison.

“And part of what she liked was what?” continued Megan.

“The way I led the Academic Decathelon competition – which I guess you’re implying means that they knew it fit in with what they were going to need about now, like scouting local talent for a football team?” answered Madison, getting the implication.

“Yes, but what about the rest of us. Why did we get scholarships? And who funds them to begin with?” asked Megan.

“Well, Cassie was a student service leader. . . ” Madison started to analyze.

“Yes, as was Kelly and even Ginger as well as yourself. Me too. The alumni scouts want leaders or they don’t get scholarships. But none of us were especially skinny, were we? You seem to be the exception and were selected with a slightly different agenda in mind – which is why you haven’t apparently been told,” Megan said analytically. .

“You’re saying that Powers recruits girls who are likely to be bigger or become heavier?” replied Madison.

“And when it comes to guys, also those who appreciate them. Its not the only ones they recruit – you obviously weren’t like most of us because they had a special reason for you, But you weren’t a fatophobe, were you?” Megan bore down.

“No. But what does this have to do with Jeff’s family?” demanded Madison.

“80% of this student body is on scholarships financed by the Wilsons – and size acceptance is a mandatory factor. I know because my Mom is one of the alumni who scouts at the job fairs. Ask Jeff – it was his grandmother who started it decades ago. I’m sure he knows,” revealed Megan.

Madison for the moment was speechless.

“And it turns out you are indeed more than just an academic team captain recruited to fill a role – at heart you are making choices in life that are leading you into becoming one of us,” Megan smiled.

Madison was nonplussed. As she savored a bite of her second glider she thought back to remarks from Jeff, Mrs Green and others – as well as to her own erotic fascination with her expanding body. She was indeed being given choices at Powers and she was making ones which were just what Megan implied. As she finished her fries and drink she pumped Megan for as much as she knew – and, as she refilled her soda cup before leaving, realized she had to talk with Jeff.

The Alumni swing into action after reading the rant
141331121122211111111221222221.content:
“Its basically true,” Jeff confirmed that evening. “The dorm rooms here at Powers are a little roomier, the doors a little wider, the food arrangements conducive to eating generously. It all fits in with both my grandmothers and mom’s views on size acceptance. The Alumni recruiters are selected based on agreement with their philosophy – the entitling of heavier peopleto an equal role in society. Powers is a good college in its own right but there is also an underlying philosophy that articles have been written about. Its no secret. And no, not everyone agrees – as that op ed piece today illustrates. The college doesn’t exclude those with more traditional views.”

Jeff paused, then continued “I’m a bit of a rebel for deciding to lose weight against my mom’s wishes because Dad convinced me I should.”

“I guess I can get that, bur what is Erica so upset about?” Megan asked. “I don’t even know her?”

“Nothing personal, really. She just doesn’t think we deserve to be running the team because it represents an image that doesn’t correlate with the views of people like our first lady. In other words, they feel fat folk need to be seen as little as possible and heard from less.” Jeff groused. “You may have noticed that she never eats in the dining hall – because she lives with her parents in town. They can afford the tuition and its local – she’s not your typical Powers student.”

“So Megan is right about 80% of the student body being screened, recruited and funded by your family?” Madison exclaimed.

“Well, not exactly. My grandmother set up an Alumni fund which the family later supplemented. But there have been other contributors over the years. The alumni run it, we don’t. But there is a theme, just like Tuskegee for blacks or Gallaudet for the deaf,” explained Jeff, who paused and began to smile. “But Erica’s entitled to express her views – and don’t be too upset by them. Its happened before. Watch the next issue of the Proclaimer– there will be rebuttals. Remember who gets the paper!”

“So you’re not bothered by it?” queried Madison. “As for me I know that with your photographic memory and my analytical mind plus the skills of the others on the team we’re capable of winning this tournament at any weight!”

“Of course not. It just a biased op-ed piece by a blind sycophant who’s spouting the traditional stuff,” commented Jeff, “but I know its crap. But its why Chris Christie had to have weight loss surgery and fat jokes are still tolerated on TV whereas ethnic ones aren’t anymore. Its why I’m trying to lose eighty pounds rather than being Mama’s poster boy for a ballooning and successful business man.”

Jeff inhaled and continued. “By rights you and everyone else should be able to decide their own weight for themselves. The problem is sticking to that position long enough to endure and finally drown out the static from the control freaks.”

Jeff had of course been speaking of Erica, but suddenly Madison knew it also applied to her Mother. She knew what she had to do, Jeff was right. Her Mother needed to realize she could lose her relationship with daughter if she couldn’t let Madison make her own decisions.

“You, Cassie and Megan all seem to be telling me the same thing --- don’t let my Mom control me, don’t cut her out, but demand that she respect my boundaries and choices,” whispered Madison

“Exactly. And I think your Dad understands it. After the way you handled my mom I think you can do the same with yours,” Jeff answered.

Madison the next day went and sought counsel from Mrs Green, who had a surprise for her- an opportunity to be a summer camp counselor after her detail to Jeff ended. She smiled when Madison told her of Megan’s remarks.

“About 20% of the student body comes here apart from the ones who the Alumni help fund,” she acknowledged. “They’ve not felt the sting of bigotry and rejection due to their size, or been saddled with guilt because they don’t blend in with the common view. For them people like me who agree with the Wilson’s probably seem bit strange, but it sounds like Megan and Jeff seem to think you’re one of us.”

“Us? But you don’t weigh much more than me,” Madison said, startled.

“That’s because a few years ago I made the choice to lose eighty pounds,” Mrs Green answered. “At fifty years of age it wasn’t to impress anyone, but a precaution for health reasons. As you say, I’m still much larger than you – probably fifty pounds. But yes, you may be in heart be one of us. But remember, its your choice – don’t let Powers just be another type of peer group to conform to.”
”
“Yes,” acknowledged Madison, thinking of her enjoyment of her body and of food, “you could be right.”

That evening Madison wrote to her Mom:

“Mom:

Please know that I love you and always will – even if after reading this you reject me because you can’t accept or agree with my choices in some areas of life. My message is simple and firm without anger as an adult: I must insist that you surrender the desire to control me, even for my own good as you see it, and give me freedom to make my own choices.

My grades are definitely in the top 5% at Powers and I’m heading a team along with a man I’m coming to increasingly care for. Along the way my body has grown to be larger, possibly not in the top 5% but certainly larger than either of us would have imagined a year ago. I won’t tell you how much (I don’t even know precisely myself) but its decidedly more than 15-20 pounds.

There are those who feel that Jeff’s and my size disqualify us from trying to win the competition. Hopefully you do not share this view. I feel the need to stop their mouths. Strange as it may seem I’m comfortable with my new body and, at least for the present, have neither desire or intention of trying to reverse what has occurred and continues.

More news: I have been offered a summer job so won’t be able to come home for the entire 10 weeks. I can, however, be there for two and would like to do it. But I would also like to feel acceptance for myself and my by then 250 pound “new and improved” boyfriend. I guarantee you that I’ll not be that large, at least this year, but hope you’ll agree that my added bulk complements him.

Please consider making me welcome and give me your reply after the upcoming competition. Jeff and I really need to be giving it our full attention. . I do love both you and Dad.

Madison

After composing the letter Madison called her Dad and told him she was sending it to his attention to give to her Mom after making a silent prayer.
