Open Choice
15311.content:
Liz's parents had her stuff shipped into the dorm by movers, a rather unusual and possibly unnecessary step, but pretty in line with the excess that she was used to. Cassi was shocked when she got packages about a week before Liz was set to move in of clothes, but Cassi just had the movers set up the things, or put the clothes in the second closet that was designated as Liz's. It seemed amazing to Liz that her family wasn't just going to move her things in with her, but Cassi in her small town upbringing had come from a much different family than the hyper-competitive, always busy upbringing that Liz was accustomed to.

When Liz finally came on Freshman orientation day, she walked in, to a Cassi who sprung off the couch. Liz's first thoughts centered at the roommate in front of her. Unlike Alison, she did not do any background research or social media friending with her new roommate, so Cassi's size caught Liz off guard, "Oh my gosh, she's fat," she thought, rather disappointed and shocked.

"Hi, you must be Liz!" Cassi said, trying to be friendly to someone whom she knew nothing about, except that they would be living together the next year. In her first impressions, Liz was thin, pale, skinny, and had nice black hair. She was wearing clothing that looked really chic. However, Cassi sensed that back when she was thinner, she was prettier than Liz, as if Cassi had more natural beauty, however, she had yet to learn any kind of personality traits associated with this face she had just seen for the first time.

"Yep. So we're roommates...I'm so excited!" Liz said in what she hoped sounded enthusiastic. In truth, she was slightly disappointed that not only did she have a Sophomore roommate, she had one who looked huge, but she figured she could make the best of it and meet some new guys, or friends outside of dorm life. Plus, her goal was still to ace college and get into a top business or law school, and open up a lucrative career path, so if she had to make nice with Cassi, she could live with that.
15311.title: Liz meets Cassi

choices: Meet Kelli's roommate while they all plan a party
Spend some more time with Sandra's binge week
153112.content:
Sandra Morris arrived on campus ten days before school started. She knew it wouldn’t cost anymore for room and she wanted to adapt to her new environment. Up to now she’d been a studious quiet tyer – nothing exciting, always conforming in the background, happy to let her grades speak for her. It is what you might expect from a loving but strict family background. Now she had a partial scholarship and the opportunity to soread her wings a little.

Sandra had no intention of doing anything wild or getting into trouble. She had no vices such as smoking or drinking and certainly wasn’t interested in drugs. She was hoping to advance her education, have a good time out on her own, and possibly find a boy friend. She was a lithe 124 at 5’7”. all as the result of no special effort on her part. Weighty matters, her own or those of others, were the least of her concerns,

What she didn’t anticipate upon her arrival after a two hour delay at the airport because of a missing piece of luggage was the note signed by her new roommate, Jessica Wright. She knew her name, but unlike Madison had never tracked down anyone’s picture on the Internet. Nor had thery texted, phoned or emailed one another. ,

”Sorry, stocked the kitchen with food for both us and an upcoming psrty, even cooked two casseroles and put them in the freezer, then got called away for a week to a family emergency.

"Enjoy as much as you can – especially stuff that coould spoil. I’ll replace it on my return. FYI, our rent includes free breakfast on the commons ngtil school starts but for lunch and supper we either do our own or pay.”

Sandra sighed. “Well, if I’m alone at least there’s food in the house and I‘m starved. Let’s see what I can find.”

She went to the jammed refrigerator and quickly discovered some mayo, cheese and luncheon meat. Six two litre bottles of soda were on the counter. She made a quick sandwich and demolished it in no time with a large glass of root beer. Then she looked in the freezer and removed one of the frozen casseroles so it could begin to thaw. She also found three of what appeared to be larger than average containers of old fashioned ice cream in different flavors. Examination showed them to be genuinely rare true 64 ounce half gallons - not the dumbed down 48 ounce size common today. She ladled out a generous helping of chocolate chip from the first container and seated herself in front of the television with another root beer. By the time the show was finished she fell asleep.

At three o’clock she awoke from her nap hungry. This time she made two peanut butter and jelly sandwiches which she accompanied with cookies fro a bag and some more ice cream.

By the time the next program was over her belly was bulging but Sandra was dressed only in her underwear, felt comfortably full and took no notice. Instead she went about unpacking and arranging her room. By six o’clock she was done and it was getting colder. She slipped on some clothes and went to the kitchen to see what had happened to the casserole.

“Its softened up quite a bit - I could pop it into the microwave now,” she mused “Bur as nice as tuna and noodles are here should be some vegetables as well.”

Sure enough, she found packages of frozen vegetables and emptied the contents of a bag of broccoli into a pan of boiling water. Then she carved out a hearty serving of the casserole and set it to heating. When it was finished she doused it with ketchup and enjoyed her meal.

“This is the perfect match to some more of that ice cream,” she thought. She had her third helping of the day and noted that it was two-thirds gone.

“Hmmm, at this rate all three containers will be used up before Jessica returns,’ Sandra realized. “Well, she invited me to enjoy so why not? I can’t get fat in just a week and its fun to stuff myself a little.”

The next morning Sandra had digested her eating from the day before and her abdomen was a flat as ever. She decided for breakfast to explore the dining hall on the commons. It could easily seat over a hundred but only about two dozen people were present. The largest group consisted of five girls and four guys. She couldn’t help but notice that three of the five were fat, two of them obese. This surprised Sandra but didn’t bother her.

“It’s nice that the guys here don’t mind larger women,” she thought. As she looked around trying to assess the room one of the guys arose and case over and approached her.

“Hello, my name is Mark I take it you’re new here?”

“Yes, my name’s Sandra. I just arrived yesterday and found that my roommate had to go away so I settled in without knowing much about anything.”

“You must mean Jessica,” Mark replied. “we’re good friends and I expect she’d want me to look after you. Would you join us for breakfast?”

“Well, since I don’t know anyone I guess that’s a good plce to star,.” Sandra replied, walking towards thst table.

“The first two on the left are Jim and Madison with her roommate Allison. Across from them are Tim and Cassie with her roommate Liz. Then we have Michael an Kelli, whose new roommate hasn’t gotten here yet. That leaves two spots for us. Let me introduce you and then I’ll show you the buffet.

Sandra nodded her assent and Mark did the introductions before going wt her to the serving line. He grabbed a try and placed a regular plare and a dessert plate on it.

“It’s free till the start of the school year to give newbies on the staff practice,” he explained, “so take what you want. Meanwhile I’ll be happy to get you tea coffee or milk. I think the soft drink machines may also be working.”

“A large coffee, with cream and raw sugar if they have it please” Sandra replied.

While Mark was getting the coffee Sandra went through the line, having a large waffle, some corned beef hash and what appeared to her to be a cheese enchilada. She put melon slices on the dessert plate,

“I’m going to be tempted to pay for these breakfasts when the semester starts – there’s such a variety” she remarked on her return. Mark, Madison and Cassi smiled. Like everyone except Liz and Alison they knew what would likely happen. It would be five days before Jessica retuned and by then Sandra would be well on the road to acquiring a different life style and figure.

Sje would half-heartedly try to cut back but fail, instead electing to stuff and bond with her new friends
153112.title: Jessica's roommate meets the others

choices: The three girls  discuss the hesavier sophomores over lunch
The girls discuss something else
1531122.content:
Sandra realized that Allison and Liz were freshmen, while the three larger girls were all sophomores with upper class boyfriends. Mark had implied a relationship with Jessica, her so far elusive roommate whose note had alluded to a planned upcoming party.

“Mark, Jessica has several frozen bags of chicken parts, beef patties, buns and snack food for some party. Do you have any idea who or what it could be for?”

“Jim and I had talked about doing a welcoming party Saturday night – he and I are the grill masters around here,” he replied.

“You’re welcome to be part of it and help as well,” volunteered Madison, relieved that the newcomer was apparently more interested in a party than discussing her, Cassie and Kelli’s size. Liz and Alison had seemed rather reticent and Madison was at a loss about getting them to share their thoughts..

Sandra smiled. “I know a few magic tricks, so you might have some surprises.

“Or we could do Karaoke,” suggested Allison. “I can’t sing but I can fake it in pantomime.”

“So who’s all going to be coming – it seems to me we’re short some guys” remarked Liz.

“If we pass the word about free food we’ll get the guys – we just need to remember that booze is banned on campus. I think about a dozen is a good crowd,” asserted Jim

By this time Sandra had polished off her plate. Realizing that the others had had larger portions than herself she decided to have seconds. She excused herself and returned to the serving line. Mark watched with interest thinking “this girl has great promise and will be a positive influence on Jessica”

Then he noticed something that bothered him. A guy dressed in a biker jacket walked up to Sandra. By focusing his attention across the space in the lightly occupied dining hall Mark was able to pick up on what they were saying

“Hey there sweet stuff, you new on campus?” was the biker’s opening line.

“Well, yes, Actually I just arrived yesterday,” replied Sandra, who was thinking “How do I make it clear to his guy that I’m not interested without being rude?”“

So, you looking to make new friends,” he pressed

“Naturally, in fact I’m with some now, but I’m afraid all the seats are taken,” she answered, thinking “hopefully he takes the hint, I don’t want to hurt feelings.”“

Oh,” the cyclist said glancing at the table. ’You’re too much of a beautiful goldfish to be stuck in that school of whales.’

“Or, “ shot back Sandra, her temper flaring inside and fighting for self-control “and with attitude I guess you’re like Captain Ahab, just looking to lob your harpoon? Well, sorry, that’s not the kind of humor I enjoy, so just go away and let me fill my plate”

“Don’t you mean refill? That’s your second one. Keep that up and you might get as pudgy as them you know.” grinned the biker as Sandra ladled some scrambled eggs onto her platter and added a coffee cake.

“If you’re trying to start a fight using stereotype insults you’d better watch it, You’re living proof about what I’ve heard about bikers.”Sandra shot back

“What’s that?” replied the startled bully, who had expected a more defensive response.

“The most dangerous part of the cycle is the nut connecting the handle bar to the seat.,” she replied, looking at him with a steady gaze, then raising her voice . “Now take your crass bigotry and comments and get lost or I might just stumble with this food and the plate will wind up n your face!!

The biker saw Mark rising out of his seat ad took off. Sandra stood watching him with a satisfied smile. Mark rushed to her side, “is everything all right? Are you OK?”

Sandra smiled. “I’m fine – if you’d like to fill up a root beer while I make a taco and cool down I’ll meet you at the table.”

Her new friends other than Mark hadn’t noticed what was happening and Sandra wasn’t about to share, replying to inquiries by saying simply “creeps like that aren’t worth the time. What I need to know is what I can bring to this party we’re planning.”

As it turned out Mark wasn’t the only witness. About 15 minutes later a uniformed member of campus security force approached the table and indicated he wanted to talk to Sandra.

“What’s the problem officer” asked Mark.

“One of the servers felt a guy was coming n string to this young lady.” He replied. “We’ve had two other reports on his approaching co-eds and he doesn’t appear to be a member of the student body.”

“Well, that explains his lack of class,” Sandra noted, “But I didn’t get his name. He was just, well, crude and rude. “

“We’re told you threatened him,” asserted the officer.

“If he didn’t back off, yes,” answered Sandra. “I know martial arts and can defend myself if necessary. But in a public place his abuse was more vocal than physical. I think he just wanted to see what I’d put up with, which isn’t much..

Mark agreed. “Sandra’s right officer. I was tracking most of the entire exchange and he definitely started it. Everything Sandra said he brought on himself. And when he saw me coming over he took off like a jack rabbit.”

“Thank you,” concluded the officer. “If you hear or see him again let us know. We definitely want to talk to him.”

“Yes sir. Now, can I finish my breakfast before it gets any colder?” asked Sandra.

“Go right ahead.” said the officer as he left.

“Well, that was a bit of excitement,” exclaimed Cassie,

“Yes, but I’ve dealt with worse,” answered Sandra. “I really think we need to focus on what we were planning.”

“You don’t seem upset about this at all,” interjected Allison.

“Yes,” agreed Elizabeth. “Are you really trained in martial arts”

“The Kung Fu approach to Taekwondo specifically. And part of our training is to react naturally rather than letting fear take hold. That poor guy was just another insecure bully trying to resolve his inner misery by controlling others. Sandra sighed Someday maybe he’ll become teachable, but for now he’s not ready.”

“That’s maybe why we’re the ones in college and he’s on the outside?” inquired Tim.

“Exactly,” said Sandra. And since you’ve finally said something maybe you can tell us what you’re going to do for the party. Can you and Michael each invite two more guys?””

“Umm, well, OK. I guess so,” Tim said, not entirely comfortable with a new freshman effectively taking charge. But he knew he hadn’t been a leader so it was his own fault. The others just wondered how well Sandra and Jessica would blend given her assertiveness. Sandra for her part was oblivious to this, already thinking of how to make the party a success and develop some relationships for she, Allison and Liz.

Getting back to her room she channeled her adrenalin idea into writing on her computer about the party. Just before 11:00 she received a phone call from Allison asking if she and Liz cold come over. She suggested they do so around 11:30.
1531122.title: Spend some more time with Sandra's binge week

choices: After breakfast, Jessica finally arrives
Something else
15311221.content:
Knowing Allison and Liz were coming Sandra did a quick inventory of the suite she and Jessica were sharing. The layout was identical to the other 19 apartments in the dorm building – two bedrooms that doubled as a study center, common bath and kitchen and a living room/dining area. There were five such suites on each of the four floors plus a common laundry and storage room, all fronting a central multi-story atrium.

There were ten such structures on the campus on one side of a triangular commons. The base of the triangle was the main classroom building with faculty offices in its upper floors. The third side was a structure which housed the college’s dining hall, library and administrative offices. Its opposite side faced the main entrance and parking area.

More parking was available both underground in the dorms and in a structure adjacent to the classrooms. About 20% of the student body lived off the main campus, largely in frat and sorority houses. A gym field was located on the other side of the classroom parking structure, affording added capacity for games.

None of this topography was as yet familiar to Sandra. She’d been there less than 36 hours. Knowing that her visitors would be there during lunch she thought about the spices available in Jessica’s larder and other kitchen resources. First she started a carafe of tea by running water thru the coffeemaker loaded with herbal tea bags. Then she hastily grabbed a package of creamed cheese and a can of tuna, mixing he contents with salsa, parsley and red onion. This created a spicy tuna spread that she put onto a set of three sandwiches, covering them with wax paper and putting them into the refrigerator. By this time the tea had percolated through and could be cooled off with ice cubes and mixed with sweetener.

Less than ten minutes after she was finished her classmates arrived. She invited them to be seated while she poured them some tea. Allison and Liz were surprised at the hospitality, but it gave them the opening they wanted.

“I see you’re into food like Madison – but at least its not soda” said Alison, ”this is an herbal tea isn’t it?”

“Yes, Jessica has several flavors. I sweetened it with Truvia because we apparently don’t stock real sugar,” replied Sandra
“Its probably better for us anyway” commented Liz.

Sandra nodded in agreement.

“So you’re comfortable with this focus on food?” queried Alison

“I don’t know its that unusual – classes haven’t begun and I think the school is promoting camaraderie by giving us breakfasts. I know I enjoyed mine!” commented Sandra. “But I thought you came over to discuss the program for Saturday, not the dining hall.”

“Well, there is that,” answered Liz, “but you do have to admit that Cassie and Madison are beyond plump and Kelli is getting there. Your roomie Jessica is also big I understand. It’s a trend and I think we’re a little nervous.”

Sandra sighed. She’d noted the same thing but felt it was their personal business, not hers. She was in control of her own life and frankly was tired of hearing about weight so much all through high school. To see others comfortable with their size was refreshing. .

She decided to vent her mind, something she’d been reluctant to do while under her parent’s roof. “Isn’t that really their own affair? They all have boy friends, are happy and if some like us are average then others must be above or below. Personally I’ve seen more people our age in the hospital from anorexia than obesity. If I had to choose between weighing fifty pounds more or fifty pounds less which would be healthier?”

Allison and Liz looked at each other. This was indeed a different viewpont they hadn’t thought of.

Sandra continued, “Mark and Jim as well as Mike and Tim seem to be a group that like, or at least don’t mind, heavier girl friends. And since they already have them we’re not affected. They’re not involved with us. The question is, who do we want? Certainly not jocks like that character this morning.

“Yes,” Alison concurred. “by the way, I was meaning to tell you about that. he came on to me last week and I found out his name. Its Bud Morris and he works part time at Sculyer’s Garage, in case you want to tell security.”

“Wow, that is important,” acknowledged Sandra standing up. “Let me write that down so I don’t forget.”

Liz went back to the original subject. “You weren’t there last week, so you don’t know. But like Mark helping you this morning, there was just so much food. You need to be aware they’ll push it o you.”

“Ummm, as I recall I filled up my own plate twice – Mark just carried the drinks. Look, thanks for the heads up, but I think we can all make our own choices. For instance, once we have figured out the entertainment for Saturday I already have sandwiches made for lunch and there’s a box of frozen eclairs we can thaw in the microwave – just so you know” Sandra informed her guests.

Alison and Liz looked at each other. Obviously Sandra didn’t share their concerns. Sandra changed the subject to Alison’s interest in Karaoke and informed Liz of what she could do to help with some magic tricks. By 12:30 Liz asked “are we ready for those sandwiches?”

Alison nodded with some hesitancy and Sandra went to the refrigerator freezer, emptying a package of cream filled éclairs onto a tray which she popped into the microwave for thirty seconds. Then she unwrapped the sandwiches and put them on plates to which she added two eclairs apiece.

Allison winced. “I bet there’s 700 calories just on that plate.”

“Maybe, but if you want to give me one of your eclairs I’ll take it. They’re usually delicious. Bit be sure and try one before you decide,” answered Sandra.

Alison took a bite, “OK, I agree, but we can’t be doing this all the time. I know that!”

Liz said nothing. She was already finished with her sandwich, which wasn’t that big. She was privately wishing there was another to be had and was happly for the eclairs on her plate.

Shortly after 1:00 her new friends left and Sandra called security. Then she glanced down and noticed her protruding food belly. Thinking little of it because she knew it would flatten in a few hours she cracked open a large bag of potato chips and went to the living room where half the tea pitcher remained. After an hour of watching tv the bag was empty. She got rid of the bag into the trash and went to her room for a nap.

Sandra awoke shortly after six, her light lunch fully digested. She was getting hungry and she knew exactly what she was going to do. There were several red potatoes which she knew could be boiled with their skins on, then mashed with Romano cheese, butter and garlic. She planned to make a large batch, saving some for the next day. While getting the potatoes ready she’d let a chicken pot pie cook in the oven.

Sandra enjoyed her supper –not knowing or caring that the pot pie was worth 1400 calories, the potatoes 300 or the large bowl of ice cream for dessert another 500. Added to the 1300 calorie lunch and snack plus her 1400 calorie breakfast she had managed to pack away nearly 5000 calories in a single day. None of this was known or mattered to her. She was full and went to bed content.
15311221.title: The three girls  discuss the hesavier sophomore...

choices: An evening with Sandra and Jessica
Something else
153112211.content:
Sandra slept soundly, awaking shortly after 7:00. Knowing that the dining hall opened at 8:00 she quickly got ready because she wanted to avoid encountering Bud Ramsey. She’d called security and passed along Alison’s information the prior afternoon, but her revelation only made her aware that this guy was hanging out around the campus. It gave her the creeps.

She arrived around quarter past eight. The place appeared deserted because this wasn’t a class day and obviously a lot of people were sleeping in. Se decided to build an omelet from scratch, something she hadn’t even considered the day before, and complemented it with two pancakes, burger patty and a large muffin. It was to her mind a hearty but not excessive breakfast, although with syrup and jelly it was probably 900 caloris.

She settled in and was enjoying her breakfast and thoughts when a voice said to her, “hello, mind if I share this table with you?”

Sandra looked up to see a young male student with his own tray of pancakes and eggs plus a biscuit. He wore glasses and she thought he iht be a bit of a geek. Still, she appreciated the attention and motioned him to be seated.

“My name’s Roger and I’m new here. You?” he inquired.

“Sandra, and I’m also a freshman. Where are you from originally?” she asked.

“Olathe, southwest of Kansas City. The name is Shawnee Indian for beautiful,” he stated.

“Hmmm, must date from the pioneer days,” Sandra observed.

“1857 – before the civil war. It was right on the Santa Fe trail and I went to a Junior High School named after it. The town was half-leveled during the civil war after being occupied by Quantril’s raiders. . But then the railroad came in about 1867 and we’ve been stable ever since.” He volunteered.

“I see you enjoy history,” Sandra noted.

“Yeah, kinda. But I’m going for a business major because schools today won’t let teachers share real history. My mom’s in education and sick of having to “teach to the test” rather than sharing what she really knows.

“What do you mean,” asked Sandra as she finished the last of her omelet and began attacking her pancakes.

“Every class has to take a test and make a certain score or the whole school loses money from the government. The teachers are told to just teach the stuff needed for kids to pass the test because there’s not time for anything more. That too regimented for me so I’m not going into teaching.” Roger declared.

“I get you,” Sandra agreed. “But now you need to ask me some questions so you can eat,. I’m half finished and you haven’t had a bite”

“Whoops – OK, I guess I got into pedantic mode.” He acknowledged. “So, what about the town you came from?”

“I’m a cornfed girl from South Dakota. You’ve probably heard of the corn palace in Mitchell? Well I was born in a small town nearby that’s nearly gone now and we moved to the “big city” when I was two. The best restaurants in town are at the Casino except for one in the old railway depot.. They even have operating model trains there – its really retro, Of course we have Perkins and the fast food chains, but they don’t really count - maybe that’s why I’m actually enjoying the free farm-size breakfasts here. As for history, we’ve been there since the 1880’s but we still only have around 16,000 people.”

Roger had indeed taken note of Sandra’s generous breakfast, and now she’d confirmed what he suspected. She wasn’t one who worried and fretted about her weight like some in Olathe. But more importantly she could talk in multiple sentences without leaving it up to him to carry the conversation.

“Ummm, I don’t mean to be too forward or anything,” he said, “but could I have your full name and campus phone number. Full disclosure: yes, I’d like to find out what restaurants there are around here and take you to one. It sounds like you need to escape from the culinary limitations of Mitchell.”

“Sure,” Sandra exclaimed, and supplied him with the information that he immediately typed into his cell phone. She was sure that anything would exceed the level of the local Perkins restaurant in Mitchell. She had seen personally what generated a thumbs down review on Yelp, “cold food, rude service, and moldy carpet,”

Roger nodded before she continued “Now, full disclosure from me. We’re having a party this Saturday night and are looking for freshman guys to come and mingle. Want to be included?

“Well uh, sure,” Roger replied. He was pleasantly surprised at her assertiveness.

“And another thing, there has been some stuff going on and I wouldn’t mind an escort back to my room,” Sandra told her new fiend about Bud Ramsey and Roger instantly agreed. As Sandra stood he couldn’t help but note as she subconsciously adjusted her snug waistband. Her food belly bulge from the large breakfast was showing, although she knew that as always after a good sized meal it would disappear after a few hours. Still Roger couldn’t help but quietly notice.

On the way back across the commons they encountered a gardener who was thinning out some yellow daffodils which were likely headed for the compost heap. Sandra asked if she could have a half dozen and was given permission.

“These I can put in the vase on our coffee table for my roommate when she comes in later today,” she remarked.

Sandra was back to her room before 10:00 and began preparing for Jessica’s arrival. Mark had indicated this would probably be in the afternoon after he picked her up at the Wichita airport and took her o lunch. She did her laundry and pepared a butterscotch pudding for dessert that evening – something she hoped Jessica would lke. She was nervous, never having had a roommate before, and wanted to make a good impression.

Shortly after 12:00 the phone call came. It was the first time she’d actually spoken to Jessica, who was very apologetic about having not been able to be there when Sandra arrived. She noted that Mark didn’t have her new room phone number or Sandra’s cell. Then she asked if it would be OK for her and Mark to get caught up over lunch, then make the 45 minute trip from Wichita. Sandra assented, figuring that it meant she probably had till at least 3:00.

Sandra smiled with anticipated. The late afternoon arrival meant she had the time she needed to utilize the left over mashed potatoes from the prior evening. Grabbing cheese, mustard, garlic, onion flakes and the mashed potatoes she combined them in a skillet to make four potato pancakes which she then topped with two fried eggs. This she combined with the remaining broccoli from earlier in the week for a succulent lunch topped off with a home made ice cream sundae. Total calories probably 1300 but she wasn’t counting.

Around 1:30 she tidied up the kitchen ad at 2:00 flipped on the television with a snack of four oatmeal cookies and tea at hand. At the half hour break she replenished the cookies and tea. Then she went to her room and laid down, awaiting her roommates arrival.

Jessica didn’t arrive until around 4:00 but Sandra had her bedroom door open and heard her. She emerged to find Mark and a sizeable brunette with small overnight bag. It was apparent she’d left in a hurry and traveled light.

“Welcome home Jessica,” she exclaimed, glancing at the vase of daffodils. “I hope you don’t mind my adding the flowers.”

“Not at all,” replied the bulging Sophomore. She looked to be around 180, over fifty pounds larger than Sandra. “I’ll be honest tough, it was quite a stressful trip and I’d like to crash. But this evening we can really get to know more about one another.”

“Sure thing – I’ve had a nap and can surf the Internet. By the way, supper will be easy. I only used one of the casseroles you left and I made us butterscotch pudding for dessert, so we’re set for supper”. Sandra informed Jessica as Mark stood listening. He detected no criticism in Sandra of his girl friend’s proportions..

“Service beyond he call of duty,” replied Jessica. But can we plan on it around 7:30 or so? Mark and I just had a nice lunch and I doubt I’ll be hungry until then”

“No problem,” replied Sandra. “I’ll let the casserole start thawing but won’t do anything else until you wake up.”

Jessica went to her room. Sandra did as she had promised with the casserole. She also started another carafe of tea, then took the last of the old one with the remaining half bag of cookies to her own room to be comfort food while online. Her calorie count for the day was already 3400 – with supper it would approach 5000. But the corn fed country gal wasn’t counting.
153112211.title: After breakfast and lunch, Jessica finally arrives

choices: Kelli's roommate arrives with the party next day
Something else
1531122111.content:
Jessica’s summer had given her assurance that her family was OK with her new size and she was also sure of Mark. As she lay in her bed resting it appeared that her new roommate Sandra wasn’t a calories counter – Mark had implied as much at lunch. But what about Kelli? She was bigger than Jessica and had tempered some of her remarks, but was she happy with her new circumstances. Or was she still denying to herself that she was fat?

Jessica didn’t really know why she should care – Kelli was Ginger’s buddy, not hers. But she knew Ginger and Michael had added forty pounds to the former coquette’s once lithe frame and that during the summer she’d packed on what Mark estimated to be twenty more. That she knew now made her at least five pounds heavier than Jessica and within 30 pounds of Madison.

She would learn soon enough that there was at least some acknowledgement of reality. Although Kelli still shunned the scale she now knew she was wearing size 16 clothes without any garment swapping shenanigans by Michael – which fortunately she wasn’t aware of. Like Jessica, Madison and Cassi she had more pressing concerns, namely breaking in a new roommate, who hadn’t arrived yet, and she didn’t have Ginger to ean on.

Michael had helped her stock her new kitchen, including a number of comfort foods – including spreads for bagels, which Kelli enjoyed. With a topping such as almond butter or creamed cheese each was worth 400 calories, and Kelli could consume 2-3 in an evening. Kelli wasn’t a cook so of course she and Michael had fast food in addition to the dining hall breakfasts. Whatever habits had caused her to gain sixty pounds were continuing unabated.

Carrie and Madison, however, seemed to have stabilized at 230 and 205 respectively. They knew they couldn’t allow themselves to go on gaining forever. Their roommates, Liz and Alison, saw their sophomore roommates enjoying food but not in excessive amounts. In fact, the newcomers were out eating the larger duo at times, something which at times in her first week gave concern to Alison. Liz had no such worries – she was more interested in meeting guys and didn’t seem to care.

Jessica called Kelli to let her know she was back and they chatted for a few minutes. They discussed the new arrivals and speculated on who might be assigned to Kelli. Then, noting the tine, she went to the kitchen to find that Sandra already had the table set and a casserole waiting in the oven while a package of mixed vegetables was cooking in the microwave.

“Anything I can do to help?” asked Jessica.

“Ummm, maybe add some ice and Truvia to the tea and put in a pitcher,” suggested Sandra.

‘Wiil do. By the way, which casserole are we having” asked Jessica

“I’m not sure. Its not the tuna one and has thin noodles, so maybe that will tell you,’ replied Sandra.

“Turkey tetraziini is the official name,” answered Jessica. “It has a bunch of stuff – chicken broth, mushrooms, spaghetti, an egg yolk, shredded parmesean cheese and even cooking sherry. I think you’ll like it as long as you don’t mind a few calories.”

Sandra laughed. “This has been blow-any-concept-of-a=diet week already –sort of a celebration I guess. Why stop now?”

“Well, look at me and the others. We blew way past the freshman 15 and at first I think we thought we were immune – especially Kelli. To this day I don’t think she admits she’s gotten fat.” pointed out Jessica

Sandra hoisted the casserole out of the oven. “well, one week or one casserole – even with the pudding on top of it, isn’t going to make tht much difference. But within reason I’m frankly tired of all the fuss over weight. That’s what I told Alison and Liz yesterday.”

“Alison and Liz?” asked Jessica. “Oh, the ones saying with Madison and Cassi. Mark mentioned them but we haven’t met.”

“They were concerned about me packing away big breakfasts, but that’s what we always do in the country. Although I admit I’ve pushed the limits this week a bit. But I think that since I’m allegedly an adult now I can decide my own acceptable weight – not the government, doctors, peers or anyone else. So I hope you don’t mind if I occasionally seem to be indulging.” Sandra declared

This declaration was the precise opposite of what Jessica had been fearing. Rather than criticizing the weight of others Sandra was trying to deflect potential critiques of her own. She relaxed and told Sandra, “I’m sure glad to hear that and agree with you entirely.”

With that the girls dived into the casserole, each having about a thousand calories worth – plus the butterscotch pudding for another 500 apiece.

“You know, when it comes o food I think ‘m an Epicurean because I enjoy it for the pleasure of what it tastes like, not just to survive on,” remarked Sandra, “And this casserole is an epicurean masterpiece. Where did you get the recipe?”

“I adapted it from one online, “ replied Jessica. “Mark likes casseroles and other foods – so maybe I ‘m a culinary Epicurean at heart as well. Although in philosophy class you’ll learn that he was also a pagan philosopher who opposed the stoics and Plato.”

“OK – I’ll handle that when I get to it,” acknowledged Sandra, “but at leat we agree to enjoy and not worry when dining.”

“Agreed,” said Jessica, hoisting her glass of tea.

Elsewhere in the building Cassi and Madison, with culinary help from Jim, were introducing Alison and Liz to another version of epicurean pleasure. It was a shepard’s pie made up of leftover meat loaf, carrots, corn, mushrooms, gravy and cheddar cheese and stretched for five with mashed potatoes and side dishes of peas and green beans with French bread.

“This is almost like Thanksgiving,” commented Liz.

“It is actually a good way to use up Thanksgiving leftovers,” acknowledged Jim.

“Except in this case we have a complete cherry pie and ice cream to share, not leftovers,” noted Tim.

Liz seemed willing enough to go long, but Alison, although thoroughly enjoying the meal, couldn’t help but wonder if eating like this wasn’t why Cassie and Madison were so big. What neither girl seemed to note, however, was that both Cassie and Madison were taking time to savor and masticate every bite, while the two newcomers were eating faster and consuming more.

As for Kelli, who wasn’t skilled enough in the kitchen to make much of anything for Michael, she’d called him up and they’d had supper in the dining hall – pizza and chicken with ice cream for dessert.. Since she’d already had her two bagels for the evening she felt totally full. But she wanted to have her roommate arrive and was getting antsy. As for Michael he was wondering if any of the others could tutor Kelli in cooking.
1531122111.title: Treading water while awaiting Kelli's Roommate

Kelsey can't believe how large everyone at the party is
15311221111.content:
Kelsey arrived to campus later than the rest of her peers. She had wanted to spend a bit more time at home, plus she felt lukewarm about coming to Powers to begin with. Kelsey was always decent at soccer in high school, not good enough for a scholarship, but always decent. However, she had been emailing the coach of the soccer team to see if she could walk-on. He was the type of coach who liked getting okay players who were gym rats, to push the scholarship players in the gym, so he was on board. Kelsey and him had a good rapport, and she was all set to go, until he abruptly took another job that summer, leaving her at the mercy of a new coach.

For the few days in between knowing her soccer fate, Kelsey kept up with her strict training regimen. She ran a over 3 miles per day, and had a light weights routine going, and it showed. Her legs were strong and hard from all the running that she had done, and she had a washboard stomach, without an ounce of fat. She didn't have much of a rack, and if she was ever going to gain weight, it would have been bottom heavy. She had light brown hair, that was often up in a pony tail. Yet, seeing Kelsey, one would most likely doubt that could happen, in her current athletic appearance. She was the girl who everyone saw in athletic clothes all the time, and she wore her trainers everywhere.

Eventually, Kelsey got an email--from the new soccer coach that Powers hired. The news was not good. "My coaching philosophy is quite different, and I prefer to focus on a small core of players. I wish you the best of luck in future endeavors, although I am afraid they will not be with Powers Soccer." Kelsey was crushed. "Ugh, the only reason why I choose this freaking school was to walk onto the soccer team. UGH."

Kelsey had a decision to make, would she take a year off and go somewhere else? That seemed kind of drastic to her, she didn't want to become a non-traditional student. It was too late for her to change schools and participate in the fall, no admissions would let her in on this timeline, even with help from other coaches. Kelsey frantically tried to find something that could work, and sent game footage to a wide variety of coaches. Finally, she heard back from one.

"I like your intensity on the field, we can't do anything this year because my team is full, but if you file transfer paperwork after one year, and keep your skillset, I may have some room on my team," Coach Shella Stevensen of a rival squad wrote.

Kelsey was overjoyed. She now had no reservation going to Powers, she would just workout like she always had, and she would be fine, get to play soccer, and all would be right in the world.

It is probably necessary to note at this point, that Kelsey was not only a fitness freak, but a fatophobe.

She had requested an athletic roommate, and she ended up with Kelly. In a cruel twist, Kelly had checked that she was athletic--over a year ago when she first enrolled as a freshman. That was a long time, and many pounds ago, and Kelsey was about to end up in a bad situation that she would have no problem gossiping about to Liz and Allison.
15311221111.title: Kelli's roommate arrives with the party nex...

choices: Kelsey has her first two meals at Powersa University
15311221112.content:
It was Friday morning, almost 9:00. Since classes woudn’t start until Moday Kelli was still sleeping in when the phone rang. An unfamiliar voice introduced herself as Kelsey.

“Uh, hello Kelsey,” Kelli said yawning groggily. “Do I know you?”

“Not personally yet, but I’m told we’re going to be roommates this year.” replied the voice.

Suddenly the fog in her brain began clearing and Kelli realized who she was talking to – her missing roommate. She immediately began to consider the state of the dorm site, her state of dress, how she was going to make a good impression.

“Oh, yeah, Kelsey. Where are you? Are you coming up?” Kelli asked.

“Well, not immediately. I haven’t even taken off from the airport. But I’ll probably be there in mid-afternoon. I just thought I should call ahead rather than just showing up. Frankly I don’t even know how to get there once we’ve landed. There have been issues about whether I’d even be coming, but those have been taken care of. Anyway, the plane’s scheduled to come in at 2:30 so you can figure it from there,” Kelsey gushed in a torrent of information.

“OK, thanks. I guess I should get your number and see if I can arrange some way of having you met at the airport and some other things. Is that OK?” inquired Kelli.

“Sure,” said Kelsey, “I’ll be available for about a hour before boarding.”

Kelli jotted down the number and called Michael, who agreed to drive to Wichita and pick Kelsey up. He also pledged to make himself recognizable by wearing his burnt gold cardigan so that he would look totally out of place in the airport. Then she called Jim and asked if he’d prepare a supper if she paid for the ingredients. She knew he was already committed to the party the next day but after a brief discussion he agreed to help out. Then she called Kelsey and told her what she’d arranged.

Kelsey was favorably impressed by her new roommate’s hospitality. She obviously wasn’t a disorganized ditz and had friends. Those were good signs that being stuck at a small school wasn’t going to be all that bad despite her own frustrations.. She reminded herself that Kelli wasn’t to blame for her own situation, so she just needed to get along and play nice. Her future depended on it.

Kelsey got onto the plane and when she found her seat she rolled her eyeballs. Her focus was her athletic career and as a result she was also a fatophobe. She found herself sharing a three seat section with a large woman passenger who easily weighed double Kelsey’s 115 pounds. She was sure her seatmate would need a seatbelt extender and Kelsey worried that she might wind up being squashed if a third passenger showed up.

Fortunately serious nothing happened but her seatmate did indeed get an extender. Kelsey marveled at how unabashedly she requested it. The woman reminded Kelsey of her biggest fear – becoming obese. She couldn’t help but ask herself “has this woman no sense of shame over how immense she is?”
The trip went uneventfully, her seatmate occupied with a book and aping while Kelsey kept to herself. After they landed she was one of the first passengers off the plane. She went to the baggage turnstile where she observed a 20 year old man dressed in slacks and a cardigan. He was waiting for baggage but obviously hadn’t been a passenger. From Kelli’s call she knew this was probably Michael.

“Hello,” she said walking up to him. “Are you from the college?”

He turned and looked at the slender but apparently friendly source of the voice. “If your name is Kelsey, then yes. I’m Michael. How much baggage am I looking for?”

“Just two suitcases,” replied Kelsey, who had her carryon including her laptop over her shoulder. “they’re marked with bright yellow tape with red letters.”

“”OK. You can put your carry on that cart over there,” he said gesturing “and I’ll get the others as soon as they come off the line.”

Within twenty minutes they were on the way home and Kelsey let Michael know how much she appreciated his efforts – while also relating her opinion of her fellow passenger. Michael knew that his girl friend Kelli wasn’t nearly so large but was put on alert by the monologue. Obviously there was a potential for trouble.

He had seen Kelli’s breakfast that morning. Huevos Rancheros with two eggs, rice, beans and a large muffin on the side. All told it was a typical 700 plus calories breakfast for the indulgent Sophomore, who still insisted she was at worst moderately plump. Kelsey, Michael realized, would likely have another opinion.

At the apartment Kelli had vacuumed the dorm suite and sprayed orchid scented air freshener in Kelsey’s bedroom. Jim meanwhile was preparing an appetizing cinnamon apple salad to go with a main course of diced chicken a la king in a succulent sauce over biscuits accompanied by cajon grilled yams and sweet peas. For dessert he was using a store-bought cherry pie with ice cream

Michael drove along, making small talk and keeping his reservations to himself, but bracing for what he feared could be trouble. Finally they arrived on campus and he called Kelli to let her and Jim know they were on the way up.

Kelli had the door open and Michael wheeled the bags into the apartment heading for Kelsey’s bedroom. As he did Kelli emerged from the other bedroom door. and Kelsey nearly lost it. Although not as humongous as he woman on the plane she saw Kelli as fat! Before her reaction became obvious Michael stopped, went over to Kelli and gave her a warm hug and kiss,

“Thanks for taking care of my new roomie,” Kelli exclaimed.

“No problem, darling,” replied Michael, making the relationship clear to Kelsey. Any remarks directed at his chubby girl friend would have consequences.

Just then Jim emerged from the kitchen. He announced “welcome from the culinary department as well. I’m Jim and supper will be ready in about 45 minutes.”

Kelsey found herself fighting for control as the delicious aroma from the kitchen flooded the room.

“I think we need to get these bags into the bedroom and let you unpack,” volunteered Michael.

“Yes, I guess you’re right. Sorry, Kelly. I’ll try to be ready on time,” replied Kelsey, struggling to keep her real feelings hidden. She succeeded. Kelli, savoring the aroma from the kitchen, was oblivious.
15311221112.title: Some more about Kelsey beforte the party

choices: Kesey has most of a day to think before the party
Kelsey comes to the party and is shocked at the girl's average size
153112211121.content:
An hour later supper was served family style. No one pressed Kelsey on her portions and she loaded her plate with the salad, praising it as outstanding. , She also politely partook of the main entrée and side dishes, albeit in portions about one-half those of Kelli. Michael and Jim.

During the course of the meal Kelsey was invited to the party the next evening and she accepted, hoping to meet guys who weren’t already spoken for. She was also invited to breakfast, which since it was free she also decided to accept. Anything to fit in and get along; that was what she knew was critical for her own future. But when it came time for dessert she demurred.

After Jim and Michael left Kelsey told Kelli she needed to finish unpacking and Kelli smiled, telling her she understood. After Kelsey retired to her room Kelli took Kelsey’s rejected dessert along with two cinnamon raisin bagels spread with cream cheese and a large soda to her own bedroom for comfort food; such grazing had become her common habit.

The next morning it was Kelli who awakened Kelsey, telling her that Michael had called to inform her that some big news was going to be shared at breakfast. They needed to be ready in thirty minutes.

“What could be so important?” queried Kelsey.

“You don’t know about this but we had a creep stalking the campus pestering co-eds. He’s been identified and picked up. Now apparently the police want Sandra and Mark to witness a police line-up. I don’t know why - I guess we’ll get the full story there,” gushed Kelli. “I have to get dressed, you too, so no time to talk.”

Kelsey couldn’t help but notice the bulging rolls of Kelli’s torso, broad hips and thighs without an inch of light between them.

“No doubt about it,." Kelsey thought. “She’s a nice enough person but she’s a hippo.”

When they got to the dining hall Kelli confirmed Kelsey’s opinion by loading up her tray with a burrito, two pancakes and some scrambled eggs – probably an 800 calories breakfast. Kelsey winced and exclaimed “isn’t that a lot? Aren’t you concerned about your weight.”

“Oh I know I’ve gotten a bit thick – especially compared to when I came last year. But Michael likes meat on the bones and I’ve come to enjoy being a big eater. It’s only been a few pounds – not like I’m really fat,” chirped Kelli.

Kelsey was non-plussed. She took some melon slices, yogurt, and a piece of toast. When they got to the table with Mark, Jessica, Michael, Robert and Sandra she was astonished – the plates of everyone else were just as full as Kelli’s. Jessica was just as big as Kellli, though Sandra appeared to be average.

“What,” she wondered “have I gotten myself into?”
Mark confirmed Kelli’s summary. It seemed Bud Ramsey was now a suspect in a disappearance case, but to confirm his modus operandi the police needed he and Sandra to pick Ramsey out of a line up. Because of the weekend this would happen on Monday after classes.

“Nothing like a little excitement to kick off the school year," remarked Sandra, as she finished her plate. Kelsey had noticed she seemed to be eating somewhat faster than the others, not really chewing her food or talking as much .

Robert noticed the empty plate as well, but first had a question. Heasked “can I go with you on Monday? I’d like to be there for moral support – maybe go somewhere afterwards.”

“Sure,” said Sandra, hesitantly glancing at the buffet,

“Great!” exclaimed Robert. Then. picking up on the hint. “By the way, is there something I can get you?”

“Well, I’ve already had eggs and corned beef hash. But I was thinking about some of those jelly-filled Danishes with milk and maybe two of the raisin oatmeal cookies,” Sandra replied.

“Coming right up,” Robert answered as he rose and headed for the buffet.

Kelsey could barely believe what she had just seen – the smallest girl at the table besides herself had just added seconds to an already large breakfast. And what Sandra had come to call her “food belly” was showing as usual. This of course didn’t matter to her since she knew it always flattened out after a few hours.

After breakfast Michael and Kelli informed Kelsey that they had things planned but would be back for the party. Kelli invited her new roommate to help herself to anything in the kitchen

Kelsey smiled politely with false courtesy, thinking “like I need to be stuffing my face and getting huge like you! Since you don’t cook maybe I need to be the one who buys the groceries and prepares the meals. It may be the only way I can avoid becoming a fatty here!”
153112211121.title: Kelsey has her first two meals at Powers Unive...

choices: Finally, on to the party and meeting all fattys
Something else
1531122111211.content:
After awhile in her room Kelsey felt cooped up. She decided to take a walk around the campus to orient herself. When she got onto the elevator she encountered two other teen girls wearing halter tops and shorts. The difference was in their physiques.

“Hello,” the first one greeted her. “My name is Allison and I’m a Freshman. Are you?”

“Yes, my name is Kelsey” admitted Kelsey as she took in Alison’s obviously athletic body, toned from hours of tennis playing and exercise. She appeared to be pretty much in condition, which was better than could be said for her friend, who appeared to be thin and wan in her upper body but fuller in her bottom and lower gut...

“Mine’s Liz,” said the shorter of the two. “we’re going over to the gym to work out.”

“There’s a gym open here?” exclaimed Kelsey. “Why doesn’t anyone tell me these things?”

“It’s all in the student handbook, “ replied Allison. “You probably just haven’t had time to read it yet.”

“That’s true. I just got here late in the afternoon. Maybe I’ll come join you,” she said,

As Alison and Liz strolled away Kelsey analyzed their bodies.

Alison was long boned and slender like herself. For all Kelsey knew she could be into track or even on the soccer team. Whatever the case she wasn’t carrying any excess flesh and that impressed Kelsey, “I need to get to know this girl better – she could be my savior amidst all these fatties.”

Liz in her vierw was quire another story. Althogh ot overweight she wasn’t lean either and her shorter frame carried tell tale clues that Kelsey picked upon. She of course did not know that Liz had been rid of her samall pot belly for over a year. However she did hsve a residual FUPA ( fat upper pelvic area) which had an effect she shared wityh others who in similar post-weight loss straits.
Like many such persons she wasn’t hat conscious of the FUPA’s presence but it still had a tendency to cause her pants, whether shorts or jeans, to ride higher than normal. Kelsey had seen this common phenomena before and it told her a world about Liz – she was a fatty in remission who could easily gain back whatever she had lost.

Liz understood rthe risk as well, although her level of concern differed from that of Kelsey.. At her low point in high school she’d been down to a size six and was only impressing her mother, who she once told that she rather craved having pizzas and burgers even if meant being a size 12.

Another time, feeling rebellious, she had threatened to observer National Donut Week – a fiction of her own imagination. Currently after the summer she was a snug size 8 and willing to exercise to keep in shape. But being lodged with a bodacious brunette behemoth like Cassi wasn’t the end of her world at all.

About an hour later Kelsey arrived at the gym dressed in her workout outfit. Liz appeared to have been working hard but was now wiped out, her bulging FUPA lower belly bearing evidence . Alison, however, was sweaty but still ready to go. She asked Kelsey if she wanted to jog around the track.

Kelsey pondered. She knew she was fresh and in good condition. She didn’t want to embarrass Alison. She therefore agreed to pace her for half the distance before cutting loose, remarking “you can try to catch me but I’m going to push myself so don’t feel bad.”

Alison assured her she understood and would just maintain her own pace. At the half way mark Kelsey cut loose and beat Alison by many furlongs. A totally winded Alison staggered in 30 seconds later.

“Let’s get something cool for lunch.” Alison suggested.

“I’m ready for that.” agreed Liz and Kelsey decided to join in. To her surprise both Alison and Liz had lo cal salads, although Liz drenched her’s in ranch dressing.

“This should tide us over till the party” remarked Alison.yeah, given the guest list there will e plenty of fod, ich is why I’m skiming now. I hea ?Jim’squie the chef” Liz shared

“I think I may be coming to the same party!” interjected Kelsey. My roommate’s boyfriend Mike and a guy named Jim talked me into coming to one tonight.”

“Yep,” chirped Liz. That would be Michael and Kelli with Jim and Madison – that Alison’s roommate. I guess you haven’t met her. Cassie, my roommate, is going be there with Tim as well along with Jessica and Mark.”

“Yes, I’ve met Kelli and Jessica – in fact we were also at breakfast along with Mark, Robert and I think her name is Sandra. They’re all nice. But where I’m from those two would have a hard time getting guys,” observed Kelsey.

“Not around here apparently,” laughed Liz, glancing at Alison.

“What do you mean,” queried Kelsey.

“If you think Kelli and Jessica are big you should see our roommates – equally as nice, both with boyfriends, but definitely over 200. You can make book on that. Having once been larger myself it makes me less scared are of regaining if it happens,” observed Liz.

“And that’s all up to you, “ agreed Alison. “For me, I want to be able to run and play tennis so getting that big is something I intend to avoid. But some are born to be bigger or just enjoy eating.

Kelsey’s mind was swimming. The girls at this school, even those not themselves fat, had a totally different perspective than hers. Fat was ugly. Fat was bad. Fat was just plain wrong. Or was it really her that was wrong? Liz was right. Kelli and Jessica were ice enough people and had guys. So did Sandra apparently, even though she had been scarfing and inhaling her food down her pie hole like there was no tomorrow. Kelsey was feeling totally confused as the three co-eds went back to their dormitory.

When they got to their dorm Kelsey went immediately to her suite. This left Alison was free to chat with Liz

“So you weren’t kidding when you told me you were just a reformed fat girl in a thinner body?” Alison remarked,

Liz looked at her new friend and decided she could be open even though she was an athlete. “Yeah, I’m actually 20 years old now – I just don’t look it. I graduated two years ago and was a little chubby then, probably 145-150. Then I got a job in retail and wasn’t too active. I had money of my own and bought a lot of pizza and ice cream because I enjoyed them. Also I think I was probably able to start eating bigger breakfasts since I had my own wheels and wasn’t having to walk a quarter mile to the school bus stop on a schedule every day.”

“OK, plus walking back in the evening. You lost exercise time both ways,” observed Alison, “but what do you mean bigger breakfasts?”

“Instead of a bowl of cheerios or a couple of pop tarts I could now have pancakes and eggs or French toast. And since I was making them I usually had around three, not just one. They tasted better than the other stuff, and since I was making them myself no one was monitoring me. Well. after about four months I noticed my clothes getting tighter . I knew I must be gaining a few pounds, but I didn’t care. I just bought looser ones. That was fine for everyday wear but I had a muffin top when I stuffed myself into my old jeans. I didn’t think it was all that bad and just kept on eating whatever I felt like.” Liz continued

“And of course gained still more,” prompted Alison.

“Exactly,” replied Liz. “I’d have what was now for me a normal breakfast at home plus a pastry and coffee before work, then a good size lunch and sometimes something on the way home. Next thing I knew I was over 170 with a real muffin top. I could barely wiggle into my old jeans and when I did I could grab my belly fat and make it jiggle.”

“Wow, that must have upset you,” exclaimed Alison, her eyes widening.

“You’d think so, but actually it was arousing and just made me want to eat more,” recalled Liz wistfully.

“Really?” replied Alison

“Yes, continued Liz. “I wasn’t upset about my belly or appetite because I still had friends and dates and wasn’t going out in public that way. I didn’t think I looked bad as long as I dressed in clothes big enough to fit, It was stuffing myself into the old ones just for the thrill of it that got me in trouble.”

“What do you mean?” said Alison.

Liz sighed and rolled her eyeballs. “My step mom saw me one day fooling around, freaked out and told me I needed to go on a diet and loose weight. She even took notice of my love handles. I told her I was over 18 and had the right to eat and weigh whatever I wanted to. That shut her up for awhile but I knew she was ticked off.”

“So you cut back to make her happy”? Alison concluded.

“No – that might have been wiser.” Liz replied. “Instead I bought stuff that I could snack on at night and made it obvious to her what I was doing. She told my Dad I looked like a stuffed sausage. That was just her opinion, not mine. My belly wasn’t past my bust line or anything – I was just kinda stocky. But she and he then put me on a diet which I had to follow or get out of the house. It took over a year to lose 45 pounds and my lower belly is still there.“

“Does it bother you?” Alison inquired.

“My lower belly or that I got fat in the first place?” Liz replied

“I guess both,“ Alison answered.:

Liz took a deep breath as tho choosing her words carefully. “I like eating and didn’t mind my weight, but I know it is not the normal thing to enjoy being so big. So I’m trying to get with the program and conform, but I wish society wasn’t so hung up and I’d put up with the pounds just to be able to eat what I want. The real problem is that guys stopped dating me because I wouldn't let them buy me food to eat or drink. I had to make the weight loss goals and they didn't care for that. ”

“Well, Madison and Callie, not to mention Jessica and Kelli, seem to be defying the odds.” noted Alison.

“I’ve seen that," agreed Liz. “But they don’t have my dad and step mom to contend with. And they’ve got guys who support them. I’m at a double disadvantage. If I had my way I’d be having a banana split and root beer about now! That salad was good, but it isn’t enough for my appetite. I want an entrée and dessert to go with it. But I know I don’t dare –eating like that would have me back it fatsville in a year! Its going to be tough living with Callie because inside I’m another her! Its only been a week and I’m already envious of her freedom.”

Alison shook her head. She wasn’t envious of or upset at Madison, but obviously Liz had real issues within herself.

The two girls went to their rooms to await the party. After about a half hour of fuming Liz got up with some emotion.

“Screw it,” she thought. “I’m not going to pig out but I’m not going to starve myself either.”
With that she went to the kitchen and made two toasted cheese sandwiches which she devoured with a glass of chocolate flavored milk. This appeased Liz’s appetite enough that she was able to dispose of the evidence and then get a nap. For her part Alison had already been asleep for an hour and would be fully rested for the party.

153112211121121.content:
That evening the three girls went to a party. Alison was dressed in a jean skirt that showed off how thin her legs and waist were and that she had commonly wore in high school. She also had a tight shirt on, given how fit Alison was, she did not have much of a rack, however, she always thought it was a pretty good tradeoff. Alison didn't mind people who were larger, but she was still a social animal, and wanted to stay thin. Being pretty popular in high school meant that she had expectations and standards, so she wanted to get with some hot guys while she was in school.

Alison walked down to Liz's door and knocked. When Liz answered the door, Alison realized that they had different style. Both were wearing skirts, however, Liz's seemed much more stylish and expensive. It also hung differently, it showed less leg. Maybe it was Liz buying more upscale, less "high schooly" clothing, or maybe it was a hold over from her larger days, Alison was not certain. However, as she moved upwards, she noticed that Liz's clothes didn't have any clothing chain logos on them. Alison took note, wondering if her somewhat rural style would have to be adjusted now that they were in college. Regardless, the girls were excited.

"Heyyyy, ready?" Liz asked Alison

"Yeah! Let's do this." She responded.

Next was Kelsey, who had choosen a wardrobe that showed she was fit, but also masked her more muscular legs, since deep down she had always wished she were a bit smaller on the lower side of her body. Sandra was dressed like she wasn't even thrilled to go out, just in normal clothes, possibly a nod to her more down to earth upbringing.

The girls walked in a pack to the party, they were freshmen after all. Their older roommates had made the decision to come separately, they didn't want to completely fawn over the freshman experience of a new class of people, so they started a trend of always being cautious of the new girls' space.

However, while Madison was getting ready, it was hard for her not to dwell over the effect gaining 80 pounds in one year had done to her social scene. She loved being with Jim, but she couldn't remember the last time that a guy hit on her. She also missed a lot of her smaller clothes that had showed off her former beach bod. As she pulled over the dress that was supposed to hide some of her larger figure, she noted how soft her butt had gotten, and her legs even felt more squishy than they were a few weeks ago. She also challenged her decision to go sleeveless, as it showed off more pudge in her arms as well. Madison was in the process of accepting her body, but still, an event like a party would always be hard. She would see skinny girls and think of her former self.

When the pack of Sophomores arrived at the party, Kelsey saw how large some of them looked in their too tight clothes.

"Oh my gosh," thought Kelsey, "Madison's belly is bursting out of that dress. How can she let herself be seen like that?" She also turned her attention to Cassi, "Geez, she should wear some shapewear, those rolls are all over."

Kelsey was still proud of her soccer body, and highly critical of those who had gained anything, this was in part because Kelsey had never struggled with her weight.

As the party got rolling, Allison got pretty tipsy and enjoyed talking with a few guys, as did Kelsey and Liz. They seemed to be a hit at the party. Jim also noticed that while the girls seemed to eat more while drunk, which, he chuckled to himself, was pretty typical. But as he looked at Liz's bluge which looked a tad bigger than last time, he wondered if it would stay in tact.

1531122111211211.content:
Madison lay in bed, listening to the birds greeting the day on Sunday after the last party before classes resumed. She knew it was past dawn and glanced over at the clock, at the same time pulling in air with a deep yawn, It was 9:40. She caressed her fleshy belly, part of a body 80 pounds greater than when she was in high school.

The number seemed large but somehow it didn’t bother her. She was a big woman, sure, but she had a guy who loved her, her mom and reconciled herself to her daughter’s right to be her own person, and Madison was free from the diet tyranny she knew others struggled with. It had been nice to go to a party where women of size were dominant and everyone of them spoken for. Sandra and Robert seemed to be pairing off as well, leaving three unattached freshman girls to deal with six available men

Jim and Mark had done well on the entrees with Jessica’s replenished food stores. Callie and Madison made sure drinks (non-alcoholic of course) and desserts were in full supply. Then came the entertainment and games, including Sandra as mc, Allison doing Karaoke and Liz doing a guitar solo. The evening was topped off by a final round of desserts. She hadn’t noticed any obvious pairing but no one was a wallflower.

After this Madison was ready to sleep a bit later But she had other concerns as well. Classes would start the next day and she had her reputation as a writer to consider as well as choosing a career. Jim had told her to get a good rest and expect a nice surprise. He 200+ pound bombshell wondered what was up.

She slipped out of her night clothes and showered, then climbed into a plus size blue and white blue pleated skirt that barely reached her knees. It was less confining for her thunder thighs than trying to cram into jeans. Then she slipped on a matching hi-lo tank top from Ashley-Stewart. It was an attractive coordinated plus-size outfit that looked natural, as though she’d always been a large girl - unlike the super-tight outfit she'd been wearing the night before to titillate Jim.

By now it was slightly after 10:30 and Jim, punctual as always, would be there at 11:00. She turned on her computer, checked her e-mail sand began surfing the net. At five minutes before the hour her cell phone came alive, Jim announcing he was parking and would be right up to get her.

He smiled approvingly at her outfit and followed it with a compliment. After a quick hug and kiss they were on their way.

“We’re going to get completely away from the campus for the day,” he said. “I don’t want what were going to talk about getting circulated until its announced. Do you mind Subway?”

Madison thought of her appetite, realizing that her stomach was still costing after the night before. She wasn’t actually really hungry and here it was nearly lunch time. “That’s fine – you did a great job last night and I’m still not over it.”

Soon they were settled in the corner of a Subway, each with soda and a pair of foot long Ciabatta bread sandwiches, his of tuna and her’s a turkey breast. Jim had picked the location for its isolation because, even though they were four miles from campus, he didn’t want to chance being overheard.

He began by recalling where they had met.

“Maddy, you remember a year ago you started writing for the Powers Proclaimer?”

“Yes, you were my editor and for four months I never saw you – I just turned in my articles and they appeared,” she acknowledged.

“They were good enough I didn’t think they needed major changes. But what would you write about if you could choose?” Jim probed.

“Well, last year it was fashion, then restaurants and entertainment I could do hsrd news but haven’t pushed it,” Madison rambled in free thought, not knowing where this was going.

Jim nodded “What about political and social commentary?”

Madison wondered what Jim was getting at and chose her words carefully: ”ummm – some people might find my views somewhat controversial.

Jim smiled. “I was hoping you’d say that because it fits perfectly what I’m about to discuss..

Suddenly Madison put down the remaining half of her sub. He had her attention. “Exactly what are you talking about?”

“Well, we must have been doing something right last year,” Jim answered. “because this year I’m associate publisher and its been suggested you be feature editor. That means you can write on what you want and even assign articles. What Professor Hastings wants is for this sleepy campus to take more notice of the paper. Its being squeezed by the internet and social media. No reasonable topic, including the faculty and community, is off limits. The only pre-condition is that we vet our sources and present fairly the facts on both sides,”

Madison was silent. Professor Jonathan Hastings was the head of the Journalism department but she barely knew him. She had a torrent of ideas but going public with them wasn’t something she’d anticipated. And who besides her would be willing to contribute? This wasn’t 1900 where people spent an hour on their daily paper.

“We could start by emulating last year and not getting controversial until we have something truly meaningful. We need to encourage positive improvement, not just change to be different or sensationalizing scandals,” she suggested. “I’d need to find some reliable writers willing to express themselves in sentences rather than text language shorthand.”

Jim and Madison began kicking names around and Madison finished off her sandwich, excited about the offer. When they were finished they headed home, Madison’s mind focused on possible topics. For some reason she kept thinking about the Bud Ramsey affair.

15311221112112111.content:
Sandra’s binge week was over. It had been nice stuffing herself to her stomach’s delight, seeing her food belly pooch out and then go away. She knew it had been totally self indulgent, but it had also kept her mind off the obnoxious creep Bud Ramsey and even brought Robert into her life.

“He may even like bigger girls,” she realized. “At least he doesn’t mind my appetite.”

At the party the Saturday before Sandra had intended to be moderate. However, with Robert plying her with seconds and treats, that had turned out to be relative. She had wound up eating about what Jessica and Kelli did and definitely less than Madison and Callie. She didn’t know about Liz, but she knew she’d packed away more than Allison or Kaley.

Sunday Sandra and Jessica had slept in, then made a light sandwich and soup brunch. They then went to the market to restock groceries. Most of the day was spent on laundry and preparing for classes. Jessica prepared a casserole for later in the week and suggested Sandra should decide what would be done about desserts. In the evening Mark has turned up with Tex-Mex food from Taco Bell and soda, so Jessica broke out the ice cream. She and Sandra partook generously of both.

Now, on Monday, Robert would be going to the lineup today with her, just as her roommate Jessica would accompany Mark. The two girls both had early classes so had gone to breakfast together. Sandra was surprised at her appetite. However, determined to exercise discipline and even though she would have liked more she settled for a burrito and two pancakes. She was surprised that Jessica just had eggs and a beef patty with cantaloupe.

“Aren’t you hungry today?” she inquired.

“I could be. But I tend to take time eating and I don’t want to be late the first day for class,” the stocky sophomore replied.

“Uh-huh – I guess I get that. This is probably more than I should be having, but after last week it doesn’t seem like it,” Sandra replied.

“Calories are the same regardless of the time of day. I’m trying to hold mine to around 2500 so that I don’t gain much more. I’d never hear the last of it from Kelli if I did,” Jessica sighed.

“I don’t think Kelli has much room to complain,” noted Sandra. “You’re about the same size. And if I eat all year like last week I could be there too!”

“Hang around Robert and it could happen – I hope that doesn’t bother you,” probed Jessica. She didn’t think Sandra was hung up on weight or judgmental, but wasn’t sure.

“Guess we’ll just have to see,” Sandra replied with an indifferent attitude. “OK – I need to get going.”

“Me too. See you at the police station this afternoon,” answered Jessica.

Sandra had three classes back to back followed by a 1:00 course after a lunch break. She tried dropping by the dining all but it was crowded and she decided she’d have something after 2:00. Robert would meet her at 3:30

Bt 2:00 Sandra was really hungry. The dining hall was still open but out of most menu items. What they did have was plenty of spaghetti with sauce and meatballs plus French bread rolls. She loaded her plate and quickly made it disappear. Then she went back for dessert, winding up with a strawberry sundae and a soda refill because all the ice cream was gone.

In another ten minutes the sundae too was history and her bulging food belly bore testimony. She caressed it gently, then noted a difference. Normally it was distended and firm with the adjacent skin stretched tight. Now however the adjacent flesh felt just a little softer.

“Am I actually gaining some weight,” she began to wonder. “Its only been a week and my clothes aren’t any tighter? ”

She glanced at the clock. There was still plenty of time and she had seen a scale under the sink in the bathroom in their suite. she considered going back to her room and checking, thinking “maybe I do need to start counting calories or exercise a little. I don’t mind gaining some weight but not the freshman 15 in the first four weeks!”

She texted Robert that they’d need to drop by her dorm before leaving, then pulled open her book bag and began reading an assignment. When she noticed Robert coming into the dining hall about thirty minutes later she pulled her waistband up over her snug food belly. He noticed her adjusting her pants to give her food belly room as she stood. He smiled but said nothing – the empty plates told him all he wanted to know, thinking to himself with a smile. She’s had a good lunch and dessert.

When Sandra she got to her room she switched into some looser fitting slacks, then went into the bathroom and got on the scale. She was relieved that the scale only said 126 – two more than last time and part of that could be clothing.

“I guess I just need to do sit-ups – my abs are getting soft from my food belly expanding and contracting” she decided. Donning a long over blouse that covered her waist she went out to see Robert, who still pretended not to have noticed.

On the way to the police station, about a fifteen minute drive, Robert asked Sandra about what they were going to do. She explained that, according to Mark, there would be five identically dressed men of the same height. They had to separately identify the one who had been in the dining hall.. Mark suspected that there was involvement with something bigger at stake but couldn’t be sure.

At the line up Robert was allowed to go in with Mark, leaving Jessica and Sandra alone. Jessica noted Sandra’s change of clothes.

“Yeah, I had a big lunch and my belly got big like always. But my tummy felt softer so I got on your scale. It must be soft muscle ‘cause I’d hadn’t really gained anything. But I changed clothes anyway,’ declared Sandra.

“Its brand new weight for you Sandra, and the pounds on the scale come in spurts. The first extra calories simply build the cell walls, then come the ones which fill the cells up – that’s when the pounds on the scale register,” explained Jessica. “but you could also be right about your abs.”

Before Sandra could fully digest this she was called by the guard to come and view Bud Ramsey. She didn’t see Mark and Robert, but was instead escorted to directly to a viewing room. Picking out Ramsey was easy – second from the right. She was thanked and returned to the waiting room. Around 5:30 they were released to leave. Mark and Jessica had plans to meet up with Jim and Madison. Sandra noticed that by this time her food belly had completely receded - she was ready for whatever Robert had in mind for supper.
