15311221112112111121112222221122.content:
Liz was a committed breakfast eater. Unlike Calli, Kelsey, Madison and Alison (all of whom could wait till lunch at will) Liz knew that not eating her first meal would destroy her focus in class. That is why she faithfully stopped by the Power’s University dining hall each morning and had an egg plus a strip or two of bacon. She was trying not to regain her lost pounds, but being energized for her classes took priority.

She knew better than to follow Sandra’s ballooning example. Her classmate thought nothing of adding 2-3 pancakes to a serving of eggs double the size of what Liz had. Or if not pancakes, then a pastry with hash browns. Sandy liked to justify her eating as from the stress of the Ramsey trial, but Liz didn’t believe it. She’d noticed Sandy eating even more during the complimentary meal week before school , even bragging about her food baby.

Her familiarity with Sandra’s patterns didn’t stop with breakfast. The multi story dorm building they shared had a certain social rhythm. Callie and Madison hosted a pizza night for interested coeds on Thursdays. Of course Sandy loved pizza so always came over; Liz lived with Callie and saw her each week, routinely devouring 5-6 pieces to Liz’s 2-3.

Mark and Jessica ate in on Wednesdays and of course automatically included Sandy as Jessica’s roommate. Liz had been invited twice and noted that Sandy had seconds on about everything, including double rolls and dessert.

Robert had friends who had parties on Sunday and Tuesday plus usually ideas of his own for Friday and Saturday. Liz knew he tried to encourage Sandy to eat her fill and had never seen him fail.

This pattern Liz knew meant that Sandra was eating large meals or party food every night but Monday, which happen to be one of the three evenings Liz’s own roommate Callie was working in the campus Library.

Three weeks into the school year, just after Kelsey’s big break, Liz was planning on having breakfast in the dining hall on Monday about the same time as Sandra. They decided to sit together and Liz noticed that Sandy was having her typical large breakfast – eggs, corn beef hash, and a large jelly filled pastry. Sandy had to adjust her slacks a bit in sitting down and Liz wondered if maybe they were feeling snug. As a former plumper herself she knew the signs as pants grew too small for the belly within. .

Both girls were on short time for class, but Sandy invited Liz over for supper. Liz accepted, not knowing what to expect. That evening she found out. A broasted chicken from the supermarket, baked potatoes with sour cream, green beans and a store bought pie. Sandra wanted to share her feelings about the news media pestering her regarding the trial – which she couldn’t respond to per the police and prosecutors. Then she wanted to watch a movie for relaxation.

Liz, seeing that Sandy was indeed a little stressed and not wanting to be alone, went along with this. She actually had a good time. Unlike the partying Sandra, Liz had been becoming a book worm. At the end of the evening Sandra asked if they could do this regularly and Liz agreed to “if she could.”

Liz by this point was feeling rather secure about her own weight issues. She hadn’t noticed any re-gain of her lost pounds and she was getting dates. She began to relax some of her morning discipline. Instead of one egg she allowed herself two. Instead of two strips of bacon it became three. Then she began to have an English muffin or a piece of toast – with jelly of course. It was more filling and she felt it helped tide her over to lunch.

Lunch was also at the dining hall. The first few weeks Liz would typically have a small salad and possibly a half sandwich. But she was always kind of hungry by afternoon, so the week before dining with Sandy she started having a little more. Like the larger breakfasts it seemed to succeed in keeping her from becoming hungry before supper. Her guard fell further and further. The day after her dinner with Sandra she actually had a dessert with her lunch. It was heavenly.

For the rest of the week Liz zoned out, eating whatever she felt like. Had she been counting she would have noted that her total caloric intake had jumped by a thousand calories a day to nearly 2500. And by the next Monday, her scheduled supper with Sandra, she had figured out what was likely to happen even without the numbers.

“I feel guilty tonight,” she confided to Sandy after helping demolish a casserole with an ice cream sundae for dessert. “I’ve been letting myself eat like crazy this past week and I know its going to show. The insane thing is, I don’t want to stop.’

“Then don’t,” her fellow freshman replied. “I’ve gained a few pounds this year myself and don’t care. Haven’t you noticed how big some of the sophomores are and they’re handing it. Who are we foollng? Some of us enjoy eating. Big whoopee!”

Sandy’s bluntness surprised her.

“So you don’t mind getting larger?” she exclaimed

“If I did would I be partying so much and eating so much at the dining hall? I know I tell people its all from stress, but that’s a cover. Sure, I’m stressed but I actually enjoy playing with my chub, and so does Robert” Sandy declared. “I’ll probably get as big as Kelli or Madison eventually and I don’t care.”

“What about your parents?” Liz inquired.

“As long as I make a 3.5 average and am happy they could care less Its my life and body!” Sandy declared. “That’s why I could kiss off that busy body psychologist I told you about. I wish Madison would do an expose in the Proclaimer on her for snooping where no one should be. If I enjoy being thicker that’s no one else’s business and a problem that’s not a real problem that needs solving.”

“You sound like you’d like to abolish weight related ads,” observed Liz.

“Definitely. They give false hope, don’t work and those who really need to lose weight usually can’t do it without a doctor. Its not done by someone giving phony baloney hope in an ad,” railed Sandy.

“I wish my mom were so open minded,” Liz replied. “I didn’t mind being plump but it was all that I heard about ‘till I lost it.”

“I understand and feel for you. But, yeah, I like being a little thicker,” repeated Sandy. “I also have Robert, but I know you don’t have anyone in your corner like Mike, Jim or Tom.”

“Yes, that would help. I think then I could stand up better to mom,” admitted Liz.

Afterwards she went home and looked in the refrigerator. She found a half empty box of mini-éclairs and, knowing Callie wouldn’t mind, had an extra dessert before bed.

Liz wished that she had a more understanding Mom like Sandy's, however, she doubted she would ever be able to say any of what Sandy told her back to her Mom. Her Mom was image obsessed. It could of come from their high social standing, or maybe even her Mom's own insecurities, but Liz highly doubted that her Mom would ever be fine with her gaining much weight at all.

However, this did not keep Liz from further indulging. She was often slipping bacon into her breakfasts, something that she often joked was her main vice. She was never going to find any protest from her roommate either, Cassi often had snacks around the room, and Liz saw her eating them in most of her spare time, or to help her study. Liz and Allison had talked when they first got to campus about how their roommates had each gained so much weight the year before, and this seemed to be the reason, for anytime after lunch that Cassie seemed to be coming or going from something, even something pseudo athletic, like a swim, she had some kind of food in her hand.
----
Clark had been quite pleased about how the date the evening before went. He learned a lot about Kelsey, and she seemed more than willing to share her triumphant evening with him. He called Michael to ask how it had gone. Michael confirmed that it had indeed been a hit. After Michael got off the phone with Kelly, he asked about it, "So," he asked Kelly, "what did you think about last night."

"It went really well!" The blonde said, "Actually, Kelsey and I were talking, and I think that she wanted to go out with Clark again, soon." Michael was pleased with this info. He was relayed it to Clark, who was now trying to think of another good date idea, and smitten with himself, that he was laying the groundwork to get with an athlete. An athlete on the team for odd reasons? Yes. But still, and athlete, went his reasoning.

--------------------

Liz was rather bored that same morning walking back from two classes that felt like they would never end when she got a text from Allison, asking if she was interested in hanging out. Liz was pleasantly surprised by the text, since it seemed like Allison and Kelsey usually worked out at this time, but she responded and they met at in Allison's room.

Liz walked in, "Hey, where is Madison?'

"She's working at the paper right now."

"Doing what?"

"I don't know, she didn't tell me, I guess we'll find out later."

"I guessed you would be out exercising with Kelsey right now."

"No, actually you wouldn't guess it, but her being on the team may cut that down a little bit," Allison said.

"Oh, why is that?"

"Well, as long as she is on the soccer team, she is going to be practicing with them, and doing drills specific to the sport. So that leaves me on the outside for the time being."

"Wow, that sucks." Liz replied, trying to be sympathetic.

"No, I'm happy for her." Allison wasn't lying, she was pleased that a friend who she thought was getting a raw deal had a chance to show her stuff. However, it was also true that Allison was now lacking for a workout partner. She wondered about asking Liz. She also wondered if Liz looked a bit fuller? Maybe she would want to make sure that didn't turn into anything else?

"Hey," Allison noted, "want to go to the gym with me?"

"Eh, I'm a bit hungry."

"Come on, there will be hot guys! And plus, it feels really good when you're done."

Liz sat there...she wanted to have lunch, but maybe she could convince Allison to come with her to the dinning hall instead?

Liz waffled. She wanted to help Alison, but after two energy-draining classes since having a light breakfast with Sandy she was hungry. Then she remembered something else.

She pensively replied “Alison, to be honest, I didn’t eat much for breakfast and have two more classes to go. But besides, aren’t we both on the two meal a day plan for the dining hall? If we don’t use our voucher for lunch we lose it, because neither of us are coming here tonight – its Thursday and we’ll be at Madison’s for pizza.”

Alison sighed. She knew Liz was both right on her facts and obviously not interested in the gym. She decided she could work out another time and turned towards the dining hall. Her own breakfast hadn’t been that large either and maybe she could just have a salad..

As they entered they ran into Greg Williams and Don Snyder, two fellow freshman they both knew by name but not much more.

“Greetings,” said Greg. “Going to lunch I assume?”

“Yes,” replied Alison.

“Its pretty crowded at this hour. Mind if we share a table with you girls?” he continued.

Alison glanced at Liz, who smiled and shrugged her shoulders.

“Sure, why not? Its not like we’re carrying on secret negotiations affecting the fate of the world,” Alison joked sweetly.

The four freshman loaded their trays and found a vacant able. Alison had a tuna salad with some fries on the side. Liz chose a jalapeño cheeseburger, also with fries. Greg served himself spaghetti with meatballs and vegetables. Don had mashed potatoes wth chicken thighs and peas.

“Powers U does have variety in its dining hall,” Don remarked as he glanced at the variety.

“Yes, and its all good, “ agreed Greg as he wound his spaghetti on his fork, then glancing at Liz, “By the way, weren’t you mixed up in this court deal that’s been in the paper?”

“Indirectly, yes. I knew the name of the guy who pestered Sandy, Bud Ramsey. He’d approached me the week before but not so directly and it never got reported then. How did you know” Liz asked.

“Someone in the dorm brought it up that you were the one who told Sandy his name. I’m glad the guy is off the street.” Greg remarked.

“Yes, the way to best pick up girls is to invite them to a group party and get to know them and they get to learn to trust you,” Don concurred, “which of course is part of why we wanted to talk to you two.”

“Oh?,” said Allison, who preferred the change in topic,“You’re doing a party?”

"Our dorm is doing one Saturday – no liquor but plenty of food, dancing and games,” Greg stated. “It begins at 6:00 with a buffet supper.”

“More food for the famished fems,” Liz chimed in. “No wonder no one loses any weight around here!”

“And this is bad because?” asked Don. “Neither of you look like you have a thing to worry about. But for the record I prefer plump to snobby any day!”

“Agreed,” said Greg. “Think you can make it?”

“Don’t see why not. I want to meet new people,” Alison replied.

“Count me in as well,” said Liz.

“And with that negotiation completed, I offer you delightful ladies your choice of dessert, which of course is on the house” Don offered.

Alison hesitated but Liz almost eagerly said “What are you having?’

“Apple pie with vanilla ice cream,” said Greg

“I noticed some oversized brownies with nuts,” replied Don.

“I’ll go with the pie a la mode,” Liz said.

Alison, not wanting to offend, took a deep breath and said “I guess I’ll go with the same.”

The four freshmen finished their meal and dashed off to their classes, with Don taking special note of Liz’s slightly plump form. None of them noticed a visibly agitated Robert in an animated discussion with Sandy.

“Well, I’m glad you assured her that I’m my own person and run my own life, but she does have nerve,” Sandy was exclaiming, talking about her nemesis, Dr Janelle Farnsworth.

“What I want to know is who it is that is yanking her chain,” Robert groused. “She rather pointedly asked me how many times a week we eat together, like she already knew. I pointed out to her that you had an appetite before we started going together. Sure, I like it but I didn’t invent it, so I can’t be held responsible as the cause. But she flat out asked whether I was encouraging you.”

“Why, do you think, would she say that” Sandy asked.

“I think because Bud Ramsey, or more probably his attorney, expects you to blame your weight gain on him to get the sympathy of the jury, like it’s a kind of revenge. He was sort of a fatophobe about your friends when he was trying to get you to give in to him.” Robert speculated.

“Yeah, there is that, but its crazy. If anything eating helps me not think about him but I’d do it anyway” Sandy protested.

“But Dr. Farnsworth doesn’t know that,” Robert observed,

“Yeah, you’re right. Yesterday I was telling Liz that the Proclaimer should do a profile on her harassment – now after what’s going on with you I’m getting more serious about it,”

Robert winced. He knew he had in fact been an encourager, and Sandy a cooperative gainer, although not for the motives Dr Farnsworth was attributing. He just like watching his as girlfriend was becoming bigger. But did he want this featured in the Proclaimer? He didn’t think so.

“Sandy, is that the wisest thing? Right now we go where we want, enjoy what we please, without attracting much attention. I sort of question whether making a public issue of this wouldn’t be playing right into the hands of Ramsey. “ he said analytically.

Sandy thought a minute and sighed, “you’re right. But don’t think I won’t threaten her with going public if she creates any more hassle. But I’ll keep quiet at Madison’s pizza feed tonight. Now, would you care to serve me some of that luscious coconut crème pie m’lord?”

“Definitely, m’lady” said Robert obediently.

Sandy contentedly rubbed her food baby, which was sticking out quite nicely.

Kelli emerged from the shower to the smell of …. Pancakes?

Quickly switching into her sweats she made her way to the kitchen to find Kelsey indeed flipping a pancake in the skillet with several already on a plate. In a bowl was a large amount of what appeared to be scrambled eggs with something reddish inside them – could it be salsa? A pitcher of tea, a small carafe and a cup of brown stuff was also on the table.

“What’s with the lumberjack breakfast?” she inquired. “I thought you were supposed to be teaching me.”

“I am and intend to continue,” replied Kelsey as she began cooking her sixth and final pancake, “but I need to practice myself to be sure I know where there might be problems. That’s applying sports thinking to the kitchen.”

Kelli, missing the point, looked confused and said nothing.

Kelsey sprinkled some blue and boysenberries around the base of a stack of three hotcakes and put it in front of Kelli. “Try it. Tell me what you think – by the way use that spread as well.”

“What is it” asked Kelli cautiously.

“Almond butter, and the liquid in the carafe is a different kind of syrup. Now spread some on, use the syrup, dish out some eggs and take at least two bites of each, then give me your verdict.” instructed Kelsey. “I’m the coach in this game so be a good team player and follow instructions.”

Kelli wasn’t too sure but did as instructed, then smiled. Kelsey’s breakfast was good.

“Isn’t this a ton of calories?” she asked.

“Nope, Less than 25% of the dining hall for the same quantity and more high protein than meets the eye,” replied Kelsey. “the pancakes are made with oats, water, cinnamon, protein powder and almond exact. The eggs have two thirds of the yolks removed with yogurt paprika plus salsa added. And the syrup uses blood oranges with some real sugar. The berries are anti-oxidants Next time we do it together and the time after that I’ll be in the shower trusting you to do it right. Deal?”

This was the fifth of Kelsey’s health oriented breakfast menus, two of which Kelli had already mastered. She had to admit the would be soccer team star knew something about food. Kelli had never dieted and knew she wasn’t being asked to. Still she realized this stuff was both healthful and good tasting. But she wondered if this is what Michael expected. Or even what she wanted.

“Deal,” Kelli nodded in agreement as Kelsey filled her plate.

“So, your first tryout is coming up?” she inquired.

“Yes,” replied Kelsey. “And I’m told the Alumni Association is expecting me to do well – they’re even pressuring the Coach to counter the offer for next year that I have and dangling a scholarship at Powers if I do well enough,”

“That’s wonderful,” exclaimed Kelli. Have you told Clark?”

“Uh, no. Why should I. We barely know each other. We’re not an item,” shot back Kelsey.

“Ummm, well, maybe I’m not supposed to tell you this but he was quoted as saying it was too bad you were only going to be here one year. He thinks you’re a nice person and he’s into athletics himself,” Kelli informed her dorm mate.

Kelsey was surprised. Clark had encouraged her to talk about herself but hadn’t volunteered much concerning his thoughts. Then she thought about Alison, whom she’d brushed off twice in the past week and seemed to be hanging more with Liz. Could Kelsey’s focus on her own career be causing her to miss the obvious?

“OK,” she responded. “I’ll tell Clark. And mayber Alison too. I thionk shemay feel I’ve been shuning her. But you can understand why, an’t yolu? Now that the Proclaimer has gone to bat for me I have to focus on succeeding both in the classroom and in the field.

“Of course,” answered Kelli, “And I appreciate what you’ve been teaching me. I need to test some of these recipes out on Michael.

That evening, Kelsey walked over to the locker rooms early. She wanted to get a jump on her eventual teammates and focus on the practice ahead of her. Kelsey had often tried that in high school and it worked very well. Now, she walked into the room hoping she would be alone, so she could visualize what a successful practice would look like. When Kelsey walked in, she saw that someone was there even earlier than her, Greta Hopkins. She was their Senior center-back who was probably the only legitimately good player on a team full of sup performers or flat out spare parts. When the old coach had recruited Kelsey, she saw on tape how good Greta was at sensing where the game was going, and closing down one side of the field near the keeper, while efficiently getting the ball out of the penalty area. Her ability one one side only showed how inept the other half was.

"Oh, hi," Greta said, putting tucking her jersey into her shirts, "are you the girl who is filling in while Janice rehabs her injury?"

Kelsey, from looking at the roster previously, knew that Janice was a senior, the other center-back so Greta probably would be friends with her. "Yep."

"Well, don't get used to it. Janice's injury is not a season ending one, and you'll have to prove yourself if you want to hang around for any period of time. This isn't high school."

Kelsey wanted to snap back at her, something like, Yeah, from your record, my high school team could have given you guys a run for your money or something of that variety, but instead she tried to be more subtle, "Yeah, well Janice seemed to be letting you down on her side of the field, and I play center back."

Greta didn't like that pointing out of an individual, "Hey, we win as a team and lose as a team, no one is letting me down," and with that Greta walked out of the room.

Kelsey sat there in the locker room, which only had half the lights turned on, and got ready, now collected with only her thoughts, fine, if she's going to be like that, I'll have to earn her respect. Kelsey walked out onto the field, hoping to show that she could cut it at this level.

---

On the other side of campus, Alison was waiting nervously for Kevin to come to the room. She knew that she liked him, because usually she did not get this kind of eagerness tied in with nervousness before a date. She had put on some trendy clothing and was ready a bit early, all she could do was wait. She went to the couch and turned on some college football. It was just starting to get a bit cooler in the air, and the football game as a backdrop felt comfortable and right for her, given her upbringing in the somewhat rural town where football was by and away the most popular sport. She flipped out her phone and texted some people, waiting for Kevin to come so they could go to the party.

----

"State is beating U by 7 right now." Eric replied.

"Hmm. 8:44 left in the third? Tons of football left," Kevin noted.

"No doubt. You usually don't see teams this highly ranked this early in the season."

"Text me score updates."

"You can't just check on your phone." Eric replied.

"Well...ok good point."

Kevin started to walk out the door.

"Good luck with Alison." Eric shouted at him, smiling.

Don Snyder started to don his shirt but noticed the strain on the bottom two buttons. He grimaced and shook his head. The shirt was one from his high school days – before 15 pounds this summer and no doubt a few more at Powers U. His belly wasn’t huge, but had developed enough of a pudge that he had taken to wearing newer polo shorts to class because they concealed the gut overhang at his betline. He went to his closet and found a shirt two sizes larger and out it on. He buttoned it easily. His pants, however, were more snug in the thighs and a little uncomfortable. He sighed and made a note to get some newer ones.

His roommate Greg Williams emerged from the bathroom. Like Don he’d picked up a few Powers pounds as well, but his clothes at least fit loosely. .Greg hadn’t dieted during the summer. He’d had had a job in his brother’s construction company that burned a lot of calories. He’d actually lost about seven pounds but by now had regained them plus a few.

Neither guy thought of themselves as more than perhaps a little husky, and since they both like eating and plumper girls their respective gains didn’t bother them. They just hoped that at this night they could find some non-anorexic types that could happily consume some calories without complaining. That’s why they’d invited Allison and Liz to the party – the way they ate in the dining hall and the thicknesses of their midriffs, especially Liz, had raised their hopes.

Don had tried to follow up with a phone call to Allison, only to learn she’d already invited a friend, Kevin, and that Liz was planning on coming with them. He also learned that Alison was the roommate of one of the editors of the Powers Proclaimer, Madison Kraft, whom he knew was a definite BBW but also spoken for. Still, if Alison was getting along with her it was encouraging.

As chance would have it the two FAs arrived just about the same time as Kevin, Alison and Liz. After introductions Kevin and his date headed for the buffet line, leaving Don and Greg with Liz. She was dressed in an attractive party dress that displayed a slight tummy bulge. With her brown hair cascading down over her shoulders and friendly demeanor Don thought she was lovely and his face showed ir. The only trouble was Greg.

Greg held a similar opinion but his primary interest had been Alison and he knew what Don was thinking – he needed to get lost. He suggested that Don and Liz join Kevin and Alison while he saw if he could help the party organizers. Don nodded and squired Liz to the buffet line. She followed his lead in picking up half a sub sandwich, a piece of chicken with some vegetables pus mac and cheese.

“Whoever put this together sure gave it some thought, she said approvingly. “The variety is terrific.”

“Yeah,” Don replied, “Greg and two others did the shopping. Six of us chipped together for the food. Once we get thru eating the buffet we’ll play some parlor games, then have dessert and dance a little. The idea is to mix it up and try to include everyone – shy guys and wallflowers included, if we can get them involved.”

“I don’t think Alison or I exactly qualify as wallfowers, “ Liz responded a bit defensively. “We’re both away from the dorm 2-3 nights a week!”

“Oh definitely not, “ Don hastily concurred. “But notice around us. There are several people by themselves, not looking very happy. Once the games get going they’re going to find themselves being drawn in. Everyone, you and I included, will have sheets with four numbers in a quadrant pinned to our backs. For two of the four games the girls have to find the guy with their number, for the other two it’s the guys and girls. The match-ups are partners for the game.”

“Hey, that works!” exclaimed Liz, ”and who knows, maybe those in the final set will get to share dessert together. I saw that cake and the pies. They look sensatonal”

“It could work.” Don concurred, noting her positive spin on the high calorie fare. And speaking of food our plates are empty. Can I get us seconds?”

“Umm, sure,” said Liz, wondering what Don would do. He returned with two fairly well loaded plates with different items than before. It appeared to be some beef enchiladas, casserole, and a slice of meat loaf. Liz chatted amiably, suspecting that Don was testing her.

Things went as predicted and both Liz and Alison got to know a few guys better. But at the end they both gravitated back to their dinner companions for dessert. Unlike Don Greg hadn’t tried to ply Alison with seconds because she’d shared her frustration over lack of the planned exercise opportunities with Kelsey. But she couldn’t resist the multi-layer German chocolate cake with a generous helping of ice cream.

Liz was no less reticent, although her choice was apple pie and ice cream. And she responded favorably to Don’s discussions of various types of foods. If Don was indeed testing her out as a dinner companion she was willing to pass and be pampered a little. She knew her belly was returning but didn’t care – in fact, if Don became another Robert she didn’t mind his huskiness at all. Maybe she’d even nudge it a bit.

When the dancing began Don was called away to help with the audio/visual equipment and Liz found herself alone. That’s when she noticed a slightly heavier Latina girl sitting by herself, looking rather forlorn. Liz went over and sat beside, introducing herself as a freshman.

“My name is Maria,” replied the girl, “And I’m a freshman too. Unfortunately this is Kansas and it’s a little lonely for a brown skinned salad dodger.”

“Salad dodger?” exclaimed Liz. “What do you mean?”

“Well amiga, look at me, Maria complained. “I reflect many tamales and beans, would you not agree? We call plump chicanas salad dodgers back home and we laugh. Guys here don’t have the same responses to a little extra thigh as in Las Cruces. This is my first party here because my roommate insisted. I only ate two tacos and some salad tonight but to them I’m just senorita gordita.”

Liz’s mind grasped the situation and she had a idea but she knew she needed help.

“Maria, I’m almost your size and I’ve been forty pounds heavier,” Liz disclosed. “Now it may be true that some guys don’t want chubby girls but I’ve never lacked for dates. And your brown skin has nothing o do with it. Would you let me prove it?”

“How?” asked Maria, the lonliess showing I her eyes.

“I happen to know a half Hispanic student here on campus who weighs over 200 pounds and has a great boy friend. And there are other larger girls with guys as well. I think you need to get some supportive friends to restore your self confidence,” relied Liz.

“If being forty pounds bigger wasn’t an issue why did you lose it,” queried Maria.

“Parental pressure mostly. But now I’m over 18 and don’t care – and its coming back, which is OK. But we’re talking about you. Can you be free Monday night?” queried Liz.

“I suppose so. But why?” Maria answered.

“So hopefully you can meet the support group you need.” Liz answered. “Now will you promise to stick around for a few minutes?”.

“Might as well promise that. My roommate dragged me here and she’s not going home any time soon,” said Maria. “I’m marooned unless I walk back alone.”

Liz flitted off to find Alison, who was with Kevin. While she was describing the situation Don and Greg joined them out of curiosity. Don promised to engage Maria while Alison called Madison. Fortunately, even though she was with Jim, Madison had her cell phone and told Alison and Liz to go ahead. Greg volunteered to be Maria’s escort knowing that Don would like more time with Liz. Kevin was a bit bewildered by all he wheeling and dealing but agreed to go along as well. He didn’t want Alison to be there without him.

By the time the dancing slowed down and Don returned to the sidelines with Maria Liz, Greg, Alison and Kevin were waiting. Liz made the introductions and Alison confirmed the invitation. Greg asked Maria if he could have the next dance and then he and Don would draw straws for the pleasure of being her escort. This drew a scowl from Don but he played along.

While Maria was on the dance floor with Greg Liz told Don she was, with his permission, going to fix the drawing so that Greg would get Maria. Don sighed a sigh of relief and gave her a hug. Liz found it very comfortable and noted the solidness of his developing paunch. .

“By the way,” he asked “I know you came with Kevin and Alison, but would you like a nighttime snack with me on the way home instead of going with them?”

“I would – and frankly I think they would like that too” she concurred “What about DQ? I understand they’re open till 2:00.”

“Sounds great to me,“ Don replied.

Liz sent a quick text message to Alison who responded with a smiley face and then waved from across the room. As she and Don eased onto the dance floor she silently hoped that the DQ was but the first of many shared meals together. For his part his fingers tingled over the firmness of the developing rolls of her midriff. He knew he and Greg had both fund girls with potential.

The last month had been exciting for Alison, for a few reasons. First, she was seeing things progress with Kevin, and the feeling of a new relationship with someone that she liked was an exciting one. Second, her good friend Kelsey was trying to make the soccer team and she felt like she was living that adventure through her at times, seeing Kelsey deal with the highs and lows of the experience. On top of that, her social life was strong, and she got along great with her roommate Madison. Even her studies had still been strong. There was only one thing that Alison was finding her mind drift off about occasionally.

When Alison was getting ready for school one morning, she noticed that her stomach seemed just a bit softer than what she was used to. Is this temporary bloat from last night, or am I putting on some weight? Alison dropped the pants and went over to the mirror in the bathroom. She couldn't tell the reason, but she thought that it did look just a tad bigger, although you would have had to be looking for it, or seen a comparison picture, and even then, it would have been nothing to write home about. Alison smiled at herself in the mirror, At least the cute smile is still there she thought to herself as she continued with her morning.

The issue of weight had been in the back of her mind. She could tell Liz was putting on weight, and Sandra's was even more obvious. She also had seen photos of Madison and Cassi before they started college and it was night and day. She did not hate larger people, she just did not want to be one at the moment for a variety of reasons. Kelsey, Kevin, friends from back home, she just didn't really want to change a formula that had been working for her. So Alison didn't jump in as deep as Liz or Sandra and was not eating as much. However, not eating as much as Liz and Sandra did not necessarily mean that she was eating light. With the fatty foods that were being served at their get together, Alison was eating an altered diet, and even with the (increasingly sporadic) workouts, an explanation for her slightly softer stomach could be found.

There was less hesitation and resistance over in Liz's dorm, and one would be able to guess this by looking at Liz. She had always had larger boobs, which came with a softer stomach than she wanted when she came to college, but now it was obviously morphing into a belly. Her boobs had grown, but so had her arms and her love handles. She needed to buy new clothes, but she hadn't really found the time yet. Despite her guess that Don was okay with all of this, she still knew her Mom would not be, so she was looking for an excuse to get her to give her money for clothes without letting her know why. Maybe I'll just say I need winter clothes, that could work was a common thought for her.

For Alison and Liz, despite all their differences, their diets were slowly diverging. With Kelsey often off at soccer, the social creature in Alison gravitated towards Liz, and they often made plans to go out, even if their current romantic interests were not involved.

She just sat and stared at it for a minute, thinking back to all the meals she'd had over the past week leading her to this point.

She and Liz had eaten lunch together nearly every day, with Liz sometimes dragging her to breakfast with her as well. Liz was noticeably larger than before, but that wasn't a shock considering how much she ate. She looked over and Liz's stomach looked bigger than before, and almost to be resting on her lap, although her's was also far more bloated than normal.

After they slowly got back to the dorm, Alison was too tired to work out, and lounged around for the rest of the evening.

It was Monday night at Madison’s. The week before Sandy had made a pledge. Now she was happily indulging her inner chef by preparing turkey eggplant lasagna. She had begun by using specially purchased whole wheat lasagna noodles. Then the day before she had prepared a special sauce purloined from an Internet cooking site. In addition to layers of lasagna, cheese and turkey she now included one of sautéed spinach for further flavor variety. This entree was to be served family style with salad and a crock of steamed vegetables – plus of course dessert.

As the guests arrived she couldn’t help but notice the contrast between the comfortably plump self-confessed “salad dodger” Maria and the less sanguine former fatty Liz in dealing with their respective bellies.

Maria was larger than either Sandy or Liz, but this didn’t seem to faze her. With her newly minted band of heavier friends she was quickly acclimating to celebrating her larger body. It had never been an issue back home in New Mexico and inside her own mind she didn’t think it should in Kansas. . Saturday evening she had been out to dinner with Greg. It was field research for writing her first restaurant review for the Proclaimer.

Sensing his preference she’d worn a shortened top with horizontal bands that teasingly allowed exposure of about an inch of her belly muffin top. It was a ploy from her high school days that she had seen other plump chicanas use. The roll protruded just short of two inches over the waistband of her snug slacks It delighted Greg so much that he’d encouraged her to dress similarly for Monday.

Liz on the other hand was far more demure. She didn’t mind being heavier but was still dealing with what she expected to be censure from back home. She knew it was inevitable that her Mom would discover her regaining what she had once lost. She wore a loose fitting top with narrow vertical black and white stripes whose bottom hem extended to her hip joints, well past her waistline.

The outline of her softening belly could still be discerned bulging out from her upper rib cage against the fabric, but her clothing deemphasized the growing plumpness of her figure. This modesty did not seem to bother her new friend Don at all, especially as he fully expected that her appetite would not be diminished one bit once dinner began.

Jim, Madison, and of course Sandra’s boy friend Robert, completed the octet. Despite the upcoming court drama Sandy had was becoming quite comfortable with her own expanding body. This was good because she was routinely consuming well over 3000 calories per day and packing on over a pound a week. So far most of her nearly twenty pound gain had been in her thighs and now constant food baby belly, but her upper arms and back were getting slightly softer.

With everyone present and the table set Madison helped Sandy bring out the food, starting with dinner rolls and salad. The salad was in keeping with the promised Italian theme, including romaine, butter and iceberg lettuce shredded into bite size pieces, then tossed with chopped tomatoes, Provone cheese cubes, kidney and garbanzo beans, turkey sausage chunks and mixed with olive oil and a red wine vinaigrette.

Next came the crock of mixed vegetables and two large casserole dishes with the four layered lasagna. It was obvious that Sandy had gone all out, perhaps with some assistance in menu planning from Jim. Maria was amazed both at the meal and the gusto with which Liz initially filled her plate. Sandy as chef waited her turn to the end but she too enjoyed the meal along with her friends. Neither she nor Maria were surprised when the guys began having seconds and then Liz accepted Don’s offer to refill her plate. Greg and Robert followed his example but Madison refilled her own.

Although there was discussion of the Ramsey affair Greg wanted to focus on Maria’s upcoming article. Using the coupons they had visited Felipe’s, which had been in Wichita for nearly a half century. Greg praised their homemade guacamole which included tomato, onions and seasonings along with the traditional avocado. It was served as an excellent appetizer with tortilla chips while the entrees were being prepared.

Maria agreed, but focused on the more unique menu items, such as sopes and fuego ribeye, declaring “ this you definitely won’t see in most Tex-Mex food joints, which are hardly authentic!”

“So what are sopes?” had asked Don, unfamiliar with the term..

“Ground corn patties, usually homemade, They’re fried until golden brown, topped with beans & meat plus a layer of lettuce, cheese and salsa, served with beans & rice. The meat can be whatever you choose - beef, chicken or chorizo,” Maria had answered.

He nodded. “And fuego steak?”

She paused a moment before replying. “Ribeye steak hand rubbed with spices: ancho, chipotle & poblano pepper spices. Its usually served over roasted red potatoes – according to the menu Felipe’s version features topping with their own tequila butter sauce. I suggest we order both and then share.”

Greg had readily agreed. The portions were generous, but not so large as to preclude refried ice cream for dessert.

Now on Monday Jim and Allison nodded at this synopsis and encouraged Maria to turn it in as a review for the Proclaimer.

“OK – but you do realize you’re may get blowback from the rye crisp and lettuce leaf crowd!” she responded.

“Great,” replied Jim. “The controversy will show the paper is being read!”

“Restaurant reviews are great for those who can afford them,” commented Robert. “I think reviews of great meals by our own student body talent like Sandy tonight would be a good idea as well.”

Madison and Jim looked at one another.

“Why not?” said Madison.

“Maybe if food were thought of as art form instead of the enemy attitudes would change, “ mused Maria. “Some people would rather date someone who is high or drunk than a fat girl – but we don’t cause accidents or sacrifice our school or careers. Its stupid – and we all seem to know it, but many don’t!”

“Its all popularity and a sense of dread,” interjected Liz, “Now I see things from a different perspective but when I first gained I really didn’t pay any attention. I was in denial over the first twenty pounds even though everyone else I knew could tell. The next twenty I was more aware but still dismissed it until my friends and Mom started getting on my case. Then I felt I had to change to please them to be a worthwhile person. That’s why I forced myself to lose. But I felt like crap denying myself. What I should of done was acknowledge I was fat and then simply embraced it. ”

Madison nodded as Don quietly made mental notes. She replied “My mom was appalled at me for gaining and not caring, but then had to accept it. You can be more accepting of yourself as you get older but teens tend look at their peers, not inside. I realize that now.”

“You guys are making me see myself and I’m ashamed,” commented Sandy.

“Why? What are you talking about?” queried Madison.

“Part of me has always wanted to be bigger. I even liked bigger guys and padded my clothes in my bedroom. That’s why I never teased bigger people. But I was involved n all kinds of activities and never seemed to gain because I didn’t take time to eat like I wanted. Now I’m becoming what I’ve privately dreamed about and fortunately I have Robert in my corner. He happens to like bigger girls. ” Sandy explained. “Bud Ramsey and his lawyer can say whatever they want, but I like being bigger. No one is forcing me to get that way. I’m just sorry for having lived a lie till now.”

“Wow, mi amiga. That was quite a speech!” exclaimed Maria.

“Yes, but it is from her heart and I appreciate it,” declared Robert. “There’s more to a relationship than just size but there’s nothing wrong with acknowledging what you like.”

Jim and Madison exchanged knowing glances as Don and Greg took deep breaths. Neither yet felt comfortable discussing their preferences even in a friendly group, but they sensed he implications. Sandy meanwhile beamed and decided it was time to serve dessert.

At the end of the week, Alison got a reply to the text that sent earlier,

Kelsey: Yes, I'm still able to hang out tonight, I'll be to your room in 10.

Alison was happy and put her phone down to pick up the room a bit. Madison and her had let the room get a bit messy during the week, and with some tests coming up, neither had gotten the time to clean it. There were some containers that were in the sink that she quickly washed and put away, the leftovers from Monday night that Madison saved took a while to get through, and Alison was shocked when Madison had told her how much initial food there was. "Hmm, well I guess I can see where the extra weight on her came from," Alison thought, not as judgmentally as much as matter of fact.

However, Alison also knew that she wasn't all that immune to changes either, she had gained another three pounds since she last weighed herself, bringing her up to 135 on her 5'9 frame. Sure, it was only three pounds, but that equaled a whole ten pounds since she had gotten to Powers, and she was not thrilled at the prospect of crossing over an even number like that. Soon, she feared she would be one of those people trying to lose 25, or even 30 pounds, as opposed to someone who just needed to work out more...the current way that she had classified herself. And even then, she was probably being hard on herself, she wasn't even overweight, not even close to being chubby yet. Her legs were a bit bigger, but they were nothing that was out of the ordinary, she was just shifting from very thin, thinish.

These thoughts went through her head as she changed out of her sweats and into jeans, it was officially cold now, and a trendy top. She sat down for a few minutes and watched some TV, until she got a knock on the door and proceeded to let Kelsey in.

"Hey! How's it going!" Kelsey said while smilling, happy to see Alison. Alison looked Kelsey over, who was as fit as she had been before, if not fitter. Soccer had clearly whipped her into even better shape. She was wearing a very tight shirt, and skirt, that showed off her legs, which may have been bigger, but looked more toned. Alison responded, "Good, looks like soccer has been going well for you," Alison meant competitively, and Kelsey did not catch that it could have also been taken to have meant physically.

"I'm having the time of my life, I'm actually competing for a permanent roster spot!"

This was all news to Alison, who was glad, but wondered what this would do to Kelsey's time constraints, and other friend commitments, she never did ask how Kelsey enjoyed hanging out with some of the soccer players last week. They continued to talk, mostly about class, and Alison wondered, If Kelsey and I spend even less time working out, maybe I can workout with Kevin...I really need someone to help motivate me.

After a while, Alison and Kelsey went out to a party, it was Friday night, and each wanted to have a good time. She texted Kevin, who showed up about 40 minutes after they arrived. It was a pretty typical off campus house party, people just mainly talking with some too loud music on in the background. After a while, Kevin got a text from Clark and after reading it, let Alison and Kelsey know that there was a rager going on a few blocks down, "...so are you both interested?"

Alison thought it sounded pretty fun, but was going to go with the consensus of the group. Kelsey however, did not want to get caught drunk so close to achieving her soccer goal. On a normal evening she probably would have been okay with it, but the timing was not right, and she informed the group.

"Ok," Kevin responded, "how about we get some late night food then? There is a really good dinner open until 2 a bit off campus" Being a college guy, he was always pretty hungry, and both the girls agreed.

When they got there, Alison was planning on getting something small, maybe a side of fries, but then on the way she got hungry, and by the time she was there, she was convinced that she wanted a burger....and maybe some pie to spit with Kelsey and Kevin.

1531122111211211112111222222112222221221.content:
Jessica arrived back home after two hours on an errand that was supposed to have taken thirty minutes. On the kitchen table was a note from Sandy “sorry to have eaten without you but you were out – the remainder of the KFC I picked u for us is in the refrigerator.”

Going to the refrigerator Jessica quickly deduced what Sandy had eaten as her share of their dinner. This involved devouring four pieces of chicken, half of two sides of cold slaw and green beans, and the majority of a container of macaroni and cheese. Two large chicken pieces and the balance of the sides were left for Jessica.

“Including the soda that’s another 1200 calories, girl,” Jessica thought. She knew Sandy was regularly packing away 3590-4000 calories a day and it was showing – perhaps close to twenty pounds in three months. And tomorrow finally was the hearing on Bud Ramsey, where they suspected the defense might try to prove he wasn’t bullying and harassing with unwelcome advances, just trying to intervene on what he perceived as an eating disorder.

“Yeah, right,” thought Jessica. “Then what about the others he’s accused of being involved with? Sandy may be a foodie, but not a sicko like him!”

Jessica and some of the others from Powers planned to be on hand for moral support. Jim and Madison would be writing a story. Jessica planned to wearher skin tight leggings and body suit that emphasized her thighs and belly. Other media might be on hand as well.

Jessica warmed her dinner in the microwave and had her supper. Later Sandy got back and they shared generous helpings of chocolate chip ice cream before retiring.

“You know they’re going to make a big deal of your weight gain, right?”she asked.

“I know that. But I like feeling stuffed and being bigger – and so does Robert. Its not like I can go on having fun with food forever, but I not even officially fat yet – am I?” Sandy observed.

“Probably not – but I’m bigger than you so I’m no one to talk. I’m glad you’re not bothered by it,” replied Jessica.
“Nope, I’m not bothered. There’s actually a story to why I want to be bigger that you don’t know. Maybe after the trial I’ll share it,” Sandy replied mysteriously.

The next morning Robert met Sandy at the Power;s commissary where she had her typical breakfast, including a three egg cheese and avocado omelet, hash browns and a couple of pancakes. She had on her empire cut dress with short sleeves. The outfit displayed both her growing belly and softening upper arms. Robert noted that the outfit also tended to emphasize her ample hips.

“You look great for the big day,” he noted

“Yes, I intend to be the self-confident fattie vs the the village creep. They started this but I’m ready,” she replied.

The hearing began with the cafeteria worker who had initially reported the incident repeating what she had observed. Sandy, she related, was minding her own business; Ramsey (who the server knew wasn’t a student) uninvitedly approached her, then began making derogatory references about her appetite and choice of friends when she declined his advances. If hadn’t been for the intervention of the other students it could have escalated.

Then Ramsey’s attorney had his turn. He established that Sandy was getting seconds and tried to establish that this was part of a pattern of overeating. The Judge however sustained the objection of the prosecution that Sandy’s eating habits weren’t germane to the charges.

Then it was Sandy’s turn. The plumpness of her body was fully evident as she was worn in and settled into the witness chair. The prosecution had her corroborate the attendant’s testimony and then it was the defense’s turn.

“Is the first time you’ve brought charges against someone in a matter such as this?” he enquired.

“I haven’t charged anyone. It was Powers that came to me investigating,” Sandy corrected the attorney.

“So you knew that my client was actually right in his perception of your eating disorder and were just going to let it slide?” said the attorney.
”Objection” said the prosecution.

“Sustained.,” replied the Judge. “Counsel will refrain from that line of questioning.”

“Alright, then,” pounced defense counsel. “let me ask this – does the name Ozzie Haverlick mean anything to you?”

Sandy blanched a bit but maintained her cool.

“Ozzie was accused but never indicted – and again, it wasn’t me making the charges. I just try to run my own life,” replied Sandy.

“Well, will you please tell us about the matter with Ozzie as you recall it,” probed the attorney.

“In high school he liked me but I was just courteous in response. We never dated or did anything. Then someone slipped me a date rape drug and I got woozy at a party. Ever wanting to help Ozzie saw me struggling and offered me a ride home. As we were going out to the car some other guys ran up and accused him of being the one who spiked my cola. Two of them held him while the third called the cops. He got arrested but claimed he’d been set up by these guys, who I know had a gripe against him for turning one of them in for cheating. He got suspended but graduation was three weeks away and the DA said there wasn’t enough evidence to prosecute. No one ever proved who did it – personally I don’t think he was the type and these guys were bad news.”

“And it was during the summer after that incident that you began gaining weight, wasn’t it?” charged the defense attorney.

“I picked up a few pounds, yes, but it had nothing to do with the incident. I wasn’t as physically active and enjoyed a lot of ice cream in hot weather. I didn’t mind a few pounds then and still don’t.” Sandy shot back.

“It had nothing to do with the stress of that event? Didn’t you tell your buddy Natalie Franks that if you had a few extra pounds something like that wouldn’t happen again?” he said. “And didn’t you also tell her hat he stress had you snacking more?”
“Well, yes. But it was my choice. Frankly I’ve never been against being plumper, it just didn’t happen in high school because I was so busy. “ Sandy answered.

“Now we’re getting somewhere,” the defense attorney proceeded. “Let me ask you, haven’t you been eating more since coming to Powers Isn’t that because of the stress of being away from home?”

“Objection,” said the prosecution, “calls or a conclusion not supported by any foundation.”

“Your honor, replied the defense attorney, “I am trying to show the bias of this witness. She is in denial of stress induced overeating patter that the most rudimentary investigation readily confirms. My client was able to sense it and she herself hasn’t denied it. Power’s University knows I’m right –we are prepared to put one of her counselors on the stand to confirm this diagnosis.”

“Hmm,” said the Judge, “You can proceed, but carefully. The witness is not on trial for anything.”

“OK. Now, haven’t you gained weight since coming to Powers?”

“Yes,. Replied Sandy levelly. ”But not because of what you are insinuating. I like food and being a bit bigger. Your client’s behavior may have caused me to eat even more and gain faster but that doesn’t make what he did trying to control my behavior right. What about the others he’s charged with? Were they persons of size as well?”

“That we’ll deal with down the road – my question to you is, how much have you gained since graduating high school?” probed the attorney

“At least twenty pounds – I don’t know the exact number. But your client isn’t my judge.”

“True, but I suggest he was only trying to help you wityh a very obvious issue, not harass. And enjoy your dinner tonight,” concluded the defense with a smug smirk.

With that Sandy was allowed to stand down, fuming.
“What a load of crap,” Jim said to Sandy in the court hallway as Madison looked on. “I have the perfect headline for this: ‘fat folks are fair game for predators says defense’”

“I agree,” said Madison, ”and that’s the way I intend to write it.”

Two days later the next day article appeared, portraying Ramsey and his attorney as self-righteous anti-fat bigots and Sandy as a nice girl with a forgiving nature and a full waistline. It was a sympathetic piece meant to combat size discrimination and as such drew favorable comments.

Ramsey’s preliminary hearing dragged on for two more days, the defense generating as must of a dust cloud as possible, and he was finally bound over. Ultimately the state was unable to prove its worst suspicions and he plea bargained to supervised probation. No Powers student would ever report Ramsey on campus again.

Madison decided that she should take it easy after her first week of class and ventured over to the gym after class. The gym was filled with people who seemed to care about their bodies. Madison was no stranger to the gym and quickly ran a few miles on the treadmill. She chatted with some guys who seemed into her, and also looked over and some girls who were larger and struggling to lose weight.

As she looked over on the elliptical she saw girls who looked like they hated their condition. Unlike her workout, in which she seemed to easily breeze through exercises, and her tired look almost made her more attractive, she saw girls who were filling out their shirts with spare tires, or who had to work out while their thighs shook everywhere. Madison would never say it out loud because she was nice to nearly everyone she met, but she was happy that she didn't look like that.

After she was done working out she took some laps in the pool to cool down. She wore a bikini that showed why she was so popular back in Florida.
